TITLE: I Created A Lego CV To Stand Out From Other Resumes

DESCRIPTION: For those who haven't yet heard, pareidolia is a psychological phenomenon in which the mind responds to a stimulus, usually an image or a sound, by perceiving a familiar pattern where none exists. To put it simply, it's a bug in the human mind that causes it to see things that aren't really there. For example, you look at a regular tap but see Ice Age's acorn-obsessed Scrat or you glance at a juicy cinnamon roll but it becomes an anguished E.T.
TITLE: 10+ Times Everyday Objects Were Actually Pop Culture Icons In Disguise

DESCRIPTION: Did you know that most of the different languages we speak today can actually be placed in only a couple of groups by their origin? This is what illustrator Minna Sundberg has captured in an elegant infographic of a linguistic tree which reveals some fascinating links between different tongues.
TITLE: This Amazing Tree That Shows How Languages Are Connected Will Change The Way You See Our World

DESCRIPTION: Ever dreamed about a life at sea? Many of us have dreamed of leaving it all behind, heading off to live the romantic life of exploration and adventure that only sailing the vast, open oceans can bring.

DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION:
I launched a marketplace for kids experiences and parties called My Best Gift, because I wanted an alternative to giving my kids more 'stuff' for every celebration.
For my daughter Mila's last birthday, I asked her what she'd like to do for her party, when she asked if she could have a unicorn at her party, I thought it was a crazy idea! But given the popularity of unicorns, I realised she probably wasn't the only one asking for a unicorn, so we sourced unicorns! We now have real-life unicorn parties on our site and get the chance to make kids dreams come true with these unicorns!
The unicorns have been so popular since we've added them to the site, that it's taken our business to the next level. Now when I want to know what's on trend with the kids, I just ask my girls!
TITLE: I Found Real-Life Unicorns And Turned It Into A Business

DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake rocked central Mexico on Tuesday, killing over 230 people so far and injuring thousands. The earthquake comes less than two weeks after another, more powerful quake struck Oaxaca, leaving much of the region in ruins, and a large-scale rescue operation is currently underway to locate those trapped beneath the rubble.
TITLE: Badass Rescue Dog Who Has Rescued 52 Lives Is Now Saving People Affected By Mexico Earthquake

DESCRIPTION:
A love affair involved a penguin and a figure of an anime heroine in cardboard lately
The main character in this story is Grape, a 20-year-old penguin who was traded for a younger penguin by his ten-year relationship partner
Tobu Zoo staff (Miyashiro, Japan) said the animal was sad and not fed and that everything changed as they placed the cardboard in the space where Grape lives. Life has made a wonderful sense in your life.
But the cardboard cutout was taken from the zoo and guarded to protect it from the approaching typhoon.
TITLE: Penguin Abandoned By His Girlfriend Falls In Love With A Cardboard And The Internet Gets Excited

DESCRIPTION:
French artists Ella & Pitr addresses the gravity of the global refugee crisis in her latest mural, Le Naufrage de Bienvenu. The gigantic outdoor work reaches more than 47 meters and occupies the entire length of the piney dam at La Valla-En Gier, Rhone-Alpes, France.
The project took 10 days to be finalized.
TITLE: Artists Made A Mural On An Abandoned Dam To Represent Refugees In France

DESCRIPTION: Let's be honest for a moment: weddings can get a little wearying. They seem to go on forever, during which time you're forced to make conversation with relatives you've been avoiding for years and random drunk people who nobody seems to have invited.

DESCRIPTION: So often today on social media we are bombarded by images of plastic people, airbrushed and filtered to such an extent that all genuine emotion and feeling, the human connections that shine through the picture and into our hearts, is lost.

DESCRIPTION:
The digital artist Gregory Masouras does arts using Disney Princess as female singers on Youtube.

DESCRIPTION: How many book dedications do you remember? My point exactly. Most of them are generic and unimaginative. But not these. Bored Panda has collected some of the greatest book dedications ever written to prove that writers can tell a story even in a sentence or two.

Tony Futura is an eccentric Berlin artist who creates ironic images using famous works or photographs.

DESCRIPTION: I am a photographer/videographer. My experience with Iceland is long and goes back for 9 years and 8 journeys. I have seen it transform from a peaceful serene place to an overcrowded tourist circus and each and every year it broke my heart.

DESCRIPTION: Some people believe in fate, that everything in life happens for a reason, is predetermined and therefore out of your power. DESCRIPTION: Cats have a pretty good deal in life. They sleep all day, they get petted whenever they demand it, they eat for free, and they don't have to pay any rent. As you can see from the pictures below however, not all cats are happy with their easy lives.

DESCRIPTION: If you ever needed proof that Elijah Wood doesn't take himself too seriously then check out some of the hilarious pictures he's taken with fans.

DESCRIPTION: Born and raised in Burton-on-Trent, UK Jonathan Stephen Harris has not only a steady hand but a sharp mind as well. You see, where others see letters, this artist sees shapes and forms. DESCRIPTION: Japan might have one of the lowest crime rates in the world, and also the highest life expectancy, but as you can see from these shocking pictures of drunken excess, that doesn't mean that the Japanese don't know how to party...although maybe a little too much.

DESCRIPTION: Flip flops are pure summer fun, but they're also a major water pollutant, and the Philippines are notorious for discarding vast amounts of them into the ocean. One Filipino street vendor is combating the problem and supporting his family at the same time by turning the dozens of worn-out flip flops he finds into wickedly cool action figures, and now everyone on the Internet wants to buy them.

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Deanna Hurt and I'm a pet photographer in Colorado, AKA StinkDog Photos.

DESCRIPTION: I made the dadbag because I'm desperate to have dad bod but I'm also very concerned about the health risks associated with it. DESCRIPTION: When a woman is giving birth, the right nurse can make all the difference in how she gets through and remembers the milestone event. Jill Krause, the writer behind parenting blog Baby Rabies, recently took to Facebook to express her gratitude for labor and delivery nurses, and she ended up setting off a chain reaction of love and support.

DESCRIPTION:
Though i personally, have been out of the game now for more than four years, my passions for and awe of LOVE and LOVERS has only deepened through my work exploring the nature of relationship, via nature itself. Painting people into the world found new realms of possibility when it evolved into a practice of affirming the foundations of unity beyond the mere reflection of two people - to the perspective of being part of the the the earth together.
As we progressively discover, uniting solely via matrimony leaves much to be desired for the long road ahead.
TITLE: Painting Lovers Into The World

DESCRIPTION: This is Yoshi. Yoshi has had a very hard life. She was basically used as a puppy making factory her entire life.

DESCRIPTION: My name is Lynn Hetherington Becker and I am an artist in Columbus, OH. The majority of my work is body art and my favorite subject matter to work with is children. I love transforming them into fantastic people and creatures.

DESCRIPTION:
I wanted to create a series of images (Rare Beauty) that encouraged people to want to know more about rare disease and the huge impact it has on everyone involved. We can appreciate how hard it can be for individuals and their families but how often do we also think about the people who treat and support them.
For 'Rare Beauty' the images recreate every day scenes that people with rare diseases find themselves in, for example, having surgery, meeting the consultant or having treatment.
TITLE: Through These Photos I Want To Encourage More People To Find Out About Rare Disease And The Impact It Has On The People Around Them

DESCRIPTION:
Artist Vilija Vitkute creates astonishing bodypainting in the end of the world - Lofoten islands.
Vilija is young, multi-talented artist from Lithuania/Sweden that does bodypainting, film-directing, performance art, photography which is about nature and human relationship. She is a professional artist that travels to most inspiring nature places in a world and creates art, performance, and films.

DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION: It is difficult for us to believe that our beloved felines are merciless bird hunters. They do not do it out of cruelty, but because they are responding to their primitive hunter instinct. And it is amazing how efficient they are: they approach the prey in total silence and just in a jump they are already on the poor animal.

DESCRIPTION: Shopping for everyday items after a long day at work is that mundane task some of us truly dread. DESCRIPTION:
Kyoto, the cultural capital of Japan, may be well known for its grand old temples and stately imperial villas, but one long-time resident decided to shine the spotlight on the beauty of the city's more humble architecture.
About a year ago, photographer and founder of Kyoto Journal magazine, John Einarsen, began shooting an Instagram series called Small Buildings of Kyoto on his iPhone during his daily bicycle journeys around town. He has since taken over 200 images of homes, businesses, workshops, as well as the odd neighborhood shrine and teahouse -- each one brimming with personality and charm.
TITLE: Photographer Captures Small Yet Utterly Delightful Buildings In Kyoto, Japan

DESCRIPTION: Aren't spiders just adorable? Well ok, in most cases they're bloody terrifying, but that image might change when you take a closer look. As close as to where their feet should be, where you'll find that they have...paws!

DESCRIPTION:
Lately, it just feels like there's been more bad news in the world than usual. In an effort to prevent all of us from spiraling into a deep depression, I made this book of quick and easy ways to feel happier.
With 24 suggestions like 'Wrestle your mailman' and 'Steal a dog,' the options may seem a bit bizarre.

DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION:

I wanted to make an experiment and see what kind of result an old technique like this one would give with modern technologies, I was not disappointed.

DESCRIPTION: Jessica Lewis recently decided to evacuate her college town of Statesboro, Georgia and head for home near Atlanta before Hurricane Irma arrived. There were only two problems. DESCRIPTION:
Last week I shared photos of the surging flood waters in the north Houston community of Kingwood, Texas.
The photos were taken along the freeway as the water reached its peak height of approximately 70 feet, although many suspect the flood gauges stopped working at that point.
I spent this weekend at the townhomes where I grew up, about a mile east of the freeway along the north bank of the San Jacinto river.

DESCRIPTION:

After making a life-size paper Iron Man last year, we decided to secretly up our game and built an electronic moving head into the paper robot to surprise the organisers of the Comic Con.
Needless to say, the clients joyfully lost their freakin' minds!

Every month, we run free of charge monthly themed contest in order to give a chance to emerging photographers to show us the magic of child photography.
This Summer CPC asked the photographers from all around the globe to document children spending their summer disconnected from the world of electronic gadgets and to submit the best snaps to SUMMER UNPLUGGED contest.

DESCRIPTION:
The Dead Sea is a remarkable and unique place in the east of Israel. Over the past year I've made countless trips to the area, driving nearly two hours each way, leaving at the break of dawn, in order to be there for sunrise when the light is beautiful and before it becomes too hot as temperatures can reach 46 degree Celsius (115 Fahrenheit).
The Dead Sea is going through rough times to put it mildly.

DESCRIPTION:
One day my cat was lounging (as they often do) in the classic cat loaf position, and the idea just popped into my head, my girlfriend would love to bake cat loaves! So I hopped on Amazon searching for something I was convinced already existed. After searching Amazon, Etsy, and eBay I was shocked that there wasn't a way to bake 3D cats!
Fast forward almost a full year of prototyping and testing, I finally have a finished product.
The Charlie Cat baking mold is the first cupcake mold that allows you to create 3D cat-shaped baked treats.
TITLE: I Created A Cat-Shaped Cupcake Mold So People Can Bake And Decorate One Of Their Favorite Animals

DESCRIPTION:
Talented Makeup Artist from Germany creates beautiful stories using the power of makeup by painting half skulls on her face and decorating them with beautiful elements giving the whole look an interesting story!
She uses body painting products to create these amazing makeup looks that are pieces of art!
She posts all of her amazing work on Instagram @kati_powderbrush and not just skulls, but you can find characters from your favorite TV Shows like The Walking Dead and Game of Thrones.
TITLE: Half Beauty, Half Beast! Half Skull Makeup Looks That Tell A Story

DESCRIPTION: It's obvious that today's students' taste in music, clothes, and technology has massively changed since 2007, and even more since 1997, but what about the way they learn? The teachers of Reddit were asked this very question, and the differences they revealed between students from each decade are both humorous and troubling.
TITLE: 10+ Teachers Explain The Differences Between 1997, 2007, & 2017 Students, And Some Of Them Are Worrying

DESCRIPTION: Although hummingbirds are known to be territorial and prone to fighting with each other, photographer wildwingsla managed to capture the most amazing thing - thirty hummingbirds peacefully enjoying a bath ritual together.
TITLE: These 30 Hummingbirds Just Had An Epic Pool Party

DESCRIPTION:
My name's Steph Seed and I'm the artist behind the 'The Average' comic. I draw a slice of life comics, challenging myself to do one every weekday.
I draw my comics traditionally, using a pencil -> ink -> then coloured pencil.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Comics By The Average That You Can Relate To

DESCRIPTION: Being a stay at home mom creative makes my mind race with possibilities. I have always been fascinated with steampunk, with help from Lindsey Stirling's Roundtable Revival music video back in 2014 to get me the jump I needed, I started dreaming up outfits. Lots of late night sewing and Goodwill hunting and a couple of years and babies later I was ready! I have some awesome supportive family and friends and one saint of a husband to go along with it all.
TITLE: I Photographed Steampunk Ashton Family

DESCRIPTION:
Dubare is known for its elephant camp, a forest camp on the banks of the river Kaveri in the district of Kodagu, Karnataka. It is an important base for the Karnataka Forest Department's elephants.
The elephants for the Mysore Dussehra were trained at Dubare elephant camp.
TITLE: I Spent Some Time At The Dubare, Karnataka And Could Not Feel Enough Affection For The Elephants There

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Christine and I draw the posts on the insta account YeahItsChill featuring the inner me, Krysteen. I started the account in March of this year and it's kind of taken off.
I aim to make my posts simple, honest, vulnerable, sometimes relatable and funny, and include topics I'd want to see discussed more.
TITLE: These 10+ Relatable And Honest Comics Perfectly Illustrates Parts Of Womanhood

DESCRIPTION: Traveling to my memories, to my hometown...
TITLE: Traveling To My Memories, To My Hometown Chania, Crete

DESCRIPTION: Love consists of so many different emotional and mental phases...
TITLE: I Showed The Phases Of Love Through My Conceptual Miniature Photoshoot

DESCRIPTION: It has been a great journey for Anca Berteanu, The Little Ballerina, here in Bucharest, Romania. After eight years of hard work and intense training she is going to discover new challenges at the Ecole Supérieure de Danse de Cannes-Mougins. She will be missed dearly by her family, friends and teachers.
TITLE: Little Ballerina Says Goodbye To Bucharest With One Last Urban Shooting

DESCRIPTION: Cat parents all over the world seem to be hacking IKEA Duktig doll beds and I really fell in love with all the photos I was seeing. They inspired me to create a miniature version of my Catnap pillow case design specifically for the IKEA beds. They're screen-printed onto heavy duty canvas, and have just the right amount of organic catnip in each one! They are part cat toy, part comfy cushion for your kitty & their tiny beds.
TITLE: I Make Mini Versions Of My Catnap Pillows For Ikea Duktig Doll Beds To Further Enhance Your Cat Hack

DESCRIPTION:
I decided a while ago that for my high school graduation/summer trip I was going to photograph the Canadian Rockies. I started pursuing landscape photography seriously a little over a year ago and wanted to build a photography portfolio.
I had mostly been shooting cityscapes locally around my home in Toronto and wanted more than anything to visit Banff and Jasper National Parks, and include them on my new website.
TITLE: I Cycled The Canadian Rockies To Photograph The Landscapes

DESCRIPTION: My name is David Tesinsky. When I was visiting Japan I made series of images inspired by Japanese businessmen. I named it after my favorite band's song: Kraftwerk: The Man-Machine.
TITLE: Tragicomical Life Of The Japanese Businessmen That I Captured While Traveling In Japan

DESCRIPTION:
Kids are often underestimated. We think they are too little to know anything. However, you if you spend more time with them you may soon be very surprised.
To prove it, let's share the best inventions that our kids came up with. You never know when it might turn into a real product!
TITLE: 10+ Times Kids Surprised Their Parents With Their Genius Inventions (Add Yours)

DESCRIPTION:
I love the sun, the water, the contact with nature, especially in the summer. This time it reminds me of a carefree childhood when we absorbed the moment when we were not worried about our adult life.
For years I have been happy watching through the lens of children enjoying their vacation with their ability to plunge in everything they do and forget about everything else, even about my lens.
TITLE: I Photograph Children Enjoying Careless Summers Spent Without Technology

DESCRIPTION: A picture of a dog chained up and abandoned in the dangerously rising flood waters from Hurricane Harvey is going viral. Though officials have warned repeatedly against leaving pets and livestock tied up during the storm, we see a poor canine chained to a telephone pole in Victoria, Texas, probably just hours from drowning...
TITLE: Some People Left Their Dogs Tied Up To Die In The Flood And It Will Break Your Heart

DESCRIPTION: Now that season 7 of Game of Thrones has come to a dramatic end, we thought it was time to revisit the cast in their days before they became a part of HBO's most popular series.
TITLE: 10+ Game Of Thrones Actors Who Looked So Different In Their Youth, Some Of Them Are Barely Recognizable

DESCRIPTION: The village Balestrand is situated in the middle of Norways longest fjord, where the mountains meet the ocean, in Sognefjorden (which is also the second longest in the world). Having high mountains with amazing views so close by, it cannot come as a surprise to anyone that hiking is the main activity here.
TITLE: I Spent My Summer Photographing Balestrand, A Hidden Village In Norway

DESCRIPTION: Meet Aaron Franks, a man from Pennsylvania who lives with four dogs - Tessa, Bruno, Cooper and Mia. A few years ago, Franks came up with an idea to do something amazing for his canines, so he turned his backyard into a dog playground.
TITLE: Dog Owner Transforms His Backyard Into A Large Playground With Private Pool For His 4 Dogs

DESCRIPTION: I am a big horse lover - these beautiful animals have been accompanying man for years. My photos are a tribute to these creatures. For centuries immortalized in the paintings of many masters, I too want to have a small contribution to it.
TITLE: I Perpetuate The Unique Bond That Connects Man With Horse

DESCRIPTION: Hungarian artist Agnes Herczeg blends incredibly intricate lace art with knotty wooden pieces of wood and it looks ethereal. Her carefully crafted figures are a calming celebration of our connection with mother nature and the juxtaposition of the looseness of the lace and the solidity of the wood is the link that holds everything together.
TITLE: Hungarian Artist Delicately Attaches Mystical Lace Art To Pieces Of Found Wood, And The Result Is Gorgeous

DESCRIPTION:
Do you know when you are a child and with a stick and a towel around your neck you became powerful knights fighting dragons? We grew up like this and as adults, we wanted to make it ALL real.
Skyrim is a game that has marked us as players where almost everything is possible and there is an infinite amount of possibilities. For that game we have started to create the full weaponry of Skyrim.
TITLE: As Children, We Wanted To Fight Dragons, So Now We Create Incredible Skyrim Weaponry

DESCRIPTION:
I started this project almost a year ago and stopped after a while. Today saw something similar to this theme. So I thought I should post my work before it's too late :D
All the images are collected form google and shutterstock.
TITLE: I Create Worlds In My Cup

DESCRIPTION:
Denny Kurien, creative director of Toronto, designed these pop culture characters and inserted everyday objects he found around his house to complete them. It incorporates objects like pencil, coin, food or key.
The designs turn the products into something completely new and different.
TITLE: Daily Objects Have Been Incorporated Into Pop Culture Characters

DESCRIPTION: It was like stepping into a different world and time. Hidden away in the rolling hills of Chelan, WA aside towering boulders, rocks and trees, resides one of the PNW's best kept secrets. My wife and I wanted to see it for ourselves and took photos that we'll put in photo albums to enjoy for years to come.
TITLE: My Wife And I Found A Hobbit Hole

DESCRIPTION: I'm Amit, 20 FROM Israel. I traveled to Georgia for 2 weeks and found a beautiful wild place, nice and warm people and a great culture and food.
TITLE: I Traveled To Georgia And Documented Its Wild Beauty

DESCRIPTION: On a regular day, you would never dream of spending 6 hours turning an avocado into a piece of art, or covering an entire page of your notebook with mind-blowingly intricate doodles, but it's amazing how creativity is sometimes spurred by a lack of focus.
TITLE: What Happens When People Are Bored At Work (10+ Pics)

DESCRIPTION: Game of Thrones is such an inspiring and wonderful series. I had to create photos of squirrels within this theme. These photos are with wild red squirrels.
TITLE: Squirrel Game Of Thrones

DESCRIPTION: Everyone knows the classic images of Iceland. The famous Skogafoss, The Black Beach, The Blue Lagoon, you name it. On a recent trip to Iceland me and Serena Ho decided we wanted to shoot something a little bit different.
TITLE: Amazing Iceland Aerial Images Show Why The Country Is So Popular For Movies

DESCRIPTION: When 38-year-old Daniel Modøl went outside to film a distant storm he didn't expect it would get so close. He was safely standing on his terrace in Gjerstad, Aust-Agder, Norway and shooting lightning bolts flashing in the area. Nature, however, had planned something more.
TITLE: Man Tries To Capture A Lightning Storm Outside On Camera, Records The Scariest Moment Of His Life

DESCRIPTION:
To take these pictures I used light painting and gadgets I mostly made by myself. 
I worked on my first gadget, called Dreammaker (the ring with crystals), for about a year to make it light and more or less good looking. Some gadgets, like UV filter with vaseline, didn't take so much time to make!
TITLE: I Make DIY Props To Bring Some Magic Into My Photos

DESCRIPTION: Continuing my fascination with gross yet kinda cute creatures this year, I've taken to picking up old vinyl records at thrift stores, and transforming them with slimy Grubbers.
TITLE: I Take Old Vinyl Records And Paint Gross Creatures On Them

DESCRIPTION: Professional photography gear costs thousands of dollars but you can take stunning pictures by spending only a fraction of the cost. If you have the time and the patience, and aren't afraid to get your hands dirty, then simple DIY hacks can achieve similar results to spending big bucks on advanced kits.
TITLE: 10+ Genius Camera Hacks That Will Greatly Improve Your Photography Skills In Less Than 3 Minutes

DESCRIPTION: Well, this is not just another story about quitting your job and selling everything you own to start travelling. This one is about us, Klaudia and Bartosz, a Polish couple who packed their life and moved to the Philippines for half a year..
TITLE: We Moved To The Philippines With 4-Months-Old Twins For Half A Year And Travelled Around Asia

DESCRIPTION: Your grandma's tacky 'welcome' mat probably doesn't reflect you as a person, so we've compiled a selection of alternatives that should be a little more up to snuff.
TITLE: 10+ Creative And Hilarious Doormats That Will Make You Look Twice

DESCRIPTION: When you see your favourite celebrities on TV and in magazines, it's hard to believe they were ever just regular people working to get by. But even the brightest stars had to start somewhere before making it big!
TITLE: 10+ Celebrities Who Had Surprising Jobs Before They Got Famous

DESCRIPTION: If you think you've already seen the cutest marriage proposal of the year, we raise you this heartwarming tale of a Swedish former Olympic diver who recently said 'yes' to his German boyfriend - after being surprised with the ring on a gondola ride in Venice. Here come the tears.
TITLE: Former Olympic Diver Gets Surprise Proposal In Venice, And Their Photos Set The Internet On Fire

DESCRIPTION:
Kalen Hollomon has been gaining prominence in the arts for his work that blends photography and collage. In order to question the rules and behavior of society, sexual stereotypes and the fashion world, the young man mixes magazine clippings with old campaigns and superimposes real people and situations with curious images to create montages.
The process is simple: Kalen goes to the streets with 4 or 5 pieces of pictures taken from editorials, publicity materials and even adult magazines (such as shoes, skirts, legs, and arms).
TITLE: Artist Transforms Boring City Life Into Fun Scenes Using Magazine Cutouts

DESCRIPTION: Eclipse 2017.
TITLE: Love You To The Moon And Back

DESCRIPTION: I just got chickens recently, and I wasn't sure about what to use as a coup. I repurposed my friend's playhouse (taking it off the stilts, fixing the roof, painting and adding a backyard) and it all took only about 2 weeks.
TITLE: Chicken Coup Out Of Repurposed Playhouse

DESCRIPTION:
Flea markets are great for finding hidden treasures and when I got my hands on some old books, I just couldn't stop wondering if these gems might be useful for something different than just reading.
Having a thing for aged and vintage things I got out my fineliners and started doodling on the pages. Turns out I really enjoyed the way words and art merged together creating something new entirely.
TITLE: I Use Old Books To Create Art

DESCRIPTION: Dogs are the kings of Snapchat and they don't even know it. Instead of worrying about popularity and other unimportant BS, doggos are either having fun themselves or are desperately trying to entertain their beloved owners.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Dog Snapchats That Are Impawsible Not To Laugh At (Part 3)

DESCRIPTION: Ever wanted to escape to a cabin deep in the woods and shut yourself away from the world, to retreat to a place where your closest neighbor is so far away that you don't know if you even have neighbors? Well, if you answered no then you might feel differently after checking out this list compiled by Bored Panda.
TITLE: 10+ Neighbours Who Made The Neighbourhood More Interesting

DESCRIPTION: Whether it's your wallet, your phone, or a special gift from a loved one, there's nothing worse than that moment you realize you've lost something important to you.
TITLE: 10+ Unbelievable Stories Of People Finding Things They Thought They Lost Forever

DESCRIPTION: It´s kinda sad how things in life change. Most of the time you don´t even notice. One day they´re just different.
TITLE: I Search For Someone To Love, So Each Of My Characters In These Personal Illustrations Is Searching Too

DESCRIPTION: The things are hotting up between Jon Snow and Daenerys Stormborn (of the House Targaryen, First of Her Name, the Unburnt, blah blah blah) and this racy photoshoot between the two from way back in 2012 are going viral once again.
TITLE: This Photoshoot Of Emilia Clarke And Kit Harington Kissing Is Going Viral, And We All Know What That Means

DESCRIPTION: Tel Aviv-based artist Sophia Weisstub doesn't do tattoos, but she's surprisingly skilled at turning her body into an effective canvas. In fact, her work is directly inspired by human anatomy, and how our society has come to view it.
TITLE: Israeli Artist Draws Doodles On Herself To Change The Way We Think About Our Bodies (NSFW)

DESCRIPTION: God opened a window and His glory amazed me. These are some rare photos of the Eclipse with a color saturation and clouds that define it's beauty.
TITLE: The Great American Solar Eclipse 2017

DESCRIPTION: I was always busy. My job as a graphic designer meant long hours of work and almost always take work home. My children, where babies, and had to adapt to my schedules.
TITLE: How I Discovered That I Could Be Better Mother By Becoming A Photographer

DESCRIPTION:
Our little family love traveling and wherever we go I always take my camera with me and look for opportunities to take some nice portraits of our dog Alfie.
He loves traveling and exploring, posing for portraits not so much, but he knows that this is my thing and we are good friends so he does that for me.
Here are few of our favourite pictures from this year.
TITLE: Meet Alfie, The Traveling Dog

DESCRIPTION: On Monday, August 21, 2017, millions of people were staring at the same thing through doofy glasses, as they tried to catch a glimpse of the solar eclipse. Not only that, they also immortalized the awe-inspiring moment in photos, and *Bored Panda* has collected the best of them in case you missed the phenomenon or can't get enough of it.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Best Shots Of The 2017 Solar Eclipse

DESCRIPTION: We've all been there - sitting at a desk in a high school, waiting for the seemingly never-ending lesson to finish, and doodling the boredom away...
TITLE: 10+ Examples Of Genius Textbook Vandalism By Bored Students That Can Almost Be Forgiven

DESCRIPTION: If you take a stroll around Redwood City, California, you might get the sense that something isn't quite right. Pay particular attention to the shadows. Notice how they seem to misbehave? Flowers sprout from the shadows of bike racks, mailboxes turn into shadow monsters, and shady monkeys hang around atop parking meters. What's going on?
TITLE: This Street Artist Is Painting Fake Shadows To Confuse People, And The Result Looks Too Real

DESCRIPTION: The first eclipse I remember was in 1979. I've seen a few others, but never a total eclipse. Partials are great, but I was prepared for something amazing today.
TITLE: I Photographed A Total Solar Eclipse And It Was Nothing Like I Imagined

DESCRIPTION: Witnessed Winter is an abstract winter painting series where I question things around global warming and the loss of Ice all over the globe. It's painted with a new painting method that I've developed over the past years where I paint with temperatures of over 2000°c. High temperatures generating snow like figurations in the paintings.
TITLE: Winter Is Coming: Watching These Paintings Dry Is Like Watching The Prophecy Of GOT

DESCRIPTION:
At age 20 I set out to complete an Industrial Design Bachelors degree. At the same time I began experiencing mysterious physical symptoms, symptoms that would lead me to an unimaginable future.
I went from kicking soccer balls, running and leading an active life to making use of leg braces, canes and today a full-time wheelchair.
TITLE: I Document The Progression Of My Rare Disease In Heartbreaking Illustrations

DESCRIPTION: When you see your beloved cat every day, you probably don't notice how much it has grown up. Recently, we asked you to share your then and now pictures of cats growing up and it's time to announce the best pics.
TITLE: 10+ Before-And-After Photos Of Cats Growing Up

DESCRIPTION: Few things in life are more difficult to beat than cancer, but as you can see from this inspiring before-and-after list compiled by Bored Panda, if there's one thing tougher than cancer, it's these guys.
TITLE: 10+ Incredible Before & After Pics Of People Who Beat Cancer That Will Make You Appreciate Life

DESCRIPTION:
I am a self-taught photographer and digital artist living and working in my hometown of Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. My work typically consists of pure and good subjects in horrible situations and usually features children.
Superficially, I create concepts based purely on the desire to make myself laugh, but ultimately I create to connect to people.
TITLE: Dark And Creepy Photos By Stolen Innocence Photography

DESCRIPTION: Cats have a special place in my heart, with the look in their eyes and their awesome ability to power nap in whichever place they feel like. These photos are from my trips to Turkey.
TITLE: Istanbul Stray Cats With Purrrsonality

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Epiphanie, I'm a French photographer and my last series is a work about Synesthesia.
There are different types of Synaesthesia and the one that I focus on is Chormesthesia.
Chromesthesia in this work is represented by the mix of two senses, the sight and the hearing.
TITLE: I Merged Two Pictures Together To Recreate Sounds With The Aim Of Showing What The World Could Look Like If People Were All Synesthetes

DESCRIPTION:
Cats are independent animals and those who have one inside the house knows this very well. Unlike dogs, felines like to have their freedom, go out whenever they want and come back when they feel like it.
The artist Andrew Palyanov tells the story of a cat leaving home and travels by venturing through various places and returning to the comfort of his home.
TITLE: Artist Shows In Illustrations The Adventures Of A Journey Of A Kitten

DESCRIPTION:
Would it be a provocation to vegetarians? No, it's just an art different from anything you've ever seen.
Very Still Life is a series of clay sculpture created by Tel-Aviv artist Roni Landa, which describes veggies in a totally carnivorous.
TITLE: The Macabre Masterpieces Of Roni Landa

DESCRIPTION: When mom of two Maya Vorderstrasse got tired of seeing pregnancy portrayed as perfect and easy on social media, she decided to show the world how it actually feels.
TITLE: Creative Mom Reveals The Struggles Of Being Pregnant From Week To Week In Hilariously Honest Pics

DESCRIPTION: I'm Terence Eduarte and I'm an illustrator from the Philippines. Every person has an interesting story to tell and I wanted to channel that into this project. I gathered a lot of silly secrets from friends and unexpected confessions from strangers around the world.
TITLE: For 100 Days, I Illustrated People In Exchange For Their Secrets

DESCRIPTION: This is some of my leaf-cutting art that I'd like to share to everyone. So, here it is! Hope you guys like it.
TITLE: I Turn Leaves Into Human Faces

DESCRIPTION: It's easy to be wary of strangers, especially when they're banging on your door, but this man's example is one that we should all be following.
TITLE: Everyone Ignored This Boy Banging On Doors For Help, Until This Guy Opened The Doors

DESCRIPTION: This Twitter user's brother just built an entire room for his dog under the stairs. When the man shared the photos with the world, they went viral - and for obvious reasons.
TITLE: Man Builds Entire Bedroom Under Stairs For His Dog

DESCRIPTION: Revenge is never the right answer, and it's always better to be the bigger person and turn the other cheek, but if you absolutely insist on getting your own back on somebody, at least make your revenge is proportionate to the wrong you've experienced.
TITLE: Teacher Refuses To Lend Student A Pen During Exam, So He Plans Brutal Revenge That Gets His Teacher Fired

DESCRIPTION:
As someone who's hair barely reaches their shoulders, I wanted to give some of my favorite Disney princesses cool Pinterest inspired hairstyles (you know, the ones that you wish you could wear yourself).
I drew these using Paint tool SAI. Really hope you like them!
TITLE: I Re-Imagined Disney Princess Hairdos

DESCRIPTION: Joseph Watchman Kaliher was born in the 70's in a hippy community. He grew up travelling around the world, coming into contact with diverse cultures which translate into his art. His work is internationally known, and is promoted in various galleries across the globe.
TITLE: Enjoy A Trippy Ride For Your Mind With My Paintings

DESCRIPTION: Meet a Vietnamese man named Tran and his two dogs - Tony and Tiny. Two months ago, the canines, who are real lovebirds, welcomed a litter of puppies. All of them got adopted by Tran's relatives, except for one - a furry doggie named Teddy.
TITLE: This Human Made His Dogs A Tiny Backpack So They Could Carry Their Recently Born Puppies Around

DESCRIPTION: A bunch of male students have come up with a brilliant way to take a stand against what they consider to be sexist dress codes at their high school.
TITLE: After This Sexist High School Sent 20+ Girls Home For Dress Code Violation, Boys Had A Perfect Response

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Carl Ingram and I'm an artist from New Zealand. I've long had a fascination with dark surrealism and horror movies, this interest has lead me to experiment and create a new way of making paintings.
The following creatures were summoned with a Ouija board mounted to a fidget spinner.
TITLE: I Paint Records With A Ouija Board And Fidget Spinner

DESCRIPTION:
I have been a photographer for five years and I have always been challenging myself with new ideas. It's been a while since I wanted to work with water.
The goal in this series was to bring Disney characters to life in a magical way.
TITLE: I Brought Disney Princesses To Life By Photographing My Friends In The Water

DESCRIPTION: 26 years old self learned artist travel in Georgia, in Khevsureti mountains and discovered beautiful places full of magic. He made photos, sketches and try to show us, what he saw.
TITLE: I Illustrate Georgian Landscapes With Mysterious Characters

DESCRIPTION:
I have spent a lot of hours together with horses of different races.
However, there is no more beautiful sight then to come out on a fields, a cold spring morning, and see the silhouettes of the Icelandic horses in the mist.
This is beautiful!
TITLE: Icelandic Horses In The Mist

DESCRIPTION:
I've had an interest in photography for as a long as I can remember, but I never gave myself the chance to properly pursue it until May 2017.
I was spending a few months in Canada with my brother after having completed my undergraduate studies in Landscape Architecture. I left Beirut at the beginning of February and didn't go back until the end of May.
TITLE: I Take Pictures Of Barbies To Highlight Issues On Mental Health And Societal Pressures

DESCRIPTION:
In summer 2015, my human slaves travel-bug started to itch, so she got a bike, packed down a sleeping bag and me (Cezar the travelling cat), and off we went on an epic bike-tour across Europe to escape the Scandinavian winter.
Starting from Sweden over to Denmark and Germany. Next was The Netherlands, Belgium, France, Spain, Portugal and then back to South of Spain.
TITLE: Cezar, The Most Travelled Cat In The World, With 14 Countries Under His Paws

DESCRIPTION: We set up surprise meetings between campaigners and donors for certain GoFundMe campaigns, giving campaigners the chance to say thank you.
TITLE: The Dog Saved By Crowdfunding

DESCRIPTION: Picture the USA in late 1997, but with less boy bands and more post-apocalyptic desolation. That's exactly how Simon Stålenhag envisioned The Electric State, his upcoming latest installment to an impressive streak of successful artbooks, and we're completely lost in how fascinating it turned out.
TITLE: Girl And Her Robot Travel Through Wastelands In Alternate 90s USA In Chilling Illustrations

DESCRIPTION: Award-winning comic artist Dan Dougherty created a comic strip about growing old and it will melt your heart.
TITLE: This Comic About Growing Old Will Change The Way You Look At Life

DESCRIPTION: So here I did photo manipulations using Photoshop about random stuff that I find that could work together.I compose different images together to make a fantasy-like art or something like that during my vacant hours. It took me maybe 27 hours in total to complete all of it.
TITLE: Before And After: I Create Fantasy-Like Photo Manipulations

DESCRIPTION: Hi! I'm Christo, I started my communication design school in 2014. After graduating, I was sort of bored with design work. Because a graphic designer usually makes a work for the benefit of others (just my opinion).
TITLE: I Take Walks At 3 AM To Get Inspiration For My Surreal Artworks

DESCRIPTION: Meet Fiona, the sassy hippo diva, who appears to have zero cares in this world. This young girl, who weighs 356lbs, is a resident at the Cincinnati Zoo in Ohio. She has already gained some fame on the Internet, but nothing could have prepared us for this 81 second video that is pure perfection.
TITLE: Fiona The Hippo Playing In The Water Will Make Your Day In Just 81 Seconds

DESCRIPTION: Every single dog has their own little adorable quirks. Some put their paws on people demanding for attention. Others turn in circles before lying down. And this Golden Retriever licks doors.
TITLE: Dog Licks Front Door When He Wants To Go Out But Then Owners Move And Things Get Hilarious

DESCRIPTION: The Japanese are known for their incredible origami, but Haruki Nakamura creates paper art that most find even more entertaining. Born in 1967, the designer changed his life at 27, when he picked up the encyclopedia of paper craft techniques.
TITLE: Japanese Paper Toys With A Surprise

DESCRIPTION: Hi! You may have seen some of my comics over the internet (maybe) or here on Bored Panda before but if you haven't...
TITLE: I Draw Comics That People Can Relate To (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: In these times of intolerance, fear, and racial tension, it's easy to forget that there are still places in the world where friendship knows no colour. According to Mexican-American soldier Israel Parra, the army is one of them, and his story of a bond he made in Iraq that transcended all boundaries of hate is exactly what we all needed to hear right now.
TITLE: Man Who Hated Blacks And Mexicans Joins Army, And His Conversation With Fellow Mexican Soldier Goes Viral

DESCRIPTION: Norway-based artist Karolina Maria probably celebrates Halloween every day of the year. The 21-year-old regularly uploads freakishly realistic and equally terrifying makeup transformations to her Instagram account which already has more than 368,000 followers.
TITLE: The End Result Will Give You Nightmares

DESCRIPTION:
Chinese artist Zhang Wei built Frankensteins of famous people from countless clippings of the faces of more than 300 anonymous Chinese.
The idea for the series came about when Zhang Wei met in 2008 a Japanese game called Artificial Girl, which lets you create virtual people that do not exist in the real world.
About a year before, he had photographed over 300 Chinese, including relatives, friends and strangers, for a job that sought to discuss the sense of Chinese identity in the 21st century.
TITLE: The Impressive Portraits Of Celebrities Made From Pieces Of The Face Of Ordinary People

DESCRIPTION: Some sketches of my recent project Lines of emotion.
TITLE: Lines Of My Heart

DESCRIPTION: Chomper the alligator is now 7 years old, and 2 1/2 feet long. He is truly a living fossil from the time of dinosaurs. He was confiscated from someone who had him living in their bathtub.
TITLE: The Beauty Of Rescued Black Market Animals Portrayed In 10+ Majestic Photographs

DESCRIPTION:
I am super passionate about fish and ocean life and I also like to make things, so I combined the two and made a completely new type of clock which I called Bonito!
Inspired by the graceful yet efficient movements of fish, I think the moving pendulum tail is really fun and adds a little bit of humour to the home. I am also excited to be partnering with the ocean charity Blue Marine Foundation so that each Bonito is contributing 15% to ocean preservation projects around the world. I hope that my clocks will bring excitement to as many people as possible and will do a small part in preserving one of our planets most beautiful and important resources.
TITLE: I Created A Fish-Shaped Clock That Moves Its Tail

DESCRIPTION:
One year ago I went on a strictly guided 7-day tour in North Korea, where they took away my passport and didn't allow me to explore anything on my own.
North Korea was definitely the weirdest country I had ever visited and during my time there I kept wondering what life was like in the neighboring South Korea, which used to be exactly the same country just over 60 years ago! That's why at the end of that trip I promised myself to visit South Korea this year so that I could compare my experiences in both of those countries. Here's how they compared.
TITLE: Life In North Korea Vs South Korea: My Visual Comparison After Visiting Them Both

DESCRIPTION: A 15-year-old boy named Mitchell Miner and his cow Audri recently participated in the Iowa State Fair dairy cattle show. Despite their hard work and effort, they finished only fifth out of seven. Feeling exhausted, the duo took a nap, when the boy's father came in and snapped a photo of them snuggling side by side.
TITLE: Tired Boy And His Cow Lose Out At Dairy Fair, Fall Asleep And Win The Internet

DESCRIPTION: Harry Potter movies are known for having their fair share of 'jump' moments and dark imagery, but American digital artist Dylan Pierpont has taken it up more than few notches by reimagining the famed films as straight-up horror shows, and he's calling them Scary Potter.

DESCRIPTION: The Tre Cime di Lavaredo mountains are three distinctive battlement-like peaks in the Dolomites. They are majestic and one of the most photographed mountain peaks in the world. I visited the area two years ago during the day and was blown away by the majestic mountain landscape.

DESCRIPTION:
This amazing church is located at Samarina, Greece, built in 1812. It is devoted to Virgin Mary and every year on the 15th of August a great celebration takes place in the village gathering visitors from all over the country.
At some point a small pine tree grew inside the church's temple and now it comes magnificently out of the roof! The tree is over 100 years old.

DESCRIPTION:
Dutch award-winning photographer Marinka Masséus created the photo series 'Under the Same Sun' to raise awareness about the horrible circumstances of people with albinism (PWA) in Tanzania. Her aim is to show their beauty and share a message of acceptance and inclusion.
In Tanzania, when you have albinism, you are thought to be evil.

DESCRIPTION:
Password of magic is Love and Poetry, so you can make a wish and if you kiss your loved ones and recite them a poem these dolls will become magical and your wish will come true!
It's our magical story about Keepers of magic!
We make people happy every weekend here in Kiev in a colorful place called Landscape Alley, we come there to meet people who appreciate beauty and art.
They say that our dolls bring happiness, so they come to us again and again, and it's such fun! Dreams that they had came true and they tell us stories about it! Especially little children. Girls learn poems by heart and recite them to us, and we give them our fairy dolls.

DESCRIPTION:
Brazilian graphic designer and illustrator Butcher Billy got the idea of turning famous love hits into book covers of horror master Stephen King. Joy Division's Love Will Tear Us Apart, The Smiths, Head Over Heels by Tears For Fears and many others were portrayed in a very unusual way.
This series imagines an alternate universe where some of the most desperate and tragic romantic songs in the '70s and' 80s are actually books written by Stephen King.
TITLE: Brazilian Illustrator Reimagines Famous Love Songs As Creepy Book Covers By Stephen King

DESCRIPTION: At first glance, DestinyBlue's art may only strike you as colourful, somewhat melancholy Anime-inspired portraits. If you look a little closer, however, you'll notice hidden messages that tell the story of the British artist's harrowing struggle with depression.
TITLE: 10+ Illustrations With Deep Meanings Created By An Artist Struggling With Depression

DESCRIPTION: Hi, my name is Barbara and I'm from a little Mediterranean Slavic country called Croatia. I'm obsessed with mineral world and mythology. I've grown up listening to my grandma tell stories about fairies in forest and fields that once were inhabiting our land.
TITLE: I Create Magical Jewelry Inspired By Stories That My Grandma Told Me When I Was A Kid

DESCRIPTION: With season seven of Game of Thrones well underway, we thought it was about time that we took a moment to reflect on how certain characters have evolved since they first appeared on our screens.
TITLE: How Game Of Thrones Characters Have Changed From Season 1 To Now

DESCRIPTION: Adam Savage of MythBusters hooked up with the team at Magic Wheelchair, an organization that works with makers to build awesome costumes for children in wheelchairs. At this year's Comic-Con, Magic Wheelchair unveiled five new Justice League-themed builds for these amazing kids, and we were honored to be there for the reveal!
TITLE: These Amazing Wheelchairs Customized For Kids At Comic Con Will Make You Tear Up

DESCRIPTION:
For the last few years my cousin Victoria has been buying old and broken watches at flea markets and turns them into real art objects. Every detail in gear composition is placed by hand, each jewerly piece takes from 2 to 14 hours of laborious work.
Victoria says, she finds inspiraton in vintage watch movements, they are mezmerizing.
TITLE: My Cousin Recycles Old Watch Into Unique Handmade Jewelry

DESCRIPTION: I am a South African born Illustrator, graphic designer and adventurer. I am meticulous when it comes to attention-to-detail in my illustrations. This can be seen in every stipple, line and cross-hatch.
TITLE: I Create Intricate Pen And Ink Drawings

DESCRIPTION:
B&W Child Photo Competition is an international photo competition that showcase the very best black and white child photographs from around the globe every year.
Ever since the 2014, we are giving splendid child photographers a chance to be discovered. You can see last year's winners here.
TITLE: The Best Photos From The First Half Of B&W Child Photography Photo Contest Of 2017

DESCRIPTION: Looking for new friendship goals? Then look no further than Mame and Riku.
TITLE: This Little Japanese Girl And Her Pet Poodle Will Make Your Day

DESCRIPTION: Living with other people certainly has its benefits. You'll never feel lonely (even if you want to), you'll always have somebody to talk to (even if they don't want to), and you get to share the chores (even though there are usually at least twice as many of them). But as you can see from this hilarious list of roommate pranks compiled by Bored Panda, living with other people can also have its downside.
TITLE: 10+ Times Living With Roommates Was The Worst

DESCRIPTION: A matryoshka doll is a Russian folk toy comprised of several wooden figurines of decreasing size placed one inside another. It is immensely popular both in the country and all around the world as the matryoshka is a traditional souvenir brought from Russia. Usually, the doll has some flower patterns on it, but I want to share the most unique ones that would please true art lovers.
TITLE: From Russia With Love: Folk Souvenirs As Works Of High Art

DESCRIPTION:
SEWP  is a Toronto-based artist who creates incredible, dark, freaky and slightly erotic tattoos of faceless girls.
His signature tattoos are of shadowy-faced girls with piercing white eyes. Their haunting presence fascinates more than 40k followers on Instagram.
TITLE: 10+ Slightly Erotic Tattoos Of Faceless Girls Might Keep You Up At Night

DESCRIPTION: Get your tissues handy - you're going to need them after watching In a Heartbeat. It's a new animated short film that is absolutely breaking the Internet, and it's so necessary in today's climate of intolerance and hate.
TITLE: New Pixar-Like Short Film About A Boy Coming Out Is Taking Internet By Storm Because, Well, Just Watch It

DESCRIPTION: According to illustrator Paul Westover, no one makes more irrational, emotion-based decisions than Disney characters. To highlight this, he has created a brilliant series. It imagines alternate Disney movie endings, showing how the stories would have unfolded if Simba, Aladdin, and other beloved characters used basic logic.
TITLE: How Disney Movies Would Have Ended If Their Characters Made Rational Decisions

DESCRIPTION:
It was not the first time I visited this city but I had very few memories of the city. One of things I still could remember is the special atmosphere of this gigantic place called Mezquita.
THE OLD AL-ANDALUS CAPITAL: As being one part of UNESCO World Heritage Sites since 1984, the central neighborhood still retains a great deal of its architectural and cultural heritage during years and years.
TITLE: Cordoba And The Mezquita, A Worldwide Unique Architectural Monument

DESCRIPTION: As long as i could hold a pencil ,i sketched. I had surgeries in my hand so i couldn't go to an art school. A few months ago i bought a second-hand tablet laptop and started this comic.
TITLE: About 2 Months Ago I Started Making My Own Comics About My Life, Hopes And Fails

DESCRIPTION: Every year I travel to and through Italy. At least twice. Once for holiday and once for exploring abandoned buildings.
TITLE: I Photographed Beautiful Abandoned Buildings In Italy

DESCRIPTION: 18-year-old Harry Hambley is the artist behind Ketnipz comics. The UK-based artist chose a simple fun style to present his ideas. The main character is a unique but still relatable pink bean-shaped persona.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Comics By 18-Year-Old Artist

DESCRIPTION:
To start off with, the landscape of Norway is nothing less than incredible. No wonder they have places named such as Trollstigen and Trolltunga (Trolls' Path & Troll tongue), when the nature of this country could've been taken straight out of a fairy tale.
I am Swedish, but have never before visited this neighbouring country.
TITLE: I Documented The Breathtaking Norway

DESCRIPTION: When groom Doshinski and his bride were at a pre-wedding venue viewing, the bride didn't know it was also supposed to be a pre-wedding photo shoot...
TITLE: The Bride Was Busy During A Pre-Wedding Shoot, So The Groomsman Stepped In And The Result Is Hilarious

DESCRIPTION: Travelling on the highways in North Korea is a great experience, as it allows us to see the daily life of the country not controlled by the government like in Pyongyang. The highways connect the main towns of the counties and are totally car-free. This creates a very strange atmosphere since the roads are as large as airstrips, however in poor conditions with numerous bumpings and holes.
TITLE: Highway To Yell In North Korea Which I Captured During The Last Trip

DESCRIPTION:
The Aztec culture is well known and not forgotten today even though it disappeared centuries ago but it still shows up in unexpected ways even today in Mexico.
Our inspiration came from this unforgotten culture. We had a great team to work with all details and we hope you like it as we did creating it.
TITLE: Maternity Pictures Inspired By Authenticity Of Aztec Culture

DESCRIPTION: Max Malloy, a Latvian-born artist, spent his childhood near the Baltic sea. 13 years ago, he decided to move to Ireland to be closer to the ocean and to the never ending green fields. He enjoyed these for many years, until one day when he decided to project the beauty of Ireland and his feelings for it into photography, as a means of sharing beauty with others.
TITLE: Experience The Beauty Of Ireland In Photos

DESCRIPTION: Synesthesia artist Dillon James sees colors and patterns in his vision when he hears sounds. He has a type of synesthesia known as Chromesthesia. So, he has merged those colors with the faces of the people he's painting.
TITLE: Artist With Synesthesia Combines People And Their Voices In His Paintings

DESCRIPTION: Most people don't really pay much attention to what's surrounding them when shopping at a supermarket. They just come in, grab what they need, and check out. There's absolutely nothing wrong with that, but next time when you go grocery shopping, we recommend trying to take a look around... Why? Because even a misspelled or misplaced sign could make your day a whole lot better! Take a look at Bored Panda's list of hilarious supermarket fails below and you'll see what I mean. Feel free to add your own photos if you've seen any similar supermarket fails lately!
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Supermarket Fails

DESCRIPTION:
Potatoes beware - there's a new masher in town. This rocket-shaped masher is on a mission to make mashed potatoes that are out of this world!
Called Space Masher, this product is built to look like a rocket taking off from your mashed potato dish, leaving behind billowing clouds of smoke.
Space Masher is designed by OTOTO and now available for pre-order.
TITLE: Space Masher Just Landed And It Will Take Your Mashed Potatoes Out Of This World

DESCRIPTION: Working in an office isn't exactly the most enviable job in the world. You're hunched over a computer in a low-ceilinged room with a bunch of other people for hours on end, your eyes often straining from the cold glare of dodgy strip lights while you and your colleagues inhale and exhale the same stale air all day. But as you can see from this hilarious list compiled by Bored Panda, some offices look like a lot more fun than others!
TITLE: 10+ Funny Pics That Perfectly Sum Up Office Life

DESCRIPTION:
Alone I ride,
at once crossing with the winds
and drifting with it.
Between land and sky,
I feel alive,
know nothing about life.
The distance is far,
my destination is here.
TITLE: A Solo Cyclist Illustrated In One Stroke Chinese Calligraphy

DESCRIPTION: David Daneman has a lot to say with his comic series The DaneMen, but it turns out that silence is his strongest storytelling technique.
TITLE: 10+ Dark And Unexpectedly Hilarious Comics By David Daneman

DESCRIPTION: Romantic surprises help couples keep the spark burning but some of them act out better in our heads than in reality. Illustrator Jacob Andrews has created 5 hilarious comics that perfectly sum up these passionate endeavors.

DESCRIPTION:
Created for Gallery 1988's first Official Rick and Morty Art Show in Los Angeles. Rick and Morty is a cartoon featured on Adult Swim.
Drawings were made using chalk pastel on BFK Rives paper.
TITLE: I Created Realistic Portraits Of Rick And Morty

DESCRIPTION: Meet Paddy, the special-needs Chihuahua who was rescued trying to cross a deadly four-lane highway. The doggie was very starved, and kept falling over due to a misaligned disc in his neck. Luckily, he got adopted, and a few months later he even got a very special friend - a lamb named Lily.
TITLE: This Dog Has Just Lost His Best Friend, So They Gave Him A Plushie That Looks Just Like Her

DESCRIPTION: When 4-month-old Jonas Gutierrez from San Antonio, Texas, was forced to wear a helmet after being diagnosed with plagiocephaly, his family didn't want him to feel any different from the rest of them, so they came up with the sweetest way to show their solidarity - they all decided to wear helmets too!
TITLE: This Baby Has To Wear A Helmet So The Whole Family Decides To Step In

DESCRIPTION: These violent delights have violent ends...
TITLE: Dreamy Romeo And Juliet Inspired Photo Shoot

DESCRIPTION:
As a long-time fan of Alice in Wonderland, Sue has endeavored to capture and convey the whimsy and charm of the Alice stories in her newest line of heirloom quality jewelry. Each piece has been expertly carved in wax to maximize detail and the expressiveness of the characters, before casting in sterling silver or bronze.
The line will start with necklaces, but if there is sufficient interest Sue already has plans to expand it to include earrings, bracelets, and rings, featuring a range of different Alice in Wonderland characters and scenes.
TITLE: Lifelong Alice In Wonderland Fan Makes Wonderland A Reality

DESCRIPTION: Nobody stays young and handsome forever, that's a fact of life. Melbourne street artist Rone, whose full name is Tyrone Wright, recently finished a new project that he called The Omega Project.  He continues his longstanding interest in the concept of creating something beautiful within the context of decay and decline.
TITLE: Artist Covers Soon-To-Be-Demolished House In Murals To Let It Shine For The Last Time

DESCRIPTION:
I made these series of Twouniversese/times/views. I tried to show same thing in two different perspectives.
Positive and negative, Alternate Universes, Two timelines - you can call it anything.
TITLE: I Photograph The Same Miniature Scene From Two Perspectives To Portray Alternate Universes

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Igor and I live in cold Russia. In between dismantling of an AK-47 assault rifle and training of the home bear, I like to listen to music and when I peer into the cover of the album I find a place for myself there.
I have decided to make a small selection of interesting covers and show what might be off-screen if I were there.
TITLE: I Extend Famous Album Covers To Create Hilarious Stories

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Anna Tokarska and I'm a Polish artist & photographer creating realistic looking portraits composed mostly of fruits and vegetables. The inspiration behind the work, are the paintings of XVI Italian mannerist Giuseppe Arcimboldo, who has been known for his incredible allegorical-still life-portraits.
The whole set of eight photographs took about a month to complete.
TITLE: I Use Fruits And Vegetables To Create Realistic Looking Portraits

DESCRIPTION: Unless you keep your finger on the fashion pulse constantly, it's difficult to know just what is and what isn't considered to be in at any given time. But no matter how bad your sense of fashion might be, we're pretty sure we can all agree that the clothes below will NEVER be in style.
TITLE: 10+ Epic Clothing Disasters

DESCRIPTION: If you walked past Jaimie Wilson on the street, you'd probably take him for an all-American heartthrob; muscular build, deep blue eyes, and casual scruff. You would probably never guess that he's one of approximately 1.4 million transgender adults living in the US today.
TITLE: Transgender Man Shares Incredible Before & After Progress Photos, Loses His Friends And Family

DESCRIPTION: If you work in advertising, you know what it's like when a bad client comes along. Thankfully, the staff of Coplex (formerly Ciplex) have been observing a variety of clients in their native habitats for some time now, and they've come up with a handy field guide on how to approach this temperamental species.
TITLE: 15 Types Of Difficult Clients And How to Deal With Each Of Them

DESCRIPTION:
Is it possible to spend summer without butterflies and wild flowers? Unique handmade jewelry that mimics the shape of true butterflies: Death's-head hawkmoth, Actias luna and other.
Precious collection of amazing insects in woodland.
TITLE: I Create Unique Handmade Jewelry That Mimics The Shape Of True Butterflies

DESCRIPTION: Ekaterina Panfilova, a wonderful craftswoman and a true artist from Moscow, creates stunning jewelry: unusual brooches you would hardly understand what technique they are made of. Glittering, as if sprinkled with a summer rain, her brooches are actually made of polymer clay, but the amazing texture is given by crystals and gems. Ekaterina implements her brilliant ideas with this amazing technology very efficiently and carefully.
TITLE: The Sunshine Of A Talent: Textured Brooches By Ekaterina Panfilova

DESCRIPTION:
My friend suggested I start 100-day challenge, and I took up drawing miniature paintings ranging from Monet's water lilies to Harry Potter and Buckbeak!
I'm currently on day 21!
TITLE: I Paint Miniature Watercolor Art For My 100-Day Drawing Challenge!

DESCRIPTION:
I love 35mm photography. Especially since Instagram came on the scene, before then I had spent time creating the right Photoshop effects to create that vintage feel - suddenly, everyone was doing the same on an app - and I was frustrated.
So, I picked up my 35mm camera and start capturing the world around me on film.
TITLE: I Want To Show The Beauty Of 35mm Film

DESCRIPTION:
She's been working very hard lately.
Also, might need some sleeping lessons.
TITLE: My Girlfriend Is Really Tired

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Micah and I want you to feel like a fairy princess whilst cleaning the house and running errands, not just at a festival! I make crowns using wire and quartz because I am a silversmith without a studio. Living a minimalist lifestyle for a few years can make you grow as an artist - you have to make the most of your space and equipment to achieve your objective.
I began making crowns a few years ago when inspired by festival fashions; I love seeing people dance around as fairies, unicorns, mermaids, princesses, whatever you want to be outside of everyday life, and thought every day you CAN wear a crown.
TITLE: I Make Crowns For Your Fantastical Outfits

DESCRIPTION: I am a bird photographer but due to a small accident 1 month back, I was unable to lift the heavy telephoto lenses. So I invested my time to capture the small world in my garden and around my office. Moreover, since it's monsoons, it's the ideal time for the insects.
TITLE: I Am Bored Macro Photographer

DESCRIPTION: It's not easy to change your negative lifestyle habits. That's why they're called habits. But one woman finally decided that enough was enough, and as you can see from her incredible before and after pictures, the impact has been truly remarkable.
TITLE: This Is What Happens When You Change Your Bad Habits

DESCRIPTION: I've always been fascinated by the intricacy of paper cutting art, specifically kirigami or origamic architecture. Some of the artists that inspire me include Professor Masahiro Chatani, Ingrid Siliakus, and Hary & Deepti. With my background in architecture & product design, I wanted to create something beautiful and also practical, hence the lamp functionality.
TITLE: I Hand-Folded A 3D Castle That Turns Into A Cozy Lamp When Illuminated

DESCRIPTION: Some pictures I took in Paris while traveling for few days.
TITLE: I Took Some Pictures In Paris And The Results Are Pretty Satisfying

DESCRIPTION: After realizing I look like Little Debbie, I decided to own it.
TITLE: I Photoshopped Myself As Little Debbie And Have Been Putting Stickers On Actual Boxes Since June 2017

DESCRIPTION: I'm an American expat who grew up in Hong Kong, and have now lived in Beijing for three years. I know I won't be here forever, and I'll be sorry to leave this frenetic, inspiring place.
TITLE: Leaving Beijing, With Love

DESCRIPTION: James Findley is a professional aquascaper who uses water as a playground to create intricate mini worlds. You get attached to every scape that you planted, said Findley. He compares aquascaping to painting: An artist has to understand what happens when he puts his paint onto a canvas, that's what I would equate [aquascaping] to. If you understand what's gonna happen when you put plants into substrates and add CO2 & light (that comes with a little bit of experience), no more or less, we're just artists with plants.
TITLE: Aquascaping: The Art Of Aquarium Decoration

DESCRIPTION:
My paintings are large scale, hyperrealistic renditions of microscopic sections of human skin, which serve as an investigation of emotional and psychological landscapes translated through the visual analysis of flesh. 
Through 'close ups'  of skin, I explore the endless fluctuations and subtle intonations of color and temperature found within flesh that are in many ways reflective of the breadth and fragility of human emotion. 
I am particularly interested in how the magnification of flesh can induce an alternating sense of claustrophobia and desire.
TITLE: My Hyperrealistic Paintings Of Human Skin

DESCRIPTION:
When I first saw them, they looked to me as giant robot heads sticking out of the earth, and I had no idea what the purpose of those concrete/metal structures was.
Later I found out that those are Bomb Shelter entrances/exits. I managed to map them and then decided which ones to use for the project.
TITLE: We Turned Old Bomb Shelters Into Robot Heads

DESCRIPTION:
I'm an oil painter from New Zealand creating surreal paintings made with an unusual process.
I start with a marbeling process (floating oil paint on water then transferring the pattern to paper). Once that's dry I work in thin transparent layers of oil paint to bring out patterns, people and objects.
TITLE: I Create Marbled Madness Using Oil Paint

DESCRIPTION:
Hello everyone! I'm Lukasz, a self-taught artist from Poland.
Three years ago, just for the fun of it, I started creating a short comic story set in the time of viking discovery and exploration of North America. It was supposed to be a story that I hadn't read before - something that combined my two biggest boyish interests: vikings and indians (how cool is that?)
Then, as I delved deeper into the research, the story and the universe I created started to grow.
TITLE: I Spend Three Years Crafting A Tale About A Viking In Newly Discovered America

DESCRIPTION: I am a decent person. My brain on the other hand is a vile, perverted, despicable thing. Here are some conversations between Me and My brain.
TITLE: Ugh, My Brain Says The Grossest Things

DESCRIPTION: Back in the times of the Ottoman Empire, people would build elaborate miniature palaces for the birds. Found in the territory of today's Turkey, the birdhouses were affixed to the outer walls of significant city structures, such as mosques, inns, bridges, libraries, schools and fountains.
TITLE: Incredible Ottoman-Era Bird Palaces That Show How Much Turkish People Loved Birds

DESCRIPTION: Sidrit spends up to 250 hours hand-carving his beloved movie characters: Lord of the Rings & the Hobbit are my favorites. I love Gandalf!

DESCRIPTION: Winning the food lottery? That's probably the best feeling in the world. Losing it, however, is more painful than your empty stomach could ever imagine.
TITLE: 10+ Times People Absolutely Lost The Food Lottery

DESCRIPTION: There's a giant 26-foot-tall Knife Angel sculpture in the UK, built entirely out of 100,000 donated knives. But besides the impressive statistics, it's also a monument built out of morbid necessity to remember the victims fallen to the increasing knife violence in the United Kingdom and to finally acknowledge that there is a real problem.
TITLE: Sculptor Spends 2 Years To Build Knife Angel Out Of 100,000 Weapons, However Government Rejects It

DESCRIPTION:
The children that arrive at the orphanage in Alytus are different, very vulnerable, and they need special attention, care and help of various specialists. Attention for a child in the orphanage is not individualised; the lack of encouragement of cognitive activity, emotional relations, adequate parental example (as inspiration) is inevitable.
The creative aspirations of my brother and I came through early yet they were constantly clouded by the poor household and parental negligence and later - by routine environment of the orphanage.
TITLE: You Are Already Looking At Me Longer Than My Parents Ever Did

DESCRIPTION:
Everyone knows that if a cat fits, it sits. No matter how tight or, to our eye, uncomfortable the space is, cats must and will find a way to fit there.
Does your cat surprise you with its liquid-like abilities to get into anything? Share pictures here!
TITLE: If It Fits, I Sits: Post Your Photos Of Cats Fitting Into The Tightest Spaces

DESCRIPTION: Probably everything can be turned into an art object, in my opinion. It all depends on your attitude to an object or art in general. The artworks are created from expired and useless objects.

DESCRIPTION: Parents definitely have dirtier minds than children, and here's proof.

DESCRIPTION:
Art and science seem like two completely different worlds but sometimes they merge, swirl and produce something remarkable. Early after the development of the modern computers artist such as Georg Nees and Frieder Nake used computers and plotters to draw complex and fascinating figures.
Now scientists develop machines that can paint with real paint and brushes.

DESCRIPTION: Two months ago I got bored from usual traveling pictures, so I started to combine them together by using double exposure. I've got inspired by Salvador Dali, Rene Magritte and my new phone which I got before 10 hours flight to Sri Lanka, so it was plenty of time to experiment. After that I went to one more trip to Latvia.

DESCRIPTION:
If you love fashion and Disney characters, we've just discovered you're new favorite Instagram.
Artist Gregory Masouras created incredible mashups on his Instagram by replacing models with Disney princesses and other characters. Gigi Hadid gets transformed into Elsa, Kendall Jenner gets a Snow White makeover and even the Edna Mode as Anna Wintour.

DESCRIPTION:
Imagine the following situation: the zombie apocalypse has arrived and you are there in the midst of millions of undead! Terror is everywhere and besides having to worry about food, drinking water, shelter and other necessities, you'll probably need to kill some zombies to survive, and these zombies are kids !! Terrible is not it?
This time it is the photographer Amanda J. Alvares who decided to toast us with these frightening children.
A professional of weddings and family photos, he had the idea a few years ago to do this project, when photographing children characterized for the Halloween parties.

DESCRIPTION: I have been a freelance hair and makeup artist for 10 years and have always dreamed of the day I could do Disney Character inspired makeup. I use mainly drugstore makeup brands to create these looks. And there are no hair pieces or extensions used at all.

DESCRIPTION:
When we talk about fashion photography we all know that it is a product of manufacture with little time of life, something comercial. Very few photographers have managed to bring fashion photography to the artistic field, and they are what we call legends today.
Big names like Helmut Newton, Amsel Adams and Richard Avedon come to our minds when we think about the immortals of photography.

DESCRIPTION: This is BITZ. Using my pet whippets as inspiration I set myself the challenge to build a functional stop-motion puppet using ONLY the random junk I had in my toolbox. Cat Care Community and Pukainis.

Belgian street artist Jonathan Pauwels, better known as JAUNE, creates hilarious art both in streets and in galleries.
Wondering what the secret life of the city's technicians and employees would be like, the artist spread little illustrations across the streets of Belgium showing these guys in comic situations, revealing their secret lives.

DESCRIPTION: In my free time I teach my plotter bot Karel to draw with a pen. This is one of his styles. The photo is first divided into small tiles and then Karel randomly selects a style for each tile.
