DESCRIPTION:
I met Lone and Liga in Malmo, during one of my earlier visits to Sweden. They attended a button masala workshop and requested me to come back and teach the refugee kids for their B art program.
I obviously could not miss the opportunity and went back in the month of November to Malmo to teach these kids.
TITLE: 300 Old Tshirts, 20 Refugee Kids And One Wind Mill

DESCRIPTION: These are some of my recent drawings. I started drawing in 2007. My first drawings were cartoon characters.
TITLE: Some Of My Portraits That I Drew Using Pencils

DESCRIPTION: When you think of Slavic culture, the first things that come to mind are probably vodka, fur hats, and the Orthodox church. Polish photographer Marcin Nagraba, however, wanted to show the world a more ancient view of his Slavic roots - by dialing it all the way back to Pagan times.
TITLE: Incredible Pagan-Themed Photoshoot By Polish Photographer Reveals Stunning Beauty Of Slavic Culture

DESCRIPTION: I recently got a Nespresso machine for my birthday. Since we set it up, my wife thinks she is the Picasso of the barista world..
TITLE: My Wife Thinks She Is Picasso Of The Barista World

DESCRIPTION:
There are always flowers for those who want to see them. - Henri Matisse
I have always been very much inspired by the beauty, colours and simplicity of flowers. For me, flowers are the living proof that magic do exist in this world! I always try to portray little visual stories which are atmospheric, dreamy and give a sense of emotions.
TITLE: I Use Flowers To Create Magical Images

DESCRIPTION: The Italians certainly know how to construct breathtakingly beautiful buildings, which means it is all the more heartbreaking when you see the ones which are abandoned. I spent a very memorable 6 days driving around Italy, entering and photographing their most photogenic derelict buildings. I hope you enjoy the photographs.
TITLE: Abandoned Italy

DESCRIPTION:
Needle felting is a beautiful thing when it comes to sculpting animals, as the effect is fuzzy, soft, and can be as realistic as your imagination and patience will allow. I have spent the past year furiously poking wool roving with my little barbed needles to create cute animal friends.
I'm always trying to improve my technique and achieve a greater level of detail! I sell these little guys and custom-created personalized felted pets on my Etsy shop, Honoring Wilderness.
TITLE: I Create Realistic Needle Felted Animals Out Of Goat Wool

DESCRIPTION: I turn 30 this year and I always loved toys, I like to travel with them and turn them alive with my camera. My backpack is always full of action figures, Lego and other toys to make pictures during my trips. For examples you can find my toys below in France, Switzerland, Japan, Germany, Cuba.
TITLE: I Turn My Toys Alive With My Camera

DESCRIPTION: Berk Armagan is a 22 years old self-taught artist & traveler from Turkey, who uses paper coffee cups as his medium. Berk usually decides what to draw before he visits the location but sometimes he gets inspired by the streets and the buildings on the spots as well. He travels with plain cups and all of the illustrations are made on the road.
TITLE: Artist Travels The World And Uses Paper Coffee Cups As His Canvas To Reflect What He Sees

DESCRIPTION: If you stay at hotels often, you know that most of them seem to offer the same old thing - mildly friendly reception, a decent bed, and a warm shower. Today, however, we'd like to focus on a few hotels that decided to up their game and take hospitality to the next level.
TITLE: 10+ Times Hotels Surprised Everyone With Their Creativity

DESCRIPTION: Do you take the subway to and from work? Well, you might want to think about walking instead once you've seen this bizarre bunch of people who were snapped on various tubes, subways and undergrounds around the world.

DESCRIPTION:
This piece was made out of laser cut mat-board, with an embedded mirror as the surface of the water, and framed with stained hickory. The wall hanging piece is 33 in x 43 in x 4 in
After visiting this amazing national park this May, I decided to recreate it with a bit of a psychedelic spin.
I use a laser cutter at a local maker space here in Colorado (Tinkermill in Longmont).
TITLE: I Made This Crater Lake Sculpture With A Mirror Inside

DESCRIPTION: Ah, Italians. They gave us pizza, Leonardo da Vinci, amazing wine... Oh, and Western civilization. We have a lot to thank this Southern European nation for, and here at Bored Panda, we're doing it the only way we really know how - with jokes.

DESCRIPTION: Some people think thrift stores, yard sales and flea markets are nothing but places to find piles of junk that other people don't want. DESCRIPTION: For anybody thinking about owning a Pomeranian, there's one thing that you probably need to know. They melt in water.

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Emily Copeland, I'm a Canadian charcoal artist, specializing in photorealism. I focus on recreating objects on a larger scale.
At the age of only 23, less than a year out of my Undergrad, I secured my first large scale solo show in the heart of New York City, at the Bernarducci Meisel Gallery after getting noticed on Instagram.

DESCRIPTION:
Anyone who has an animal likes to take pictures with them - and, well, there are those who do not need owners to pose for the cameras. But is the feeling reciprocal? Photos shared on sites like Reddit show that there are several cats that hate selfies.
 
In addition to fun, the images bring a warning: when it comes to posing with dogs and cats, avoid flashes, as they annoy and irritate pets.
TITLE: Internet Gathers Cats Who Hate Selfies And The Result Is Hilarious

DESCRIPTION: A stray puppy wandering on the side of the road just outside Beirut, Lebanon, recently caught the attention of Amal Andari as she and a friend drove by. Though they only meant to give her some water, when they discovered a gaping wound on her head, they knew she needed more serious help - and fast.
TITLE: This Homeless Puppy Was Shot Dozens Of Times In Head, But She Kept Fighting For Her Life

DESCRIPTION: When a barber shop owner, Rich Holtham, got an estimate of £1000 for the new shop floor, he decided he can do better. So instead, he exchanged 700 pounds to 70,000 pennies and covered the whole floor with them.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Chuando Tan, the Singaporean photographer who will make you wonder just what the hell you're doing wrong in life. Because believe it or not, Tan is actually 50-years-old. Yes. That's right. Five zero. And he seems to be getting younger with age.

DESCRIPTION: It's no secret that life in the far east moves a lot faster than most of us could ever imagine, but you might be shocked to find out that this also applies to the modelling industry.

DESCRIPTION: Humpback whales are pretty big. Quite enormous in fact. The average weight of a fully grown adult is around 36,000kg, which is about the same weight as 24 adult hippos, but that didn't stop the massive mammal in the video below from putting on an incredible air display when it leapt completely out of the water in South Africa recently.
TITLE: 40-Ton Whale Was Just Filmed Jumping Completely Out Of The Water, And This Incredible Video Is Going Viral

DESCRIPTION:
As I love trying new and fun techniques, I decided one day to dip my brushes into some of my favourite beverages and with a little practice, I was able to create the paintings below. Some might celebrate their daily work at the easel with a large glass of red wine, I just prefer to pour it on my watercolour paper!
To use coffee as paint, I have to brew it quite strong. Tea is simply lovely when painted but is just too light to show up in a single pass - I normally brew a couple of tea bags in a shot glass of boiling water for about 10 minutes to make the tea as dark as possible.
TITLE: I Use Coffee, Tea, Beer, And Wine To Create My Art

DESCRIPTION: President Tito had the bunker built in case of a nuclear attack on Yugoslavia. It was unknown to everyone until 1992 and was open to the public in 2011. Yugoslavia's third largest military investment (4.
TITLE: I Went To A Yugoslavian Secret Underground Nuclear Bunker

DESCRIPTION: Remember Taz from Looney Tunes? He and all Tasmanian Devils are considered endangered. Luckily, people like Tim Faulkner dedicate their lives to fighting their extinction. Tim is a Tasmanian Devil keeper in Australia, and the animals that he takes care of love him with all their hearts. Especially the little ones.
TITLE: Baby Tasmanian Devil Is So In Love With His Human It Follows Him Everywhere He Goes

DESCRIPTION:
Deeply disturbed by Trump's suggestion to build a wall, I drew a wordless picture book about Wall (War) and Please (Peace). Peace, Will You Play With Me? is a story about how adults build walls of separation that kids easily bring down through their love and innocence.
For even the toughest walls shall not stand strong when faced with a child's innocence.
TITLE: I Drew A Picture Book About Wall (War) And Please (Peace)

DESCRIPTION:
The digital artist Gregory Masouras does arts using  Disney characters as Game Of Thrones characters. In these digital mash-ups, you can see what happens when 16 characters of Disney are placed into the sets of Game Of Thrones.
His works are prominent in the world media, just like the magazines Glamour, W, Vogue and more which have already made articles about it.
TITLE: If Disney Characters Acted In Game Of Thrones

DESCRIPTION: I always dreamed to take maternity shoots in that amazing place. And I did it!

DESCRIPTION: Cy and Kai, married for six years, have been traveling the world to see Game of Thrones locations - and they don't take the usual touristy photos. Kai shares, We travel every year, it's one of our traditions as a couple. We love to discover new places and equally LOVE GoT.
TITLE: Couple Travels To Experience Iconic Game Of Thrones Shoot Locations

DESCRIPTION:
Once upon a time, my best friend and I used to read hundreds of fairy tales. Years after that, they still left an imprint and we are always trying to re-create that magical feeling through our visual stories.
We made it our life goal to make the world more colorful one photo at a time.
TITLE: I Captured A Fairytale With A Cosmic Twist

DESCRIPTION: I'm Ana, a 19 years old game development student that mainly likes to draw. I have been struggling with my mental health for a while, medicine, counseling and all but had to drop it. My art is what makes me happy and the wish to create keeps me on my feet.
TITLE: Trying To Cope With Depression And Decaying Mental Health Through Simple But Meaningful Doodles

DESCRIPTION:
Yeah you read correctly, signs you stick in dog poop :P The idea is to stick the signs in dog poop you find on the sidewalk or parks with the purpose of making other pedestrians laugh. To make matters even more fun I made this Gift Box version of the flags so that you can send the flags to friends, relatives etc.
I really hope you like it and tell me what you think!
TITLE: I Made These Signs For Sticking In Dog Poop

DESCRIPTION:
Dublin born, New York City based creative Tadhg Ennis, has been walking around New York City, after midnight, for the past year snapping pictures of what ever catches his eye.
I love New York, it's always been a dream of mine to live here, I moved here in 2009 and it's been pretty much home ever since. Tadhg is just about to graduate from Miami ad school NY, after under taking a 2-year art direction diploma.
TITLE: I Walk Around Manhattan After Midnight

DESCRIPTION:
Figuring out how to make components and materials that you normally toss in the trash work as art inspired me to build these fabously detailed Fairy Houses.
The under structure of each is made from things like drinks containers, tubes, gum holders, juice containers, Dove body wash bottles. Lots of recycled elements and found objects.
TITLE: I Create Detailed Fairy Houses

DESCRIPTION: My latest drawing. On acid-free gray paper using Polychromos monochrome pencils from Faber-Castell. I've been a fan of John Wayne since I can remember watching movies as a kid.

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Flori Green. In October 2015, I left Europe in quest of adventure.
I flew to Sri-Lanka and traveled 6 months through South East Asia.
TITLE: I Quit My Job In London And Became A Hand Poke Tattoo Artist In Cambodia

DESCRIPTION:
TinyRobots are one-of-a-kind creatures made completely out of recycled materials: discarded electronics, computer parts, monitors, MP3s, keyboards, mouses and many others.
Device upgrades are becoming more and more frequent for many of us. Unfortunately, too many people give virtually no thought to what becomes of all those discarded gadgets, and neither are most device manufacturers.
TITLE: I Turned Electronic Waste Into Tiny And Biggie Robots (Part 3)

DESCRIPTION: My passion is art in all kinds. I create my own fairy tales on paper. Watercolor and ink are tools for me, because I love graphic.

DESCRIPTION:
Mexican photographer Felix Hernandez Rodriguez has appeared in posts from all over the world with the incredible work he has created for Audi.
The elements used in his works are miniatures that according to him, Photoshop is not used. What he actually uses are some accoutrements, lighting and effects effects with the camera's own features and special angles.

DESCRIPTION: There is no doubt I love watching movies and different TV-Series. I draw lots of my inspiration from those and over the years I have created many TV or Movie related projects. I always try to get my own spin into the images.

DESCRIPTION: Our 12-year-old Pharaoh Hound, Aramis, has been diagnosed with a mass on his liver that is untreatable - I decided to have as much fun as possible with him and honor his personality in a special way. I hope you enjoy these images as much as I have enjoyed making them. And to my Aramis, forever the court jester of our home, I love you, baby!
TITLE: I Found A Way To Honor My Pharaoh Hound And The Joy He Gives Us Through Images Will Make You Smile!

DESCRIPTION:
It's no secret that office job can get pretty boring sometimes. But when you work with a lot of people in one place there is a big chance that some of them have a good sense of humour.
What's the funniest or the most evil thing you or your colleagues ever did at the office? Let's share pics of your hilarious office life!
TITLE: Hey Pandas! Share Funny Pictures From Your Office

DESCRIPTION:
Want to create a great family tradition? On weekends, start baking cookies with cool design made with a carved rolling pin. Your kids will definitely remember such cakes and these warm memories would be with them during a lifetime as one of the brightest impressions.
Vera Bukreeva, a wood artist from the Russian city of Astrakhan, creates these unusual rolling pins from wood with her own hands manually.
TITLE: Carved Gingerbread Rolling Pins By Vera Bukreeva That Leave Unforgettable Impression

DESCRIPTION: Just a few words of encouragement can seriously mean the world to someone, and this babysitter's heartwarming story just showed us why.

DESCRIPTION: Kyrgyzstan is the hidden gem of central Asia. The moment you visit the rural areas, you will be mesmerized by the beauty of the landscape. Green hills and mountains are everywhere; it is like walking in a Microsoft Windows Wallpaper.
TITLE: I Photographed The Lovely People Of Kyrgyzstan

DESCRIPTION: My name is Lorenzo M. Durán, I was born in Spain, in 1969. Although I had been drawing, painting and sculpting little things since I was a kid, I decided to become a full-time artist when parenthood, unemployment, and midlife crisis visited me (at the same time!) in 2006, pushing me to think about what I had done with my professional life and what I would really want to do with it.
TITLE: A Caterpillar Having Lunch Inspired Me To Start Creating Leaf Cutting Art

DESCRIPTION: Until the first of many phases of extensive facial surgery to correct my Bells Palsy three years ago I'd never embroidered anything. It was during a hospital stay to insert one of my chest muscles into my left cheek that I realised I could marry up my love of hand sewing with my love of human anatomy and a hobby was born. I bought embroidery thread, dug out my old copy of Grey's Anatomy and got started on an image of the facial muscles which was immediately bought by my consultant facial surgeon.
TITLE: I Started Creating Anatomical Embroidery After I Had An Extensive Facial Surgery

DESCRIPTION: The Mosaic Project is a photographic initiative that aims to celebrate the rich contribution of immigrant artists living in the United States. As a Costa Rican photographer, who spent eleven years as an undocumented immigrant before obtaining my green card in 2014, the topic is not only timely, but of personal and professional relevance. Recent negativity in the media inspired me to use my art to reshape public perception by increasing the visibility of immigrant artists and highlighting their creative and cultural contributions.
TITLE: The Mosaic Project Is A Photographic Initiative That Aims To Celebrate The Rich Contribution Of Immigrant Artists Living In The United States

DESCRIPTION: Everyone has an embarrassing moment every once in a while, but this mom... Her moment was so embarrassing it'll make you cry with laughter!

DESCRIPTION:
Anyone who watched the Up animation probably was thrilled by the love story of the elderly couple, Carl and Ellie Fredricksen. In today's times, of liquid loves and disposable relationships, it is rare to see a lasting relationship. So, these images thrilled you so much!
This photoshoot was made by Russian photographer Irina Nedyalkova, who after posting on her personal Facebook page, photos were quickly shared worldwide with the extremely positive response.

DESCRIPTION: I am a Vietnamese student. I came to study in Wageningen University, the Netherlands 2 years ago for my MSc degree. My campus is located in a rural area, where ones can expect nothing but cows, sheep, flat meadows and stuff like that.

DESCRIPTION: If you're a parent, you probably have at least ten moments a day where you have to stop and ask yourself - am I doing this right? Stay-at-home mom Karen Johnson knows exactly how you feel, and she thinks it's about time we all cut ourselves (and each other) a break.

DESCRIPTION:
It is characteristic of the photographic work of Matheus Dacosta his way of seeing the scenes of the daily life under an artistic perspective. In his first exhibition in the subway of São Paulo entitled De Passagem (ticket / passing through / walking), the artist presents 15 photographs that were made over the last 6 years.
For Matheus Dacosta: The subway stations are like rivers that constantly change through meetings and disagreements, the movement of the cars, the haste, the waiting, the desire to arrive and the need to leave.

DESCRIPTION: As far back as I can remember, I have ALWAYS wanted to be a mother. I also wanted magical powers like mind control, the ability to fly and invisibility, I mean, who doesn't right?? But I digress..

DESCRIPTION: If you have ever wondered how to fuse your love for tattoos with your green thumb personality, then this post is for you. Nature tattoos isn't a new thing and flowers and animals were always popular among the trendy tattoo styles, but now succulents specifically are coming into popularity.Succulent tattoos are very versatile and look great both in tiny designs and in huge intricate pieces of tattoo art.

Summertime has come and everyone is looking for a refreshing bath, even these popular characters. They will be safe and
They will be safe and chill with the floats I have drawn for them.

DESCRIPTION:
Venus is a female illustrator based in the South of England. She spent several years working within a variety of different art industries around London before realising she had a burning desire and hidden talent for drawing.
The general aesthetic of her work reflects a personal irritation and bitterness that has steamed from experiences of misogyny, patriarchy and a constant fight for equal rights for women in the work place.

DESCRIPTION: Whether they're appearing in movies, music videos, or on the front covers of magazines, celebrities are rarely seen without a face full of makeup and/or a misleading amount of Photoshop. But as you can see from this revealing list compiled by Bored Panda, sometimes celebrities get tired of living up to expectations.

DESCRIPTION: I am photographer living in the Middle East. Most of the weddings I shoot with my partner include elaborate beaded & bedazzled ball gowns. Enormous skirts, giant heels and layer upon layer of tulle are all par for the course, everything it takes to make a princess dream wedding session.

DESCRIPTION: Everything you can imagine is real by Pablo Picasso is a quote which describes my work best and is in my mind when I'm thinking about new concepts. I try to paint my own dreamworld through the images that I combine in an unexpected and uniquely way to surrealistic photo manipulations. I want to show the people that everything is possible and could be real if you can imagine it.

DESCRIPTION:
I love doodling as much as I love reading about art and I wanted to see what these famous artworks would look like if I drew them in my own style.
I mostly focus on zentangle-based doodles as it helps me with my anxiety. Each of these pieces nearly take around 3-4 hours and are about 5-7 inches in size.

DESCRIPTION:
If you've ever visited Japan in the midst of winter or spring, you've probably noticed a barrage of people sporting face masks in the trains and walking about the city. A popular way to battle the spread of germs in the winter and pesky pollen in the spring, surgical masks have been common in Japan since the early 20th century.
However what began as a seasonal safeguard has recently become a year-round custom.
TITLE: Mask On: Japanese Flu Season Just Became More Colorful

DESCRIPTION: Jewelries are amazing when they're light and gorgeous, catch the eye from the first sight. Elena, a craftswoman from Ulan-Ude, Russia, creates the accessories you'd wish to adorn yourself with. As if weaved from air, they're made from simple materials.

DESCRIPTION:
We often find Romania in difficult positions, from politics to migration and poverty. However, as a traveler you will not encounter many of such problems, as most of these need to be understood in depth before they can be observed on a day-to-day level.

DESCRIPTION: Katie Newhouser is a UPS driver who has developed a friendship with Leo, her client's pit bull from Rancho Cucamonga, California. The woman, however, had no idea that one day she would be looking after this sweet doggie.
TITLE: This UPS Driver Just Adopted A Pit Bull On Her Work Route After The Death Of His Owner

DESCRIPTION:
We're Val and Tim, the co-founders of The Nomads Bus. Together with our kid, our dog and guests, we're exploring Europe. 
After a summer in Spain and a winter in Austria, we're now driving through Norway.
TITLE: We Turned An American School Bus Into A Hostel On Wheels

DESCRIPTION:
I painted the Green Dragon scarf recently, because I just had to find out: how many scales should be on dragon's back?
So, the answer is MANY! and MANY MORE!
This 90x90 cm scarf is full of dragon. It almost breath fire. Imagine wrapping it around your shoulders and taking it to work or to a party.
TITLE: I Paint Custom Silk Scarfs, So You Can Always Have Your Dragon With You

DESCRIPTION: I wanted to tell you how lonely a tree is when the seasons pass by
TITLE: Lonely Tree And The Seasons Passing By

DESCRIPTION:
I am a freelance illustrator from Lithuania-Vilnius.
I work with illustration, art direction, animation, objects, workshops, scenography, and ideas. Feel free to get in touch regarding various projects.
TITLE: Stars Over Scars: Project For A Street Art Festival

DESCRIPTION: Maya foundation in Ahmedabad, India approached us and asked, if we could teach street kids, to make rain coats. Maya foundation runs a school for construction workers kids, who had no place to go while their parents worked. During monsoon these kids would stop coming to the school because they had no rain protection and obviously no money to spend for it.
TITLE: I Made A Rain Coat For Less Than 10 Cents For Poor Street Kids

DESCRIPTION:
Jesper Krijgsman is a designer who fell in love with nature.
Trough photography and digital collage, I try to combine the diversity of nature with modern techniques in the computer and express certain states of mind I'm unable to express through a single photograph. I try to evoke the some of the mysterious quality that nature holds and create my work intuitively.
TITLE: Dutch Artist Uses Nature To Express Emotion

DESCRIPTION: Did you know that one third of all food production is wasted? That comes down to a worldwide wastage of 1.3 billion kilos per year. This is a huge environmental burden! When people waste food, it's also a wastage of the water, CO2, energy and land that has been used in order to grow and transport the food.
TITLE: At Restaurant Instock We Tackle The Problem Of Food Waste By Serving Delicious Food Made From Food Surplus

DESCRIPTION: 2-month-old Filipina baby girl with bouffant hair.
TITLE: Hairy 2-Month-Old Baby Girl

DESCRIPTION: Counting the days before the release of the new season of GOT I was looking through the posters of the series on the web. While browsing I found this cool project by Depositphotos. Using stock pics from their library the guys gave some creative touches to the photos and came up with alternative posters.
TITLE: Game Of Thrones Posters With Stock Photos

DESCRIPTION:
This love story started 4 years ago.
Well, I've got to admit it wasn't love at first sight!
I don't like to stand out, and this colour is seen miles away (quite handy to find in the parking lot though!).
But for several reasons I ended up buying it.
TITLE: I Drove Alone Across 8 Countries In Europe In A Baby Blue 27 Yr Ford Fiesta

DESCRIPTION:
Sixteen kittens have been adopted between these four mothers and they have been left in foster care for months. Mama cats deserve forever loving families too, especially after all they have been through!
Any of these cats can be adopted through Cat Adoption and Rescue Efforts in Richmond Virginia.
TITLE: These Four Mother Cats Were Left Behind When Their Kittens Were Adopted

DESCRIPTION: Hey there, I am Nayan Shrimali and my partner Vaishali we are Paper cut artist based in India. Myself and my partner we make paper cut artworks and wearable. This series of Paper cut artworks contains some of the most inspirational and our favorite characters from history and cinema.
TITLE: We Created Paper Cut Portrait Of Some Famous Personalities From History And Cinema

DESCRIPTION: Meet Storm, the doggie who didn't hesitate a second when he saw an unidentified animal drowning in the water and came to the rescue. As the dog approached the helpless creature, it turned out to be an injured baby deer.
TITLE: Good Dog Saves A Baby Deer From Drowning

DESCRIPTION: You might think that cats and soccer are two things that have nothing in common. And you'd be right. But you, the true masters of Photoshop, are here to change that.
TITLE: Cats Photoshopped Into Pictures Of Soccer Make Everything Better (Add Yours!)

DESCRIPTION:
After 56 years to the day, John and Martha are finally getting wedding pictures! In 1961 they left Oklahoma and eloped to the neighboring state of Arkansas, because of their frowned-upon 10 year age difference.
They are the perfect example of true love and are both very much still in love!
TITLE: Soulmate Goals: A Perfect Example Of True Love After 56 Years

DESCRIPTION: In October 2017, I gave birth to my second child. I now had two boys under two and saw the same nurses 17 months before with my first son. I also have a step son whom I drive to care in the next city every couple days each week, I get stopped by a female traffic cop as she directs traffic.
TITLE: Honoring Mothers Who Save Was The Only Thing That Made Sense After I Had My Baby

DESCRIPTION: Just 2 weeks after a shocking incident fiercely reignited the vaccination debate, another blow has been dealt to the anti-vaxxer firewall after a genius analogy against their logic (or lack thereof) went viral.
TITLE: Anti-Vaxxer Tries To Shut Down People Who Are Pro-Vaccine, Gets A Perfect Comeback

DESCRIPTION: Ever tried to imagine how famous fast food chain mascots would look if they were anime characters? Ozumii Wizard has, and she is showing the whole Internet!
TITLE: Illustrator Reimagines Fast Food Mascots As Anime Characters And Now Everyone Wants To Read Their Manga

DESCRIPTION:
Here at Bored Panda, we're pretty much obsessed with two things - pandas, and art. When a Chinese illustrator combined them together to put a fun twist on some of our favorite paintings, the result was something we're still having trouble calming down over.
The creator of these certifiably 'panda-licious' masterpieces goes by a Chinese moniker which translates to 'A Shaggy Dog.
TITLE: 10+ Famous Paintings That Look Better With Pandas

DESCRIPTION:
Our pet hedgehog, Princess Perdita Pricklepants, is a very talented art historian and critic. Let her introduce you to some of the amazing milestones of Hedgehog art through the ages.
For those who are interested in this fascinating field of art history, there's much more on her blog/etc.
TITLE: The Amazing World Of Hedgehog Art History

DESCRIPTION:
Since 2012, I create series Summertime is a black and white photo depicting carefree childhood in the countryside, but sometimes the color is very important, it reflects the beauty of the environment.
Because of that, in parallel with the black and white series were also made colorful pictures.
TITLE: I Capture Colorful Moments Of My Kids Spending Idyllic Summers Without Computers

DESCRIPTION: Despite the seriousness of a courtroom and everything that happens in it, this place also produces hilarious (unintentional) comedy. Charles M. Sevilla has compiled some of the funniest exchanges from justice halls between defendants and plaintiffs, lawyers and witnesses, juries and judges, and released a book called Disorder in the Court.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Hilarious Things That Court Reporters Have Ever Recorded To Be Said In Court

DESCRIPTION: We love to make unforgettable cakes and we love challenges, so we thought: what about an Optical Illusion cake? 530 pieces and 8 hours later, here is the result!
TITLE: It Took Us 8 Hours To Make This Optical Illusion Cake From 530 Pieces

DESCRIPTION: The UK and the USA may share a language (mostly) in common, but when it comes to a number of cultural customs, the Atlantic Ocean seems like the smallest thing separating them.
TITLE: 10+ Times Americans Were Surprised By British Things

DESCRIPTION:
By the spring of 2003, I completed my thesis titled The Relationship Between Career Maturity and Career Aspirations of Learning Disabled Students. The purpose of the study was to determine if the career decision-making process is unclear to learning disabled students in comparison to regular education students and to see if the differences in career maturity contribute to their choice of low prestigious careers.
The study found no significant differences between career maturity scores and the level of prestige and no significant differences between the learning disabled and regular education students and their level of career maturity level.
TITLE: Career Aspirations At The Forefront

DESCRIPTION:
Most people will probably pass by this decaying house in the French countryside.
But what's inside will blow your mind!
TITLE: I Found This Abandoned House In French Countryside And Was Surprised With What I Saw Inside

DESCRIPTION: Meet Aragon, a rescue dog who just saved a whole litter of kittens left to die in the mountains of Greece. But his heroism didn't stop there - once the felines were taken to the shelter, Aragon became the best stepdad they could have dreamt of.
TITLE: This Dog Lead His Humans To A Mysterios Box In The Mountains, Ended Up Becoming A Father

DESCRIPTION: It's all about macro.
TITLE: I Take Macro Pictures Of Insects

DESCRIPTION: My puppy's name is Penny. I created these pictures to be more meme-like after realizing that I was saying them out loud as if they were her thoughts. I am happy to be taking care of her as much as she is excited to see me every day.
TITLE: I Took Photos Of My 4-Month-Old Puppy & Added Captions To Them Of Her Thoughts

DESCRIPTION: As we reached the peak I was blown away by who showed up to the party - 77 landmarks from Mount Rainier to Forbidden Peak are visible in the same image, taken from a peak in the Pacific Northwest.
TITLE: I Labeled 77 Peaks And Landmarks In This Huge Panorama

DESCRIPTION:
I unveiled this new LEGO creation at Emerald City Comic Con earlier this year as a tribute to Carrie Fisher, who had originally been scheduled to appear there. After Fisher's passing, there were many LEGO tributes, most of which depicted a demure Princess Leia shoving a floppy disk into some poor hapless droid. But I wanted to reimagine a moment from the original trilogy that really captured her feisty character!
The project began with the construction of the Leia figure, which was relatively straightforward as most of my LEGO creations are human characters.
TITLE: Leia The Huttslayer Reimagined In Lego

DESCRIPTION:
When we first moved to Amarillo, Tx I grew a strong fascination with the amazing thunderstorms that would roll through.
This particular evening. My daughter and I were heading out for some practice shooting.
TITLE: Calm Before The Storm

DESCRIPTION: Recently, I was lucky enough to be able to have the opportunity to photograph some of my friends at Rolling Hills Asylum in East Bethany, NY after getting permission from owner Sharon Coyle. Before becoming infamously known as Rolling Hills Asylum and a widely documented hotbed of paranormal activity, the property was originally named The Genesee County Poor Farm, often affectionately referred to as The Old County Home. You can read about the fascinating history of the property at the asylum's website.
TITLE: I Spent A Day Creating Sci-Fi Scenes In A 200 Year Old Asylum

DESCRIPTION:
I always imagine what those popular characters can do with their abilities if they are living in our real life.
They can find a very good Part Time Job with their abilities, I think they can be very good in sports too.

DESCRIPTION: Anyone who has cut their long hair knows the fear that comes before it, and the relief and joy after.

DESCRIPTION: Having a ruff day? Cute dogs always help, but we've got something even better this time - cute dogs with cheeks so soft and squishy you'll want to squeeze them like Play-Doh.
TITLE: 10+ Squishy Dog Cheeks That Are Impossible To Resist Squishing

DESCRIPTION: Taipei City, the capital of Taiwan, is gearing up to host the 2017 Summer Universiade. To spread the hype, they gave the subway cars of their Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) system a makeover - by turning them into shockingly realistic simulations of sport venues.
TITLE: Taiwan Surprises Passengers By Turning Subway Cars Into Different Sport Venues For Upcoming Universiade

DESCRIPTION:
I am a photographer from Amsterdam and almost lost my touch and love for taking pictures. My friends and I had a plan to go to Tokyo, and after two years we finally made it happen.
While walking the streets of Tokyo, I found my love for photography again.
TITLE: How Tokyo Saved My Artistic View On Photography

DESCRIPTION:
I have been travelling over the past year and have kept a diary in sketches.
Here are some of my more detailed cityscapes. Each drawing is 5x5inches in size and done with pen markers.
TITLE: I Am A Travelling Artist And These Are Some Of My Latest City Illustrations From Around The World

DESCRIPTION:
The technique which is called pointillism is a kind of meditation. You poke and poke by the liner on paper and your brain turns off.
Each picture takes about 15-20 hours.
TITLE: It Takes Me Up To 20 Hours To Create One Image By Dotting

DESCRIPTION: This series of paintings was a really long journey for me. Between managing all my dayjob related stuff, family and friends, there was only little time left for painting. 5 canvases, 4 years, a lot of paintovers, but now they´re done.
TITLE: I Express My Thoughts About Being An Artist In These Metaphorical Paintings

DESCRIPTION: Nancy Le Vine is a senior dog photographer who believes old canines should be celebrated in all their dignity, wisdom and unconditional love. Today the woman is travelling through the States, taking photos of senior dogs...
TITLE: 10+ Old Souls Of Elderly Dogs Captured By Nancy LeVine

DESCRIPTION: On the peak Ljuboten, on the mountain Shara in Macedonia, the wild fox Lisa appeared by the door of the mountain house of Mr Vase.She came looking for food.Since then, he feeds her everyday, for a year.

DESCRIPTION: In Russia, a collaborative of street artists has created an awesome optical illusion, and it looks like Photoshop in real life.

DESCRIPTION: It has been a wonderful journey this World Days Poster Project. I had the opportunity to learn so many things about international commemorative days, history events and important people. Each one of them designed with love and passion for impact intrigued my thought about my personal point on view on them, and the message I had to communicate like a striking bomb.
TITLE: I Communicate Strong Messages Through My World Days Posters (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: Do sperm whales sleep? It's not a question that gets asked frequently, but when it does, none is the wiser to answer it. That's until now, of course, because now we have photo proof of just how these ocean giants nap.
TITLE: Photographer Captures Incredibly Rare Sight Of Sperm Whales Sleeping

DESCRIPTION:
For the past six years I've been fortunate enough to attend San Diego Comic-Con, and for the past six years, I've crocheted little superheroes to scatter around San Diego Comic-Con for people to find!
Here's who I'm bringing with me next week...
TITLE: I Crochet Little Characters To Scatter Around San Diego For Strangers To Find

DESCRIPTION: Meet Meatball, the fat dad cat who needs a little bit of help keeping up with good manners. See, recently he became a parent, and when his humans started giving solid food to his kittens, he took it as an invite to eat more than he should - all at the expense of his children and his puurrfect body shape.
TITLE: Fat Dad Cat Kept Eating More Than His Share, So His Owners Came Up With A Genius Solution

DESCRIPTION:
Get to know the works of Tullius Heuer, a self-taught digital artist from Maceió, Alagoas, Brazil.
Tullius mixes images to create his own realities with touches of surrealism and often a certain somber bias and terror with figures that are surpassing the limits of his drawings.
TITLE: Brazilian Artist Creates Digital Paintings That Leap Off The Page

DESCRIPTION:
Using a magnifying glass and tiny brushes, I paint miniature sized paintings on porcelain to create one of a kind pendants.
They are first sketched onto the porcelain with a pencil and painted with underglazes and fired twice in a kiln.
TITLE: Miniature Works Of Art On Porcelain

DESCRIPTION: My boyfriend turned 30 just last month, so I decided to theme all of his presents 'Corgi', because he's obsessed with them. Did you know there is a memorial for Susan, The Queen's first Corgi, at Sandringham House, which The Queen designed herself? I do. Did you know that Susan was the first Pembroke Corgi and is the ancestor of all the rest, just like the monarchy? I do.
TITLE: My Boyfriend Loves Corgis, So I Did My First Ever Oil Painting

DESCRIPTION:
I am a fan of a retro-futuristic world, custom culture, classic cars, and motorbikes. My true passion is hand drawing.
I am also an illustrator, graphic designer, and calligrapher.
TITLE: Couple Of My Hand Drawings From My 20 Years Collection.

DESCRIPTION: Jan Campbell was preparing an avocado for lunch one day when she was struck by the beauty of the pit inside, an object most people throw away without a second thought. After weeks of pondering its potential, a deeply pigmented surface scratch inspired her to carve away its layers until a beautiful piece of art appeared.
TITLE: Most People Throw Away Avocado Pits, But This Artist Carves Them Into Magical Forest Creatures

DESCRIPTION: UK-based graphic artist Tom Ward has a lot to say about the current state of the world, and he's using the help of everyone's favourite Disney characters to do it.
TITLE: Illustrator Accurately Reimagines What Disney Movies Would Look Like If They Were Made In 2017

DESCRIPTION: Beleaguered UK railway company Southern Rail isn't exactly used to good press these days. Industrial disputes, reduced services, and late-running trains have seen public anger at the rail firm grow exponentially over the last year, but all of that seems to have been temporarily forgotten thanks to an unlike savior in the form of a 15-year-old student called Eddie.
TITLE: Most Hated Railway Puts 15-Year-Old In Charge Of Their Twitter Account, And Things Escalate Quickly

DESCRIPTION:
Frownland is a single panel webcomic that humorously dissects human behavior with cynical abandon.
Posted every Sunday, it skewers such subjects as new age culture, low wage jobs, and public transportation. Frownland is posted every Sunday on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook, all of which can be found by visiting the link below.
TITLE: 10+ Cynical Comics Where I Humorously Dissect Human Behavior

DESCRIPTION: We are two brothers fascinated by timber and nature overall. Having a different point of view into details was in our essence as far as we remember. We always had a great imagination and seeing different tiny worlds in moss, wood rot or fungus was effortless.
TITLE: We Found A Way To Bring A Portion Of Nature To Your Home

DESCRIPTION: Golden Retrievers are one of the most pure things on Earth. I mean, everyone knows they're super friendly, they love everyone, and they're ohhh-sooo-adorable. So, what could be better than a pic of a Golden Retriever, one may ask? Well, of course - only a picture of a retriever puppy...
TITLE: 10+ Times Golden Retriever Puppies Were The Purest Thing In The World

DESCRIPTION: I was into graffiti during junior high and high school. I spent most of my free time scribbling on paper. I majored in photography at college.
TITLE: I Was Either Going To Get A 9-5 Or Dedicate Myself To Tattooing

DESCRIPTION: Amazon sellers have been experimenting with AI for a number of years now, but the company clearly wasn't keeping an eye on the mischievous bot that recently had its way with their 'phone accessories' section.
TITLE: Amazon AI Designed To Create Phone Cases Terribly Malfunctions, Fills Store With 31,000+ Hilarious Products

DESCRIPTION: This is my dog, Squiggy. Maybe not the most photogenic dog out there, but a great subject, for sure. There's a dog cookie waiting for him at the end of any photo shoot, and he's more than happy to comply.
TITLE: My Unusual Looking Dog Is My Favorite Photo Subject

DESCRIPTION: Meet Messy, a yellow Lab who is the definition of a real friend - not only for his Thai owner Oranit Kittragul, but for one lonely doggie named Audi, too.

DESCRIPTION: Dachshunds were bred to fight underground animals in their burrows but this particular wiener adapted his natural born tunneling talents to something much more useful above the ground. As it turns out, Crusoe the Celebrity Dachshund is an excellent garden helper - he can easily dig a hole wherever his human asks, making the whole planting process as easy as pie.
TITLE: How To Garden With A Wiener

DESCRIPTION: Hello everyone! Im Squidwizard and these are my two cats: Fritatta and Ciabatta. They're each about 4 years old. Fritatta was an abandoned stray kitten found in a gas-station parking lot when she was about 3 months old.
TITLE: Meet My Beautifully Unphotogenic Cats

DESCRIPTION:
I'm really proud of this intricate ink and spray paint on a 5ft bear. It took 35 hours over 7 days to complete from start to finish and I had a lot of fun working on it.
The bear is part of The Big Sleuth campaign and will be displayed in public for 10 weeks and then auctioned off for charity in October 2017.
TITLE: Doodling On A 5ft Foot Bear In 35 Hours

DESCRIPTION: My name is Nadia Callahan and I am the Owner of Nadia Callahan Photography. I am truly in love with vintage style photos. To me they represent a more happier time without tv's, cell phones etc.
TITLE: I Spent Time Taking Vintage Inspired Photos Of My 3 Year Old

DESCRIPTION:
I just returned home to California after completing a fun photography project in Europe.
I took 13 scanned old photos of me from 30 years ago and went to see if I could find the same exact locations to take photos of what I look like now. I hope to return again in another thirty years!
TITLE: 30 Years Later: Same Locations But Different Me

DESCRIPTION: Panoramic photos can be breathtaking if done right - a spectacular view stretching beyond the scope of peripheral vision, all in one photo. When left up to phone-wielding amateurs, however, they turn the world into a warped, mutated circus of fear.
TITLE: 10+ Times People Tried To Make A Panorama And Ended Up Opening The Gates Of Hell

DESCRIPTION:
We collected most delicious summer berries. 
We made this collection using precious and semi-precious berries (gemstones), 18 k. yellow gold and sterling silver.
TITLE: Jewelry Collection That Resembles Berries

DESCRIPTION: I drew these pics wheI I was a student.
TITLE: My Iron Pen Art

DESCRIPTION: When I produce new artworks I can`t avoid to get covered by acrylic blots. Depending on wich colors I use I look different every day. Here are some close-ups.
TITLE: Every Time I Make Art It Transforms Also Myself Into An Artwork

DESCRIPTION: As anybody who's been to Japan (or anybody who frequently visits Bored Panda) will know, there's no shortage of things to do in the Land of the Rising Sun. We're not just talking about eating, cosplaying, and visiting awesome temples either. We're talking about perusing the clothes stores in search of shirts with the best (or more like worst) examples of badly translated English.
TITLE: This American Tourist Went To Japan And Decided To Photograph Badly Translated English Shirts

DESCRIPTION: When Tommy Rivers agreed to look after his auntie's dog Pepper for a day, the guy was surprised to find out the doggie came with a set of rules. Some of them were so hilarious, it made the whole Internet fall in love with his auntie, and, of course, with Pepper herself!
TITLE: Woman Afraid To Leave Her Dog Alone With Dog Sitter Writes Him List Of Rules, And They Go Viral

DESCRIPTION: Border Collies, originating from the United Kingdom, are famous throughout the world for their incredible intelligence and obedience.
TITLE: Get Ready For Family Picture Guys!

DESCRIPTION: My mom took this handsome British-shorthair cat because of his different colored eyes. Since then he is one of my favorite models. Not only his eyes are strange but he also has a pretty weird personality, he is very human-like and sometimes he scares us with his mood swings.
TITLE: Tihon: Very Special Cat With Odd Eyes

DESCRIPTION: In the cold winds of a village in North India, living out the golden years of life is a pleasure. The pure water that flows through the mountains and the crisp air keep worry and sickness at bay. Though their skin may be wrinkled and arms thin, the elderly of Himachal Pradesh look after themselves with agility that can put anyone in their youth to shame.
TITLE: The Legacy Of The Golden Year

DESCRIPTION: My new photographic series, Black Dots, explores the far-flung mountain shelters of the UK known affectionately as bothies. These small, primitive buildings are hidden away in the loneliest corners of the British Isles and remain unlocked 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. They have no power and no running water, but provide much needed shelter from the elements in some of the most unforgiving landscapes that Britain has to offer.
TITLE: I Spent 3 Years Photographing The Remote Bothies Of The British Wilderness

DESCRIPTION:
Daniele Barresi is an award-winning carving designer originating from Italy who now resides in Sydney, Australia. He is world renown for his extraordinary artistic carving abilities involving a range of mediums including but not limited to fruits, vegetables, cheeses and soaps.
From a young age having spent most of his life living in a small beautiful town in Italy, it was natural for Daniele to explore his local town and surroundings that gave him inspiration in which fuelled his imagination to create art in the form of carving.
TITLE: I Just Used A Knife To Hand Carve Them!

DESCRIPTION: The 2017 Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards are still accepting entries but while the judges are warming up we can already take a peek at some of the funniest submissions of the contest.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Entries To The 2017 Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards

DESCRIPTION: Mixing parents and Twitter is a dangerously hilarious combination that we have already established previously. We showed you the most hilarious mom tweets, dad tweets, we even showed you the best celebrity parent tweets. This time, we've got something just as good in store for you.
TITLE: The 10+ Most Hilarious Parenting Tweets Of The Year So Far

DESCRIPTION: There's nothing worse than a generic bar or restaurant with no personality. If you're paying money to go out and eat or drink somewhere, you want the place to have character - otherwise you would've just stayed at home!
TITLE: 10+ Genius Bars And Restaurants That Will Surprise You With Their Creativity

DESCRIPTION:
Outlights are the world's first glow in the dark decals that go over your outlets, allowing you to easily see them in the dark. Additionally, they are really creatively designed, and turn your previously boring outlets into a fun and whimsical part of your room.
Outlights were born while I was daydreaming during finals last year (my junior year of college), and has come quite a long way since.
TITLE: I Made Glow-In-The-Dark Outlet Stickers!

DESCRIPTION: Ever seen a perfectly peeled coconut? Probably not, because it is, after all, damned hard to peel a coconut. But as you can see from this mildly freaky list compiled by Bored Panda, some people have gone to the effort of peeling all sorts of fruits in order to see what they look like naked.
TITLE: 10+ Terrifying Pics Of Peeled Fruits

DESCRIPTION: Kids these days are clearly aiming a lot higher than making a couple bucks at the lemonade stand. 15-year-old London schoolboy Nathan John-Baptiste went from selling a few chocolate bars out of the boys' bathrooms to selling flats full of sweets and pop across 3 schools - and raking in over $1.2k a week doing it.
TITLE: 15-Year-Old Boy Turns School Bathrooms Into A $56,000-A-Year Sweets Empire

DESCRIPTION: Two years ago I fell in love again with the folding-technique all of us know from the kindergarten. After many exercises and experiments, I developed this technique further until I found a way to generate faces. Now I use it for my art.
TITLE: To Create These Unique Portraits I Fold Pictures Up To Hundred (Or Even More) Times

DESCRIPTION: It's a story about fight, resistence and love. I draw with pen on recycled wood. This is the first of a largest serie.
TITLE: My Animal Sanctuary: Pen On Recycled Wood By Martina Billi

DESCRIPTION: Every one of us who has cut their hair at least once knows that blissful feeling of losing a few kilos from their heads. However, for most of us it takes time and courage to finally make this step.
TITLE: Share Before & After Pics Of Your Extreme Haircut Transformations

DESCRIPTION: Sara Geurts was just 10 years old when she was diagnosed with a rare skin condition called Dermatosparaxis Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), a connective tissue disorder that inhibits the body's ability to produce collagen. As a consequence, Geurts has skin that wrinkles prematurely and makes her look way beyond her years, but as you can see from these stunning pictures, the model, now 26, is determined to show the world that she has nothing to be ashamed of.
TITLE: This 26-Year-Old Woman Is Changing The Way We Think About Beauty Standards

DESCRIPTION: When 23-year-old John Mackay saved 20-year-old Edith Steiner from Auschwitz in 1944, neither were to know that they'd spend the rest of their lives together.
TITLE: Holocaust Survivor And Soldier Who Rescued Her Spend More Than 70 Years Together

DESCRIPTION: Snoopy the cat (grey) was brought home 1 year ago, and I knew he was a bit different because he didn't mind wearing accessories. With some treats and feathery distraction Snoopy would sit patiently and allow me to help him take pictures. One picture led to another and now he has a collection of cosplay costumes.
TITLE: I Make Costumes For My Cats

DESCRIPTION: About a year or so ago, I began looking for ways to bring more texture to my paintings. I started off with modeling paste, then realized I would never be able to create the defined shapes I wanted with that medium. So I started adding clay, gels and even wood burning and etching to my large wood panels.
TITLE: I Create 3D Paintings Using Modeling Paste And Clay

DESCRIPTION:
I've been using gel pens as an art medium for years and cannot stop using them! My favorite pens are usually neon colors to make psychedelic art but I am starting to dabble with other color pens. I started out just doodling with them and once I started I couldn't stop.
My art really started to take shape when I became ill many years ago and didn't have much strength to leave my own bed.
TITLE: I Use Gel Pens To Create Colorful Art

DESCRIPTION: The pencil is a symbol for creativity, like drawing, writing, brainstorming, designing...
TITLE: I Play With The Symbol Of Pencil In My Illustrations

DESCRIPTION: In Paris, a huge students residence has been left to almost 100 graffiti artists for three weeks. It is visitable for one month before some renovation works start. Here is the result with a selection of pictures, discover more on the link below!
TITLE: Discover The New Temple Of Graffiti

DESCRIPTION: What is right and what is wrong? Or are there several truths? My Project You got me wonrg is a series of photos based on misunderstandings and differences existing between self-perception and perception. This deeply interpersonal feeling of alienation and separateness has assumed a new, larger and even political dimension nowadays in times of fleeing, abandoning, and uncertainty of arriving. The truly questionable believed reality, so surely believed, becomes brittle.
TITLE: You Got Me Wonrg: Series Of Photos Based On Misunderstandings

DESCRIPTION:
Hello! We are two Romanian creatives, based in Bucharest. We have a gray cat, an apartment photo studio and lots of imagination.
Recently we created a little outdoors science-fiction story for two beautiful kids to capture how awesome childhood can be.
TITLE: We Surprised The Awesomeness Of Childhood In A Poppy Field

DESCRIPTION: I have spent countless hours diving in the Sea in St. Lucia lying on the sandy bottom and looking up at the liquid surface as it distorts the light.
TITLE: I Painted An Amazing Sea Turtle On Silk

DESCRIPTION:
A few months ago, I wanted to work on improving my ink drawing skills as well as my ability to draw likeness portraits in ink, so I asked Instagram users to submit their favorite selfie(s) using the hashtag #fritzselfiesub.
I really enjoy drawing human faces, so this has been an enjoyable adventure!
It takes about 30 minutes or so to draw one selfie and I'm on number 70. I finally started scanning them and they'll all be in a book together.

DESCRIPTION: Some years ago I started photographing wild red squirrels with spread legs. I started name it squirrels in yoga positions, but many people responded as karate. I love the poses when they have their legs in a split.

Niki is an artist,from Greece.

DESCRIPTION: I am particularly interested in accessing places and parts of people that are usually more hidden or tucked away, and this is a theme that marks much of the work I do. For me, Bare has been about exploring human vulnerability, an aspect of people that is often hidden beneath the surface. It became, also, a project about the stories behind and the process of redefining it.

If I had a time machine I would spend most of my time at the ballpark. But unfortunately, the only time machine available to me is Photoshop, research, patience, and the dedication to create these images that appear to have been taken yesterday.

DESCRIPTION:
I have a dog named Alfie and he loves ice cream and I love taking photos of him when he is eating it and that gave me the idea for this little photo project.
I asked my friends, if I could take photos of their dog eating ice cream and they happily agreed.
I know, that ice cream is not the best treat for dogs and some of them can be lactose intolerant, but most of them had eaten ice cream before and just to be safe we used lactose free ice creams.

DESCRIPTION:
I professionally paint on silk and when the inspiration for Dragon scarf came, I did not hesitate long: I grabbed my brushes and started creating!
It took me a week to paint this 63 x 17 inches scarves. It has A LOT of details, can you see the scales on both dragons? Well, each one was painted separately and enhanced with colorful outlines.
The Dancing Dragons scarf shimmers in the sun, it dances with the wind making the dragons come alive.

DESCRIPTION:
I wanted to start a drawing challenge this year since I am a full-time animator and I kinda lost my connection with the traditional art world.
I had a big white blank wall in my apartment and I thought it would be a great idea if I filled the whole wall with little canvases, and from this concept, the whole daily BLOB challenge was born.
I splash some paint randomly on tiny canvases and when it dries I look at it and imagine a monster and I draw it on the spot, filming the process.

The Dronestagram social network has listed the winning photos taken by its users with a drone.

DESCRIPTION:

DESCRIPTION:

I graduated as Russian-English interpreter in 2005 and worked for some years in a bank but that never fascinated me, I felt like I have something inside me that is not quite happy with what I'm doing. Since my childhood I liked to create beautiful things from beads, then I learned an art of creating silk flowers but my true passion is clay.

DESCRIPTION:
Altai Tavan Bogd National Park is an impressive natural reserve and is famous for its 5 highest peaks and largest Potanin glacier, lying on more than 4,000m above the sea level, the highest and westernmost region of Mongolia.
The park has not only natural wonders but also it has cultural and historical wonders including thousands of ancient rock carvings, listed on UNESCO World Heritage Site, mysterious stone men and burial mounds and uncommon nomadic cultures of Kazakh and Tuva people.
There are also beautiful hidden lakes Khoton and Khurgan, worshipped Shiveet Khairkhan Mountain, crystal clear rivers and and rare wildlife.
TITLE: I Traveled To Mongolian Altai Mountains

DESCRIPTION: On this very day in 1907, modern art icon Frida Kahlo was born in a borough of Mexico City. Though she only lived to be 47 years old, she left behind a legacy of art that still fascinates and inspires to this day. These rare photos, taken by famed French photographer Gisèle Freund during the early 50's, document the last days of a magnificent creator and cultural icon, and serve as a fitting tribute to her memory.
TITLE: 10+ Rare Photos Of Frida Kahlo During The Last Years Of Her Life To Celebrate Her 110th Birthday

DESCRIPTION: Did you ever wonder where that one sock went when you distinctly remember putting BOTH socks of the pair in the hamper? Or what's watching you in the dead of night...

DESCRIPTION: Macarons always mystified me because they're really tricky to make. DESCRIPTION: Vitiligo is a skin disorder: the skin cells cannot produce pigments as a result of which certain areas of the skin become white.
