TITLE: 10+ Incredibly Detailed Animal Drawings By Faye Halliday

DESCRIPTION:
This series is made with a Big stopper (a long exposure filter) and a polariser filter.
The post processing is made on photoshop, and I show here some details and process of my images. It's an architectural series, made in black and white, in Paris, New York and London.
TITLE: Emblem: My Architectural Series Of Paris, New York, And London

DESCRIPTION: Paris just got even cooler, because now the city has a neon technicolor basketball court with some serious 80's video game undertones - the new ultimate play-time spot for Instagramers and style-savvy folks.
TITLE: This Technicolor Basketball Court In Paris Just Made The City Even Cooler

DESCRIPTION:
Craig Murphy does things the old fashioned way. He uses the same methods photographers like Mathew Brady, Alexander Gardner and others used during the Civil War.
The upstate NY artist took his tintype photography studio on the road and began photographing Erie Canal locks at locations across New York State.
TITLE: Photographer Uses 19th Century Techniques To Create Striking Photos Of The Erie Canal

DESCRIPTION: The island of Madeira belongs to Portugal, but a thousand kilometers of the Atlantic Ocean separates it from the mainland. This is why the inhabitants of the island need to be conscious of the resources they have and trash they produce. A non-profitable association Teatro Metaphora, situated in the town of Câmara de Lobos in Madeira, organizes projects to promote a sustainable lifestyle and often chooses artistic representation.
TITLE: We Collected 25 000 Empty Beverage Cans From Local Bars To Create Street Art

DESCRIPTION: I Captured The Beauty Of Iceland During My Trip In 2016
TITLE: I Captured The Beauty Of Iceland During My Trip In 2016

DESCRIPTION: Dain Yoon is a makeup artist unlike many others. Instead of creating illusions of longer eyelashes and plumper lips, she creates reality-defying illusions that can make your mind bend.
TITLE: What This Artist Does To Her Face Will Seriously Mess With Your Mind

DESCRIPTION: There's literally no character that cosplayer Alyson Tabbitha can't turn herself into. Don't believe us? Then scroll down to see for yourself.
TITLE: This Cosplayer Can Transform Herself Into Literally Anyone (10+ Pics)

DESCRIPTION: When I was around 15 or 16 years old, I started to get into making manipulations. I was on Google and I stumbled upon Rosie Hardy's images (they're amazing by the way) and I instantly wanted to do the same thing. So ever since then, I've been making these.
TITLE: Edits I Made In Photoshop

DESCRIPTION: Do you ever wonder what your pet does when you're at work all day? 'Sleeping like an angel' or 'guarding my house' might be among your top guesses... But what if your pet is actually up to no good without you knowing it?
TITLE: 10+ Times Pets Were Caught Red-Handed

DESCRIPTION: Phone scams may be getting more and more clever by the day, but one office full of phony IRS agents made a decidedly dumb move when they called a computer programmer who happens to specialize in scam prevention.
TITLE: Phone Scammers Accidentally Call A Programmer, Regret It Immediately

DESCRIPTION: With mist on a sunny day you are able to capture amazing sunrays in the forest. In the misty mornings about an hour after sunrise you can find the sunbeams.
TITLE: Collection Of Amazing Sunrays In The Forest In The Netherlands

DESCRIPTION:
Many of us live in urban settings and are seemingly disconnected from nature. In fact, the average American spends about 90% of their time indoors!
But no matter who you are, or what you are doing, you are always connected to the wild and mysterious processes of the universe.
Like many people, I am deeply concerned about the state of the world.
TITLE: I Illustrated Some Of The Freaking Amazing Ways We Are Always Connected To The Universe And All Life On Earth

DESCRIPTION: I work for a rescue station for cats in Spain every summer. The rescue center is called Estepona-Katzen. It is not even a center.
TITLE: I Photographed Homeless Cats In A Rescue Center That Nobody Wants

DESCRIPTION: Hey guys so I started a new webcomic about 3 weeks ago and I thought I'd share some of my adventures with the Bored Panda community. I hope you guys enjoy! Here's Murrz
TITLE: Who Needs Bug Repellant When You Have This

DESCRIPTION: Needle felting artist Alicia Guseva create decorative soft sculptures from the wool. Realistic animals, shopping bags, magnets and many more.
TITLE: Needle Felted Art By Woolly Land

DESCRIPTION: This is a series I have been working on since june 2016 and it is the culmination of hours and hours doing urban exploration. Barcelona is one of the best city in Europe for its magnificent architecture, especially the modernism. Ceiling and interior patio has something magical and mysterious.
TITLE: 10 Best Spots In Barcelona To Look Up

DESCRIPTION:
It's strange how certain people find each other sometimes.
Last week I got a Facebook message from a beautiful lady residing in the UAE, who has taken it upon herself to rescue unwanted and special needs animals. She found me by chance because I have a small Facebook group.
TITLE: A One In A Million Meeting With A Lady With A Heart Of Gold

DESCRIPTION: These photographs were taken in the Souda Refugee Camp in Chios, Greece. We intentionally cropped out the background of the harsh camp conditions in each photo to focus on the individuals, not their label as merely refugee. Refugees are not faceless statistics, they are men, women, children each with their own hopes for a better life in a kinder world.
TITLE: The Face Of Refugees: We Cropped Out The Context Of A Refugee Camp To Focus On Individuals And The Results Are Breathtaking

DESCRIPTION: COWABUNGA DUDES!! My husband is a giant TMNT fan, so when we had our little guy I surprised him with a TMNT newborn picture. Then one for his six and nine-month pictures. So naturally, we had to finish that cycle off with a bang.
TITLE: I Surprised My Husband With A TMNT Newborn Photoshoot

DESCRIPTION:
I started Paper Love October of 2015! I am a single mother of a little boy who loves art as much as I do. It started as a hobby, I enjoy learning new things, so I self-taught myself how to do it! It started by finding Danielle on Instagram. She would make short tutorials and one day I said f** it I'm trying this!
And almost 2 years in my art has been in weddings, baby showers, funerals, homes, hotels and local stores! My dream is to have my art in Celebrities homes and fashion shows! But my biggest goal is to set an example to my 6-year-old! That one, if you love what you do it will show in your work, and two, to never ever give up and always aim for more! What I love the most of what I do is teaching others how to make flowers.
TITLE: Giant Paper Flowers

DESCRIPTION: I remembered drawing Penrose and M.C. Escher inspired optical illusion images to my math and history books when I was a kid, so that is why I was so drawn to revisit this concept and create something new out of it.
TITLE: I Created M.C. Escher-Inspired Image About Painfully Long Endless Triathlon

DESCRIPTION:
Impressive OOAK Art dolls with stories by Helena Oplakanska.
In my dolls I would like to show sensuality, weightless mist of sadness, attracted by its mystery.
TITLE: I Create Mysterious Dolls From Unknown Worlds

DESCRIPTION: My name is Vincent and I'm the creator of LOLNEIN. I've always loved to make people laugh and when I was still in school I scribbled a lot during lessons. So back in 2013, I decided to combine these two things by starting a webcomic.
TITLE: 10+ Lolnein Comics That I Created To Make People Laugh

DESCRIPTION: Everything and everybody has a shadow, and all of them look different depending on what angle the light is coming from. But sometimes shadows get tired of living in, well, our shadows, and so they decide to forge their own identity by taking on secret lives of their own.
TITLE: 10+ Incredible Shadows That Will Make You Look Twice

DESCRIPTION:
As a little girl, I was obsessed with finding treasure. I found that the soil in my garden was rich in treasure - full of broken pottery pieces, bits of glass and a lot of lovely little worms.
As an adult, I discovered that charity shops, second-hand shops, car boot sales, bead shops and even Brighton Beach were also rich in treasure.
TITLE: These Animal Portraits Are Not What They Look Like

DESCRIPTION: My first eng movie was Titanic. From then I think if I able to draw a portrait, I will draw jack. And naturally, it becomes my target.
TITLE: It Took Me 1 Day To Draw This Charcoal Pencil Portrait Of Leonardo Di Caprio

DESCRIPTION: A 32-year-old man from Tulsa, Oklahoma made a sacrifice in January that ended up saving a complete stranger's life. 3 months later, that stranger decided to write him a 'thank you' letter, and it's so touching we can hardly stand it.
TITLE: Man Donates Kidney To A Total Stranger, Receives Emotional Letter 3 Months Later

DESCRIPTION: Keeping in touch with your best friends from high school can be tough. People move away, start families, start careers, and suddenly nothing is the same as it was. For 5 pals from Santa Barbara, California, however, staying connected is a top priority, and every 5 years the group gets together to recreate a photo that has come to define their friendship.
TITLE: Five Friends Take Same Photo For 35 Years, And Go Viral Again In 2017 With Their Newest Pic

DESCRIPTION: Wars never really end, because even though they may finish on the battlefield, many veterans bring the war back home and are forced to live with them for the rest of their lives.
TITLE: What Veterans Look Like After A Decade Of War In The Middle East In 10+ Shocking Pics By David Jay & James Nachtwey

DESCRIPTION: When Barry Peterson and his wife returned home from the holiday, they found an unexpected intruder in their house. It's kind of an odd request, the wife from Shorewood, Minnesota, told 911 emergency services over the phone. I don't know if I should call you or what... but we just came home from being gone - and a wild turkey flew through our front window and is now in our house.
TITLE: Couple Returns Home From Vacation, And Finds Unexpected Guest Inside

DESCRIPTION: When Blossom the shelter dog lost two of her three newborn puppies in mid-June, she was completely heartbroken. Maggie Escriva, Blossom's foster mum told The Dodo that the doggie became 'frantic' and was inconsolable. Then, almost by a miracle, 6 puppies in need of a mother came into her life...
TITLE: Puppies Thrown From Car Window Get Adopted By A Dog Mamma Who Just Lost Her Own Children

DESCRIPTION:
If you love intricate art and all things beauty, you will love this. I'm Alexa Jacob, a 19-year-old French makeup student.
I started displaying my passion for makeup and the looks that I came up with on my instagram page that I made 1 year ago and posted every sunday.
TITLE: I Create Detailed Makeup Looks Everyday

DESCRIPTION:
Jeez love, maybe you're pregnant - are the words that started it all. Yep, I was officially pregnant and my world was going to change - I was going to become someone's mother.
My husband was crying in the hall and I was glued to the toilet seat staring at a very obvious blue cross, feeling a tad faint to be honest, but mixed with obvious glee and astonished giggles of disbelief.
TITLE: I Incorporate My Son Into My Drawings

DESCRIPTION:
Inspired by the beauty and history of his home town of Istanbul, Turkish artist Hasan Kale paints stunning miniature portraits on all kinds of unusual canvases, from butterfly wings to coffee beans and even tiny pepper seeds.
No surface is to small for 57-year-old Hasan Kale. Ever since the 1980s, this Turkish micro art master has been painting his miniature marvels on things as small as cactus thorns and rice grains.
TITLE: Incredible Tiny Arts

DESCRIPTION:
After long and cold winter months I'm here to present you new creatures.
They are awake now and ready to bring magic in our lives, to show you how close fairytales can be.
TITLE: Fantastic Beasts: I Create Fairytale-Like Jewelry

DESCRIPTION: Though seemingly lifeless, dull and drab, abandoned buildings are jam-packed with the embers of many colorful stories. All the various lives lived within its walls; all the tears, all the laughter, all the love, all the heartache, stories of life and death. If these walls could talk, imagine the stories they would tell.
TITLE: I Bring New Life To Abandoned Buildings

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Cheetah and Rhiann Platt! This couple has completely rekindled the internet's belief in True Love! In 2015 they decided to hold their first wedding ceremony together and since then they have travelled the world and held over 90 weddings on 6 continents, in nearly 30 countries!
They spend very little money on travel (packing the same wedding dress and suit in their backpack everywhere they go), and all their weddings are held for free in public locations; yet their epic ceremonies and unbelievable photos rival those taken by professional photographers in ridiculously expensive venues around the world! Oh! Did we forget to mention?.. They Take All Their Own Photos!!!
The couple says Cheetah (the groom with the fiercest name we've ever heard!) is the dedicated photographer using his smartphone, and tripod! Can we say Serious Selfie Skills?!!?
When asked about the quality of his photos Cheetah replied with a smile,It's pretty easy to take a gorgeous photo when I've got Rhiann standing in the frame!
Their photos are featured on their combined Facebook page Cheetah & Rhiann Platt and their new Instagram account: @TheWorldWideWedding
The couple will be getting married several times this coming week along the East Coast of the USA before holding their 100th Ceremony in Washington DC on the 4th of July!
I can't think of anything more fitting! America's 241st birthday, and the 100th wedding in the nations capital - I'm not usually a romantic, but I am rooting for these two all the way!
They are even ordained and hold a self unifying ceremony where they officiate their own wedding! I mean, how romantic is that? We just love the way this couple had completely redefined and upgraded the wedding ceremony!
TITLE: This Couple Is About To Hold Their 100th Wedding On The 4th Of July

DESCRIPTION: I love to create pictures using found beads and buttons. Each bead or button is individually glued on taking between 1-2 months to complete each picture.
TITLE: I Paint With Beads And Buttons

DESCRIPTION: I love to create pictures using found beads and buttons. Each bead or button is individually glued on taking between 1-2 months to complete each picture.
TITLE: I Created This Leopard Using Just Beads And Buttons

DESCRIPTION: I love to create pictures using found beads and buttons. Each bead or button is individually glued on taking between 1-2 months to complete each picture.
TITLE: I Created This Panda Using Just Beads And Buttons

DESCRIPTION: I've been in love with horror for as long as I can remember, movies, games, manga, anime...
TITLE: I Create Cosplay With A Gory Twist

DESCRIPTION: I have problems with sleeping, so I stay up and paint instead.
TITLE: Acrylic On Canvas With A Help Of A Hairdryer

DESCRIPTION:
I created miniature versions of the places I saw in my dreams. It took me about two months to create all of them.
I saw these places in my dreams and it was a bit challenging to turn my imagination into reality but the whole process was fun and awesome.
TITLE: I Recreate Miniature Versions Of Places I See In My Dreams

DESCRIPTION:
For the past 13 years, I've twisted balloons. It was never something I thought I'd be good at, but through a lot of work, imagination, and dedication it has become my superpower and now I can't get enough of it! From balloon dogs to balloon dresses, if you can think of it there is a strong possibility that I have made a balloon version of it. 
Ever since I read my first comic books I've loved their bright and bold style of art.
TITLE: I Recreated Iconic Comic Book Covers Using Balloons

DESCRIPTION: Dragon Ball sure made its fusion dance famous all around the world, inspired by that I created different fusion dances for distinct cartoon characters.
TITLE: I Fused Different Cartoon Characters Into One

DESCRIPTION: Remember Sean Spicer's embarassing 'disappearing into the bushes' moment after journalists asked him to explain why the president fired FBI director James Comey? Well, we found this gardener who predicted this would happen back in 2013 when he hid in the bushes while at work - and here are the pictures to prove it.
TITLE: Gardener Sends Photos Of Himself At Work To His Friend, He Uploads Them Online And They Go Viral

DESCRIPTION:
I am a self-taught, 31-year-old artist from Serbia. Actively engaged in drawing  for less than 4 years.
I'm presenting you my latest 3D drawings from last two years.
TITLE: 3D Drawings That I Create To Confuse People (Part 3)

DESCRIPTION:
The temperature in Pheonix has almost reached a record-breaking 122 °F (50 °C) recorded on June 26, 1990, and it's becoming harder and harder to escape the insane heat. The flights are being cancelled, and things are literally melting.
Today it's up to 116 °F (47 °C), and 168 °F (76°C) on the concrete.
TITLE: Temperatures In Arizona Are So High Right Now That People Are Posting Pics Of Things Melting

DESCRIPTION:
Looking at pictures from your childhood can bring back lots of fun memories, especially when you find evidence of embarrassing fashion choices you made, first selfies, or pictures that capture one of those awkward phases you went through as a teenager.
Take a look at your old photo albums and share pictures of your blunder years! Let's laugh at ourselves a bit! If they're hilarious (or rather, humiliating) enough, they just might make it to a new post that we'll share on Facebook, where everyone can share in the awkwardness.
TITLE: Post Your Most Regretful Childhood Pictures That Are Too Funny Not To Share!

DESCRIPTION: I've been working in the animation industry as a character and background designer for several years. After bringing other people's visions to life, I had an intense need to create work for myself, so I started drawing on post-its and making comics in my down time. Usually, I'd draw a character with the focus on her facial expression.
TITLE: I Tell Stories Of Lust, Heartache, And Loneliness In My 10+ Drawings On Post-It Notes

DESCRIPTION:
Half a year ago the world of one couple changed drastically when a boyfriend posted comics that his girlfriend Catana drew online. The cute style and adorable messages of the comics made them irresistible and they went viral really fast.
Now more than 300k followers are waiting for Catana's weekly comics.
TITLE: Girlfriend Secretly Illustrates Everyday Life With Her Bf, He Uploads Comics Online And They Go Viral (New Pics)

DESCRIPTION:
I am a Belgian female artist & illustrator and I use a self-invented technique of automatic drawing to delve into the subconscious.
I doodle everywhere and every spare moment of my time. By quickly drawing, barring any conscious thought, I am giving as much room as possible to my imagination.
TITLE: I Turned My Entire House Into A Giant Canvas For My Doodles

DESCRIPTION: Having a swimming pool is a super fun way to stay cool during the summer. For the small animals living in your backyard, however, it can be a death trap. Wildlife biologist Rich Mason is out to change that with his simple, yet ingenious invention - the FrogLog.
TITLE: This Genius Invention Is Saving Animals From Terrible Death

DESCRIPTION: Julia Kaye is a 28-year-old cartoonist living in Los Angeles. She's already famous from her webcomic 'Up And Out', but last year a big change came to her life - she became a transgender woman. This was clearly a very hard step to make and Julia went and is still going through many challenges that bring both melancholic and optimistic feelings.
TITLE: Transgender Artist Illustrates Her Gender Transition In 10+ Emotional Comics

DESCRIPTION: One Japanese diver has been friends with the same fish for 25 years - and this is not a fairytale, guys. It's for real.
TITLE: This Japanese Diver Has Been Visiting His Best Friend Fish For 25 Years Now

DESCRIPTION:
Hi-RES is the title of a new series of works in sculpture and painting that explore visible reality through the analytical lens of 3D computer modeling. Hi-RES delves into relationships between the art object that takes visible reality as its point of reference, and the boundaries of verisimilitude between observable reality, art and science.
Surely it can be said that since the invention of photography, and more specifically since that historic moment when visual artists discovered photography as a reference for looking at reality in a manner that is, shall we say, indirect or alternative, everything changed in the use they began to give to that referential reality.
TITLE: Hi-RES By Rómulo Celdrán

DESCRIPTION: I'm visiting Schwangau Germany this week to view the castles, paraglide and take photos. This storm passed earlier this morning so I ran out with camera in hand and while I missed most of the storm I discovered the Milky Way overhead. The meteor was an added bonus.
TITLE: Milk Way, Lightning And Meteor Over Neuschwanstein Castle Early This Morning

DESCRIPTION: My parents live along the bank of the Deschutes River in Bend Oregon. During the summer they open up the doors to allow the cool, calm breeze to flow through their home. On this day they, they had a lot more than a breeze roll through.
TITLE: My Parents Have Lived In Their Home For Over 10 Years, This Was The First Time Anything Like This Had Happened

DESCRIPTION: This family has a family photo unlike any others. Shared by the Roussel Six Pack Facebook page, the photo shows 17 grandchildren of 6 siblings all in one place. The grandchildren are all standing in birth order with color-coded shirts for each family.
TITLE: This Photo Of Color-Coded Grandchildren Is Going Viral, And It Shows Just How Much One Family Can Grow

DESCRIPTION: About three years ago I learned how to make an origami crane, and ever since I've enjoyed folding them. I fold them while watching the baseball game, I fold napkins and receipts into cranes at restaurants, I fold them to procrastinate, etc..
TITLE: I Make Incredibly Tiny Origami Cranes That Take Me Around 45 Minutes Each

DESCRIPTION:
Pink Flamingo Day was declared in 2007 by Dean Mazzaralla, the mayor of Leominster, MA to honor the work of Don Featherstone, creator of the plastic lawn flamingo.
Don Featherstone created the iconic piece in 1957 while working for Union Products. He based his design on photographs of flamingos from National Geographic because he was unable to get real flamingos to use as models.
TITLE: 10+ Gorgeous Flamingo Pics To Celebrate Pink Flamingo Day

DESCRIPTION: When The Queen of England delivers her yearly speech, she usually does so while dressed in a plethora of typically royal regalia. Jewels. Furry robes. And, of course, a crown. But this year Queen Elizabeth II raised eyebrows by ditching the traditional regal attire and opting instead for a simpler outfit.
TITLE: It Looks Like The Queen Just Trolled The UK Prime-Minister About Brexit In The Most Brilliant Way

DESCRIPTION:
There's undoubtedly something about broken patterns, messy alignments, and other flawed elements that bothers us. Even if you don't consider yourself a perfectionist, your brain is programmed to prefer things in a nice order, and everything else may fall in the annoying category.
Don't believe me? Bored Panda has put together a list of pics to prove just how annoyed you could get in everyday situations.
TITLE: People Are Posting Annoying Things That Annoy Them More Than They Should (10+ Pics)

DESCRIPTION: The universe works in mysterious ways, but you can't help but feel that it sometimes has a sense of humor. This list of brilliant comedic irony, inspired by our previous list of ironic moments, shows some of the greatest unexpectedly comical outcomes that have ever been captured on camera.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Ironic Things That Have Ever Happened

DESCRIPTION:
In new series by Tezi Gabunia, presented images create unfinished plots, they challenge the visitor to complete the painting by their free choice, including any kind of action.
Complete the painting is an interactive art project that reflects on interactive trend of contemporary art. Series of paintings provide certain scenes with different characters, which trigger a communication with a visitor.
TITLE: Artist Invites Viewers To Complete The Painting

DESCRIPTION:
So here are some more of my art collection. Needless to say there are many of small, medium and big rocks in the house right now.
My poor husband is sighing every time he notice me carrying home new stones, and then he begins to groan even more when he can see me painting hearts, always hearts.
TITLE: I Paint Colourful Hearts On Stones

DESCRIPTION:
Have you ever wondered what the Star Wars characters get up to after the Director shouts 'THAT'S A WRAP EVERYONE!' on set?
Photographer and fine artist David Gilliver has given us a rare glimpse into the secret lives of Star Wars villains revealing all kinds of secrets, like how Vader actually has a baby AT-AT at home who is not yet house-trained!
David obtained his Honours Degree in Fine Art Photography from the Glasgow School of Art where he studied from 1997-2001. His final degree-show featured lots of photographs of toys which has been a recurring theme throughout his photographic work for many years now.
I first photographed Star Wars figures during my degree at the Glasgow School of Art.
TITLE: The Secret Lives Of Star Wars Villains

DESCRIPTION:
Lonesome George, my new paper cutting series, is named after the last Galapagos Tortoise of its kind, who died in 2012. Like him, all the animals depicted here are extinct or in the process of going extinct, as a result of human activity.
Each paper cutting was cut from a single black sheet of paper.
TITLE: I Create Paper Cuttings Of Extinct Animals

DESCRIPTION: Time flies by so fast, especially when we're watching our little canine friends grow up. It seems like just yesterday, I brought the little puppy that could barely fit in my hands home, and now he's all grown up... Can you relate? You're not alone!
TITLE: 10+ Adorable Before & After Pics Of Dogs Growing Up (Add Yours!)

DESCRIPTION:
Some people might say that dolls are toys for kids and nothing more. But incredible artists can change the minds of the harshest critics.
Noel Cruz is one of those people.
TITLE: Artist Repaints Mass-Produced Dolls To Make Them Look More Realistic, And The Result Is Amazing

DESCRIPTION: Remember when we wrote about how people just assume that artists should work for exposure? Well, turns out some people assume the same about programmers.
TITLE: This Programmer Was Asked To Do ~40 Hours Work For Free, And His Brilliant Response Goes Viral

DESCRIPTION:
I have always had lots of Anxiety when talking to other people and even just being around them which makes it hard to be productive and go out to enjoy everyday life. So I started drawing and found out that creating new things helps me gain the confidence to talk to people and if anything, makes for a great conversation starter.
So after years of drawing countless creatures, I am hoping to have a future career as an artist.
TITLE: Drawing Mythical Creatures Helps Deal With My Social Anxiety Disorder

DESCRIPTION:
Hey! My name is Peter and I am the creator of Peter's Comics.
For a couple of months now I've been interested in anything drawing related, so a few weeks ago I made a decision to purchase a drawing tablet and start drawing webcomics.
I'm trying to draw a new comic once a week, mostly when I see something I find funny while browsing the internet.
TITLE: I Drew These 9 Comics In Past Few Weeks

DESCRIPTION:
Matthew Holmes, 23 years old and exploring Britain's derelict and forgotten relics.
Frozen in time in a time warp Matthew brings back to life these empty spaces exploring them and creating a portfolio to showcase to the rest of Britain.
Matthew has been into the Second World War Nazi Prisoner of War Camp located in Weston, England in which he wondered around the forgotten camp walking in the same footsteps as 100,000 Nazi prisoners of war between the years 1939 and 1945.
TITLE: Exploring Abandoned Buildings With Matthew Holmes

DESCRIPTION: The Ukrainian artist uses wire to tell love stories. These are small unique sculptures for wedding ceremonies: ring holders flowers and birds. They are gentle and light but at the same time strong and unshakable as true love.
TITLE: The Ukrainian Artist Uses Wire To Tell Love Stories

DESCRIPTION: I present one of my greatest passions, the drawing has accompanied me almost since I have use of reason, I'm interested in minimalism and tattoo style drawing, for a couple of years and since then I publish everything that comes out of the Mind .. I like to detail my drawings without losing the essence of simplicity.
TITLE: Thorough And Detailed Illustrations By The Colombian Brian Holguín

DESCRIPTION: Volunteer group from cat protector organization Cat Care Community and Pukainis.lv with Puszatek.pl visited friends from Poland, animal shelter Schronisko Na Paluchu in Warsaw.
TITLE: They Saved More Than 1000 Cats And Dogs Last Year

DESCRIPTION:
I've posted several light-painting photos already, suggesting others to try their hand at this fun photography technique. If I haven't got you to try it out yet, hopefully these will give you the extra inspiration you need! Happy light-painting!
If I haven't got you to try it out yet, hopefully these will give you the extra inspiration you need! Happy light-painting!
TITLE: I Create Unique Images Using Light Painting

DESCRIPTION: Dating someone younger than you can be a fun, humorous experience, but like all relationships that aren't deemed 'typical' by society, it can also mean tons of annoying and intrusive questions. Romanian-Canadian artist Cassandra Calin knows this all too well, and she's got a new comic series to which anyone who has a few years on their partner will undoubtedly relate.
TITLE: 5 Truths Of Dating Someone Younger That Are Way Too Real

DESCRIPTION: My name is Katarina Blazhievskaya (La Katarina) and I am happy to introduce my art here. My work tools are Photoshop and dreams. I like everything that is connected with mysticism, imagination, and magic, they are all very esoteric to me.
TITLE: My Work Tools Are Photoshop And Dreams

DESCRIPTION: Nearly 1000 dogs were cramped in wire cages and loaded in a truck, only to be transported to a slaughterhouse in Guangzhou, China. Luckily, brave locals and animal right activists managed to put an end to this horror, showing the world just how much we can do when we stand against animal cruelty together.
TITLE: Guy Sees Truck Loaded With 1000 Dogs About To Be Butchered, Drives His SUV In Front Of The Truck To Stop It

DESCRIPTION: I've always been creative but after a series of rubbish events, I'd completely lost my way. Then, quite unexpectedly, I met someone awesome. It was a whirlwind romance and after only a few months we were not only inseparable but living together (many people thought we were nuts).
TITLE: I Fell In Love And Started Drawing Silly Sentiments

DESCRIPTION: Cats have always been funny, but as you can see from these hilarious pictures, they're even funnier with Snapchat!
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Cat Snapchats That Are Im-paw-sible Not To Laugh At

DESCRIPTION: Office dress codes have become a hot-button issue in recent years, especially as hot temperatures outside force people into less-than-modest attire. An employee at a call centre in Aylesbury, UK, named Joey Barge recently faced up against his company's code when he was sent home for wearing a smart pair of shorts on a nearly 30-degree summer day. In rebellion, he took a tip from a fellow Twitter user and came back in a dress.
TITLE: Boss Sends Guy Home For Violating The Male Dress Code, So He Decides To Follow The Female One Instead

DESCRIPTION: It was celebrated in ancient Greece, ignored during the Middle Ages, and rediscovered by scientists over and over before the scientific community finally agreed that it exists. What are we talking about? The clitoris of course!
TITLE: The Clitoris: This Adorable Animation Explains Clitoris Like No One Else

DESCRIPTION: As part of my job as a photographer, I get to travel around the world and document many beautiful landscapes. Quite often I get asked what my favorite place to visit is. My answer can be somewhat of a surprise, as it actually goes back to my home country of Israel, and specifically its capital Jerusalem.
TITLE: A Journey Through Time In Jerusalem: How Centuries Have Changed The City

DESCRIPTION: For the average consumer, food packaging is nothing more than a necessary evil to keep their produce safe. It isn't there to be admired or appreciated, and it'll end up in the recycle bin just as soon as the box or package is empty. But as you can see from these intuitive and innovative food package designs, that doesn't have to be the case.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Genius Food Packaging Designs Ever Created

DESCRIPTION: Canadian artist Maskull Lasserre is known for creating intense, cringe-worthy pieces of art, and his newest piece is no exception.
TITLE: Giant Tree Trunk Carved Down To Frayed Rope By Maskull Lasserre

DESCRIPTION: On a random afternoon, in a Hollywood bakery, I spotted SNL legend Chris Kattan having a little car trouble, as he seemed to have locked himself out. Long story short, after I broke into his car, he asked how he could repay the favor. I explained that I was a professional, high-concept commercial photographer and launched the notion of doing a shoot collaboration of his choosing.
TITLE: Chris Kattan And I Recreated Old Buster Keaton Pictures, And They Are Pretty Epic.

DESCRIPTION: What does it take to become the number one video on YouTube? It's a question many vloggers have no doubt repeatedly asked themselves. But as one Japanese YouTuber named Jun just proved, all you need to hit the top is one rusty knife and a whole lot of polishing!
TITLE: Seller Thought He Ripped This Guy Off When He Sold A Rusty Knife For $3, He Will Regret It After Seeing This Video

DESCRIPTION: United Nations announced that the number of persons seeking asylum or escape from areas of conflict in 2016 reached 65.6 million, which is even more than there was after the World War II. Many of these refugees live in dire conditions, so a Syrian refugee and an artist, Abdalla Al Omari, has decided to act and send an urgent message to the world leaders, most of whom seem to be indifferent to the crisis.
TITLE: World Leaders Reimagined As Refugees In A Powerful Project By A Syrian Artist

DESCRIPTION:
Using vintage and antique wooden boxes, paints and mixed media, I create boxes in both pre-designed and custom themes. I have been making these for 7 years now, and every one is unique!
I list spaces to purchase the boxes on the 1st of each month. More details can be found on my website www.
TITLE: I Make Custom Gothic And Fantasy Jewellery Boxes.

DESCRIPTION: Back in the 19th century, Tinder and Craigslist weren't exactly a thing yet, so people had to find other ways to search for a mate. Advertising yourself in a local newspaper was one of them, and that's exactly what this eligible bachelor did in 1865. Now, in 2017, we all wish we could transport him to the future and take him up on the offer.
TITLE: 18-Year-Old Guy Is Looking For A Wife In 1865 And His Newspaper Ad Will Make You Want To Marry Him Now

DESCRIPTION: If we could request who Oprah should do the next episode of Where Are They Now? on, it would definitely be the Disney princesses. What have they even been up to since riding off into the sunset and living happily ever after? LA-based photographer Tony Ross is helping us visualise it by depicting Disney's most iconic maidens as majestic queens, and to make sure the portraits were extra-realistic, he had the princess models call in their moms to pose as the mythical matriarchs. The results were a royal success.
TITLE: Disney Princesses Reimagined Years Later As Queens By Daughters And Mothers

DESCRIPTION: We are a Belgian couple, both 26, named Jolien en Karel. She is a starter architect and he is an electrical engineer. Instead of buying a house and settle down our lives like almost all of our friends around us we decided to buy a mercedes-benz vito and transform it to our first home.
TITLE: Instead Of Buying A House We Bought A Mercedes Vito And Converted It To Our Rolling Home

DESCRIPTION: Telling a little white lie to your child every now and then is certainly not a bad thing. As long as you make sure to backtrack and let them know that eating watermelon seeds won't actually turn them into a watermelon before they make it to high school, you're in the clear.
TITLE: 10+ Funny White Lies Parents Tell Their Kids

DESCRIPTION: disorderimages visited Thuy Tien Waterpark and although it was an unsuccessful venture in the past found it more successful cashing in on its 'abandoned, spooky' theme today.
TITLE: An Hour At A Run Down And Not So Spooky Waterpark, Hue

DESCRIPTION: I'm using a special technique, that no one else does, which consists of manipulating phosphorescent pigments in a way that allows me to create paintings with shadow and light in a way that the artworks have depth in light or dark. The artworks usually charge from daylight and release it during the night. The technique consist of sculpting layer by layer the phosphorescent pigments with binding mediums.
TITLE: Solar Paintings Glowing In The Dark

DESCRIPTION: Niam is 14 years old with Autism and minimal speech and comprehension. He started painting two years ago. As any proud mom, I started posting the paintings on Facebook.
TITLE: 14 Year-Old Artist With Autism Becomes Art Sensation

DESCRIPTION: Ever wondered what sorts of meals movie directors would make if they were chefs? A comic artist who goes by the name of Cheekylicious certainly has, and the results are brilliantly accurate.
TITLE: 14 Comics Reveal What Would Happen If Movie Directors Were Chefs

DESCRIPTION: I make window sandwiches, says artist Dustin Yellin. His glass sculptures decorated the historic Lincoln Center with their luminosity, transparency, and colorful ornamentation to coincide with New York City Ballet's winter season.
TITLE: Artist Dustin Yellin Creates 3D Collages In Layers Of Glass

DESCRIPTION: Yuto, aka OruFun, uses a technique similar to Luciana Frigerio's and without any scissors folds the pages of books into intricate popular culture designs.
TITLE: Artist Folds Books Into Sculptures

DESCRIPTION: I guess the common thread in all of this is the idea not of using new tech to tell stories, but of using tech to tell new stories
TITLE: Artificial Intelligence Turns A Book Of Flowers Into Surprisingly Lovely Dinosaur Art

DESCRIPTION: In my free time, I program my plotter bot, Karel, to draw with a pen. Because the plotter uses a simple pen all I can use are simple black lines, not too much to play with. But I came to love the simplicity and elegance of a simple line and started to utilize it in my drawings.
TITLE: I Programmed A Plotter Bot To Draw With A Pen

DESCRIPTION:
Hi! My name is Anastasija Jevstafjeva.
From 8 am to 5 pm, five days per week I'm almost an invisible associate in a financial company. All the other time I am an artist creating my own world using imagination and makeup.
TITLE: I Match My Makeup With Colorful Handbags

DESCRIPTION:
After struggling for years in writing and drawing picture books, I am well aware of the hardship that every creator goes through in trying to find our audience. We all started out full of hopes and dreams, in search of someone who understands and appreciates our talents.
Whether you are a writer, a composer, an artist, or simply someone looking for love, we are all looking for a 'listener'.
TITLE: I Drew A Picture Book To Inspire Everyone To Continue Chasing Their Dreams

DESCRIPTION:
When you see your dog everyday, you probably don't realize how much it changed over time until you see it's then and now growing up photos. They are the same puppies, just bigger.
To show how quickly they grow up, we invite you to share photos of your own pooch from their earliest puppyhood and how they look now.
TITLE: Share Then And Now Pictures Of Your Dog Growing Up

DESCRIPTION:
Sensibility and love are two feelings (among a lot of others) that you will feel for sure looking at these pictures. Aline Brant is working on a photographic project that portrays the feminine side in works that receive embroidery intervention.
Aline Brant is a Brazilian artist who uses photography as a fundamental tool for creating her works.
TITLE: Photography Merges With Delicate Embroidery In Works By This Brazilian Artist

DESCRIPTION: From people and plants to cars and buildings, time eventually wears everything out. Sometimes it takes weeks or months, other times it can take years or decades, but eventually everything begins to crumble beneath the unstoppable pressure of Father Time.
TITLE: 10+ Unbelievable Examples Of Things Being Worn Down Over Time

DESCRIPTION: Do you have a picture that you'd like altering? Perhaps you'd like an ex-partner removing from a photograph, or maybe you wish that your hair didn't look quite so dorky in an otherwise perfect shot? Whatever you need, this guy can help. His name is James Fridman, but we prefer to call him the King of Photoshop, because as you can see from his hilarious creations, there seems to be nothing he can't do.
TITLE: What Happens When You Ask The Wrong Guy For Help (10+ New Pics)

DESCRIPTION: Hey Pandas! Recently we asked you to send us your pictures of your dogs acting weird, and as you can see from this hilarious list, you certainly didn't disappoint us!
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Pics Of Dogs Acting Weird (Add Yours!)

DESCRIPTION: Marionettes as tall as 5 storey houses strolled along the streets of Montreal during the city's 375th birthday on May 17th, 2017. The performance began in Jeanne-Mance Park with the Little Girl-Giant waking up in front of hundreds of people and continued for 3 days.
TITLE: Giant Marionettes Take Over Montreal

DESCRIPTION: Dancers' bodies have extraordinary grace, and as it turns out even their fingers can build mesmerizing performances. StatusSilver has uploaded a video of the Kaleidoscope Dance, performed by XTRAP, a dance entertainment trio from Japan.

DESCRIPTION: Having triplets is a blessing! It is a lot of work, but so worth every second. There are a few challenges on the way, but we wouldn't have it any other way. I am a busy mum of six.
TITLE: Life Of Triplets: I Document The Joys Of Raising My Six Kids

DESCRIPTION: Old cameras are a special kind of cool, a fact that Portland, Oregon photographer Kati Dimoff knows well. In fact, she makes a point to search for them at the Goodwill thrift store on Grand Avenue whenever she gets the chance, hoping to find the lost and forgotten treasures that often linger on their undeveloped film. She struck gold in early 2017 when she discovered a trove of photos showing the chaotic 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens on a vintage Argus C2.
TITLE: Woman Buys Old Camera In Thrift Store, Develops Its Film, And Discovers Mt. St. Helens Eruption Photos

DESCRIPTION: I create handmade decorations using moss and other materials gathered from the forest.
TITLE: Handmade Creations From Nature

DESCRIPTION:
Since 2007 I have been painting full-time, traveling the world and learning from experts & tribal communities about how best to help the endangered species that still remain. This painting of a sea turtle is part of a series that will eventually become a book for charity 
Also last but certainly not least, if you enjoyed the music as I did that is playing in the background while I paint, go check out Xavier Rudd, buy his music and if your lucky get a ticket to see him perform live. TOTALLY EPIC!
TITLE: I Paint Endangered Species To Raise Money For Charity

DESCRIPTION:
Visit Bangladesh anytime where there is something for everyone. Your dream will come to a reality in this beautiful land where life is happening all the time.
Happiness needs no reason here.
TITLE: 10+ Amazing Photographs Of Bangladesh Will Make You Fall In Love With Its Beauty

DESCRIPTION: As long as I can remember, i have always been obsessed with miniatures and things of whimsy. Now, I strive to create them. I began recycling these vintage and/or pre-loved jewelry boxes into tiny little magical worlds that you can hold in the palm of your hand.

DESCRIPTION: Beautiful Magical Beetles jewellery from polymer clay!
TITLE: I Create These Magical Beetles From Polymer Clay

DESCRIPTION: 6 months ago, I began to record my observations of a three-year-old daughter. Draw comics about our daily routine has been an exciting activity. My daughter does not let me get bored.

DESCRIPTION: I'm a nerd / geek artist, and everyday I doodle a pop-culture icon inspired everyday objects that I find lying around.
TITLE: Pop Culture Nerd Art Made Out Of Everyday Objects

DESCRIPTION:
5 years ago I suffered an injury in practice which ruptured my spleen and gave me internal bleeding which went undiagnosed for 4 days until I collapsed. I was rushed to surgery and due to the blood loss my heart stopped and I was clinically dead for several minutes.
I eventually came back and moved on to make a full recovery, but the fact that I died at the zenith of my life left a looming realization that has stayed with me ever since.
TITLE: When I Was 21 I Died: This Is How I Cope With It

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Poly, six years old kleinspitz girl on her way to became Instagram celebrity!
Poly (her name means dust in Finnish) runs household in Finland and loves being photographed. Poly loves sun and relaxing and eating snacks and her favorite hobby in taking naps.
TITLE: Meet Poly, The Cutest Kleinspitz On Instagram

DESCRIPTION:
There is no past, no future, only the present moment.
In this short blissful moment of silence, we go into a space that connects us to something greater than who we are.
We connect with the flow of energy, our heart, and soul.
TITLE: Orgasmocracy: I Paint The Faces Of Pleasure

DESCRIPTION: I didn't want to see all the beautiful cards we got for our wedding shower and wedding go to waste or sit in a random box somewhere...
TITLE: I Cut Up All Our Wedding Cards And Turned Them Into Art For Our Home

DESCRIPTION: If you love animals then this brand is created just for you! I founded this company for myself, for the need to have gadgets that were not in stores. Now, the only thing that limits me is the imagination that seems to have no end ;-) I create bags, accessories, and clothes that you can express your love for your favorite pet or wild animal from the forest. Everything is created without harm to living animals, with artificial fur and leather.
TITLE: Purrfect Brand To Animal Lovers

DESCRIPTION: In Russia's isolated and remote region of Siberia, an underground economic boom is taking shape. Radio Free Europe photographer Amos Chapple, back in 2016, went inside the dark world of the Russian men illegally mining for tusks and remains of the long-extinct woolly mammoth, in hopes of cashing in on black market trade. The images he captured show a compelling cycle of toil, desperation, and environmental consequence.
TITLE: Photographer Joins Illegal Mammoth Tusk Hunt In Siberia, Captures How They Get Rich, Get Drunk And Nearly Die

DESCRIPTION: Digital artist. I live in Minsk, Belarus. I do digital portraits on photos.
TITLE: I Create Digital Portraits

DESCRIPTION: Indonesian authorities have seized a haul of hundreds of critically endangered pangolins and scales worth 190,000 US dollars, a navy official said on Wednesday.
TITLE: No Trade, No Killing: 200+ Muggled Pangolins Tracked Down In Indonesia

DESCRIPTION:
Japanese artist Naoki Onogawa is taking origami art to the next level, and she's doing it in the most Japanese way ever.
Inspired by the legend of the 1000 cranes and the story of Sadako Sasaki, she folds hundreds of miniature origami cranes which later become beautifully delicate Bonsai trees of various colors and styles.
Since ancient times, Japanese people have been mindful of natural phenomenon.
TITLE: 1000s Of Miniature Origami Cranes Turned Into Incredible Bonsai Trees By Naoki Onogawa

DESCRIPTION: I attended tea ceremony courses since my childhood, so I was heavily exposed to Japanese ceramics, Masumoto says. My teacher inspired me with her self-made cups. Seeing this, I became interested in the idea of giving form to something while still being able to using it too.
TITLE: Half-Octopus, Half-Pottery: Japanese Artist Creates Ceramics That Blur The Line Between Function And Form

DESCRIPTION: With rates of homelessness rapidly on the rise in Los Angeles, residents are scrambling to find solutions. One group of students at San Fernando High School took it upon themselves to make an impact, and despite having no prior experience with engineering or invention, they managed to construct a solar-powered tent that rolls up into a backpack, and now they've earned a whole lot more than just the world's respect.
TITLE: Teen Girls Invent Solar-Powered Tent For Homeless With No Engineering Experience, Win Grant From MIT

DESCRIPTION: Japanese visual artist Nobuhiro Nakanishi doesn't believe that time can be grasped, but with his latest exhibition, he does a spectacular job of showing us what it might look like if we could capture it in the palms of our hands.

DESCRIPTION:
As the world has become more and more flat, every corner of the earth has been discovered by adventurous people. Millions of pictures of landscape appear on our newsfeeds everyday that makes us feel our planet diminished.
However, more than those images and more than conventional landmarks, the earth out there is still an endless source of inspiration through the eyes of artists.
TITLE: The Incredible Landmarks With Minimal Art Style.

DESCRIPTION: At CaroMont Regional Medical Center in North Carolina, some very special mini-ceremonies are taking place - honoring and celebrating the lives of premature babies. Once the newborns are about to leave the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU), they get a personalized graduation cap and a portrait.
TITLE: Awesome Hospital Organizes Graduation Ceremonies For Premature Babies Leaving Intensive Care

DESCRIPTION: Since 9 years in every season I walk this territory and shot thousands of captures, hunting for misty pictures, moody scenes...
TITLE: I Love This Misty Land

DESCRIPTION: It's becoming increasingly difficult to know just what is real and what isn't when browsing the internet. We're not just talking about fake news either, but the millions of images that may or may not have been digitally manipulated beyond recognition.
TITLE: Photoshop Master Reveals Why You Should Never Trust Photos You See On Social Media

DESCRIPTION: Finding the right person to spend the rest of your life with isn't about finding somebody who's perfect. It's about finding somebody who's perfect for you. Because as you can see from this hilarious list compiled by Bored Panda, it's important to have a husband or wife who can handle all of your weird, annoying, and downright unbearable quirks!
TITLE: 10+ Funny Reasons Why Being Married Is The Best

DESCRIPTION:
Hi. My family is a frequent reader of Bored Panda, and my younger daughter Sophie felt strongly that the following was post-worthy.
Today she disappeared into her bedroom for a little while and when she came out she handled me this (I think it speaks for itself!)
TITLE: 10-Year-Old Gets Fed Up With Idiots Hurting The Planet And Writes Open Letter To Humanity

DESCRIPTION:
On a normal afternoon on 31st May, 1970, a quiet town in Peru suffered what is now the most catastrophic disaster in Peru's history. Yungay, a small highland town, was completely wiped out along with all of it's 25,000 residents, in a matter of minutes.
It happened at around 3:23pm, when most of the locals were watching the Italy v.
TITLE: I Visited Yungay, The Town That Disappeared, And It Broke My Heart

DESCRIPTION:
This Instagram project Home Zen Garden is inspired by traditional Japanese rock gardens and original haiku poetry.
Many of haiku poems might seem to be simple but they depict profound emotions or beautiful moments. Thinking about a visual representation of the haiku stories opens a great potential to reinforce one's imagination, concentration and patience.
TITLE: These Miniature Zen Gardens Visualising Famous Haiku Poems Will Make You Really Zen

DESCRIPTION: If you're a cat owner, having a small bag of green powder in your home means something very different from what most people would think. It's that magical dust that turns domestic felines into wild jungle cats as soon as they get a whiff of it, and melts them into a motionless puddle of fluff if they lick it up. Enter the wondrous world of catnip, and the stoned kitties who can't get enough of it.
TITLE: 10+ Times Cats Found Catnip, And Cat.exe Stopped Functioning

DESCRIPTION:
I am silk painter located in Poland, Kraków. I'm inspired by Art Nouveau as you can see on this huge natural silk scarves!
The Firebird Wings scarf is big enough to become pareo or a beach wrap, ideal for the summer time: lightweight Habotai silk and vivid colors.
The Wings scarf was painted with silk paints in two steps: first I painted feathers, then I added red - burgundy outline.
TITLE: I Hand-Painted This Silk Scarf That Will Give You Firebird Wings

DESCRIPTION: This shoot has been a long time dream of mine. I was envisioning the horse walking on the beach with a girl dressed up in steampunk style riding on top. When we got to the beach we started as planned, but Maddie, (our horse) was clearly not happy, she kept going right to the edge of the water and putting in her nose, not quite sure what to do in this new environment.
TITLE: Steampunk With Maddie The Lake Loving Horse

DESCRIPTION: You could say some clothing manufacturers are trying too hard because their products look simply ridiculous, but even though these stick-on pads look unorthodox, they actually have a set of very useful functions to help your feet relax on holiday.

DESCRIPTION: While many types of cacti have wonderful flowers, I hope you'll soon agree that the Echinopsis family of cacti rules the roost, says the mysterious plant lover.

DESCRIPTION:
Today I would love to share with you some of my photograph, which I captured in a Madrasah, place of religious education to Muslims, there is a system for religious education in all religions, Madrasa is the place of highest religious education for the Muslims. Starting from young age, one becomes an Islamic scholar after completing Madrasa education.
There are several kinds of Muslim madrasas, there are some of the Arabic medium, some use the mother-language beside Arabic.
TITLE: 10+ Photographs That May Completely Change Your Point Of View About Religion, Forever

DESCRIPTION:
Rome is a mix, of The Classics and everyday.
This is but a small selection of the everyday sights.
TITLE: What Can You Expect To See In Rome

DESCRIPTION:
Everyone! My sister got a kitten! After a tragic encounter last summer with the roommates dog, her loving cat of 8 years unfortunately passed away. Since our whole family are huge pet-lovers, it was a hard time for all of us. Enter Calypso, the 6-week old rescue kitten!
As a professional photographer who often shoots weddings, couples and lifestyle sessions - this was so much fun and a great way to welcome the new little bundle into the famjam!! I just know she will help rescue my sisters heart!
TITLE: The Newborn Kitten Photoshoot I Did With A Rescue Kitten That Rescued My Sister!

DESCRIPTION:
This is my photo project Ethereal. I wanted to surprise my friend's ethereal world, her delicacy and femininity through projection photography.
Even if she has different roles in society, her soul finds freedom in ballet and art.
TITLE: I Used A Projector To Portray The Magic Of A Soul

DESCRIPTION: For the past six years, I have been doing residencies, mostly in schools and through the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts. We determine the project, usually to be completed in ten or twenty school days. Then I take in sheets of glass, tools, and cement board.
TITLE: I Let Kids Play With Glass And Here Are The Results

DESCRIPTION: Bikinis and mini-skirts may be commonplace in the Western world, but the Middle-East is a slightly different story. Countries like Saudi Arabia and Iran enforce strict modesty laws on women in keeping with Islamic tradition, and prohibit any skin other than the face and hands from showing. These restrictions even apply to Britney and Madonna, as it turns out.
TITLE: 10+ Pics That Reveal How The Same Products And Images Look In The West Vs. Middle-East

DESCRIPTION: Fashion can be so ridiculous sometimes, we really shouldn't even get amazed by it anymore. But this list of fashion pieces, though... If it does one thing, it surely amazes.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Ridiculous Clothing Items That Are Actually Being Sold Right Now

DESCRIPTION: I am an Indian artist, illustrator and storyteller based in Berlin, when I came to Europe I was surprised to see the way cycling was looked at, there was a lot of talk about environment and thinking green. In India, where I come from, the bicycle is a necessity and I can also take the liberty to add that it's mostly a poormans mode of transportation, many businesses run on these and most of the people who use them don't even think about the contribution they are making to the environment. I grew up the same way, where there was one bicycle at home which was used by everyone and for different purposes.
TITLE: I Illiustrate Bicycle Stories From India

DESCRIPTION: Walks at 4 a.m, with a camera, could be very interesting. Today I was lucky because it was warm morning and all Cracow was covered in fog.
TITLE: Underwater City: I Captured The Mystical Feeling Of Cracow At 4 AM

DESCRIPTION:
I have been touring Europe with my Digital Artist workshop for past couple of years and now I decided to do something different on my home turf Finland. I decided to put together a two and a half day workshop about creating fantasy art.
The goal of the workshop was to help each of the photographers individually to realise their vision by extending their skillset and lending my support on the techniques and creative process.
TITLE: I Organized Disney Themed Photography Workshop In Finnish Countryside And The Results Were Amazing

DESCRIPTION: I live in a tiny house in the woods with my hubby (who is also an artist) and sometimes our neighbor's cat who seems to have adopted us. Making tiny art in my tiny house was kind of a natural convergence of what was exciting and what was practical. I paint with opaque watercolors on linen stretched in tiny embroidery hoops.
TITLE: I Paint Tiny Portals Into My Dreamland

DESCRIPTION: Cyanotype is an archaic photo process. I mix the chemicals in a recipe, it exposures the sunlight and develop the water. But I deliberately wreck it, before I expose it to the sun I sprinkle its water.

DESCRIPTION: This is the work I have made, some are personal some for clients. But all have been done with love for the craft!

A couple years ago I have opened a shop on Etsy to sell my creations.

DESCRIPTION: Red Squirrels in the Scottish Cairngorms this Spring.

The idea was developed by two London based architects, who have already created a version for their hometown and now hope to play different cities against each other.

DESCRIPTION: Roanoke coffee shop owner Austin Simms was fed up with rude customers so he decided to do something about it.

DESCRIPTION: I was diagnosed with colorectal cancer in 2014, which included chemotherapy, radiation, multiple surgeries and an ostomy bag. This happened while working full time as a therapist and being married with a small child. I'm currently cancer free, but the experience was a complete life-changer.

DESCRIPTION: Before we had Pantone Color Guide, there was no universally recognized system to identify colors. But there were attempts to make it, and probably the most impressive one came from the artist known only as A. Boogert, who back in 1692 created an impressive piece of literature about mixing colors.
TITLE: 271 Years Before Pantone, One Man Painted Every Color Imaginable In An 800-Page Book

DESCRIPTION: Sibling love is a truly special thing. It's a bond that connects for life. But Jacee Dellapena, a 12-year-old from Mississippi, took it to the next level when she helped her mom deliver her brother.

DESCRIPTION:
As you step through the metal doors, going down to George Cosbuc boulevard, you can step back in time and imagine how a whole was running there 100 years ago.
The Bragadiru beer factory exists thanks to Dumitru Marinescu Bragadiru's passion and dedication, built at the end of 19th century, following to conquer an entire continent with his productions. He was a very popular character in his time, a very humble person and someone who valued honesty.
TITLE: Abandoned Bragadiru Beer Factory In Bucharest, Romania

DESCRIPTION: When you think of old photographs, you naturally think in terms of black and white, but as you can see from these stunning photographs from the turn of the 20th century, color photography has been around for a lot longer than you think.

DESCRIPTION: From Los Angeles to Washington DC, people have recently been coming together across the US for Pride Month. But it hasn't just been a celebration for people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender.

DESCRIPTION: Are you a fan of using virtual maps to explore new places? Well, you're in for a treat, because these pictures taken in Ulleung-gun, Gyeongbuk, South Korea, not only give you a street view - you also get a friendly golden doggo to accompany you and be your guide.
TITLE: Dog Follows Street View Photographer, Photobombs Each And Every Photo

DESCRIPTION:
Cassie is a 5-year-old girl who loves to paint. At the age of three we discovered her passion and since then she has not stopped painting.
She has sold over 100 paintings and has chosen to donate some of her earnings to various charities to help people around the world.
TITLE: 5-Year-Old Has Donated Over $750 To Charity By Painting Galaxies

DESCRIPTION: These macrame wall hangings are handmade by me using unbleached cotton rope. Different sizes and shapes, but the same style - bohemian.

DESCRIPTION: My village is in the region of Trás-os-montes in Portugal. In English it means between mountains. It is a fascinating region, very archaic, full of personality.
