DESCRIPTION:
My latest cookies are inspired by the comic world.
This is the piece I have presented at an international sugar artists collaboration called CAKE CON.
To make it I have baked 4 butter cookies and I have decorated this with royal icing and food colorings.
TITLE: My Edible Version Of The Cover Of Marvel Divas

DESCRIPTION:
I've had this old metal suitcase floating around for years so I finally decided to do something with it: Build a rugged portable sound system.
I used a cheap Makita USB Adapter from eBay and a small Bluetooth Amplifier that runs on 12-24v so it was perfect for my 18V Drill Batteries. The rest is a pair of used speakers from a second-hand store.
TITLE: I Made A Cheap Portable Bluetooth Boombox From Used Speakers And An Old Suitcase

DESCRIPTION: Periods are the probably the most annoying part of being a woman. They always start unexpectedly and they mess up your emotions while somehow managing to ruin the one pair of panties you really love.
TITLE: 10+ Painfully Hilarious Posts About Periods That Only Women Will Understand

DESCRIPTION: Inky was born with a rare birth defect, called Eyelid Agenisis. In short, his upper eyelids did not form in the womb. It causes the eyes to dry out and the hair to grow into the eyes.
TITLE: Meet Inky, The Kitten With No Eyelids

DESCRIPTION: We can finally ride our luggage instead of carrying it. Modobag is the first motorized suitcase in the world, and it can reach 8 mph (12.8 kph), which can seem really fast when you're that riding so low to the ground.
TITLE: Luggage That You Can Ride

DESCRIPTION:
Hello! It's Maui again.
These are some of my drawings I did a while ago as an update since I haven't posted in a bit.
I usually take a look at random people pictures on the internet as a reference and draw them but I always do some modification like the hair, eyes, face shapes etc so it wouldn't look like the same person anymore, or sometimes it would be totally different.
TITLE: People Would Have To Be One Of My Favorite Things To Illustrate

DESCRIPTION: You kind of know you'll end up drawing pictures when your grade school notebooks are filled with sketches, doodles and cartoons. Same with middle, high school and college. Fight the will to draw, and you've given in to your mortal enemy, boredom.
TITLE: Repurposing My Illustration Skills To Toys

DESCRIPTION:
Laetitia KY is a fashion designer and, as she states herself, an art addict from Ivory Coast in Africa. Recently, she's been making some waves on Instagram after releasing her new photo series in which she transforms her hair into all kinds of shapes to express her mind.
Laetitia leaves people surprised not only because of her infinite creativity, but also of the fact that our hair can be shaped in such different ways to really speak our minds.
TITLE: This Ivorian Artist Can Sculpt Her Hair Into Anything

DESCRIPTION: For whatever reason, people tend to view [anatomy art] as 'morbid' or 'creepy.' Part of the goal of these pieces is to combat this ignorance and educate individuals as to the beauty that lies beneath
TITLE: Realistic Body Anatomy Art

DESCRIPTION: 98-year-old Russ Gremel has led a simple life, with no one knowing he was a millionaire the entire time. Until recently, that is, when the eldery man donated 2 million dollars to the 395-acre Gremel Wildlife Sanctuary to protect wetlands in Amboy, Illinois - so people could come out and experience and enjoy nature the way he did as a kid. I'm a very simple man, says Gremel. I never let anybody know I had that kind of money.
TITLE: This 98-Year-Old Just Donated $2 Million In Stock To Create A 395-Acre Wildlife Refuge

DESCRIPTION: People say they love dogs all the time, but does it really mean anything if you don't have dog-themed playing cards?
TITLE: These Dog Playing Cards Have The Most Awesome Illustrations Ever

DESCRIPTION: In the 1950s the US government did a lot of experiments with psychotomimetic drugs (in fact, as anybody who's seen or read 'The Men Who Stare At Goats' will know, the US government used to do all sorts of weird and wonderful experiments). One of these experiments included feeding human test subjects measured quantities of LSD and then monitoring their ensuing behavior.
TITLE: 1950s Experiment Asked Artist To Take LSD And Draw The Same Portrait 9 Times, And Each Portrait Got Crazier

DESCRIPTION: Ever wanted to take a walk on the wild side? Well now you can thanks to these funky socks that'll turn your feet into animal paws!
TITLE: Realistic Animal Socks Will Make You Look Like You Have Animal Paws

DESCRIPTION: Night time bike rides can be a thrilling experience instead of a terrifying one if you take appropriate safety measures. French tire manufacturer Michelin has created a lighting device for bicycles that could become a vital piece of gear for any two-wheeled nightcrawler.
TITLE: Michelin Just Made A Bike Lighting System That Protects Cyclists From Traffic Inside Its Ring Of Red Light

DESCRIPTION:
After graduating from art school in 2016 I started documenting the daily struggles of adulting in my early(ish) 20's in little hand drawn comics.
What started out as a joke among friends and was only meant to be a little side project to my work as an illustrator has now become my way of figuring out life and what it means to be a woman in today's society.
Sometimes I am a little worried about oversharing but then again I hope by being (sometimes maybe a little too) honest I can inspire people to open up about their own problems in real life so we can slowly grow into a society where nobody needs to feel alone with their struggles however big or small.
TITLE: 10+ Of My Comics Deal With The Daily Struggles Of Being A Woman In Her Early 20s

DESCRIPTION:
Ana Salvador is a Portuguese artist living in Holland, she creates beautiful dolls in plastic ceramics. Its inspiration comes from the styles of yesteryear like the Art Nouveau, the Victorian Era, also of the films of Tim Burton.
Their dolls are unique and unique, wearing period costumes and with a melancholy and needy look, as if they asked you to take them home.
TITLE: The Adorable Dolls Of Ana Salvador

DESCRIPTION:
I'm a nature lover and traveller. On the way I love painting things that are a bit confusing and unique.
Doodling came to be my thing.
TITLE: I Doodle Everything That Comes To My Mind, Making It More Chaotic

DESCRIPTION:
Hi! My name is Marie Antuanelle, I'm a Sydney-based Russian-born seascape abstract artist. Painting is a therapeutic meditation for me, it keeps me sane and alive. What is it about?
OCEAN - TIME.
TITLE: I Use Mineral Crystals And Seashells To Create Abstract Seascapes

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Jeff Victor and I'm an LA-based artist. I have designed characters for animation at such studios as Nickelodeon, Dreamworks, Warner Brothers, and Cartoon Network.
Currently, I'm working as a children's book illustrator, but when I'm not drawing for work, I'm drawing for fun.
TITLE: I Illustrate Evolutions Of Famous Actors And Characters

DESCRIPTION: Hey, I'm Keith! A lot of the time, people don't see the faces I see in inanimate objects. So, I decided to illustrate them in a cartoonish way and write little stories about them to bring them to life. You can follow me on Instagram where I post more of my art.
TITLE: I Have Pareidolia, And I Create Characters Out Of The Faces I See

DESCRIPTION: You know that feeling when you're watching a horror movie and you want to scream at the protagonists to warn them against approaching danger? Well, you're not alone - this doggie in the video below feels the same way too and barks whenever she senses a threat. Khaleesi the bulldog loves watching horror movies and always tries to protect any potential victims from harm, writes the canine's owner Dawn Curran.
TITLE: Bulldog Watches Horror Movie, And His Reaction Is All Of Us

DESCRIPTION: A family of wild bald eagles in Canada just welcomed a new and unexpected member of their family - an orphaned newborn hawk. The birdie appears to be loving his new life as an eagle baby, as his new parents seem to be regarding it as their own, making sure he always get an equal share of the food as his eagle siblings.
TITLE: Eagles Bring Baby Hawk Into Their Nest Planning To Eat Him, Decide To Adopt The Bird Instead

DESCRIPTION: Around 3 hours of trial-and-error for a loose but recognizable result.
TITLE: Painting Self-Portrait In Front Of The Mirror

DESCRIPTION: Usually, when we think about cats, we think about how easy their lives are - eat, sleep, and play, all day long. But have you ever thought about the actual struggles they face? Especially first world cats.
TITLE: 10+ Hilariously Heartbreaking First World Cat Problems That We Probably Never Realized

DESCRIPTION: The Netherlands-based artist Thomas Anton Geurts has created a tumbling bowl from walnut, cherry, and hard maple. The three materials contrast with each other perfectly, allowing Geurts to create a trippy looking 3D arrangement.
TITLE: Turning Wood Into A Bowl

DESCRIPTION:
When looking at the incredibly detailed sculptures Toshihiko Hosaka, it is hard to believe that they are made of sandy beach grainy, not a kind of clay. But it only uses sand, talent and 20 years of experience.
Hosaka, 43, has been making sand sculptures since I was in school and has been honing his skills for over two decades.
TITLE: the Sand Sculptures By Toshihiko Hosaka

DESCRIPTION:
Bug, will you help daddy make bread?
Real bread?
Yes, bug, good, fluffy bread we can all eat.
One second later, she was in the kitchen. That's how the 26-day father-daughter bread-making adventure began.
TITLE: One Bread, 26 Days: I Made Bread With My Daughter To Teach Her About Life

DESCRIPTION:
A Down syndrome diagnosis for your child can be scary. I hope that when parents facing a new diagnosis (or just people in general!) see these photos of my four-year-old daughter and her BFF just enjoying the carnival - all they see is joy, beauty, and hope.
Willow and Mason both are rocking their extra chromosome and have survived multiple open heart surgeries.
TITLE: A Day At The Carnival

DESCRIPTION: I love using a ball pen and coloured pencils to make portraits of my friends and people I don't know. This one took me 12 days of work, the size is 85x96cm. Hope you enjoy!
TITLE: I Made Another Portrait Of My Friend With A Ball Pen And Coloured Pencils

DESCRIPTION: My name is Daniele Barresi, I am 26 and I am from Bagnara Calabra (RC), Italy. I started carving at the age of 7 and I describe this period like the best in my life. I also became world champion of carving fruit and vegetables twice.
TITLE: This Avocado Took Me Only 1 Hour To Hand-Carve

DESCRIPTION: Trying to determine if a girl is coming onto you is a risky business. The signs can be pretty subtle after all, and misinterpreting them could lead to all sorts of disaster. But even when a woman tries to make her intentions as clear as they possibly can, some guys just don't know how to take a hint, no matter how obvious that hint might be.
TITLE: 10+ Obvious Hints From Girls That Guys Hilariously Failed To Notice

DESCRIPTION: Earlier this week, with the help of our users we released a compilation of weird-acting cats. But there are cat-people and dog-people, right? So, this time I call all the dog owners to post your cute weirdos so we can have another good laugh!
TITLE: Hey Pandas, This Time Share Pictures Of Your Doggos And Puppers Acting Weird

DESCRIPTION: I recently went to Tuscany and had interesting daytime conditions with blue skies and puffy clouds. When I posted some photos on Instagram Stories I noticed how almost everyone was saying the scenes looked like the classic Windows XP wallpaper. I already thought of this myself but it was funny to see how everyone acknowledged my thinking.
TITLE: I Photographed Tuscany And It Looks Like The Classic Windows XP Wallpaper

DESCRIPTION: Actually, my carving story has begun with our wedding invitation cards. My husband and I wanted to make our cards ourselves. So we got the first materials.
TITLE: I Make Handprints And Hand Carvings Inspired By Nature, Culinary, Travel And The Beauties Of Life

DESCRIPTION:
I have created The In-boxed project to show that thinking out of the box is not enough. You need to stop living in it and passing it on to next generations.
We all live in a box.
TITLE: Let Me Tell You A Story Of How We Became A Nation Living In Boxes

DESCRIPTION: My mom always loved pets, she did not care if they were peculiar, street or fancy ones. She just loved them. This was pessed to me and my oldest sister.
TITLE: My Family And I Were Adopting Rescued Pets Since 2009 And This Is What We Got

DESCRIPTION: Nothing kills appetite like finding a stinky colony of bacteria and fungi on your bite. Collectively called saprophytes, these microbes are the primary decomposers of all dead organic matter. They are airborne or may be transferred to food by contact.
TITLE: Food Aging Time-Lapse

DESCRIPTION: London-born actor Tom Hardy just shared the devastating news that his beloved dog Woodstock passed away - and people all over the world are saying they're crying for the canine they 'haven't even met'.
TITLE: Tom Hardy Posts Emotional Tribute For His Dog Who Just Passed Away, And People Are Drowning In Tears

DESCRIPTION: Using Western and traditional Japanese joinery techniques, Dorian Bracht creates some of the most delicate joints without nails or glue - with only wood and his tools.
TITLE: Ingenious Japanese Wood Joinery

DESCRIPTION: Meet Gavel, the German shepherd who was fired from a job as a police dog for... being too friendly for this type of work. Yup, instead of sniffing for explosives and catching thieves for the Queensland Police Service in Brisbane, Eastern Australia, the pooch was more interested in getting a belly rub or two.
TITLE: Police Dog Gets Fired For Being Too Friendly, Later Receives An Even Better Job Offer

DESCRIPTION: No one knows as many secrets as Kagen Sound (formerly Schaefer). Sound is a full-time artist, known for his wooden boxes that are much more than what meets the eye. To open them, one has to solve secret mind-bending puzzles, invisible at first glance.
TITLE: These Boxes Only Open When You Solve A Puzzle

DESCRIPTION: Hey, my name's Emily, and I'm seventeen. I run a rescue for small animals called Happy Hammie Haven. We currently house over sixty small animals - forty-five hamsters, a gerbil, eleven bunnies, two rats, a mouse, five guinea pigs, a chinchilla and a hedgehog.
TITLE: I Run A Small Animal Rescue For Over Sixty Animals

DESCRIPTION:
The village of Geamana once lay deep in a fertile valley, today it lies under 90 meters of industrial waste.
All 2017 photos Copyright Amos Chapple/RFE/RL. Archive images courtesy Cornel Holhorea.
TITLE: This Church Spire Is All That Remains Of A Village, Soon It Will Be Buried Completely

DESCRIPTION: Most of us don't really take the time to pay careful attention to the product instructions we receive when purchasing an item - however, you should. If not for the instructions themselves, at least for the hidden easter eggs.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Funniest Product Instructions And Tags

DESCRIPTION:
2 years ago I started teaching myself special effects makeup, I have been working hard and improving since.
Then along came this competition where I would be able to show case my skills called THE FACE AWARDS by NYX Professional Cosmetics. I knew I had to enter and amazingly was accepted to the top 30! In my last challenge (National Pride) I got through to the top 15 and now I am trying to make it to the top 6!!!
The makeup I made is below.
TITLE: I Turned Myself Into A Candy Dream At 2am In The Morning

DESCRIPTION: I'm sure that shaving competes with periods for the first place on every women's blacklist. It's just one of many chores that you regularly avoid. The hair, however, keeps on growing despite your hatred towards it and at some point its removal becomes inescapable.
TITLE: 10+ Hilariously Painful Comics About Shaving That Only Women Will Truly Understand

DESCRIPTION: I am Anthony Christou an Illustrator and Concept Artist who loves making cool art. I also love coffee, video games, comics and card games. I never plan to grow up.
TITLE: My Dream-Inspired Worlds And Creatures

DESCRIPTION: When you want to send a postcard from a particular place, it's really hard to choose its design. After all, you have to decide what site portrays the essence of that location best. Google goes through the same problem - if a person searches a place, the website has to determine what images appear at the top of the result list. So what 'postcards' do Google assign to the cities around the world?
TITLE: The First Picture That Appears When You Search Your Capital On Google Images

DESCRIPTION: On May 15th, mother of four Chrissy Corbitt gave birth to her daughter Carleigh, who ended up to be quite a big of a bundle of joy. Literally.
TITLE: Mom Gives Birth To A 13.5Lbs (6Kg) Baby, And Her Photos Become Internet Sensation

DESCRIPTION:
Hi Bored Panda, I'm Caitlin Quijano. You may remember me from my previous post where I shared comics that sum up my life as an adult.
It's been awhile, so I thought it was time for an update.
TITLE: I Draw Comics About My Life

DESCRIPTION: Here is a giant Sketch I made for an exhibition in Germany.
TITLE: I Created This Giant Sketch

DESCRIPTION:
I am a 25-year-old self-taught artist and I like to put into my artworks people who inspire me, and who have left a great impact over humanity.
I use graphite and mechanical pencil, with occasional splashes of acrylic. Here are few of them.
TITLE: I Like To Draw And Paint People Who Inspire Me As An Artist

DESCRIPTION: I like knitting with recycled cables. I collect cables of different sizes and colors and use them to make creations like jewelry and wall hangings. Possibilities are endless and al creations are one-of-a-kind!
TITLE: I Make Brooches By Knitting Cables

DESCRIPTION: I was on a camping trip with my family in Custer, South Dakota. The sky was clear and the stars were so bright. You could easily see the Milky Way's bright core with the naked eye.
TITLE: I Shot A Time Lapse Of The Milky Way And Ended Up Capturing A Meteor Exploding In Our Atmosphere

DESCRIPTION: This lamp got a modern makeover with nearly 90 upcycled pill bottles. A friend of mine with a few health conditions unexpectedly left a bag full of empty pill bottles she had been saving for me (over time) on my doorstep and asked me to turn them into something useful. As an upcycler I took on the challenge.
TITLE: I Revived An Old Lamp Using Nearly 90 Empty Pill Bottles

DESCRIPTION:
In this project, I, Ben Heine, create abstract acrylic paintings on large wooden panels in a couple of hours only. The particularity of the project resides in the fact that a living person is integrated into the artwork and is part of the whole composition, becoming almost invisible. 
The end result is often very colorful, wild and eye-catching.
TITLE: 10+ Times People Disappeared In Paintings

DESCRIPTION: The time lapse video has almost become an art form of its own, its great to watch back as a visual document or blue print to my work. Created in oil paint on canvas I work with my fingers. I found myself finger painting after years of wood carving, and as a carver I always brush away the chipping and dust by hand to feel the texture and shape of the sculpture as it comes to life.
TITLE: My Time Lapse Video Of My Finger Painting Of The New Forest In Hampshire In Oil On Canvas

DESCRIPTION: This series of images is about the planets of the Star Wars universe : Korriban, Mandalore, Rakata Prime, Naboo, Dathomir, Kamino, Geonosis, Felucia, Yavin IV, Hypori, Malastare, Dantooine, Serenno, Ryloth, Rugosa, Christophsis, Utapau, Mygeeto, Kashyyyk, Mustafar, Lah'mu, Wobani, Jedha, Eadu, Scarif, Tatooine, Hohth, dagobah, Bespin, Endor, The Death Star, Jakku, Takodama, Starkiller and Ahch-to. They are made with toys photography, taken with a source light on the background, for have a silhouette render.
TITLE: How To Create An Easy Silhouette Render

DESCRIPTION: Dan Rawlings is a self-taught artist based in Gloucestershire, UK, who works with recycled tools, unloved canvases, tired skateboards and anything else he finds and turns them into beautiful tree and plant sculptures that merge with nature. He uses a variety of tools including files, grinders, scalpels and welders, and he believes the process of making something is just as important as the end result.
TITLE: This Artist Is Turning Old Scrap Metal Into Delicate Plants And Trees, And The Result Is Amazing

DESCRIPTION: This 13-year-old just did the bravest thing ever. Or shall I say, two bravest things... Paris Harvey not only hit back at her bullies but she did so by facing her biggest fear - stripping down to her bathing suit in public.
TITLE: Fat-Shamed Teenager Just Did The Bravest Thing To Shut Down Bullies

DESCRIPTION:
Do you know the feeling of excitement when you finally purchase your plane tickets and start counting days left till your next adventure?
When we were buying our plane tickets to Namibia, none of us was sure what to expect. When it comes to Africa, Namibia is not a place of first choice for most of the people. But you know what? It turned out to be one of the most stunning countries we have ever been to! Orange, endless desert horizons, majestic sand dunes, breathtaking canyons, wild animals crossing the road, beautiful people, incredible starry skies and those sunsets! Words cannot describe the beauty of this country, so let the video and photos speak for themselves!
TITLE: We Went To Namibia To Explore Its Most Amazing Places, And This Is What We Found

DESCRIPTION: China is going for another world's first with their new 'ART' train design which mixes bus, tram and train all in one. Except instead of following the usual metal rails, it follows the dotted white lines painted on the road.
TITLE: China Just Unveiled A Driverless Train That Uses White Painted Lines Instead Of Rails

DESCRIPTION: Luna the cat has spent 15 wonderful years with the Olavarria's family, so to celebrate it, her humans decided to throw her a quinceañera. It's a cultural tradition and rite of passage that marks a girl's 15th birthday - this time, with a meowy touch to it.
TITLE: This Family Just Threw A Quinceañera Party For Their 15-Year-Old Cat To Celebrate Her Birthday

DESCRIPTION:
Leading parallel lives, Phil and Iva worked at their corporate jobs in Asia until the fateful day their friends conspired to make them meet.
They fell deep in love and one day started putting all their savings towards a common idea: changing their lifestyle so they could pursue their dream of living on a sailboat. Here is a story of their dream come true.
TITLE: This Couple Will Make You Want To Drop Everything And Follow Your Dreams Right Now

DESCRIPTION:
Some of you may know us from our previous work: dolls and fantasy creatures.
This time we deal with some creatures from the deep ocean: fish and seahorses! Some of them are cute, some of them are creepy and scary.
These figurines/Art-Toys were made by us - Katyushka Art Dolls.
TITLE: We Discovered New Ocean Species

DESCRIPTION:
While recently browsing Instagram, I came upon an image that made me catch my breath. It was of a butterfly that had been transformed into a Steampunk masterpiece!
Artist Emme Rigby creates beautifully dreamy flying insects with enough gears and gizmos to captivate any Steampunk without being heavy handed in the mechanical department.
Sometimes Steampunk art can feel a bit cluttered, like you're in the bowels of a dirigible, but Rigby's work is the opposite, expansive, uncluttered and unfettered by too much.
TITLE: This Digital Artist Creates Ethereal Images Of Steampunk Butterflies And Dragonflies

DESCRIPTION: I start drawing at a very early age, since I was able to hold a pencil. Until then I never stopped. I do 8 years in total of artist schools, practicing ceramic and ceramic decoration, illustration, drawing from a posed subject, trying a lot of styles and techniques from oil to black and white.
TITLE: I Try To Make My Hobby My Work

DESCRIPTION:
One day I decided my Japanese kimono would look better on the cane back chair in our living room than on myself. By taking apart the chair and hundreds of tiny staples later I was able to use the original chair fabric as a backing to the kimono fabric.
This strengthened the kimono fabric and gave the chair the extreme makeover it needed.
TITLE: I Covered Cane Back Chair In My Japanese Kimono

DESCRIPTION:
Musician, artist, teacher and husband, Maxime André Taccardi has dedicated his last years to a whole new level of artist introspection and self-enlightenment, starting as the creator of amazing paints, making them with his own blood, passing through the creation and reflections of our own decadence as humans, he has invented even music that can transport you to realms far beyond and over the understanding of the common human race.
Settled in France, he still working as an art teacher in a school, but for sure, not letting the kids know the magnitude of his job..
TITLE: Artist Paints Nightmares With His Own Blood

DESCRIPTION: June is LGBTQ Pride Month, and there's no better way to celebrate it than sharing these touching same-sex wedding photos.
TITLE: 10+ Emotional Same Sex Wedding Pics That Will Hit You Right In Your Soft Spot

DESCRIPTION: If anyone tells you that posing near a sculpture is boring, it's only because they don't know how to do it properly. The sculptures are alive, and you only need to turn on your imagination to see that.
TITLE: 10+ Times People Took Posing With Sculptures To Another Level

DESCRIPTION: It's a well known and established fact that when cats are not taking a nap, they are plotting to take over the world. Probably the only pastime they love more than doing those two things is soaking up the sun.
TITLE: 10+ Cats Who Love Sun More Than Anything

DESCRIPTION: On working days I am designer in Vilnius Architecture Studio. I create logos, architectural visualisations, presentations and some other awesome stuff for architects and their projects. I'm also a visual artist who just love to take pictures of almost everything around me and manipulate with them in every possible way, creating my own virtual universe.
TITLE: Cosmic Black & White Photo Illustrations Of Architecture

DESCRIPTION:
London artist Joshua Dunlop has created a project called Pokémon Zoology, a series of illustrations realistically depicting Ash's main pokémons (Charmander, Squirtle, Bulbasaur, and Pikachu). The result was none other than spectacular, incredible details of texture and color reminds us of a unique realism of pokémons (who never wanted to have one?)
The project was so well received by netizens that the new proposal is to do the same with all existing pokémons.
TITLE: What If Pokémon Were Real

DESCRIPTION:
Dogs teach you how to love, but they can't teach you how to stop loving.
When my friend's dog died, she had a very hard time letting go. Their last months together were extremely harsh, due to the dog's (Igor, The Dandelion Beast) epilepsy, so she decided to reimagine them.
TITLE: 11 Months Of Happiness: Reimagining The Loss Of A Dogfriend

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Yanina Link and I am a graduated fashion designer. Creating unique and completely handmade dogs (and their friends) has become a wonderful profession for me. 
I only use high-quality materials and fabrics for my creations.
TITLE: I Create Unique And Completely Handmade Dogs

DESCRIPTION:
The third abandoned architecture series by British fine art photographer James Kerwin which looks at a specific subject, religion captured during 2016.
A movement away from attending church has been ongoing for several decades now and the numbers of churches, chapels and other religious buildings that are closing their doors every year is increasing.
In Wales for example, the average Sunday attendance to Church has fallen to below one per cent of the population.
TITLE: Lost Religion: A Photographic Series By James Kerwin

DESCRIPTION:
Snowy the albino skunk is a bit lazy when it comes to waking up in the mornings!
Anything to go back to sleep !
He's just like having a real life teddy bear in the house!
Snowy was hand reared by us from birth as his mum rejected him, he's become the most friendly, cuddly animal you could ever imagine.
He sleeps with the kids, is incredibly clean and litter trained. He does what he wants when he wants, he has the run of the house!
TITLE: Snowy, The Adorable Sleepy Albino Skunk

DESCRIPTION: Depending on your demeanor, the Camino may feel at times, less a pilgrimage, than a very social shared experience. Maybe pilgrimages have always been this way. Chaucer's and Boccaccio's pilgrims were frequently less than pious.
TITLE: The Camino De Santiago -800 Kilometers Of An Ancient Pilgrimage Route

DESCRIPTION: Two boys were walking down the street in Lanus, Argentina, when they saw something horrible - a dog fully covered in tar. It is unsure whether the doggie fell into the tar himself, or whether someone threw him in there and left to die. What was obvious is that the pooch needed help, and he needed it a.s.a.p. to survive.
TITLE: Two Boys Rescue A Dog All Covered In Tar, And Now He Looks As Good As New

DESCRIPTION:
We are passionate about painting our visions for a world full of life, hope and love.
We created an art institute to help other artists make a living from their art and fulfill their destiny. We help artists cultivate their voice, and give them a platform to be heard.
TITLE: We Are A Family Of Artists

DESCRIPTION: Some Twitter accounts rate dogs, others rewrite Trump's tweets like grown-ups but it would be hard to define Derek's presence there. He calls himself a contributor to global warming but a more accurate title would be the king of comedy.
TITLE: 10+ Funny Tweets By Derek

DESCRIPTION: When our daughter Emilia was born, we staged this photoshoot that made it look like our little baby could fly. The pictures went viral. That was 2 years ago.
TITLE: We Let Our Children Do Dangerous Things Instead Of Stopping Them (No Photoshop)

DESCRIPTION: Is that a photograph of a car/motorcycle, or is it a PAINTING? That is the question that fine vehicle artist, Shannon Shan Fannin, loves hearing from the viewers of her paintings. It takes some visual investigation to know for sure. At first, her paintings seem photo-realistic.
TITLE: Artist Mixes Realism With Abstraction In Vehicle Paintings

DESCRIPTION: This hydroelectric power station is one of the most important industrial archeology monuments in the district. Built in 1911 in a unique V-shape. At the end of the 1930s the power planthad an average annual output of 191 million kWh.
TITLE: I Photographed This Beautiful Abandoned Powerplant

DESCRIPTION: I wanted to show you what my job looks like. Lady Cat - step by step.
TITLE: This Is How I Create My Works, Step By Step

DESCRIPTION: I am a D.C.-based Lebanese-American photographer who loves travel photography and recently started a project called An Open View inspired by my love to capture different cities and cultures through open doors and windows.
TITLE: I Capture The World Through Doors And Windows

DESCRIPTION: As a photographer I have always dreamt about the opportunity to take photographs of moms and their kids. I didn't even expect that my dream will ever come true in such a beautiful way. Finally, when Mother's day was coming, there came the possibility to capture moms with their unique kids - children with special needs.
TITLE: I Took Photos Of Moms And Their Children With Special Needs To Show Their Love To Each Other

DESCRIPTION: Rebis Alobar never intended to be an artist. He had planned on becoming a fighter pilot and attending the United States Air Force Academy after he graduated high school. Sadly, however, the summer between Rebis' junior and senior year he was diagnosed with narcolepsy, a sleeping disorder most famous for its ability to cause seemingly random bouts of deep sleep during normal waking periods.
TITLE: Narcoleptic Artist Paints Eerie Visions From Sleep Paralysis

DESCRIPTION:
You know those little moments in life when things do not go the way you wanted? Or when something unexpected and weird happens? Or when sadness creeps onto you without giving any notice? Well, these are all the topics Viakavish explores in his comics.
Viakavish started creating half a year ago without even planning on doing it for a long time, but comics gained some attention, people were relating to them and slowly the audience grew.
Some of these comics are sad, some - unexpected and some will surely make you smile.
TITLE: 10+ Comics About The Sad Realities Of Life By Viakavish

DESCRIPTION:
Her name is Melanie Gaydos, she's a brave woman who faced the fashion industry and won.
This American is just 28 years old. She has a genetic disorder called ectodermal dysplasia, from which she suffers from the day she was born.
TITLE: Meet Melanie Gaydos, 28-Year-Old Model With A Rare Genetic Disorder Who Broke All Fashion Stereotypes

DESCRIPTION: Some people argue dogs are the best thing that happened to humanity. They're loyal, cheerful, friendly, smart... It's no surprise we get carried when they're around. We plan our lives around doggies, we spoil them more than we do our children, and tell them 'I love you' a 100 times a day. Yup, the shocking truth is that dog owners are pretty much owned by dogs.
TITLE: 10+ Funny Dog Tweets That Are Too Relatable

DESCRIPTION:
My unique paper curling technique to create tapestries has evolved in the last few years to sculptural 3D tapestries! I am an industrial designer turned into
I am an industrial designer turned into a paper artist - and have used the principles of 3D printing to construct these works - layer upon layer of fragile paper strips have come together to form these pieces that give viewers pause and a space to contemplate or rest. They will be on show at Koskela in Sydney, Australia from 24th June to 23rd July 2017.
TITLE: I Create 3D Paper Tapestries Made With Curled Paper Strips

DESCRIPTION:
With her platinum blonde hair and signature red lipstick, Marilyn Monroe (who would have celebrated her 91st birthday on the 1st of June) is easily one of the most iconic celebrities of all time, however, only a few know what the actress looked like before she was famous.
Born Norma Jeane Mortenson, Monroe had a really tough childhood. She moved from one foster home to another, going through traumatic experiences in almost all of them.
TITLE: 46 Rare Marilyn Monroe Photos Reveal Her Life Before She Was Famous

DESCRIPTION: This is an ongoing series of reportage drawings of my experiences of places in London. Having recently moved to the city, I am drawn to the everyday life of Londoners and the changing atmosphere of its districts.

DESCRIPTION: Rinjani volcano area at Lombok Island, Indonesia is the real photographic paradise! Three days trekking was hard but unforgettable not because of difficulties but the incredible views. First rays of the sun showed me beutiful landscape and misterious trees in the mist. Sunsets above the clouds were just amazing, full of colours with magnetic views.
TITLE: I Captured The Most Beautiful Views During Volcano Rinjani Trekking

DESCRIPTION:
Black cats have a bit of a rough ride. They are the least likely to get rehomed from shelters than any other colour cat, and have been seen as an omen of bad luck by superstitious people for centuries.
As an artist with a love of colour, black cats are maybe not the most obvious choice of subject matter for me, but I have found a way to bring out the rainbow in them.
TITLE: I Take Black Cats And Make Them Magical

DESCRIPTION:
Child Photo Competition is an international photo community devoted to discovering and promoting the most talented child photographers from all over the world.
Every month, they run free of charge monthly themed contest in order to give a chance to emerging photographers to show us the magic of child photography.
In May 2017, photographers from more than 40 countried portrayed the theme of Innocence.

DESCRIPTION:
Hellenikon International Airport served Athens from 1938 till 2001. It is located in the south part of Attica, in the municipality of Hellenikon (Elliniko).
After its closure (2001) some of its parts were used for the 2004 Summer Olympics (canoe/kayak slalom, field hockey, baseball, and softball) but the main buildings were left and still are unused.

DESCRIPTION:
For many years, I've been staring hard at little pieces of shit in the forest, learning not to casually dismiss any piles of excrement as they could actually turn out to be devious little dung spiders, sometimes also known as bird dropping spiders.
Living its life as a pile of poop may sound shitty, but the facade is actually an ingenious predatory and defensive tactic.
** Predatory tactic
Excrement from birds, lizards and other vertebrates are an excellent source of food and nutrients for some insects, especially flies and some bugs.
TITLE: I Spent 7 Years Photographing These Pretty Disgusting Animals

DESCRIPTION: Meet Rakan Abdulaziz Kurdi, a Saudi Arabian guy with handicap since he was born. But his handicap didn't stop him from achieving his dreams. Rakan successfully completed his studies and now he's a professional painter and graphic designer.

DESCRIPTION: I started building paper sculptures and eventually masks as a distraction from my graduate work. When a little side business developed, I decided to start showing examples of what you could do online. It turned into the adventures of a prehistoric tyrannosaurus in a human's world.

DESCRIPTION:
Microcromo is a multifunctional transforming furniture designed to be at the same time an artistic painting, a smart ambient light and a comfortable table. Designed for sophistication but built for functionality, our product use microscope photography, chromotherapy and transformation to turn any space into a better place to live.
Microscopes can bring a smaller, practically invisible universe within reach.

DESCRIPTION:

With the project Art would liberate the artist Lukas Ricardo wants to show that children enter the world of crime by influence of daily life!

DESCRIPTION:

This particular creation is something I have wanted to make for years, but just couldn't work up the courage because of the complexity and my hectic kitchen work schedule!
Finally, one day when my son was with his father and I had time off in between career moves, I sat down with my two cats (Lady Popfizz Fuzzybutt and Miss Molly), set up my boards and picked up my tweezers, and then I placed the first few beads, then a few more.

DESCRIPTION: Those who said you need canvas and vivid colors to make a masterpiece were wrong. This 24-year-old artist from Sterlitamak, Russia creates incredible portraits on the pavement in front of his house. He only uses chalk to create such detailed portraits that will leave you speechless.
TITLE: Awesome Crayons From Rustam Valeev

DESCRIPTION: Someone just posted an instructional series of photos of what happens to an egg in a frying pan left in a parked car on a hot day for 15 minutes - all in the hope of raising awareness about NOT leaving dogs in a car.
TITLE: Guy Leaves Egg In Car During Hot Day To Show Why You Should Never Leave Your Dog There

DESCRIPTION: Taylen Biggs is her name but the tiny model is better known as @taylensmom and she just turned FOUR! In a short time Taylen has become one of the most requested models to headline major campaigns, features on social media and it's one of the TOP influencers in kids fashion today as featured on Parents magazine, Cosmopolitan and People en Español ...
TITLE: Running The Fashion World At Three Years Old!

DESCRIPTION: Photographer Conceptual Erik Johansson created this beautiful and surreal image titled Full Moon Service which shows a couple of workers swapping on a full moon to maintain the lunar phases. Johansson also cast a fascinating behind-the-scenes look at how the project was done, from conception to completion.
TITLE: Creating A Conceptual Photo Of The Full Moon

DESCRIPTION: Three days ago I was on a business trip in Split. I was amazed by the beauty of this city and I had to share it through my photos.
TITLE: Split In Croatia Through My Lens

DESCRIPTION:
Apart from writing, painting, designing clothing and more I do a lot of photography.
But, because of my several disorders, for example, social anxiety, I don't meet people very much. So, instead, I shoot toys and stuff.
TITLE: How I Cope With Severe Diagnoses Like Schizophrenia

DESCRIPTION: I photograph cats wherever I go. This is a selection of numerous shoots I did.
TITLE: I Photograph Cats Captivated By Their Beauty And Uniqueness

DESCRIPTION: I have always loved to draw and paint faces, ever since I was a little girl, and I still do. Recently, I decided to start a pet portrait business, which is a lot of fun. But when I got the opportunity to do a portrait of Holly and her person, animal healer, Rachel Augusta, it made me really happy.
TITLE: I Love To Immortalize The Love Between A Pet And Their Person

DESCRIPTION: I started creating beach mosaic art as a way to practice my art outside of my studio. The idea was to use only what I could find around me in a small area of the beach. A way to practice creativity and letting go by creating something temporary.
TITLE: I Create Beach Mosaic Art With A Message

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Henry, the little hound made from donated horseshoes. Named after Henry Bear, Michelle and Andys beloved Westie, who's death at 15 led the couple to discover Chimney Farm International Dog Rescue and adopt their first Romanian Stray, Minnie Minx.
We saw what was happening to the dogs in Romania and just couldn't turn a blind eye.
TITLE: Introducing Henry, The Horseshoe Hound Raising Funds For Dog Rescue

DESCRIPTION: The piece took three days to complete.
TITLE: I Created This Piece Using Silk Paints And Cold Wax On Habotai Silk

DESCRIPTION:
For this collection I wanted to do something very simple only using silhouettes drawn from ink, paint and oil. I only added shadows where it was necessary.
My main intention was also creating some elegant prints for my walls.
TITLE: My Double Exposure Abstract Silhouettes

DESCRIPTION: Somebody from Japan has just come up with pigeon shoes, and everyone started asking why?
TITLE: People Are Freaking Out About This Japanese Woman Walking In Pigeon Shoes

DESCRIPTION:
I had created the dress for a previous shoot in 2014 but sustainability in fashion runs deep in my philosophy and so it was the perfect canvas for my next project.
Usually, only natural fibers (silk, cotton, linen etc) can be dyed so the mixed fibers of this dress (silk dupion and polyester tulle) presented something of a challenge. In the end, I used a spray called 'Oasis' which is designed for use by florists on flowers! But I tested it first on some pieces of the same fabrics and the effect was perfect.
TITLE: We Spent 61 Hours To Create This Incredible Dipdye Wedding Dress

DESCRIPTION: Meet Jack - the 10-year-old from the U.K. who has some mad makeup skills. Smokey eyes, contouring, perfect lashes - you name it, the boy can do it all!
TITLE: 10-Year-Old Becomes Internet Sensation For His Awesome Make-Up Skills

DESCRIPTION: This series of photos shows salt crystallisation ponds found in Western Australia. I asked the pilot to remove the doors from the tiny airplane, and within 10 minutes of flying over and around this amazing landscape, I was trying my hardest to hold it all together - the noise, the shaking, the wind, and looking through my telephoto lens. And somehow I managed a bunch of beautiful, calm images.
TITLE: I Nearly Vomited Taking These Aerial Photos Of Salt Ponds

DESCRIPTION:
Let me tell you a story. Story about little bear and people with big hearts.
Once upon a time in a land far far away in Eastern Europe Bieszczady mountains lived a bear mother with her little baby bear.
TITLE: Story About Little Bear And People With Big Hearts

DESCRIPTION: I travel a lot. And one of my travel projects is shooting street art. Thanks to street art, you can understand a lot about the country, about culture, about the place.
TITLE: I Photographed The Graffiti Of Latin America

DESCRIPTION: Drop whatever you're doing this moment and hand in resignation letter to your boss - one vet clinic in Ireland just announced they are hiring a full-time cat-cuddler. This may be the chance you've been waiting for all your life!
TITLE: Looking For A Job? This Company Will Pay You For Cuddling With Kittens All Day Long

DESCRIPTION: Thankfully, these days the oral medicine is advanced enough to offer a solution not only to the physical problems the crooked teeth present, but also by bringing back the confidence to smile as you please.
TITLE: 10+ Incredible Before & After Transformations Of People Who Wore Braces

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Audre Schutte (also known as 'Charamath') and I absolutely love drawing monsters. I usually just publish more widely popular cute watercolor illustrations, but it's weird little creatures that fill my sketchbooks and dance in my dreams at night.
I'd like to give my monsters a chance to escape my sketchbook, so I'm sharing them to the world.
TITLE: I Draw Creatures And Monsters Every Day

DESCRIPTION:
I am a makeup artist and tail maker living in Calgary AB. About 3 years ago I started to build mermaid tails, I have always loved the water and with a background in special FX makeup and science it just made sense to try to build one.
The first mermaid tail took around 6 months to build, hand sculpting over 1500 individual scales and designing a unique fluke.
TITLE: I Spend Hundreds Of Hours Making Mermaid Dreams Come True!

DESCRIPTION: Our goal was to deliver a remote control car and a remote control Baby Groot and share the red carpet premiere of the Guardians of the Galaxy Vol.2 in Los Angeles from Baby Groot's point of view.
TITLE: Baby Groot In Los Angeles

DESCRIPTION: Yehuda Adi Devir is a Tel-Aviv-based illustrator, comic artist and character designer who creates adorable comics about his daily domestic adventures with his wife, Maya.
TITLE: Artist Illustrates Everyday Life With His Wife In 10+ Comics

DESCRIPTION: Being The Pope isn't easy. Just ask Pope Francis. Or better still, just look at this picture of him posing with Donald Trump. He's trying to smile. He really is. But some challenges are just too great, even for a man with God on his side.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Funniest Reactions To Super Sad Pope Meeting The Trumps

DESCRIPTION: In October of 2015, I contracted Spinal Viral Meningitis. I caught this disease after photographing in a Louisiana swamp. I was not wearing any type of mosquito spray so there were around 200 bites over my body.
TITLE: I Contracted Spinal Viral Meningitis After A Photoshoot In A Swamp, And This Art Series Capture My Battle Against It (NSFW)

DESCRIPTION: You might have heard about Reza Farazmand before as he's the guy behind one of the largest webcomics on Facebook called Poorly Drawn Lines. But these visually simple and hilarious cartoons are not the only project run by this San Francisco-based cartoonist. Trash Bird is another brilliant character that Farazmand has brought to life.
TITLE: 10+ Trash Bird Comics By Reza Farazmand

DESCRIPTION: After seeing cool robots that can draw like e-David I wanted to try it out myself. Since I can not afford an industrial robot I bought a simple plotter that can hold a pen and started programming. Because the plotter can hold only a pen it can only draw lines with a constant width, so there is not a lot of variety.
TITLE: I Programmed A Robot To Draw Single Line Drawings With A Pen

DESCRIPTION:
From the beginning, Toronto-based artist working out of The Village Ink, Molly Jean has been creating gorgeous and weird headless girl tattoos. She even has a club that is called #headlessgirlclub.
These headless girls utilize her skill at dot work, linework, and watercolor styles.
TITLE: 10+ Strangely Beautiful Tattoos Of Headless Girls By Molly Jean

DESCRIPTION: Once upon a time, I was walking through the heart of my hometown and then I saw a small shop, what was full of used old vinyl disks. I was thinking where they will end. So I decided to buy few of them.
TITLE: I Made Art From Old Vinyls

DESCRIPTION: One 21-year-old guy took his cat, Charlie, a 1.5-year-old Russian Blue mix, to a professional photo shoot with the idea to print one of the pictures on a canvas for his mom as a Mother's Day gift.
TITLE: Guy Gets Professional Pictures With His Cat, And They End Up Looking Like Engagement Photos

DESCRIPTION: Remember the stories about homing pigeons carrying urgent messages before technology kicked in? Well, apparently today those messages have been replaced by drugs... and lots of them.
TITLE: Pigeon Gets Caught Trying To Smuggle Almost 200 Ecstasy Pills Across The Border

DESCRIPTION: Meet Kheris Rogers - the 10-year-old who started a clothing line after being bullied for her dark skin.

DESCRIPTION: I created this piece to depict the powerful colours and design in nature.

DESCRIPTION:
London based photographer Luke Agbaimoni is currently producing a London photography project called tube mapper, which can be found at tubemapper.com.
The aim of the project is to share the photos he's captured near and around London Underground stations.
TITLE: London Photographer Captures Awesome Shots Of People Waiting For Trains

DESCRIPTION: So this is Etching Piece (one Of many) that my dad made, I just want the world to see how gifted he is!
TITLE: My Dads Creates Incredibly Detailed Drawings

DESCRIPTION: I was commisioned to carve two ten foot long cedar trees that would be used as support for the entrance to a cabin being built in North Bend British Columbia. I was asked to simply carve what felt natural to be standing outside the cabin while theoretically keeping watch like two guards. These are the two original works I came up with and I love the way they turned out.
TITLE: Two 10 Foot Tall Carved Cedar Posts Complete With Attitude

DESCRIPTION: My name is Savannah Kate Morgan of Savannah Kate Photography. I am a fairytale photographer located in Monroe, Louisiana. I have always used photography as a way to document how I see the world.
TITLE: I Take Magical Mermaid Images Inspired By Fairytales

DESCRIPTION:
I entered the world of international logos and brands, to get some photos from their personal lives, see them behind the camera, and have an idea of their attitude between each other.
I made these illustrations using Adobe Photoshop, without adding any modification on the logos, because I wanted to present them as they are in reality.
TITLE: Personal Life Of Logos

DESCRIPTION: Date rape is a very serious modern age issue, and three high school students hope to prevent it with a (seemingly) simple solution - a straw!
TITLE: High School Girls Invent An Ingenious Straw That Detects Date Rape Drugs

DESCRIPTION: Have you ever wondered what the animals in your cartoons would look like if they were people? Illustrator Astkhik Rakimova, gave them Brightside human form, and we liked them so much that we wanted to share them with you.
TITLE: See What The Cartoon Animals Look Like If They Were Human

DESCRIPTION:
It's not a secret that social media creates unrealistic standards and expectations for everyone, new mothers included. One day Kathy DiVincenzo, a young mom of two, grew tired of seeing picture perfect moms on Facebook and, together with her friend and photographer Danielle Fantis, decided to show another, not as beautiful, but extremely possible side of motherhood.
Kathy suffers from postpartum depression, anxiety, and obsessive-compulsive disorder.
TITLE: Mom Reveals What Postpartum Depression Really Looks Like

DESCRIPTION: Kids can be awesome. But as you can see from this list of tweets, kids can also be savage...
TITLE: 10+ Funny Tweets That Prove Kids Are Absolutely Savage

DESCRIPTION: I mean, the 72 animals didn't all happen at once. We actually just had one chocolate labrador the first time that we made our way up the single track roads that were to become our home. This was a couple of years ago, now - and along the way, our family grew.
TITLE: My Family Bought 72 Animals And Moved Up A Mountain

DESCRIPTION:
I started my comic blog Tall N Curly back in 2012 to tell my story. By doing so, I realized I was telling the story of so many other women.
Women who, just like me, want and need to be reminded that it's OK, fun and special to be different and own who they are.
TITLE: 10+ Problems I Face When Being A Tall And Curly-Haired Girl

DESCRIPTION: Never underestimate how clever dogs can be. Especially when their owner sets rules for them...
TITLE: 10+ Times Dogs Tried To Bend Human Rules, And It Was Hilariously Adorable

DESCRIPTION: Well if you are about to buy a new printer, then make sure it is expendable or else you might run it a bad deal. We use 3D printers for definitive different purposely such as creating household goods, DIY Inventions, and Presentation models. So we have to make sure it has the following features and counts for the money you pay.
TITLE: Things To Consider Before Buying A New 3d Printer

DESCRIPTION: I recycle old computers and other electronic devices and make unique jewelry. Each piece is one of a kind and totally handmade. They can make the perfect gift for a geeky friend, a tech lover, a developer and anyone who admires handmade goodies.
TITLE: I Turn Old Electronic Devices Into Geeky Jewelry

DESCRIPTION: Artists are collectors. When my pressed flower collection grew really big, I felt I had to do something creative with it. Arranging and sticking them on a piece of paper was not enough.
TITLE: I Use Dried Pressed Plants And Paint To Create Original Artworks

DESCRIPTION: Meet Sophie, the rescue kitten who gets to sleep in her own miniature version of a human bed with rotating sets of sheets, comforters, and even a mini crocodile plushie. Life hasn't always been so sweet and comfy for this fur ball. When she was around 3 years old, the kitty was rescued from a hoarding situation. Her previous owner would keep her and a ton of other animals in small cages, one cat on top of the other... So, it's no surprise that when she got adopted by Christiana Viscusi and her partner, all this sweet and loving cat wanted to do was to be with her human parents all the time - especially at night.
TITLE: Cat Rescued From Terrible Conditions Now Sleeps In Her Tiny Doll Bed Each And Every Night

DESCRIPTION: Ladies, we've all been there. One way or another, we wind up texting some guy who turns out to be super creepy, and he eventually asks for nudes. A girl who recently found herself in this situation, however, came up with a response so blindingly brilliant that it should be inscribed in history books.
TITLE: Girl Gets Asked For Nudes, Comes Up With Absolutely Brilliant Response

DESCRIPTION:
Our family of 13 LOVES to take road trips! This past summer, we ventured north to Montana for some camping, fishing, and time in the great outdoors.
One of our side trips found us in the ghost town of Bannack. Full of spooky old buildings, it was the perfect place for an impromptu photo shoot with my 7 year old daughter, Octavia.
TITLE: I Photographed My 7-Year-Old Daughter In A Haunted Ghost Town

DESCRIPTION: Inspired by Asta Skuyjte, my husband and I decided to find most of GoT shooting spots we can find in Dubrovnik and recreate the Magical moments. And yes we did. I'm overwhelmed by the scenic views and of course superbly satisfied with shots taken by my patient husband.
TITLE: My Husband And I Decided To Recreate Moments Of Game Of Thrones Shot In Dubrovnik

DESCRIPTION:
May 23rd is the World Turtle Day, shellebrated since year 2000, and its goal is to bring attention to, and increase knowledge of and respect for, turtles and tortoises, and encourage human action to help them survive and thrive.
Nowadays, there are more than 300 different species of turtles and tortoises in the world, and more than half of those are in endangered, threatened or vulnerable status. Here you have a list with some of these turtles and tortoises that we need to care so they won't disappear, all of them beautiful in their own way.
TITLE: 10+ Endangered Turtle Species That You May Not Know Exist

DESCRIPTION:
The brilliant Twitter channel Medieval Reactions is back! And since our last coverage, they've been busy with their mission of turning unrelatable classical art into hilarious internet memes that also offer a much more 21st-century style interpretation of it.
So far this trendy Twitter account has captured the attention of nearly half a million tweeters, and it's for all the right reasons. From the funniest puns about your love life to wild weekends explained in one sentence, these will transform your visits to the classical art galleries.
TITLE: 10+ Art History Tweets That Prove Nothing Has Changed In 100s Of Years (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: You'd imagine that a student with a grade point average of 4.4 and multiple scholarships would have to do something pretty extreme to get suspended from school for two weeks AND banned from their graduation, right? Wrong. Because this student from Hickory Ridge High School in Harrisburg, North Carolina just got suspended, and almost ARRESTED, for nothing more than wearing a shirt.
TITLE: Honor Student Gets Suspended, Banned From Graduation And Almost Arrested For Wearing This Shirt

DESCRIPTION: Hidden in the woods there is a wonderfull collections of Volkswagens rotting away. So sad to see them end like this and nature slowly taking over.
TITLE: I Photographed Old Cars Lost In The Woods

DESCRIPTION: In the long run, some things turn out to be incredibly significant to our lives, even though we couldn't have known about it at first. For example, when I was a little kid and still couldn't swim, my father had to cut the grass around the pond in our back yard. He was planning to do it early Saturday morning, but his friend dropped by for an unexpected visit and the two went fishing, so my pops postponed cutting the grass to Sunday.
TITLE: What Thing Seemed Unimportant At First But Changed Your Life Forever?

DESCRIPTION: As an artist I spend a great deal of time contemplating the nature of color. What makes you walk past one flower but stop and stare at another? Why do you choose to wear the color clothes you do? To me, the funny thing about color is that despite all my thinking about it, its power over us really defies contemplation. We're not moved because of how we study it; it just hits us.
TITLE: Colorful Birds Of The World

DESCRIPTION: After an explosion occurred at Manchester Arena last night, scores of panicked teenagers scattered into the streets. One woman felt the blast from nearby Victoria Station, and stepped in immediately to help. Her actions are now being showered with praise by social media users, who have dubbed her the 'Angel of Manchester.'
TITLE: Hero Woman Rescues 50 Children After Horrifying Manchester Arena Explosion

DESCRIPTION: Beautiful Life In Nara, Japan
TITLE: Beautiful Life In Nara, Japan

DESCRIPTION: I started doodling and sharing my drawings on Instagram some years ago as a quick way of doing something creative and stress releasing. I drew on napkins, tray mats, cup holders, and/or anything I could find. At first, I simply wanted to let out my anger, frustrations and worries; but, with time, I learned how to create something funny out of things pulling me down.
TITLE: How A Doodle A Day Has Kept My Psychologist Away

DESCRIPTION:
Dogs are like humans, each one has its own unique personality. In many ways, they're just like us, and it's this uniqueness that I capture with my illustrations.
When it comes to fashion you are what you wear, and it's this idea that brings my illustrations to life.
TITLE: What If Dogs Dressed According To Their Personality

DESCRIPTION:
Vicki-Lea Boulter is a Photographer by trade but has always enjoyed art.
So she likes to combine the two and use Photoshop as a creative medium, to transform the portraits she has taken of women in to Fantasy Style Images, which capture people's personalities and tell a story.
TITLE: Photographer And Digital Artist Uses Photoshop To Create Fantasy Portraits Of Women She Meets, Capturing Their Personalities

DESCRIPTION: We are Marco and Weronika and in 2012 we decided to quit our office jobs. We moved to a countryside and decided we will going to change our lives and we won't go back to a regular job. We decided to work with our hands and so we founded Bianca and sons.
TITLE: We Turn Unique Pieces Of Wood Into Everyday Items

DESCRIPTION: There are places in the world that almost every landscape photographer wants to capture in pictures. One of them is South Moravian Region - a photographic paradise. In Spring and Autumn Moravian fields are filled with dozens of photographers from all over the world.
TITLE: I Captured The Most Beautiful Places In South Moravian Region In Czech Republic

DESCRIPTION: As a child, I often saw unhappy people around me. I sensed it very sensibly and I remember how I said: God, when I'm big, I want to be happy. In puberty, kids laughed me as I dressed.
TITLE: I Make Jewelry That Gives You Freedom

DESCRIPTION: My name is Dave Hänggi and I am a designer and illustrator from Berlin, Germany. Born and raised in Switzerland, I started working as a designer in 2005 at a branding agency in Zurich, where I spent the following six years. After a year in advertising and some freelance work, I moved to Berlin in 2013, where I joined branding agency Realgestalt.
TITLE: I Make Digital Surreal Collages

DESCRIPTION:
When I travel I come up with photo projects in one style.
I hitchhiked around Central and South America for 20 months.
TITLE: I Travel Around The World To Capture Its Beauty

DESCRIPTION: Law enforcement and sense of humor are five words that you don't often see together, but as you can see from this collection of Facebook posts, Australia's New South Wales police force is so funny that they should be locked up for making us laugh so hard.
TITLE: NSW Police Is Winning The Internet With Their Awesome Humor

DESCRIPTION: Ever thought about eating something from the work fridge that didn't belong to you? Perhaps you've considered stealing somebody else's parking space, or maybe you've been tempted to beat the traffic by driving down the outside lane and cutting everybody else up? Well before you go ahead and do whatever nefarious thing you've been contemplating, just remember that karma is watching you, and it won't let you get away with it!
TITLE: 10+ Times Karma Taught Assholes A Valuable Lesson

DESCRIPTION: My husband and I have started an unconventional Christmas tree tradition. With half this year gone we're already trying to plan for this year's! This past year we based our tree on a popular paper bag craft I saw on Pinterest where you twist and cut the ends to create branches. Instead of a miniature paper bag tree I suggested we built a giant paper bag out of Kraft paper and create a life size version.
TITLE: We Made A Christmas Tree Out Of A 15 Foot Paper Bag

DESCRIPTION: When it comes to yearbooks and writing that little quote next to your photo, it can be tough. It's just not always that easy to think of a quote for all your classmates to remember you with when you can't even use the same amount of symbols that are in a tweet. Which is why sometimes the result can, later on, be embarrassing, hilarious, or simply lame.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Yearbook Quotes That Are Impossible Not To Laugh At

DESCRIPTION: The hilarious webcomics mostly revolve around one nerdy girl who always picks the worst words for conversations. Her everyday struggles include her love life, her career, and other common themes.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Comics For Socially Awkward People

DESCRIPTION: Sometimes the most obvious things are completely invisible. Inspired by Sesame Street's iconic sketch One Of These Things, *Bored Panda* has compiled a hilarious list that will not only brighten up your day, but - like the original - check your attentiveness as well.
TITLE: One Of These Things Is Not Like The Other (10+ pics)

DESCRIPTION: Ever heard of the phrase, 'never let your dreams be dreams unless you're sleeping'? Well, me neither. But I somehow managed to sleep with more celebrities than anyone else on this planet. A dream come true? See for yourself below.
TITLE: This Average Guy Has Slept With More Celebrities Than Taylor Swift

DESCRIPTION: In case you haven't been reading the news this week, Donald Trump is currently on his first world tour as US President, which he kicked off in Saudi Arabia over the weekend. A strange moment involving a mysterious glowing orb, however, has given birth to the latest knee-slapping Trump meme, and it's kind of stealing all the spotlight.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Funniest Reactions To Trump Touching The Orb During His Visit To Saudi Arabia

DESCRIPTION: These 6 comics capture the most beautiful aspects of my relationship.
TITLE: I Captured The Most Beautiful Moments Of My Relationship In 6 Comics

DESCRIPTION: A little girl was walking down the Indian Shores Beach near Tampa, Florida, when she saw something she thought was a Cheeto. When she picked it up, the girl realized it was a seahorse in desperate need of help. The child put the tiny fellow into her sand bucket, filled it with water and rushed to show the seahorse to her mom.
TITLE: Girl Rescues Orange Seahorse Mistaken For A Cheeto, The Creature Turns Yellow Once She Feels Better

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Alexandra and am a french digital artist who created her own little Cabinet of Curiosities or 'Wonder Room'.
In 2014 I visited a real 'Wunderkammern' in Scotland, and it left me with a really eerie, mystical and dreamy feeling. So when I came back home I decided to create my own Cabinet of Curiosities, using mixed media technique (a digital art technique combining photos and digital painting).
TITLE: I Create My Own Stunning Cabinet Of Curiosities

DESCRIPTION: I serviced 12 years of a rare blood disorder called Aplastic Aneamia. I was diagnosed with this at the age of 10, back in 2004. It was a struggle to do school as I was always tiered and fatigued also I was lacking concentration.
TITLE: I Serviced 12 Years Of A Rare Blood Disorder

DESCRIPTION:
Japan is beautiful all year round, but Spring is one of my favorites, so I decided to share these pics!
They are taken in many places around Tokyo, but mainly in Nishi Nippori (Yanaka Cementery and Yanaka Ginza), Komagome station surroundings and Chidorigafuchi.
I took in Tokyo this Spring for the first time and I will do it again next Spring. How about coming to Japan next Spring? If you are doubting about when to come, Spring is my suggestion! It's crowded depending on the place, but it's totally worth it!
TITLE: 10+ Beautiful Cherry Blossoms In Tokyo

DESCRIPTION: After i saw a similar experiment here, i decided to make it, in my small town, Targovishte in Bulgaria...
TITLE: My Amazing, Small Town, Nowadays And More Than 50 Years Ago

DESCRIPTION:
I started photographing my kids in late 2015. We have a 10-acre farm with lots of farm animals, so they make their appearance often in the photos with the kids.
Sometimes other critters make their way into the photos too, not just farm animals.
TITLE: I Photograph My Kids Growing Up On A Farm

DESCRIPTION:
Artist Andres Lozano illustrates some of the cutest names for the @ sign from around the world.
From Monkey's Tail to Strudel, you can see all of the images here.
TITLE: Cute Names For The @ Sign From Around The World By Andres Lozano

DESCRIPTION: I started making these pincushions because, quite truthfully, I found the traditional tomato pincushion to be boring. To feel inspired, I feel that one needs to see something a bit better than just a red tomato on their table. So I made my favorite animal, something that I love looking at on a daily basis: a cat.
TITLE: I Combined My Love Of Sewing And Cats To Create Functional Pincushions With Personality And Humor

DESCRIPTION:
Hey everyone!
I'm a 30-year-old illustrator based in Hamburg (Germany). I began creating comics on Instagram to share my life as a crazy cat lady and the awkward and funny moments of my two white cats.
Feel free to check out some of my artwork!
TITLE: My Diary Comics About My Life With Two Cheeky Cats (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: Cyprus based artist, Elena Anastasiou Neocleous, shows us her latest paintings which promise a glimpse into her soul. Her dense and intricate brushstrokes convey complexity and depth in each master piece. The jest of colors allow us to sense her deepest emotions that have escaped her brush.
TITLE: Colorful Artworks Expressing Deepest Emotions By Elena Anastasiou Neocleous

DESCRIPTION:
I spent one night in Shanghai.
It was past midnight, I got bored so I decided to take my camera for a walk.
TITLE: One Night In Shanghai

DESCRIPTION:
By the end of 2016, the war in Aleppo had subsided, and the old city returned to become the main destination for all the citizens of the city, to return to contact with the remaining symbols of their heritage, namely the citadel of Aleppo and the old city around it.
Mass destruction is enormous everywhere, a loss of architectural heritage, reminiscent of prehistoric times because Aleppo is one of the oldest cities in the world.
Samy Bayrakdar, a young man from the city of Aleppo, photographed a collection of photos about the Old City and published it with messages with very deep meanings.
TITLE: Aleppo, The Home City Through The Eyes A Young Man

DESCRIPTION: We'd be pretty surprised to hear of anybody who's never seen a comic by Safely Endangered, but in case you haven't yet come across this brilliant web cartoonist before, allow us to introduce him.
TITLE: 10+ Safely Endangered Comics That Will Make You Laugh Out Loud

DESCRIPTION:
When Australian athlete Rebecca Colefax traded in her star-studded career for motherhood, she rediscovered an old passion for photography that has now become her livelihood. Inspired by the beauty of life's humble beginnings, she now specializes in capturing portraits of newborn babies, a craft she hopes will preserve precious family memories.
Dubbed the First Lady of kiteboarding, Colefax made a name for herself as Australia's first female kiteboarder and went on to become the country's first world champion in the sport in 2003.
TITLE: Photographer Takes Pictures Of Babies As Never Seen Before

DESCRIPTION: Ever heard of purrmaids? These tiny little creatures are the combination of...you guessed it - cats and mermaids!
TITLE: Purrmaid Necklaces By Girl And Her Cat

DESCRIPTION: In this day and age, seeing someone share too much information on Facebook is as common as birds in the sky. It's not every day, however, that you hear about someone doing it accidentally, but that's exactly what happened to the newly-engaged Miranda Levy.
TITLE: Couple Posts Engagement Photo On Facebook, Immediately Regrets Not Checking The Foreground

DESCRIPTION: My bright blue eyes peered out at people as they walked back and forwards. Picking up items and disappearing again, never to be seen. Where am I? All I want to do is play and be free to roam around in my own home.
TITLE: It Was Love At First Site

DESCRIPTION: For this family of tourists at the Steveston Fisherman's Wharf in Canada, it was supposed to be just another pleasant afternoon feeding sea lions and enjoying the animals' company. However, a terrifying video shows a sea lion grabbing the little girl and dragging her into water - all this horror happening in just a blink of an eye!
TITLE: Sea Lion Drags Little Girl Underwater, And The Whole Terrifying Scene Is Captured On Cam

DESCRIPTION: Theunis Botha, a well-known 51-year-old big game hunter from Johannesberg, South Africa, just had his last hunt. The man was leading a group of hunters in Gwai, Zimbabwe, when they saw a herd of breeding elephants. Sensing the danger, three of the animals stormed the hunters and Botha shot at them. What the man didn't see was a fourth elephant coming after him from the side...
TITLE: Elephant Just Killed Big Game Hunter During His Hunt In Africa

DESCRIPTION:
Inspired by the beauty of pollen grains as seen under a microscope, Swiss designers Regine Cavicchioli, Roman Jurt and Michael Kennedy created a series of pollen lamps. They chose to design hay fever's main triggers in Europe: grass, birch, ragweed, dandelion, sunflower and ash pollen.
They recreated the pollen based on microscope (SEM) images and 3D printed them with nylon powder using Selective Laser Sintering technologies.
TITLE: Swiss Designers Created A Series Of Pollen Lamps Inspired By The Beauty Of Pollen Grains As Seen Under A Microscope

DESCRIPTION:
Pets are no angels - that's a fact. They might seem cute and innocent, but those who have one will definitely remember that one (at least) time their beloved kitty peed in their shoe, or destroyed expensive curtains.
Pet-shaming is a perfect way to return the favour.
TITLE: Share Your Pics Of Pets Being Shamed For Their Crimes

DESCRIPTION:
I am a self-taught mixed media artist. I love to work with many materials, therefore my artwork portfolio contains paintings, textile, and clay work.
I get my inspiration from from colors, nature, folklore art and various materials.

DESCRIPTION: It all started when I was debating on what I should do about my stained handbag. The bag was still fairly new, but it has a stain that I couldn't remove. I didn't want to throw it out, and it hurts me to keep staring at it, so I had a crazy idea - let's paint something to cover it up! It made the purse so much more unique and it's now one of my favorite handbags.

DESCRIPTION: The Most Infuriating Friends to Play Games With
TITLE: The Most Infuriating Friends

DESCRIPTION: It's 2017. Dogs have more followers than you and some have bigger wardrobes too. Once you've come to terms with this fact, it shouldn't surprize you that some of the world's biggest celebrities are often caught wearing the same thing as man's best friend.

DESCRIPTION: Hello! My name is Monica and my passion is to create perfect illusions, with pictures from my own portfolio. My aim is to confuse people and to immerse them in an imaginary world where anything is possible..

DESCRIPTION: Working as a researcher of wooden constructions specializing in historical monuments, I have the opportunity to get to many places, which are inaccessible to ordinary visitors. What attracts me most to them is their abandonment associated with some kind of mystery. The same feeling accompanies me by building surveys of many other cultural monuments, from Gothic churches to Functionalist constructions.
TITLE: Here Is What I Found Under The Roofs Of Historic Buildings In The Czech Republic

DESCRIPTION: Just because everyone needs a giggle in the day!

DESCRIPTION: To pass the time while their bosses were out, these engineers decided to combine their loves of engineering and racing to create a track in their office to race on, much to the annoyance of their co-workers!

DESCRIPTION:
The illustrator Federico Babina once again found a way to demonstrate his fissure and passion for three common arts: illustration, cinema, and architecture.
Wondering what the iconic movie houses would look like if they were based on her films, Babina created an illustrative series called Archidirector. The series follows the same pattern of another series, Archicine, in which Babina illustrates famous houses and constructions of certain films.

DESCRIPTION: Always looking to improve my skills I set out to paint with ink on Chinese paper. I wanted to try something special with the backgrounds, and discovered through trial and error I could accomplish this great effect. I love it.

DESCRIPTION: As a traveler first and photographer second I always hated using a tripod. The weight of the equipment, the lack of flexibility sometimes took away the joy of photography as it should be, at least for me. So I used the tripod only and only when I had to, proffering to get more noisy images rather than get stuck in a place with a camera.

Busted! series I did with Lilly and Deuce in Portugal in January 2015. © Jasmina Lozar 2015.
So in 2015 I got a chance to go from Slovenia to Portugal (2500km) as an exchange student to study photography.

But then you wonder if maybe, just maybe, somebody did something so stupid once that someone else put a sign up to dissuade other people from doing something equally ridiculous.

Everybody looks great with a snapchat filter. But if you are hanging around for more than 200 years you probably won't believe! This 20+ hilarious pictures might change your mind!
Checking the newest filters every day and finding the perfect match in painted history has become an ongoing project for a while. More coming soon! Scroll down to check them out and please share suggestions in the comments!

The only problem was that the guy got loaded the night before, and was pretty much unresponsive after hitting the pillow at 6 AM. What's a girl to do in a situation like this? Exact sweet revenge, of course.

DESCRIPTION:
What do Rapunzel, Ariana Grande, and a guinea pig have in common? If you guessed hair, you are right.
There are many species of guinea pigs, but Abyssinian, Peruvian, Coronet and Silkie guinea pigs are unique in their impressive, floor-length fur. These little creatures are beautiful to look at, but require a lot of care because of their unusual locks.

DESCRIPTION: Social media is there for everybody, but that doesn't mean that everybody should use it.

DESCRIPTION:
The twin sisters Maria Pignaton Pontin and Paulina Pignaton Pandolfi are close to turning 100 and are now given a photo essay to commemorate another year of life. The photos were taken this Monday (05-15), in Ilha do Frade, located in the city of Vitória (Brazil).
According to the photographer who presented the sisters, Camila Lima, they occupy the post of older twins of the Holy Spirit and the second place at the national level.

DESCRIPTION: We've had quite a few hair trends in the past year - holographic hair, glow-in-the-dark hair, hidden rainbow hair - to name a few. Yet another new hair trend is on its way and it's kind of like the new and improved rainbow hair trend! Say hello to shine line hair.

DESCRIPTION:
When anxiety forced me to drop out of my Philosophy PhD, I started trying to turn DrawingsofDogs, my little webcomic into more of a business. I now sell the comics on greeting cards and am working on a book.
Making jokes about dogs allows me to reflect on the oddity of human behavior.
TITLE: After My Anxiety Forced Me To Drop Out Of A Philosophy PhD I Started Drawing Dog Comics

DESCRIPTION: Ever wondered what you'd get if you crossed a Corgi with a Chihuahua? Ever seen a Corgi mixed with a Siberian Husky? Perhaps you've always dreamed of owning a Corgi crossed with a Beagle? Whatever type of Corgi mix you prefer, you're sure to find your favorite in this adorable list compiled by Bored Panda.

DESCRIPTION: Hello there, I'm Jess and I'm a newborn and baby photographer based in Worcester. I'm pretty used to photographing teeny, tiny bundles of joy but a few days ago my partner and I became foster parents to a..
