DESCRIPTION: I travel the world bringing photo enthusiasts to remote places where we document the local people's way of life. I always try to stress to the group that we should see what they have, and not contemplate what they don't have. So many of these rural indigenous people light their huts with kerosene lanterns which emit toxic fumes.
TITLE: Photo Group Donates Solar Lights To People Living In Darkness

DESCRIPTION:
In 1989 Romania violently ended decades of communism, but not everything was wiped out. Some things in my life still taste of communism.
One day I took my Smena 8M on a bicycle ride across the Transylvanian city of Targu Mures.
TITLE: I Used A Soviet Camera To Capture The Taste Of Communist Romania

DESCRIPTION: Six months back I became a dad, since then there has been a major change in my life. Apart from it being a big challenge its been a lot of fun too. I also like the fact that as a graphic designer, travelling artist, illustrator and storyteller I had always looked for inspiration outside but now my work is mostly governed by the presence of this little one.
TITLE: I Have Been Illustrating My Thoughts And Experiences As A New Dad

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Idan lightman, I live and create in tel Aviv Israel, I was always fascinated with fine details in art and nature, for the last 8 years I'm living In one of the largest cities in Israel and as I observe it I find an amazing array of details within this city from so many cultures and decades, colors, textures, different lives and life forms.
For a daydreamer like me, sometimes the city seems like its own entity
Made of all these individuals including myself.
While I get lost in it I remember old fears, dreams, daydreams and living ghosts of future memories.
TITLE: I Draw Old Dreams And Nightmares On The Streets Of Tel Aviv

DESCRIPTION: A huge victory for animal lovers around the world - dog meat has just been temporarily banned from the infamous Yulin Festival in China that has already taken the lives of thousands and thousands of innocent canines. The ban will come into effect on June 15 - that's one week before the start of the festival. It will prohibit the sale of dog meat at restaurants, markets, and street vendors. Those who don't obey will be facing a fine of up to 100,000 yuan (nearly $15,000) and arrest.
TITLE: Dog Meat Is Finally Banned From Yulin Festival In China

DESCRIPTION:
As I was staring at my stained purse, debating on what I should do with it - hide it in the garage, sell it (would anyone even buy it), donate it (would people want it), or throw it away, I decided to take a paintbrush and paint on it. It's now one of my favorite purse and it's not going anywhere!
This art is inspired by Vermeer's The Girl with the Pearl Earrings.
TITLE: My Purse Had A Stain And I Decided To Paint On It

DESCRIPTION: Its been like a month I'm trying to catch the Milky Way, having in my head the idea of getting the Milky Way over the snow...

DESCRIPTION:
We bought our first drone as something to play with and ended up using it way more often for work purposes. Drone photography is rising in popularity and we are quite sure you've seen the breathtaking shots these flying machines can capture.

DESCRIPTION: Molly, aka MoMo, the gremlin or the pirate, is a tricoloured Persian who has changed our lives. Her low-pitched purr and her gorgeous and unique looks have made her the star of the neighbourhood.

DESCRIPTION:
After having visited Irelands citys more than once I decided to explore it's wild nature - and was absolutely stunned by its beauty and roughness.
I traveled the Wild Atlantic Way which is a 2,500 km long coastal road leading from the very south of Ireland, passing the amazing city of Galway and ending in Derry in the far north of Ireland. It is often referred to as the most beautiful and scenic coastal roads in europe and as far as I can judge this is absolutely true.

DESCRIPTION: After you have your first spoon of Nutella, your life changes forever, because you finally find out the taste of love. And our lives are about to change again, because the first-ever Nutella Cafe is opening in Chicago, in the Millennium Park Plaza On Wednesday, May 31st, at 10 a.m.

DESCRIPTION: Lola the doggie had spent 8 years chained up in a dark garage just lying on cold concrete floor, prior to being rescued by AMA Animal Rescue. For the last seven weeks she has been living with her new human mom, Charlène von Saher, in Manhattan. During that time, the abused doggie has already perfected the art or relaxation, taking the concept of 'comfort' to the next level.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Sophie, the fluffy female cat, and Scottie, the boy cat next door who is helplessly in love with her. Sophie is a rescue from Boston who was adopted back in 2014. Scottie would always keep a distance but never lose sight of the cat of his dreams.

This condition is entirely temporary but INCREDIBLY ADORABLE! As they grow older, their kitten fur will fall out and their true color will start to show.

Wake up an hour early, get to live an hour more. Or so they say.

DESCRIPTION:
I've been saving Starburst wrappers diligently (with the help of friends and family) for 4 years to create this dress. After enough were saved I organized them into colors, ironed them, folded them into links, and made candy wrapper chains. 
With the use of elastic thread, I was able to sew the links together into a fabric to create the dress.
TITLE: 4 Years And 10 000+ Starburst Candy Wrappers Went Into This Dress

DESCRIPTION: Sometimes life kicks me in the nuts, and it's hard to stand up but we have to, right? I mean, the good life isn't the one without suffering, it's the one where it contributes to our development as human beings. When I'm feeling down, a walk through the busy city streets really helps. It kind of reminds me that everything's still in its place and the Earth is still spinning.

DESCRIPTION:
So it's been 5 years since I first painted over this abandoned old boat lost in woods in my hometown Zagreb, capital of Croatia.
I came back to it because it was kind of washed of and I wanted to do something different/new but again same as the first time..

DESCRIPTION: I decided to make a series of reimagined album and single music covers redesigned in my pop art geometric style. For me and for a lot of designers out there I think, music is a part of my creative process. It can inspire me, give me ideas or even give me the mood and energy to complete a design.
TITLE: I Reimagined Covers Of Classic And Newer Iconic Albums And Music Singles

DESCRIPTION: Just like people, every single dog comes with their own quirks. Usually, those quirks are some kind of ridiculously hilarious phobias. Vacuums and thunder definitely make the top of the list but there are a lot more things pups can be afraid of, and we're about to show you!
TITLE: 10+ Dogs Who Are Afraid Of The Most Ridiculous Things

DESCRIPTION:
Hello and welcome to my wonderful world of whimsy!
My name is Fugi Naim. I am a mother of two, I live and work in a secluded and beautiful village in the Judean Hills on the outskirts of Jerusalem, Israel.
Art is my life and has been for as long as I can remember.
TITLE: I Create Ceramic Dolls Inspired By Vintage Figurines

DESCRIPTION: Unlike a quick selfie, classical portrait paintings weren't that common back in the day and sometimes took months or even years to complete. So when people got their portraits made, they took it seriously. And nowhere is this more evident than in classical art galleries, where you'd be hard-pressed to see anybody smiling.
TITLE: Guy Visits Museum But Finds Classical Art Characters Too Serious, Uses FaceApp To Make Them Smile

DESCRIPTION: Meet Tony, the loyal doggie who didn't leave his owner's side after the man injured himself falling 6 feet down on the concrete sidewalk when pruning a tree outside his home on Saturday. The owner, whose name is Jesus Hueche, hit his head and lost consciousness - but the puppy was there by his side up until the ambulance arrived.
TITLE: This Dog Refused To Leave His Owner Who Got Injured And Lost Consciousness After A Fall

DESCRIPTION: I fight against a boring job, waiting for my dream one to come. I make one sketch a day showing the little troubles of a joung girl employee because I need to do a perfect lemonade.
TITLE: I Make Comics About Everyday Struggles

DESCRIPTION: After working for 14 years and achieving all that I could at work I decided to quit it all and become a mom . Had a very happy pregnancy . I gave birth to my beautiful baby girl Siya and while I was happy , the life that I knew suddenly changed, happiness was replaced by anxiety , being home bound , low on energy , feeling fat and uncertain about my future started taking a toll on me and depression crept in .
TITLE: How I Got Creative To Beat Away My Post Natal Blues

DESCRIPTION: The artist born in Singapore and based in Holland, Qixuan Lim creates these tiny and frightening sculptures that fit in the palm of the hand. As a background work, Lim carves not only the babies' heads, but also tiny ceramic hearts (almost always with teeth), animal skulls, pigs, and forearms. All of them are always very small and fit a lot of them in the palm of the hand.
TITLE: Unsettling Baby Carving Sculptures By Qixuan Lim

DESCRIPTION: I wanted to create a home for my cat, Ryker, so she could stay comfortably while I was away. I converted an old dog kennel into a muilty story house. There is a bed inside for sleeping and upstairs for viewing.

DESCRIPTION: When it comes to modern TV logos, any kind of design can be dreamed up and produced with a few swift clicks on a screen. Back in the day, however, producers had to get a little more creative, and you may be surprised to find out that many iconic TV logos still in use now were physical objects fashioned for filming.
TITLE: When TV Logos Were Actual Physical Objects

DESCRIPTION: How far can one line go? Berlin-based tattoo artist Mo Ganji makes a living out of testing that very possibility, and has become a master at bending and weaving single lines into strikingly coherent images.

DESCRIPTION: Today I was bored at home, so I took my camera and went out against the always awful weather in London, here's what my neighbourhood looks like.
TITLE: I Spent A Cloudy Afternoon Capturing Hidden Spots In My Neighbourhood

DESCRIPTION:
IT'S TOTALLY OK to be an introvert! I think I always kind of knew I was an introvert, but it's only last year I realized it's not a bad thing and don't have to change. Silly, I know!
The world is just so focused on extroverts, we sometimes forget it's totally fine! So I made these reminders for myself and all the introverts out there: embrace your sensitivity, cherish your alone time and never think of it as a bad thing again!
TITLE: Hi Introverts, These Are For You!

DESCRIPTION: To spread his message about endless waste production, Portuguese street artist Bordalo II (Artur Bordalo) creates stunning animal sculptures. However, unlike most artists, Bordalo doesn't buy his material - he scavenges it.

DESCRIPTION: Specialized in visual and graphic arts, we explore the concept of continuity through our one line minimalist artwork, the artist say

DESCRIPTION: Lilly was my first dog, my first love any she saved my life. When I adopted her I had severe asthma attacks and she took me on long walks every day - she cured me. In no time I was off my medication, I could breathe normally again and I gained a new best friend for life.
TITLE: I Hoped To Photograph A Miracle, But Instead, I Captured My Hardest Goodbye

DESCRIPTION: Why go somewhere over the rainbow when you can just hang out inside of it? Kampung Pelangi, a small village in Indonesia, has transformed itself into a stunning display of bright colours and whimsical designs, a huge departure from its former state of squalor.

DESCRIPTION: I painted these with watercolor on wood (I coat the wood with clear gesso to prevent it from absorbing the paint). These paintings are all inspired by my love of nature and my love for myth and story. I try to present things from nature like trees or fungus as dramatic and expressive characters, instead of background scenery.

DESCRIPTION:
As a creative portrait photographer my day to day job involves capturing the personalities of characters in unique art images commercially.
I got bored of looking at pictures of animals looking like they are inanimate objects when they have as much, if not more, personality as humans! So I had a go myself, and here's what I came up with..

DESCRIPTION:

No, this does not mean a chess that is played with only one piece.

DESCRIPTION: For over a decade, I've captured images of food, cooking and culture throughout the world. My photographs explore local food culture and traditional cuisines through scenes of unique dishes and ingredients, markets, cooks, street vendors and artisans encountered during my travels. Here are a few of the interesting people I've met along the way.
TITLE: Portraits Of Cuisine: Food Culture Photos From Around The World

DESCRIPTION: Chaichan Artwichai is a 29 year old digital artist from Thailand. His illustrations are simply incredible.
TITLE: Beautiful Digital Artworks By Chaichan Artwichai

DESCRIPTION: Meet Finley, a character I started working on virtually by accident. This 'being' just popped onto the page one day when I started my sketch for the day (I'd commited to a 30 day sketch thing). Up till that day I'd been drawing some pretty anxty things induced by our current political climate and violence around the world.
TITLE: The Creation Of Finley Fetherston

DESCRIPTION: Italian graphic designer Andrea Antoni searches the world for Pantone colors, reminding us to embrace the colorful nature of our surroundings.
TITLE: Italian Graphic Designer Finds Pantone Colors In Natural Landscapes And Cities

DESCRIPTION: Don't stare too hard! The shapes and bright colors contrasted with the black wood gave this mini DIY adventure a hypnotic result. I placed nails around simple, geometrical shapes on black stained wood and used embroidery floss to embellish. Drawing the shapes on attached white paper helped with nail spacing, however it didn't look like much until the paper was removed near the end.
TITLE: I Tried Abstract Geometrical String Art And The Result Is Slightly Hypnotic

DESCRIPTION:
I was lucky enough to participate again this year in the Coffee Art Project and for this occasion, I wanted to create something special. Using coffee both as the theme and the medium for this illustration, I wanted to represent the moment of drinking a cup of coffee and its meaning.
Thoughts, decisions, emotions.
TITLE: A Coffee Piece For The Coffee Art Project

DESCRIPTION:
I drew this portrait with graphite and charcoal pencil.
I named the hyper-realistic painting Born To Eat.
TITLE: I Drew A Hyper-Realistic Portrait Using A Graphite And Charcoal Pencil

DESCRIPTION:
Russian artist Marina Berulava recreates the depth of the whole universe in amazing rings, necklaces and ceramics. Overflowing effects of lampwork attract and surprise like if you are looking at waves or a starred sky. And suddenly you come across lampwork jewellery revealing the beauty of the deep azure ocean or space in miniature!
When gazing at such a lampwork piece, one feels like watching faraway stars and nebulae twinkling in a telescope.
TITLE: Cosmic Lampwork: Jewelry By Marina Berulava

DESCRIPTION: Having a hard time back at work after the weekend? This little girl waiting for the beat to drop will help you get through your dreary Monday!
TITLE: Toddler Goes Viral After Patiently Waiting For The Beat To Drop, And Then Killing It With Her Dance Moves

DESCRIPTION: Meet Jin Jin, the Persian kitty who recently became the victim of one of the most epic hairdresser mishaps ever. As is quite typical with long-haired cats, Jin Jin's owner Xie Qian Qian makes sure the cat gets shaved every once in a while. This is supposed to keep the cat cool and bring less hair to the house. Jin Jin would always return from the hairdresser with an adorable lion-style cut, with the fur on his head and tail being mostly untouched. Not this time, though...
TITLE: Owner Surprised After Taking Her Cat To A Groomer

DESCRIPTION: Beer pong table that I created a custom mural on using spray paint. Follow my YouTube for more to come.
TITLE: I Made This Custom Painted 8ft Beer Pong Table

DESCRIPTION:
Global warming is a ticking bomb that we need to defuse before it explodes. To raise awareness about this modern issue, Italian artist Lorenzo Quinn (previously here) has built a monumental sculpture for the 2017 Venice Art Biennale.
Quinn is widely known for incorporating elements of the human body parts in his work, and this project is no different.
TITLE: Support: Giant Hands Rise From A Canal In Venice To Send A Powerful Message About Climate Change

DESCRIPTION:
Every day I walk with my dogs in our beautiful surroundings, and sometimes I find, in my point of view, the perfect rocks to paint hearts on.
My dogs always shake their heads when I fill my carrier bag with rocks, especially when, like in most cases, we still have 6 miles until we get home. Needless to say, I usually have pretty sore shoulders after a walk.
TITLE: Painting These Hearts Makes Me Relaxed

DESCRIPTION: I started this project year ago after one amazing concert of the band Wardruna. This was my kick in the ass start this journey. For me it`s spiritual and personal experience but I believe that the people can feel this too as personal for themselves.
TITLE: I Am Making Runic Cards Set

DESCRIPTION: A few weeks ago I visited this amazing Asylum in Italy. The asylum was designed in 1789 and the work was completed in the early 1800s. The King of Sardinia opened the church building for the Sons of the Militaries in 1834.
TITLE: I Photographed This Abandoned Asylum

DESCRIPTION:
I made my project Icons using celebrities, who even dead now, still have influence on people (including me) and are seen as idols and role models.
While alive most of them were also famous for their drug abuse, which in most cases here is the reason for their death. However, even nowadays people admire and see them as saints.
TITLE: I Put Faces Of Dead Celebrities On Religious Paintings To Show The Icons Of The New Generation

DESCRIPTION: I love drawing portraits. I also love illusions. So I combined both and came up with this.
TITLE: Is It Real? Or Is It Just An Illusion?

DESCRIPTION: I am an emerging collage artist who uses vintage magazines, postcards and papers to create pieces that question accepted norms, and highlights the pressing issues of our society.
TITLE: I Make Contemporary Art That Challenges Vintage Ideals

DESCRIPTION: Every now and then we like to get creative in our kitchen and turn fresh ingredients into popular characters!
TITLE: Making Healthy Food Fun!

DESCRIPTION: Mother's day is coming, let's appreciate our supermoms.
TITLE: Hey Pandas, Share Vintage Photos Of Your Moms Being Cool!

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Tomer Jacobson. Over the last five years my partner, Maxim Golovonov, and I have been working on a series of pictures named Songs from the shutter since each photo reflects our interpretation of a different song we like.
Each work was carefully executed and involves complex, self-financed productions with a lot of support from our close environment.
TITLE: Songs From The Shutter: Our Reflection Of The Music In Pictures

DESCRIPTION:
I believe that when a woman becomes a mom she gains some kind of super powers. It's simply too hard to believe that they are all that good in multitasking, caring and selflessness without any kind of magic.
Lucy Knisley is a cartoonist and one of those magical moms.
TITLE: 10+ Fun Parenting Comics By Lucy Knisley

DESCRIPTION: Turns out, sometimes our resistance to learn something new and master a new skill can lead to something pretty amazing. Pat Hines, who couldn't be bothered to learn Photoshop and illustrated his ebook using good old Microsoft Paint, is the proof. I suck at Photoshop and other programs, and have worked exclusively in Microsoft Paint for over ten years... I honed my craft working long overnights at a hospital reception desk..., the guy writes. That's why when it came to choosing the program to create illustrations for his novel Camp Redblood And The Essential Revenge, he looked no further and just went for something he was already good at.
TITLE: Guy Sucks At Photoshop, Spends 10 Years Mastering Microsoft Paint To Illustrate His Book

DESCRIPTION: My dad was in Chile for work... This is what he got every day!
TITLE: My Dad Went To Chile, And His Hotel Had The Most Awesome Maid

DESCRIPTION: Hi to all! Here is the story of Tyson. Tyson is a French bulldog that we bought in 2016. Unfortunately he had an accident and fell on the stairs.
TITLE: Tyson The Hero With Three Legs

DESCRIPTION: I recycled some Coke plastic bottles into a fairy house lamp. Materials used: plastic bottles, tin foil, paint, hot glue and paper clay. Have fun!
TITLE: Recycling Some Plastic Bottles Into A Fairy House Lamp

DESCRIPTION: When an Australian man named Terry decided it was time to pop the question to his girlfriend of over 2 years, Anna, it didn't take him long to find the ring - she was already wearing it without knowing.
TITLE: Woman Wears Her Engagement Ring For Entire Year Without Even Knowing It, And Her Reaction Is Priceless

DESCRIPTION: They say practice makes perfect, so what do you do when you want to learn how to make comics? You make comics, duh! Creator Mike Organisciak decided to draw comics every day for 100 days without any prior experience, and now that the time is up, he has shared his results online.
TITLE: 10+ Brutal Comics With Unexpected Endings That Only People With A Dark Sense Of Humor Will Understand

DESCRIPTION:
I first went to North Korea in 2008. At this time, there were no mobile phones in the country, and the only pics people were taking were thanks to the official photographers who stood at the entrance of the main monuments to sell some photo souvenirs to visitors.
I first thought about making Polaroids just as a kind of artistic work, to keep the dull colors of this country, but quickly I discovered this camera was the best way to make contacts with locals and to break the ice.
TITLE: I Introduced Polaroid To North Korea, And It Made People Open Up And Tell Their Stories

DESCRIPTION: From childhood I had a strong connection to dolls. Toy dolls and various display dolls that filled the display cases in my grandmother's house. As a creative person I have been drawn to making figures in different materials over the years.
TITLE: I Make Ceramic Dolls Based On Old Dolls No Longer Manufactured Today

DESCRIPTION: Meet Huckleberry, the doggie who loves nothing more than spending time on the rooftop of his human's house and looking at the world from up high. Passengers are so surprised by the view, Huck's owner even wrote a 'Don't Be Alarmed' note. It says that they're perfectly aware of the strange roundabouts of their dog and that they make sure the canine is safe at all times.
TITLE: Family Makes Sign To Explain Why Their Dog Is On The Roof, And It Becomes An Internet Sensation

DESCRIPTION: Female sexuality is not the easiest thing to depict in illustration but Polly Nor does a great job doing that. This London-based artist chose a bold and daring style to express her thoughts on modern ladies and their sexuality by drawing girls and their demons in various situations. She uses bright colors and flat style to create a cartoonish feel, but her sometimes dark and unsettling themes prove that these works are not for kids.
TITLE: 10+ Honest Illustrations Of Modern Women And Their Demons By Polly Nor (NSFW)

DESCRIPTION: Enormous pits, filled with multi-colored balls is one of those vivid memories, exclusive to childhood. But, according to Lee McAteer, 32, it doesn't have to be.
TITLE: Boss Surprises Employees With Balls

DESCRIPTION: Cats are often mysterious and unexplainable creatures, but thanks to webcomic artist and crazy cat lady Lulu VanHoagland, we finally have a small window into what might be going on inside those furry little heads.
TITLE: 10+ Comics By Lulu VanHoagland That Purrfectly Capture Life With Cats

DESCRIPTION: In this post I want to show my pastel drawings. Pastel technique is one of my favorite for pet portraits. I need pastels, paper and a lot of patience.
TITLE: I Draw Portraits Of Dogs

DESCRIPTION:
I visited all these places from my studio.
I created all of this miniature landscapes here in my studio with help of very basic products. I used old cardboards, plaster, polystyrene sheets, newspapers and acrylic colours.
TITLE: How To Make Friends Envy Your Travel Photos Without Leaving Your Room

DESCRIPTION: Dogs are supposed to be man's best friend, but it looks like these pups have gotten it wrong, because as you can see from this hilarious list, these guys aren't man's best friend - they're MUD'S best friend!
TITLE: 10+ Reasons You Should Never Let Your Dog Play In The Mud

DESCRIPTION:
I paint vibrant portraits of animals and people, working from black and white photographs. I never know how a painting will turn out. If I did, I wouldn't want to paint it in the first place!
Using black and white images helps me to focus on the tone of an image and not be distracted by the subjects real colours so I can make up my own.
TITLE: I Take Black And White Images And Inject Them With Explosions Of Colour

DESCRIPTION: Tattooing plays a major role in certain communities. Some people use their body as an art canvas to reflect their status, ideology, memorable stories, etc..
TITLE: I Documented The Last Tattooed Women Of The Tharu Tribe

DESCRIPTION:
We are freelance copywriter and art-director, who work in advertising and constantly travel. We have lots of stories to tell and to make it fun and easy for our followers, we post weekly comic strips.
With the help of our illustrator Yana Solovyeva we keep our clients and friends informed about our whereabouts and adventures in the most exciting way.
TITLE: We Work In Advertising And Tell Stories About Our Adventures Using Comic Strips

DESCRIPTION:
I make custom lookalike dolls from people pictures or selfies!
Every doll is one-of-a-kind, made with love to make you smile!
TITLE: I Make Lookalike Dolls From People Pictures Or Selfies

DESCRIPTION:
Check out this amazing gadget on Kickstarter!
This wearable device can save lives! I never saw anything like it before, it really makes sense!
PLOOTA is worn round the neck. An integrated sensor technology lets the system know when the swimmer (toddlers as well as adults) is in danger. With the help of an integrated CO2 cartridge the two inflatable cushions fill up automatically.
TITLE: We Created The First Automatic Sensor Controlled Safety Device For Swimmers

DESCRIPTION:
Summer is coming! It's time to think about meadow, birds and picnics. So I decided to make a foldable picnic table with two wine holders and additional space for grapes and cheese.
Small project, but very satisfying to make and.
TITLE: I Made An Oaken Picnic Table With Wine Holders

DESCRIPTION: The face of this elder lady, had my interest for a long time now.She is always smiling, nice, and caring about folks around her.Adored by her family too.
TITLE: Belgian Artist Drew An Incredible Portrait Of An Elder Lady

DESCRIPTION: I'm Julien Brogard a young french and fresh Graphic designer and illustrator, this is a series i made during my spleepless nights. It's about loneliness, introspection and abscence.
TITLE: I Create Series Of Illustrations About Loneliness, Introspection, And Abscence

DESCRIPTION: Sometimes somebody takes a photograph so perfectly timed that it can never be recreated, no matter how hard you try. Like that moment the dog decides to puke on you while you're taking a selfie for instance. Or that moment somebody gets hit in the face by a flying cup of soda at a music festival.
TITLE: 10+ Pics Taken Seconds Before Disaster That Will Make You Feel Pain Just By Looking At Them

DESCRIPTION: The photoshoot was done in 1 hour, I just made pictures of myself with the matching hairstyle and makeup, and then matched with the photos of each animal. The manipulation took me up to 20 hours for each.I observed the angle, lighting, colour and texture.
TITLE: I Become One With Animals By Replacing My Eye With Theirs

DESCRIPTION: I drew this to try something new, something rare to be done in ballpoint pen art. I drew five hours every night for 3 weeks. I used multi-colored pens; for details, for halftone or shading, and for dark tones.
TITLE: My Ballpoint Pen Art

DESCRIPTION: The main purpose of signs is to be helpful, but that doesn't mean they can't be fun at the same time! We already showed you creative bathroom signs, and now, we've got something even better in store for you - zoo signs.
TITLE: 10+ Funny Zoo Signs Which Probably Have Some Incredible Stories Behind Them

DESCRIPTION: Whether you're in middle school, high school, university, or anything in between, it has never been a better time to be a student. Schools around the globe are embracing clever and practical new technologies and ideas in their buildings, all geared towards making life easier for students and teachers alike.
TITLE: 10+ Genius School Ideas That You Wish You Had At School

DESCRIPTION: A lot of facts about our lives (like the lack of control over it and the inevitable death afterwards) are tough to swallow, so it's best you learn about them from somebody soft and fluffy. Luckily, there's a tumblr, dedicated to using cats to deliver heavy information. It's called Hard Truths From Soft Cats, and it helps to carry the burden of existence.
TITLE: 10+ Brutal Life Truths Told By Cute Cats Will Give You Mixed Feelings

DESCRIPTION:
Paulina Bartnik is an incredible Polish artist that creates brooches of birds using embroidery. Her detailed colorful works are spot on copies of the actual feathery beauties.
Paulina creates many different birds, from gray pigeons to colorful hummingbirds.
TITLE: Incredibly Detailed Embroidered Bird Brooches By Paulina Bartnik

DESCRIPTION:
Hello, Andrew here and my dream ever since I could remember was to be a professional full-time artist. I have spent the last few years really pushing myself learning new styles while always producing completely unique work from my mind. 
I currently work customer service 8 hours a day and feel like every day is a waste since I can't put 100% of my time into what I am passionate about.
TITLE: Help Me Stop Working A 9 To 5 Job And Start Living My Dream As A Full-Time Artist

DESCRIPTION: If you're thinking about a new career you should consider working in a silicone factory. This place probably doesn't belong on the top of any guidance counselor's list but, judging from this video, it has to have the highest job satisfaction level.
TITLE: Satisfying Silicone Annealing

DESCRIPTION: Jimmy Fallon is asking people to tweet out something weird, funny, or embarrassing that their moms have said by using the hashtag #MomQuotes. It's for his latest hashtag game, and the best will appear on his show, but as you can see from this hilarious list, he's going to have real trouble deciding which ones are the funniest!
TITLE: 10+ Of The Funniest Things That Moms Have Ever Said

DESCRIPTION: I am a photographer based in Vilnius, Lithuania. To me roundabouts are somewhat special places: they connect drivers and at the same time they lead them to the different directions. I usually take pictures of the cars, automotive events and shows.
TITLE: I Took Pictures Of All Roundabouts In Vilnius

DESCRIPTION: When life gives you Twizzlers, make a candy castle...
TITLE: 2 Foot Tall Candy Castle Made Out Of Twizzlers

DESCRIPTION:
Spring time is my favorite because I can paint flowers from nature. I like wildflowers the most, but I also look forward to the first flowers that bloom in my garden.
It is great fun when I can put a small bouquet on my window and use natural light to paint the flowers that I really see them.
TITLE: I Paint Flowers From Nature

DESCRIPTION: [I] hoped for smiles, the ones that happen when you witness a random act of kindness. That was my goal, my vision. Create an emotional response through flowers.
TITLE: Crime Or Art? Someone Is Turning NYC Trash Cans Into Giant Vases Filled With Flowers

DESCRIPTION:
I am a nature photographer from beautiful Prince Edward Island, Canada. For the last 3 years I've had a couple of different foxes visit me, but just one has been there the entire time, and that is my good buddy Zorro the Fox.
I've captured many sides of him since I met him, and I thought I would share some of my favorites.
TITLE: Meet Zorro The Fox Who Visits Me Every Day For The Last 3 Winters

DESCRIPTION: It's no secret that Americans do things a little differently from the rest of the world. As the first European colony to win independence, they've had lots of time to form the unique identity we associate with them today. Let's take a few moments to celebrate all the quirky and ridiculous little things that make the USA what it is, even if we still fail to understand them.
TITLE: 10+ Times Tumblr Hilariously Roasted Americans

DESCRIPTION: Lirika Matoshi is a New York-based artist creating incredible, detailed pieces that you can wear...
TITLE: Embellished Fishnet Tights Are Here And It Will Make You Feel Like A Mermaid Caught In A Net

DESCRIPTION: As winter is slowly coming to Brazil, a few kind people at a local bus station decided to do something amazing for the stray dogs freezing on the streets. Employees at a Barreirinha bus terminal created a space at their facility where they can stay warm and be looked after. Not only are they providing the pups with food and water, the staff also got them animal beds made out of old tires covered with blankets.
TITLE: Bus Station Comes Up With A Brilliant Solution To Help Stray Dogs Escape The Cold

DESCRIPTION: An old lady from Avon, Connecticut was baking brownies when an unexpected guest showed up next to her front door asking for his portion. It was a giant bear and the woman got scared. She asked her neighbor Bob Belfiore to help her. The man rushed to her house and couldn't believe what he saw - the bear was very persistent to get inside and determined to do whatever it took to get himself a brownie.
TITLE: Bear Smells Brownies, Tries To Get Inside

DESCRIPTION: I'm willing to bet that almost everything looks cuter when shrunken down to the size of a pea. Seoul-based tattoo artist Witty Button specializes in creating this kind of tattoos, no bigger than a hairpin, and they look incredibly delicate and personal.
TITLE: 10+ Tiny Discreet Tattoos For People Who Love Minimalism By Witty Button

DESCRIPTION:
I quit my job as a graphic designer and web developer to make fine woodworking art. I love the pleasant, warm feel of wood and dedicate all my spare time to working with this noble material.
My creative journey began one year ago when I realized that I want to do something different in my life.
TITLE: I Quit My Job As A Graphic Designer To Make Fine Woodworking Art

DESCRIPTION: Recently we wrote about IKEA's hilarious response to Balenciaga's $2,145 version of their iconic 99 cents Frakta bag. Well now everybody seems to be jumping on the idea of turning the furniture giant's famous blue bag into a must-have fashion accessory.
TITLE: People Are Now Making Clothes Out Of 99-Cent IKEA Bags, And They Look More In The $2000+ Range

DESCRIPTION: A small set of illustrations on the subtleties and the underlying truth of the animal entertainment industry. Nowadays there's still quite a lot of abuse in the entertainment industry, in order for an animal to 'behave' they must go against their own nature and one of the most common ways of doing that is by physical hurting them, yet we're often unaware of this.
TITLE: Abused Animals. But Illustrated In A Way That Is A Bit More Subtle

DESCRIPTION: Today is Teacher Appreciation Day in the US. Do you appreciate your teacher? Probably not. But if they're good then you probably should. After, school can be kind of boring, and so it takes a very special kind of teacher to stop you from falling asleep at your desk every day. Check out this list, compiled by Bored Panda, for our favorite examples of awesome teachers.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Awesome Teachers Ever To Celebrate National Teacher Day

DESCRIPTION: For half a decade Zupagrafika studio, author and publisher of Brutal East, Brutal London and Blokoshka, has been documenting post-war modernist housing estates around Europe in the form of illustrated paper model collections. While working on each series they took numerous portraits celebrating those who inhabit the buildings they worked on (some doomed to premature demolition). The pictures have been collected in a photo album called The Tenants.
TITLE: Portraits Of Tenants Holding Replicas Of Their Concrete Homes Awaiting Demolition

DESCRIPTION: I suffer from Generalized Anxiety Disorder, Depression, and Psychogenic Non-Epileptic Seizures. No amount of words could explain how these disorders affect me, so I'll let the pictures do the talking. This project is sort of an emotional catharsis, and I'm just putting it all out there.
TITLE: These Photos Tell The Story Of My Mental Illness

DESCRIPTION:
Influenced by surrealism, I decided to photograph the world exactly as I see it.
Without an aesthetic necessity, but with the obsession of balancing the chaos that surrounds me and pursuing me, any time.
In this way Photography becomes a much more dignified process than it is today.
TITLE: My Point Of View

DESCRIPTION: They are best friends and dancers. Caterina Stutz and Paz Orozco.
TITLE: Best Friends Get Together For A Photoshoot

DESCRIPTION: As a henna artist, I incorporate henna patterns in almost anything :) I played around with icing until I managed to get the perfect consistency for henna pattern decorating. It takes a few hours of the day depending on the order quantity.
TITLE: I Make Henna Themed Munchies

DESCRIPTION: I have two passions in life: Calligraphy and Photography. join them together and it becomes light calligraphy. Drawing felt interesting at a very young age.
TITLE: My Passion For Calligraphy Combined With My Interest In Photography. This Is Light Calligraphy

DESCRIPTION: It's been said that love can move mountains, but one California couple has proven that it can also climb them. Ashley Schmeider and James Sisson felt that a run-of-the-mill wedding ceremony wasn't right for them - so they decided to get married on Mount Everest instead. As you can probably guess, their wedding photos are monumentally epic.
TITLE: Couple Gets Married On Mount Everest After Trekking For 3 Weeks, And Their Wedding Photos Are Epic

DESCRIPTION: Whether it be bumping into an ex, farting at a funeral, or asking somebody when they're due when they're not even pregnant, we've all found ourselves in awkward situations at some point in our lives. But there's awkward, and then there's awkward, and as you can see from this cringeworthy list compiled by Bored Panda, some folks take it to a whole new level.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Embarrassing Situations That People Have Ever Been In

DESCRIPTION: Hello, My name is Emilie, I am a french independant Illustrator. I like drawing of course, but I like taking pictures too. I photograph my dolls, I collect those things.
TITLE: I Create Miniature Food For Dollhouses

DESCRIPTION: My name is McKenzie, known as Brutiful McKenzie across social media. I am a self-taught artist out of Nashville, TN, that loves to give people the creeps. Dark arts inspire everything I paint and draw.
TITLE: I Am A Self-Taught Artist That Loves To Give People The Creeps

DESCRIPTION: Has your grandpa ever dressed up as princess Leia? Perhaps he loiters in places where loitering is strictly prohibited? Does he walk through town with a bright pink shirt that reads 'Don't laugh, it's your girlfriend's t-shirt'? If you answered yes to any of these questions then congratulations, because you officially have a badass grandpa.
TITLE: 10+ Grandpas Who Are More Badass Than You

DESCRIPTION: If you ever tried cutting a simple snowflake out of paper, you should be able to appreciate the incredibly delicate paper art by Patrick Cabral. This multi-disciplinary artist is based in the Philippines and he has just created a gorgeous paper cut-out series to raise awareness of endangered animals from all over the world.
TITLE: Incredibly Intricate Paper Cut-Outs Of Endangered Animals

DESCRIPTION: Anorexia is a psychological eating disorder and, in some cases, even a life-threatening disease. There are people who die starving themselves because of anorexia, as the grip of the illness takes control - yes, it's that serious. It's no surprise that most of those who have been through it call such experience a living hell.
TITLE: 10+ Before & After Pics Of People Who Defeated Anorexia

DESCRIPTION: If you need a change of perspective, go on a cross country road trip. If you need to change your life, do it in a pop-up camper. My husband and I and our three children did just this and it was one of the most astounding experiences of our lives.
TITLE: Living In A Pop-Up Camper While Traveling Across The Us Changed My Life

DESCRIPTION:
My tribute to Rei Kawakubo; I recreated iconic creations by Rei Kawakubo for Comme des Garcons as a tribute to the 2017 Met Gala.
I look forward to the much anticipated Met Gala as many others look forward to the Academy Awards. I brace myself and read up as much of what is expected to happen both on the red carpet as well as the actual exhibit which I will visit as soon as I can get there.
TITLE: I Recreated Iconic Creations By Rei Kawakubo As A Tribute To Met Gala

DESCRIPTION: Reza Parastesh is just your average, everyday 25-year-old guy, except for one little thing - he happens to look exactly like Lionel Messi, and it's recently gotten him into a bit of trouble with the law.
TITLE: Iranian Student Gets Arrested By Cops Because He Looks Exactly Like Lionel Messi

DESCRIPTION: Keenan Watkins of North Vernon, Indiana put his pride on the line when he walked into a Goodwill store with a baby doll strapped to his cart, but the story behind the odd scenario is deeply touching - and it's going viral for all the right reasons.
TITLE: This Intimidating Guy Took A Baby Doll Shopping With Him, And The Story Behind It Is Amazing

DESCRIPTION: If I could go back and relive the last few years of my life, I would relive each moment in exactly the same way. This simple realization emerged from deep internal reflection. Some people exercise or practice yoga, others meditate; I engage in walking meditation practice - I put on headphones with a loud music and go on long walks.
TITLE: My Photos Of Reflections

DESCRIPTION: Travel photographer Mohamed Hakem recently visited Siwa, Egypt's largest oasis and one of the most remote places on Earth. Meanwhile, he did a little experimentation. 5 who took pictures of the same place for 24 hours, showing how the time of day changes the image.
TITLE: 5 Pictures In A Day: How The Time Of Day Affects A Photo

DESCRIPTION: Capturing a snapshot of depression doesn't necessarily equate to mournful pictures of tears or sadness. Depression is, after all, a dark and complex creature that manifests itself in different ways in different people who suffer from it.
TITLE: The Reality Of Depression Captured In A Single Picture

DESCRIPTION: At 63 years old, Lyn Slater is not exactly a typical haute couture model, but that's part of her appeal. She decries age-based discrimination in both the fashion industry and in everyday life, including the tired notion of 'dressing for one's age.'
TITLE: Journalists Accidentally Confuse A 63-Year-Old Teacher With A Fashion Icon And It Ends Up Changing Her Life

DESCRIPTION: I make one of the most popular mirror glazed mousse cakes. It takes three days to make one mousse cake due to very unique and rare techniques used to produce them. They are made of natural ingredients, real cream, milk, fruits and berries, premium chocolates and top-class biscuits.
TITLE: My New Mirror Glazed Mousse Cakes That Take Three Days To Make

DESCRIPTION:
These are my pets that helped me to show those moments when you want a good shot, but your friends want to amuse so they take pictures of you in the funniest situations.
The first picture is the one how you imagined it to look like, and the second is what your friends actually did!
TITLE: Expectations Vs. Reality: How You Imagine Your Photos To Look Like Versus How You Actually Look

DESCRIPTION:
Two years ago I set out to capture photos of my neighbor's kids growing up in my small community. After completing the initial set and posting it to Bored Panda in April of 2017 it immediately went viral and impacted the lives of many folks around the world.
Fast-forward two years later to date and I'm still documenting their growth through childhood; and so, I've decided to share once more.
TITLE: Two Years Later: Happy Childhood Moments Of Kids Growing Up In My Neighborhood

DESCRIPTION: Have you ever seen a nice motivational poster that touched you where none has touched before? Well, I haven't! So I took a few famous motivational quotes and added my own twist to them. Below, you'll see a series of Demotivational Posters I made to please my sarcastic self. All of them are also available for purchase (everybody got bills to pay, right?).
TITLE: If Motivational Quotes Were Honest, They Would Be Like This

DESCRIPTION:
Hi my name is Tijana, I come from Serbia and I am a professional nail tehnician. It all
startes out small but now I have my own small nails salon called 'Flawless'. The difference between me and others of my profession is that I can portray anything my clients want on their nails.
TITLE: I Create Timeless Artwork On Nails

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Kristina, I'm a photographer from Moscow. And one day, my friends and I just took tickets and got to Japan during the cherry blossom.
Japan itself is an amazing country, and during the pink madness it turns into a fairy tale.
TITLE: I Bought Tickets To Japan During The Cherry Blossom, But Ended Up In A Pink Fairy Tale Instead

DESCRIPTION: Moms are the funniest members of the family. If you don't believe us then just click here. But what makes them so hilarious? Easy. They're funny when they want to be, but they're also funny when they don't even realize it!

DESCRIPTION: Photographer Roger Weiss was finding himself increasingly disassociating with the photographs depicting women, so he set out to capture the female form in a different way.

DESCRIPTION: I'm Koko with love - an artist who likes to try out different styles and subjects. I begun with making jewelry that looks like pastries, cupcakes and other sweet things which was featured here on Bored Panda some time ago. Recently I started experimenting with the dark, fantasy and mystical realms.
TITLE: I Make Magical Polymer Clay Jewelry That Is Taken Out Of My Fantasy Worlds

DESCRIPTION: so i travel on average about 1500/2000km a week by car for business in and around South Africa , so i developed a liking for messing around with a few photography apps on my smartphone.Eventually started to get the hang of it , i started to keep an eye out for eye catching natural and man made geometry. Currently using a Huawei P9 that collaborated with Leica for the camera , it has 2 lenses - one processing RGB and the other in monochrome (b&w) which apparently allows for 150/200% more light into the lense which i find the detail to be amazing .
TITLE: I Travel Across South Africa For Business And Enjoy Shooting And Editing Surreal-Symmetric Cell-Phonography

DESCRIPTION:
My objects sometimes take hundreds of hours to create due to fact that I use hand tools only. No machinery takes part in the process, every stitch is done by hand and there are thousands of it in every project.
With a background of having studied Biology I find my inspiration in nature where I have fallen in love with organic shapes and structures.
TITLE: I Sculpt Leather To Create Surreal Characters And Objects

DESCRIPTION: Hello! My name is Maui. I'm 18 years old. I really love art, not only drawing, I also paint, carve, and making 3D projects.

DESCRIPTION: I am a 25 years old artist based in the Philippines focusing on traditional drawing. This was my passion ever since I was a kid. Now I started binge watching on tv series late 2013.

DESCRIPTION:
Have you ever seen a Cornsh rex cat? How about CRX kitten? This domestic cat breed is famous for its curly fur and huge ears. Little CRX kittens look like bats / aliens with their ridiculously big ears and eyes.
Cornish Rex cats are highly active and social, topped with kitten-like playful attitude throughout their whole lives.

DESCRIPTION:
I do digital commissions of pets in a non typical way. Anywhere from animals in space or with fantastic colors, my vector art transforms ordinary pet portraits into magical ones. In this particular series I showcase pets surrounded by food, because what is better than your best buddy and their favorite treat (or yours)?
Owners choose how many items they want and what sort of snacks they want for their furry friends, then I create it in adobe illustrator.

DESCRIPTION: In my early teens I had this habit to collect attractive ,shiny metal scrap from the roadside, house etc in India and store it in my small closet. One fine day I had a cupboard full of waste scrap!. That was the time when i started to up cycle this scrap into something innovative and beautiful.
TITLE: I Make Amazing Models From Scrap Metal

DESCRIPTION: I bet you can remember having a crush at some time of your life. Daydreaming, tingly feeling deep inside your stomach, inability to clearly express your thoughts when your crush is around..

DESCRIPTION: I visited Iceland recently and I fell in love with this country. Lot of beautiful waterfalls, stunning landscape, active vulcanos, many glaciers and empty areas. I especially liked the atmosphere around the glaciers, because it reminded me the global warming.
TITLE: Humans And The Glaciers. The Icelandic Melancholy

DESCRIPTION: This is a really hard topic to talk about. I've done some things I'm ashamed of. Things that make me feel like an awful mother.

DESCRIPTION: In addition to documenting plants of my backyard, I also photograph them in Blacklight (UVA) Party Lights.

DESCRIPTION: I FINALLY got puppies! I know that no one will care, or upvote this post, but please don't hate me just for posting these adorable things on BP! Anyway, the puppy's are Gerberian Shepskies (German Shepard + Siberian Husky). I hope they will brighten your day!

DESCRIPTION: I (Victoria Morphine) fighting with demons with my lenses and creativity. I'm 24 years old woman, self-taught artist. I started my more professional journey with art almost 10 years ago, art was my way to help myself with stress and frustration.

DESCRIPTION: One of the most challenging experience that I've ever faced back in the school days were the exams. It involves 5% crying, 7% hair loss, 25% praying to God, 19% actual studying, 11% snacking, 23% praying to other Gods/mythical beings and 10% screaming randomly. As a survivor, I can tell you that they don't matter now.

DESCRIPTION: Mojito and his fellow siblings were born to a dog who got pregnant after running away. When the mother came back and her humans found out about her new puppies, they didn't want anything to do with them so they immediately surrendered the gang to Love Leo Rescue in Los Angeles.

DESCRIPTION: Life is like the longest of negotiations. We are like skiffs in a turbulent sea, as we struggle to retain some semblance of control while braving the incessant waves of a myriad of challenges, disappointments, exertions and triumphs which daily life throws at us. Physiological and psychological responses to these artistic and ideological exchanges crafted by our (sub)conscious minds come in a variety of forms which are not necessarily tangible or rational in nature.
TITLE: Strolling Through The Red Line Area

DESCRIPTION: Hey guys, my name is Tom aka. Sarid One, I´m a Graffiti Artist from Berlin, Germany and I love Star Wars, and I know you too. So I decided to paint a special Graffiti Piece for you to celebrate May the 4th.

DESCRIPTION:
Irina Safronova is a professional photo editor experienced in photo retouching, photo manipulation and matte painting (composing photorealistic images of raw parts) in Adobe Photoshop. She has worked in this area for over 7 years.

DESCRIPTION:
Hey guys! My name is Jon Youshaei and I'm the founder of a cartoon series called Every Vowel. Why that name you might ask? Because I have every vowel in my last name and thought it'd be fun to create a cartoon world where the characters were each of the vowels.
My cartoons have been featured in Forbes, Time, and BuzzFeed with many calling it the Dilbert for Millennials.

DESCRIPTION: Here at Bored Panda, we firmly believe that any embarrassing situation can be laughed off - unless you made it onto this list. DESCRIPTION: It may be the year 2017, but some people still have a hard time understanding rape, and constantly look for ways to blame the victim. A North London girl took to Twitter to say it a little louder for the people in the back, and her visceral explanation of the heinous act struck a chord.

DESCRIPTION: I would like this post to put a smile on your face...

DESCRIPTION: More drawings on cups, plus made some styrofoam shelves...

DESCRIPTION:
A friend of mine found this digital picture on Pinterest of a cat looking at the moon and wanted to see who could paint something like it. 
Here's my take of a Kitty and moon painting.

DESCRIPTION: Easter painting I did. All spray paint. check out the video and my other paintings.

DESCRIPTION: I've been working on a series of little octopus refrigerator magnets. Each one is sculpted by hand with polymer clay, and are all approximately 3 inches long.

DESCRIPTION:
Puns are the best. A lot of my illustrations revolve around them and they're always so much fun to draw.
Last week, as a little creative exercise, I challenged myself to come up with one silly food pun each day.
TITLE: Freshly Picked Food Puns That I Create To Make Your Day

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Michelle and I dress to match wall murals and art in museums and art galleries. What started as a coincidence in 2013 has turned into what I call my passion project, Dressed To Match.
I have a degree in Art History and have always had a love for fashion, so this has allowed me to combine the two.
TITLE: I Coordinate My Outfits To Match Art

DESCRIPTION: The pregnancy journey that is uniquely different from each mommy, but yet strangely relatable for all mommies. As a first time mom-to-be, I get to experience some of these 'moments' which I'll treasure for years to come. There's no other better way to 'store' these memories, but to illustrate them through my very own Preggy Visual Journal.
TITLE: As A First-Time Mom-To-Be, I Illustrated My Pregnancy Journey

DESCRIPTION:
I got into digital art after my father gave me a 1 megapixel camera back in 2002. I already had spent years painting and drawing and the camera was the perfect tool for endless experimentation. I tried then a scanner and started merging my drawings with my photos because photography was never satisfying to me; my head was always way too up in the clouds to portrait reality, I knew I wanted quiet the contrary, to destroy it and make something new out of it, and what better medium than photomontage to do that?
I'm deeply inspired by flora and its complex shapes.
TITLE: I Create Sinister Digital Art That Shows Nature In A Constant Tension With The Human Body

DESCRIPTION:
Probably the most of you have seen a lot of dramatic black and white images representing the german WWII concentration camps.
As I always try to make something special, something different, my idea was to photograph this these horrific places in color.
In order to represent the place as dramatic as it is, the bright midday sun helped me with those strong shadows making high contrast images.
TITLE: I Photographed Auschwitz And Birkenau In Color

DESCRIPTION:
For my first panda post I am sharing a couple of digital paintings I recently completed.
They usually take around 20-30 hours (recent ones) to complete and each gets a number. The goal is to reach 365 pieces and of course, learn as much as possible while doing it.
TITLE: I Love Painting

DESCRIPTION: I am a 19 year old self taught artist. I started drawing two years ago. My first drawing was for an assignment that we had in school.
TITLE: I Drew 3d Illustration That Will Trick Your Mind

DESCRIPTION:
I gave my Visual Communication students at Fashion Institute of Technology the same illustration project I was recently assigned by The New York Times concerning the age of Trump. 
I know some of the students were sharing the emotions of fear and loathing that have permeated the zeitgeist in the age of Trump.
My hope was that in addition to creating a compelling illustration, the process of creating a work of art would help them purge their negative emotions via catharsis.
TITLE: Art Students Speak Truth To Trump

DESCRIPTION: Last October I created 31 depictions of mental health as part of the inktober series. I was able to donate over $3k to mental health research. With Mental Health Awareness month I wanted to to see if I could triple it by offering my inktober series as shirts.
TITLE: I Made My Inktober Illness Series Into Shirts To Help Raise Money For Mental Health Month

DESCRIPTION: I reshot some of my old canvas paintings, these are mostly painted with acrylics, and it can take a very long time to complete each of them.
TITLE: My 500 Hour Paintings On Canvas

DESCRIPTION: Meet these two prom queens, an 18-year-old from Florida, Brenda Sierra, and her 7-year-old rescue dachshund, Sasha. Together they just made the headlines when Brenda and Sasha showed up at the prom in matching outfits!
TITLE: 18-Year-Old Makes Her Dachshund A Matching Prom Dress, Wins The Internet

DESCRIPTION:
Being a doctor is clearly one of the hardest and most stressful jobs on the planet. You're taking care of someone else's life, for crying out loud! However, that doesn't mean all doctors have to be serious all the time.
Bored Panda collected a list of random doctor acts of humor, to prove that even doctors like to have fun once in a while.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Doctors That Prove Laughter Is The Best Medicine

DESCRIPTION: Meet Tre Booker and his girlfriend Madison - a completely adorable couple that just recently attended their school prom. Just like most high school couples, before heading to the dance they stopped to snap a few pictures, which Madison later shared on Twitter. But then she received an unpleasant comment from a body-shamer...

DESCRIPTION: As any cartoonist will tell you, getting published in the New Yorker is a notoriously difficult thing to do. Just ask Phil Jones. He's an illustrator, designer, and art director from Minneapolis, Minnesota who's been trying to get his work into the famous American magazine for months, but having not yet succeeded, he decided to share some of his favorite rejects online instead.
TITLE: This Cartoonist Got Rejected By The New Yorker, So He Decided To Post Rejected Works For Everyone To Judge

DESCRIPTION: When we were kids we had a dream, it was growing up and get to work for Darth Vader. We were lucky enough to miss all our shots and still make it! We had such a great time working in the Death Star, but things didn't end up well there. You may have heard about it.
TITLE: Discover The Life Of This Couple Of Stormtroopers On Earth Through Instagram

DESCRIPTION: panish designer Gerard Rubio merged knitting and digital technology, allowing people to create very personal wardrobes. His creation, Kniterate, acts as a 3D printer and allows designers to digitally create or edit/use existing projects and transform them into wearable clothes in a matter of hours.

DESCRIPTION: French Bulldogs are quite possibly the most desired dog in this day and age. From their small stature to their over the top personalities, it is easy to see why we fell in love with this breed. When Ms Holly became pregnant in December 2016, we decided to do something fun for her last litter.
TITLE: We Created Adorable Maternity And Newborn Photoshoot With Holly The French Bulldog

DESCRIPTION: Adrspach is the place of rocky formations in Czech Rep. near the border with Poland and the place where The Chronicles of Narnia were shooted.
TITLE: My First Steps In Photography In The Rocky City Of Narnia

DESCRIPTION: What seemed like an ordinary father and son's camping trip took a cute turn when a stray cat came to their camp. The guys quickly made friends with the feline but weren't really prepared for a starving visitor, so they improvised and caught a bluegill for a cat to feast on. But then... the cat just vanished. Until the next morning that is, when it came back bearing gifts.
TITLE: Father And Son Showed Some Love To A Stray Cat, Next Day She Came Back With A Surprise

DESCRIPTION: Size does matter, says potter Jon Almeda. His tiny handmade ceramics are 1 (2.54cm) in scale but their quality is everything you'd expect from top class ceramics.

DESCRIPTION: This photographic portrait project's aim, is to challenge any preconceptions people have about individuals who have a learning disability. The photographers brief was to look past the disability and focus on ability, personality and uniqueness. This film captures the journey we went on and the empowerment everyone who was involved felt.
TITLE: This Is Me: We Photographed People Beyond Their Disabilities

DESCRIPTION: I found a wooden teddy bear pull toy at a yard sale. It inspired me to create a new one similar to it but featuring Bruce Lee doing Kung Fu. That launched a new art form where I take grown-up subject matter like horror films and adapt it to juvenile playthings.
TITLE: I Make Preschool Toys For Grownups

DESCRIPTION: At the beginning there was just a digital artist. Working with musicians, dj's, sportswear and sport stars. After all this you are slowly starting to feel low.

DESCRIPTION: Hi! I'm Donna and I love illustrating on photos. I think life is so much more fun when you add funny characters and art to them. I'm dedicated to sharing my art with the world and showcasing how animations can add more to your day!

DESCRIPTION: Hippos have something of a reputation for being rather cantankerous creatures, but you really wouldn't believe it when you see these cute little critters. Check out this list, compiled by Bored Panda, for some of the most adorable baby hippos we could find.

DESCRIPTION: Seatylock is a bicycle saddle that quickly becomes a solid one meter bicycle lock. Fully compatible with any bike! This genius device solves two problems at once - its users can forget carrying a lock and they won't have to worry about saddle theft. Seatylock is compatible with any bike and it takes only 30 seconds to transform it. The trusty buddy is currently available for $99 on Amazon!
TITLE: Bicycle Seat That Converts Into A Lock

DESCRIPTION: The closer you look, the more these intricate bronze sculptures reveal. USA-based Columbian artist Nano Lopez's distinctive bright style produces pieces that look like from a world without borders of ordinary maps.
TITLE: Stunning Bronze Sculptures By Nano Lopez

DESCRIPTION: It's been tough going lately for Kiefer. After a double eye enucleation (removal of the eyeballs) a couple years back, the terminally ill dog's condition was steadily decreasing. And for the last couple weeks, the poor fella was barely moving at all. So when one night at 1:30 AM he jumped up and insisted on going for a walk, his owner knew exactly what needed to happen next.
TITLE: Terminally Sick Dog Insists On Taking A Walk At 1:30, Owner Knows Exactly Where To Take Him

DESCRIPTION:
Is it just me, or does it look like this beauty dipped her little face into some ink?Meet Smudge, a 2-year-old Himalayan kitty who took over Instagram with her huge eyes and adorably smudged face. The fluffy princess loves boxes, small spaces and looking fabulous. Smudge also loves being photographed, but who could blame her?
Meet Smudge, a 2-year-old Himalayan kitty who took over Instagram with her huge eyes and adorably smudged face.
TITLE: Meet Smudge, A Himalayan Kitty Who Was Dipped Into Ink And Became An Instant Instagram Celebrity

DESCRIPTION: Hannu Huhtamo is a Helsinki-based Finnish painter who uses light instead of paint to create stunning images. His art is based on cameras, set to take long exposure shots. While the camera's shutter is open you are able to draw in the air by moving <...> light sources in front of the camera, Hannu explains.
TITLE: Long Exposure Light Art

DESCRIPTION: Like every large metropolis, there is an outside and underground life. Two different cities that is one and the same. The subway is a second world - hidden, dark and dirty - where people spend a non-negligible time of their day regarding their location in Paris or suburbs.
TITLE: A Tale Of Two Cities: A Journey In The Parisian Subway

DESCRIPTION:
I take photographs of landscapes on film, I then digitally edit them, completely saturating the colour and altering the perspective. I paint them with oil on canvas creating these surreal dreamscapes.
I let parts of the painting leak out onto the space so that the landscapes radiate out as if you could walk right into them.
TITLE: I Paint Dreamscapes From Film Photographs

DESCRIPTION:
One of my dreams to travel the world with my camera, take photos of wildlife animals and under the sea creatures, swimming with whales, dolphins, etc. like a National Geographic photographer, so was the purpose of this project to create my own wildlife photography using some animals and sea creatures models in my room studio, until I'm able to do the real thing.
Start to work on this project 2 months ago, getting the figures was the hard part when I contact the company MOJO FUN that make high detail animals figures to ask if I can photograph their stuff they were really cool about it, even better they send me more figures all away from China to photograph!
For the North pole photo, I use 2 flash heads one on the top (Soft-Box), and one behind the background to get a nice clean white background, for snow I use snow in can I buy it from the gift shop for 1.
TITLE: I Created Wildlife Photography In My Room!

DESCRIPTION: Whether you're a beginner or an expert photographer, getting that perfect shot often takes painstaking effort and excruciating time. South African camera pro Sheldon Evans has a few quick - and we mean snappy - tricks that can cut your shooting time in half and save you heaps of hassle.
TITLE: 5 Genius DIY Camera Hacks That Will Greatly Improve Your Photography Skills In 1 Minute

DESCRIPTION: Crows are the most badass birds in the animal kingdom who give zero ducks. Want proof? Just take a look at any of the pictures below. Crows (and corvids, the family that includes crows, ravens, rooks and magpies), like to pull the tails of birds and animals who are twice as big as them 'cause they are not afraid. Some argue that this behavior was developed to snatch food away - but the other theory is that crows simply like to behave like major assholes.
TITLE: 10+ Pics That Prove Corvids Are The Biggest Baddasses In The Animal Kingdom

DESCRIPTION:
As a mother of five precious daughters I like to observe children in their daily lives. I believe in giving boundaries to our children, but within those boarders they need the freedom to create and explore their own world.
My daughters are aged between 8 and 19 years now.
TITLE: I Love It When Children Get The Freedom To Explore Their Own World

DESCRIPTION:
The internet is impressed with the make-up done by David Harris.
Conquering thousands of followers attentive to new make-ups.
Hold your breath and enjoy the pictures!

DESCRIPTION:
I am an illustrator and paper engineer from germany.
I created this pop-up book for my final exam in 2010 but there were still some pages unfinished.
Now, 7 years later I've finally finished it!
The story is about a homeless girl who wants to join a traveling circus.
TITLE: A Pop-Up Book Of A Vintage Circus

DESCRIPTION:
When I said to my five years old niece that I'm going to build a cabin in the backyard, she answered me that she didn't want a cabin but a Princess palace. 
Ok, I've done my best..
TITLE: I Turned Old Wooden Pallets Into A Little Castle For My 5-Year-Old Niece

DESCRIPTION:
The subject of the seven deadly sins has fascinated me for years, so much so that I am already designing the third series of them.
I started with the single canvas one which has a partner: The seven heavenly virtues. Designed to sit opposite each other in a banquet hall.

DESCRIPTION: This time we dived into the hypnotising beauty of colored ink in water and the interaction of this substance with different elements.

DESCRIPTION: Just as you should never put car keys in the hands of someone who's had one too many, you should also keep them as far away from the computer as possible.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Barclay, the Golden Retriever and his best friend, a four-year-old Pekin duck Rudy, who both have a thing or two to teach you about friendship.

DESCRIPTION: My name is Yulia Kelly, I am CraftMaster of polymer Clay. I started creating my jewelry since 2009. All this time I was engaged (and I continue to be engaged) in search of own style and perfecting my techniques.

DESCRIPTION: I'm young suffering artist, and only thing that gives me relief is expressing myself through many ways of art. I do photography, I paint, write..

DESCRIPTION:
I wanted to share some of my friend's art with you. His name is Andrew Ken Stewart.
He meditates every day, and sometimes he sees landscapes in his mind.

TITLE: Here Is What The Giant Planet Jupiter Looks Like From Below, From Its South Pole

DESCRIPTION: I am a self taught artist living in Cornwall. Graphite pencils are my favorite, but just started to use colour pencils.

DESCRIPTION:
When I asked people from my home town Hull to contact me with their favourite film character, scene and local location in order to recreate their favourite movie moment I didn't know what to expect.
Within hours my phone went crazy! Dozens of enthusiastic callers were talking to me with amazing ideas about the film moment they wanted to recreate.
As a result some weekends I was shooting twelve Hullywood Icons photographs a day each with a different set up, character and location.
TITLE: Welcome To Hullywood The Place Where Locals Pose As Hollywood Stars

DESCRIPTION: I find old vintage motor oil cans, clean them up, and turn them into beautiful looking and sound electric guitars.

DESCRIPTION:
There are billions of gamers worldwide and a lot of them are so passionate about gaming to decide to transform themselves, for special occasions, into their favourite games characters and today's viral news is, of course, about cosplay.
Just posted 16 hours ago by redditor karabatic33, the photo below has gone viral really fast by showing a really impressive makeup work on a model that turned her into a perfect lifelike copy of Elizabeth character from the game Bioshock Infinite!
Who is the beautiful cosplayer? Her name is Ilona Bugaeva, professional Russian makeup artist, who is already quite famous in the Cosplay world due the extremely high quality of her cosplay transformations.

DESCRIPTION: My name is Thomas Dambo, I'm a Danish artist who works with recycled materials. Over the last 3 years I made 25 big recycled sculptures around the world. Recently I made 6 hidden giants in my hometown of Copenhagen.

DESCRIPTION:
Hello! My name is Tatiana, I live in Russia and paint since childhood. I love fantasy stories - probably these magical worlds are from where all the dragons and unicorns made their way to my creations.
First, they settled on the stones - agate and jasper, then moved to wood and mother-of-pearl.

DESCRIPTION: It is known, that people who wear bright colorful socks are more creative and successful, they know the rules and are willing to break them. And we believe, that crazy socks should be delivered in more interesting and bright packaging. This is why we created the idea of Scented & Canned socks: our socks come sealed in tin cans and you can also choose the scent.

DESCRIPTION: I've spent two years travelling around the world to photograph interesting and unique corners. So I extended the project visiting Budapest a few times, cross-country Romania and my hometown Oradea, western Romania.
TITLE: I Travel Around The World To Photograph Corners

DESCRIPTION:
I chose to make these portraits, because I think that cockroaches and these characters are very similar in many ways, cockroaches relate to all the negative and repulsive to me these characters have done things that should not exist in our world as genocide , wars, violence, discrimination, racism, abuse of authority and many despicable things that everyone should condemn in general.
It is a protest that I, as an artist and as a human do, and my goal is to make others aware that this is not allowed anymore.
I use oil paint and also used a small brush to make the tiniest details.
TITLE: I Painted Donald Trump And Vladimir Putin On Real Cockroaches

One Bored Panda reader has just sent us this picture of the 'Tell The Horse Heads Apart Challenge' - can you guess which horse the head belongs to? We're not sure if this is some kind of personality test, or something that checks how resistant you are to optical illusions... Or could it even be some kind of scary horse conspiracy trap?
One thing is for sure - you bet you'll have to look twice or thrice at the photo to get the right answer. We can't figure it out ourselves, so please help us out by sharing your opinion in the comments below.

DESCRIPTION:
Depression is not easy thing to deal with, but sometimes you can take your weakness and turn it into something beautiful.
That's exactly what polish artist Dawid Planeta did - to help himself he created an imaginary world where a small man is traveling through long forgotten jungle meeting his weaknesses and fears presented as giant animals with glowing eyes. The vision created by the artist is dark, mysterious, and very beautiful.

DESCRIPTION: If you liked last year's body marbling trend, wait till you see this new makeup trend that we just can't get enough of - marble lips!

DESCRIPTION:
Paddington and Butler were inseparable friends since the day one.
Butler the cat unexpectedly came into our lives on 1st January 2014, clearly too young to be away from his mum he was drawn to Paddington and the affection he received from him.
Their bond was instant I would find them sitting together looking at the window or cuddled up in bed even trying to share food bowl, this led Paddington's few failed attempts at using the kitty litter.

DESCRIPTION: I bring toys to life using creativity and jaw-dropping photography - creating motion and emotion where none exists. Star Wars, Marvel, The Muppets, Disney, Planet of the Apes, Godzilla, Alien and more..

DESCRIPTION:
This is an ongoing project, which I started in 2011. The idea is simple: I take random songs and create minimalistic posters for them, only using pictograms.
I'm trying to depict the song title in the most simple way, often combining different objects and shapes, to make a funny and/or clever visual punchline.

DESCRIPTION: Hello, I'm an estonian illustrator Marita Liivak and recently I bought myself a bunch of copic markers. I had been dreaming of these markers for years and finally got a chance to buy a bunch of them to start my amazing colourful journey. DESCRIPTION: There's something to be said about brotherly love, and the strength of a sibling bond. My 13 year old son Anthony struggles with depression. It has been a battle for him for some time now, and it isn't always easy for him to be light and joyful.

DESCRIPTION:

If you say I can't draw! I say you can.

DESCRIPTION: Most of my images are self portraits that portray a quiet celebration of loneliness. I often feel disconnected from society and I believe that gives me a sense of freedom and inner acceptance that I would not be able to find if I looked to my community. The outer world appears to have a strong preference for extroversion.

DESCRIPTION: Jimmy Fallon is at it again with his hilarious hashtag game. This time he's asking people to share their weirdest, funniest, or most embarrassing stories about their dentist by using the hashtag #MyWeirdDentist.

DESCRIPTION:
My love for dogs is real. Apparently, many other people love their dogs just as much as I do! Over the past few years, my love for creating family portraiture has bridged the gap into dog portraits.
I use colour to express the personalities of the dogs that I paint.
TITLE: I Show My Love For Dogs By Painting Their Colorful Portraits

DESCRIPTION:
Inspired by the architectural variety of Romanian homes, I created a series of surreal photographic collages which feature the eclectic overall look of my own country, fluctuating between tradition and modernity.
©Felicia Simion 2017.
TITLE: I Made Surreal Collages Featuring Home Architecture In Romania

DESCRIPTION:
Dubai-based couple: Eva and Tamas, the founders of Analog Dynasty have created a series of extraordinary vintage photos of modern Dubai. Why it is unique?
First of all the city is so new, this method never had the chance to capture it in today's form.
It is all hand-made using a very old analog method: the tintypes, which you probably saw in those old western movies.
TITLE: Couple Uses A Retro Process To Photograph Dubai

DESCRIPTION:
Somehow, everybody sees a cardboard box differently. Some people see it as a storage unit, some cats see it as a perfect home, and Japanese artist Monomi Ohno sees it as a building material for her amazing 3-D sculptures.
It all began during her studies at Osaka University of the Arts, where she decided to specialize in 3-D animation.
TITLE: Japanese Cardboard Artist Turns Old Amazon Boxes Into Tanks, Food And Other Incredible Sculptures

DESCRIPTION:

I create whimsical pieces of art, using Photoshop and photography.

DESCRIPTION:
During Easter I went to visit Langedrag Nature Park in Norway. The park is situated 1000 metres above sea level on the peak of a hilltop overlooking the magical fjords and snowy mountains of Numedal and Hallingdal.
I was fortunate enough to spend some time with some of the Wolves in this stunning location.
TITLE: I Took Powerful Portraits Of Wolves In Norway

DESCRIPTION: At over 5 feet across and over 7 feet long, I created this orchid chandelier out of nothing more then paper and wire. These photos were taken in the Huntington Botanical Library's gift shop in Pasadena California. The Huntington commissioned my company, Solo Wing Design to create a giant chandelier to be installed in their All White section, and in keeping with the botanical theme of the Huntington, I decided to create a chandelier out of orchids.
TITLE: This Giant 7ft Long Orchid Chandelier Is Handmade Out Of Paper

DESCRIPTION: I started working on the series in 2011, literally learning about Hong Kong as I went along. The more locations I scouted, the stronger the impulsion to push further and explore more. I just had to see it all, even the most obscure and secluded corners that I would never think of visiting again.
