DESCRIPTION: Drinking Tea is the name of an unusual and eye-catching ongoing project by Chinese artist Lei Xue. The sculptor, photographer, painter and video artist uses porcelain to create sculptures that resemble crumpled and discarded soda cans, and as you can see from the pictures below, the result is both intriguing and mind-boggling.
TITLE: Smashed Can Sculptures Made In The Ancient Style Of Ming Dynasty Porcelain

DESCRIPTION:
If seeing Canada by train isn't on your bucket list, it totally should be! We hopped aboard the Via Rail Train in February and crossed 5 time zones, 8 provinces, and covered 3,900 miles!
With 2017 being Canada's 150th anniversary, there is no better time than to take an epic journey. Take a peek at our pictures and we promise you will be inspired to travel across Canda by train.
TITLE: We Traveled 3,900 Miles By Train To Capture The Beauty Of Canada In Winter

DESCRIPTION: You know the saying you should be careful what you wish for? Well, you should be careful what you order too and we're about to show you why.
TITLE: 10+ Food Orders That Were Terribly Misunderstood

DESCRIPTION: Tokyo-based German photographer Michael Wolf invites you to take a look at the Japanese capital through the eyes of the city's daily commuter. And as you're about to see, that sight is actually quite horrendous.
TITLE: The Horrors Of Tokyo Rush Hour Commute Captured By Michael Wolf

DESCRIPTION: A couple of years ago, I was strolling around in Gothenburg when I was approached by three guys. At first nothing seemed strange, but when one of them distracted me I was startled. Another one must have lifted my phone from my pocket while I was distracted, because I really didn't notice anything at the time.
TITLE: I Developed The First Anti-Theft Product That Physically Locks Your Phone To Your Pocket

DESCRIPTION:
Shuffle Designs is a Cairo based design studio, interested in experimenting with materials and mixed media.
It was founded in 2012 by Architect Amal Salah, who believes that every material is precious, it depends only on how you use it.
Shuffle Designs aims to introduce a shuffle in the field of home accessories,and decor by its unique and innovative products.
TITLE: Portraits For Inspiring Movies From Thousands Of Screw Nails By Amal Salah

DESCRIPTION: We found the pigeon laying eggs in our ashtray.
TITLE: Pigeon Found The Best Place For Laying Eggs

DESCRIPTION: Remember the bunny succulent plants? If you liked those you're in for a real treat because someone just shared a pic of succulent plants that look like dolphins and the Japanese are going crazy about them!
TITLE: Dolphin Succulents Are The Latest Craze In Japan

DESCRIPTION:
I had the opportunity to encounter Bedouins living in Sinai, Egypt during a 2016 trip there.
These Bedouins are living in the Sinai Peninsula and in the Negev. Bedouins are divided in 12 tribes, or 12 families.
TITLE: I Shot GIF Portraits Of Bedouins From Sinai

DESCRIPTION: The fact that we humans don't speak Meow doesn't mean cats aren't trying to talk to us. Luckily, while we are trying to unlock the secrets of feline speech, one kitty learned French. Parole de chat uploaded its conversation with a human to YouTube, and it exploded, reaching almost 6.5M views.
TITLE: If A Cat Learned French

DESCRIPTION:
Recalling very strongly the work of Hotkenobi, the photos of Bmyhero also stage superhero toys.
A native of Bali, the photographer uses well-known figures such as Deadpool, Wolverine or Spiderman to place them in funny and offbeat situations.
TITLE: Hero Figures Can Be Found In Amusing Compositions

DESCRIPTION: Las Vegas-based pastry chef Amaury Guichon (previously here) sculpts chocolate like it was clay. One of his latest cocoa masterpiece was a life-size nautilus. Although the lifespan of these marine molluscs may exceed 20 years, Amaury's 100% chocolate sculptures don't stand a chance to live longer than 20 seconds if I was to be around them!
TITLE: 100% Chocolate Nautilus Sculpture

DESCRIPTION: Footage was released showing a boa constrictor, one of the largest snakes in the world, writhing in pain after attacking a porcupine and getting pierced by its spikes - and the video itself is even painful to watch.
TITLE: Snake Tries To Eat A Porcupine, Regrets It Immediately

DESCRIPTION: When my son turned 4, all he cared about was superheroes. He watched superheroes TV shows, wore superhero printed T-shirts and ate from superhero plates. When I wanted to have a conversation with him, I had to talk about superheroes, I guess you get the picture.
TITLE: When Superheros Took Over My World

DESCRIPTION: In 2014 I started crafting things from recycled metals and wood I had lying around the house. This included a lot of timber from a few trees we'd just chopped down. Through a lot of practice and experimentation I began making these wood log ring boxes which now ship all over the world for weddings, engagements, gifts and keepsakes.
TITLE: Natural Ring Boxes Made From Fallen Branches

DESCRIPTION: Spring is my favorite season because all nature is coming to life in a unique and optimistic way. Seeing the sun shining with grace in a beautiful Saturday morning I decided to make the best out of it and meet with Anca Berteanu (aka the Little Ballerina) for a little photoshoot. We added a little special ingredient to make spring even more colorful and we mixed ballet with photography once more.
TITLE: I Captured Stunning Portraits Of A Little Ballerina On A Beautiful Spring Day

DESCRIPTION: Eight years ago I agreed to get a family cat. One of my three daughters was not keen on the idea so since she had to live with it she got to chose one she could possibly tolerate. This led us to shelters, pet stores and online adds with no luck.
TITLE: This Cat Enjoys Dressing Up!

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Juan Manuel Arena, know as Milaneso Napolitano on Instagram. 
I create these images using a home-camera, photoshop, lightroom and my imagination.
TITLE: I Create Surreal Photography

DESCRIPTION:
Hi, I'm Ewa from Poland and this is how I like my coffee! I like to take things on higher level, so when I got used of making those hearts, tulips and rosettes, I thought - why don't try to draw something more? And so I did. Maybe you have an idea what to put on my latte next?
All photos were taken by me.
TITLE: I Draw On My Coffee

DESCRIPTION:
I always loved drawing eyes. They are the most interesting part of the face for me.
Recently, when I was searching for a good picture of eyes to draw, I found a very interesting portrait.
TITLE: I Drew The Portraits Of Some Of My Favorite Celebrities

DESCRIPTION:
Writers On Their Hometowns/Human Cartography.
(Handmade papercut maps, with surgical blade)
TITLE: Paper Cut Maps: 12 Writers On Their Hometowns

DESCRIPTION:
Yesterday was National Puppy Day, so you know what that means: it's time to show some love to man's furry BFF. If you're looking for the perfect way to celebrate this tail-wagging occasion, look no further.
There's an Instagram account called Hot Dudes With Dogs that showcases a bunch of insanely hot men posing alongside their adorable puppy pals.
TITLE: This Instagram Of Hot Dudes With Dogs Brings Two Of Our Favorite Things Together

DESCRIPTION:
The weekend is approaching and some of you Bored Panda's out there will definitely go to celebrate something, be it a birthday or just a friday. It's quite funny to see how different we look when we're all dressed up and ready to party and how we look when we wake up in the morning realising that maybe we partied a bit too much.
What's a Bored Panda left to do but laugh at itself a bit! A great way to do just that is to share your before-after pic here!
The rules are very simple, just take a photo of you before the night out and then one the morning (or day) after! Don't forget to upvote and comment the best ones!
TITLE: Post A Picture Of You Before And After A Night Out

DESCRIPTION: I am a Berlin based illustrator and stroyteller, I love drawing bicycles and I love coffee. It has become a challenge of sorts to put random coffee stains on paper and look for bicycle stories in them by adding ink and watercolours. It's a lot of fun to do this.
TITLE: I Intentionally Spill Coffee On Paper And Look For Bicycle Stories In Them

DESCRIPTION:
A few years ago I returned to my childhood hobby - plasticine sculpting. I loved it so much that I tried to find the material that would look just like the plasticine but would be suitable for long use.
I tried polymer clay and it turned to be exactly what I needed.
TITLE: I Rediscovered The Joy Of Creating Pictures From Polymer Clay

DESCRIPTION: When Antonio Vivaldi published The Four Seasons in 1725 he probably didn't expect people melting candies to it. But that's exactly what filmmaker Erwin Trummer did and the video came out oh-so-satisfying to watch.
TITLE: Melting Candies To Classical Music

DESCRIPTION: During the 1950s and '60s, street photography was just starting to take foot as an art form, and French photographer René Maltête gave it a push with his candid and humorous scenes.
TITLE: 10+ Humorous Street Photos From 1950s France By René Maltête

DESCRIPTION: Ever seen a cat so fluffy it looks unreal? Meet Bone Bone from Thailand.
TITLE: Meet Bone Bone, The Enormous Fluffy Cat From Thailand That Everyone Asks To Take A Picture With

DESCRIPTION: Creating something with paper mâché is cheap and simple. Nearly all you need is some old newspaper, water, flour and paint.
TITLE: I Made A Simple Bunny Mask Out Of Paper Mâché

DESCRIPTION:
Photographer Kate Chebotareva reimagines her favorite pop-art masterpieces by Andy Warhol, Robert Indiana and other famous artists. She uploads her works to stock photography websites.
Kate is based in Rostov-on-Don, Russia.
TITLE: Artist Creates Beautiful Photos Inspired By Andy Warhol

DESCRIPTION: I present to you my magic balls. Each time they receive different and unique. They look like a small space.
TITLE: Magic Ball

DESCRIPTION:
As a french Illustrator, I was a bit bored of working it in my apartment on papers, in 'classical way'. So, one day I decided to put them in the streets and with other objects of everyday life. 
My aim is to find the other poetry mixing art and reality.
TITLE: I Put My Drawings Everywhere

DESCRIPTION:
Experience More Joy and Happiness in Your Kitchen!
Create a beautiful and unique patterns on your cookies and pies with our engraved rolling pins.
The engraved rolling pin will be a perfect gift for any occasions like wedding, Christmas, or just for fun!. It's a great gift not only for Kitchen gadgets fans.
TITLE: Engraved And Embossed Rolling Pins With Any Pattern

DESCRIPTION: When Sheri Kassalias agreed to nurse an orphaned opossum named Opie back to health until he is self-sufficient enough to be raised in the wild, the woman had no idea she would end up keeping the animal. Opie was so sweet he demanded to be held. He climbed up my sleeve, Kassalias, who works as an opossum and dog rescuer, told The Dodo. The opossum even began licking and grooming the woman, demonstrating a cat-like affectionate behaviour known as 'slubbing'. That's why Kassalias was told by another rescuer that she has a 'one in a million' opossum. While she released two other opossums she was fostering at the time, the woman knew what to do when it came to Opie...
TITLE: Woman Takes Care Of Orphaned Opossum, And Now It Refuses To Be Released Back Into The Wild

DESCRIPTION: Jesse Newton woke up in the middle of the night after his four-year-old son had crawled into bed smelling like dog shit. The smell was so horrifying, the man jumped out of the bed, only to discover that their Roomba robotic vacuum cleaner had ran over their dog's poop, and now covered the entire house with the doggie's turd - think rugs, floor, furniture and kid's toys. All of this horror happened while the whole family were soundly asleep...
TITLE: What Happens When Roomba Runs Over Dog Poo In The Middle Of The Night

DESCRIPTION: Using body paint and face paint I was able to transform myself in to different creations such as a White Walker from Game of Thrones
TITLE: Transforming In To A White Walker And Other Creations

DESCRIPTION: Sometimes your friends are assholes, and this is what they get by being assholes.
TITLE: I Made Rude Pictures For My Rude Friends

DESCRIPTION: This wall project was one of the fun project I ever had. It took me 8 hours and a lot of moves to complete the wall mural. This wall is painted for a company - Wired Hub, based in Jaipur, India.
TITLE: I Danced Along While Making Doodles On The Wall

DESCRIPTION: Artist Ciaran 'Yohan' Brennan has transformed his dull grey house into a playful and colorful painting. Not only that, he made an entertaining stop motion video capturing the whole process! Brennan's Spiderman-like skills should help him clean those windows as well.
TITLE: Artist Paints His House In Stop Motion

DESCRIPTION: This is what you get when you put The Beatles in a jam jar...
TITLE: When You Put The Beatles In A Jam Jar

DESCRIPTION: Sometimes it seems like Hollywood celebrities aren't actually people at all, but another species entirely. They live in big houses, they fly around in private jets, and they rarely mingle with the common plebs, so it's always nice when an A-lister shows us a side that we can all relate to. And as you can see from these hilarious tweets, movie star Anna Kendrick really doesn't seem that different from the rest of us.
TITLE: 10+ Reasons Why Anna Kendrick Is The Funniest Person On Twitter

DESCRIPTION: If you want to take tourist pictures of the attractions, you need to be up EARLY...
TITLE: I Managed To Capture Tourist Free Images Of Romes Sites

DESCRIPTION: Marketing a car costs big bucks. Unless you hire Felix Hernandez to do the job. You might remember his earlier project for Audi when Felix photographed a $40 miniature toy car and made it look like a $160K-worth R8, but for his latest assignment with Audi Middle East, Hernandez created a personal desert and roadway right in the middle of his own studio.
TITLE: Audi Asks Photographer To Shoot Their $50,000 Car, He Uses $32 Miniature Toy Car Instead

DESCRIPTION: Remember the geode cakes we wrote about last year? They were a huge hit and the Internet was obsessed, so this time we present to you - geode sweets.
TITLE: 10+ Geode Sweets That Are Too Pretty To Eat

DESCRIPTION: Ah, memes. Love them or hate them, they've become a staple on the Internet, and serve to connect us all using humor and a healthy dose of ridicule. Not only have memes been raised to an art form, they've literally been turned into art by a few talented individuals, and some of them look surprisingly wall-worthy.
TITLE: 10+ Oil Painted Memes For People Who Want To Look Classy, But Only Know Memes

DESCRIPTION: One crafty Finn turns cold and rusty scrap metal into elegant floral designs. He goes by the nickname FinnCrafted and this time he made a gorgeous rose.
TITLE: Turning Scrap Metal Into A Rose

DESCRIPTION:
What's more important: having a picture that simply confirms that you visited a special place? Or having one that reminds you of the feelings you had while looking at something incredible?
As for me, the answer is obvious.
Every time I see something captivating, I do want a pic that will remind me about this moment - but I prefer to turn my back to the camera and enjoy the view in front of me. And afterwards relive this feeling every time I look at the photo.
TITLE: I Turn My Back To The Camera When I See Something Beautiful

DESCRIPTION: What could be cuter than kids taking a sweet nap? But of course, children taking a nap with their doggies!
TITLE: 10+ Pics That Prove Dogs Are Better Than A Pillow

DESCRIPTION: Created using face and body paint, I transformed myself in to different characters
TITLE: Superhero And Villain Facepaint Creations

DESCRIPTION: The photographs were taken in the Skogar Folk Museum, founded in 1949. There you can catch the atmosphere of times long gone and experience how Icelanders lived through the centuries.
TITLE: I Photographed The Skogar Folk Museum In Iceland Showing A Village Trapped In A Time Capsule

DESCRIPTION: Was inspired by artist Dino Tomic. This is a study I did of his original piece.
TITLE: I Drew A Tiger With Table Salt

DESCRIPTION: Mechanized industrial production may produce MORE footwear than traditional handicraft shoemakers, but that doesn't mean its products are better in quality. As this video by Turkish advertising agency .NESS shows, shoemakers are experts of attention to detail and craftsmanship, something that a lot of people still value.
TITLE: Making Shoes By Hand

DESCRIPTION:
Yummy Typeface is a series of alphabets I created for 36daysoftype04 inspired by food.
It was my first participation in this Instagram challenge and I decided I'll make something I love out of it. Food!
It was slightly tricky to think and create a food element or item that looks exactly like the alphabet without much change to the actual product itself.
TITLE: I Created A Yummy Typeface That Would Make You Hungry

DESCRIPTION: A couple of years ago, I began the new year at an emotional rock bottom. The prior several months I spent struggling a worsening depression left me at a point to where I didn't want to go on anymore. I was hopelessly unable to look past the constant destructive and self-loathing thoughts I had in my head.
TITLE: I Created A Comic Strip To Turn My Depressive Pain Into Laughs

DESCRIPTION: I had brought my new green cheek conure home three days ago when I took this video,
TITLE: My Conure Fell Asleep On My Knee

DESCRIPTION: Alonso Cisneros is a street artist in New York. His work combines street art and jokes, and is meant to interact with people and the environment.
TITLE: Interactive Street Art

DESCRIPTION:
New York Times best-selling author and dance photographer Jordan Matter will blow you away with his incredible images of dancers effortlessly showing off their craft in amazing ways. Best known for his previous works Dancers Among Us and Dancers After Dark, Jordan always bring spontaneity and authentic passion to every shoot - no matter where or when.
His latest book project is Tiny Dancers Among Us and will be a celebration of the everyday moments of childhood.
TITLE: 10+ Children Effortlessly Performing Impossible Dance Moves

DESCRIPTION: The problem with the internet is that it makes everything look so easy. Take baking for example. Have a quick scroll through Instagram and Pinterest and you'll find countless cakes baked so perfectly that they barely even seem real. But they are, and they were baked by humans, so if they can do it, why can't you? It can't be that difficult...right?
TITLE: Expectations Vs Reality: 10+ Of The Worst Cake Fails Ever

DESCRIPTION: There are architects who either don't have a clue what they're doing or they just want to watch the world burn. Bored Panda has collected some of the most horrible architecture designs, and they seem to be created just to torture people.
TITLE: 10+ Accidents Waiting To Happen Thanks To These Architects And Designers

DESCRIPTION: Dating is like a roller coaster. Sometimes it's fun, sometimes it's awkward, but you never know how it'll go until you try. Luckily, even if the date goes horribly, you can at least get a great tweet out of it!
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Tweets About Dating That Tell The Story Of Your Life

DESCRIPTION: After extreme drought hit southern parts of India, this King cobra found its way to a local village in attempt to get some water. Although King cobras are known for being dangerous, the compassion of the locals for the animal was bigger than their fear. Also, knowing that this type of snake usually tries to avoid confrontation with humans as much as possible, they realised it must have been really thirsty to come to their village.
TITLE: Desperately Thirsty Massive Cobra Is Given A Water Bottle

DESCRIPTION: If there were such a thing as the best babysitter award, the world would probably agree it belongs to Keegan Carnahan from Florida.
TITLE: Teen Babysitter Surprises A 3-Year-Old By Dressing Up As A Mermaid And Her Reaction Is Just Too Cute

DESCRIPTION: All doors photographed in London in 2016 July and August. London is wonderful in terms of diversity of colors. People are not afraid to add magic to their front door.
TITLE: I Photographed Door In London In (Almost) All Colors

DESCRIPTION:
I created this whole setup under 50$.
being the miniature photographer i always think of something new and something everyone can do it.
So its very simple and very exciting.
TITLE: I Capture The Legendary Gallardo From My Studio

DESCRIPTION: Did you know that in Russia you are allowed to have a fox as a domestic animal? I made this series because I really like to show the close relationship people can have with animals and nature. Girl and her spirit. The girl's name is Sonya, she lives in a small village not far from Moscow and the fox's name is Iblis.
TITLE: I Portrayed A Little Girl With A Black Fox

DESCRIPTION:
In a post apocalyptical world where all the popstars have gone raving mad, Barack Obama and Nicki Minaj have to navigate the earth to find out what happened to their beloved USA.
This is an art series by me James Choe based in Sydney Australia.
 
 
 
There is so much more of it at http://Choe.
TITLE: After The Trumpocalypse, Obama And Nicki Join Together To Save The World. Obaminaj. An Art Series

DESCRIPTION:
A starling murmuration is a beautiful sight if you're lucky enough to see one in the wild. The birds flock together creating a hypnotising, synchronised cloud, that changes shape as the birds swoop and dive.
Scottish artist, Dougie Harley who is now based in London is inspired by his love for all things nature to create these incredible Starling murmurations.
TITLE: Breathtaking Starling Murmurations Put To Paper Using Scribbles And Dots By Scottish Artist

DESCRIPTION: The underwater world holds a lot of secrets, and discovering them can be as interesting as exploring the surface.
TITLE: See-Through Kayaks

DESCRIPTION:
Trying to grow your own seed? Help is on the way! Stick the seed right in the middle of the lifebuoy and let it float away in a jar full of water. Plants ahoy!
Design by Scratch Design for PELEG DESIGN
TITLE: Your Avocado Seed Will Grow Safely Into A Beautiful Tree With Our New Product!

DESCRIPTION: Happiness is the greatest mystery of humankind since love... But it could, possibly, be measured with cats.
TITLE: 10+ Comics About Happiness That Will Make You Think

DESCRIPTION:
There are 3 million Afar people spread across 3 countries in the Horn of Africa: Ethiopia, Eritrea and Djibouti.
In the northeast of Ethiopia, in the area of Semera, i met Afar children who are happy to go to school. But each day, they are unsure if they will be able to attend class as for months now, they have had to carry out a vital task first: searching for water.
TITLE: I Documented Daily Lives Of Afar People

DESCRIPTION: My name is Tom Rex Jessett, as a photographer I love nothing more than exploring the world and sharing its beauty with people. Not everybody wants to visit locations in harsh conditions even though it is often more beautiful. I always wanted to photograph Iceland, particularly in its winter wonderland look.
TITLE: I Spent 2 Freezing Weeks Sleeping In The Car To Capture These Photos Of Iceland In Mid Winter

DESCRIPTION: Eating at a restaurant isn't about the sustenance. It's about the experience. A good menu is a story, with its own narrative arc.
TITLE: World Class Chef Serves Dishes On His Face To Prove A Point

DESCRIPTION: While professional French skier Candide Thovex was having a snack in the Cantal woods, a crazy local resident stole his meal! Luckily, Thovex had his skiis on, so he immediately started chasing the thief.
TITLE: Skiing On Leaves

DESCRIPTION:
I have animated my paintings digitally to give them more depth. These acrylic paintings are painted on A2 size boards.
With these paintings I was inspired by card games like Magic the Gathering & Hearthstone.
TITLE: I Brought My Paintings To Life!

DESCRIPTION:
Canada's turning 150 years old this year and I thought I'd help to celebrate by making a cake of Chief Crowfoot for a competition in Ireland.
It is fully edible and made from chocolate biscuit cake, rice crispies and covered in modelling chocolate. Don't worry - we won't eat this one!!
TITLE: It Took Me Over 3 Weeks To Make This Chief Crowfoot Cake

DESCRIPTION: You probably heard about mythical Transylvania, a place of mystery, traditions and archaic beauty; and the birthplace of the most famous vampires of all - Dracula. Even the Prince of Wales usually comes to visit us during summer on his beautiful estate and is constantly involved in the conservation of rural villages. In case you were wondering what to do this summer, we have the perfect idea for you.
TITLE: Discover Transylvania Through Electronic Music In A Medieval Fortress.

DESCRIPTION:
In the age of Snapchat and Facebook Messenger, love letters have mostly gone the way of the dinosaur, but that doesn't mean modern couples don't like to share love notes once in a blue moon. And when your significant other has a good sense of humor, they're that much better!
Bored Panda collected some of the quirkiest and funniest love notes to give you some inspiration to write your own or just to give you a good laugh.
If you've ever left a fun or silly note for your significant other, we'd love to see it too! Vote for your favorites and let us know what you think in the comments.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Love Notes By Couples With A Sense Of Humour

DESCRIPTION: Londoner Rich 'Paperboyo' McCor (previously here and here) has already transformed Paris's Arc de Triomphe into a LEGO man and turned London's 02/Millennium Dome into a delicious-looking cake. Luckily for us, McCor is still on the go and he isn't running out of ideas - the photographer is back with more famous landmarks interacting with his whimsical paper cutouts!
TITLE: Using Paper Cutouts To Turn Famous Landmarks Into Art (10+ New Pics)

DESCRIPTION:
Colorado-based artist Heidi Annalise has an amazing talent to move wide open spaces into cute tiny boxes without losing their grace. She paints mesmerizing landscapes in mint tins where she attaches small pieces of palette paper to the top, and lays out a small palette of colours to work with on the bottom.
Annalise describes herself as a wilderness lover who specializes in frolicking the meadows.
TITLE: Travel Around The USA With These Tiny Landscapes In Mint Tins

DESCRIPTION: I haven't had this much fun designing & creating in a long time! I have a small business as a graphic designer, but started to expand and create more. Inspired by illustrations of floating islands, I couldn't help but start making some of my own. Using recycled cardboard, felt, and clay I make each island by hand and some of them even double as nightlights!
TITLE: I Designed Themed Floating Islands

DESCRIPTION: It might sometimes feel like there's nothing positive happening in the world, but all you have to do is take a look at these heartwarming pictures to realize that everything is going to be OK. Why? Because as you can see from this list, compiled by Bored Panda, love is actually all around us.
TITLE: 10+ Photos Of True Love That Will Give You Butterflies

DESCRIPTION: We have already showed you what parenting really looks like, and it ain't all sunshine and bubblegum. There are only a few people who know this better than Dan Gibson and his partner Corrie Whyte. The couple lives in Cambridge, Ontario and has 4 children: toddler, Emily, and triplets, Jackson, Olivia & Levi.
TITLE: Dad VS Triplets VS Toddler

DESCRIPTION: Girls Auto Clinic isn't just in the business of changing oil - they're also changing the relationship between women and the automotive industry, and offering a range of salon services to sweeten the deal.
TITLE: This All-Female Auto Shop Will Do Your Hair And Nails While They Fix Your Car

DESCRIPTION: Wyoming-based artist Danny Sherving uses flames not to destroy but to create. He begins by meticulously assembling gunpowder on wood and canvas, depicting animal portraits, mostly creatures from the Grand Teton National Park where he grew up and resides to this day.
TITLE: Artist Paints With Gunpowder

DESCRIPTION: No, this isn't something Harry Potter stumbled upon in the Chamber Of Secrets. Believe it or not, this table belongs to our muggle world - Craig Thibodeau created it, and it reveals a series of hidden elements when examined closely.
TITLE: This Table Is Full Of Secrets

DESCRIPTION: After the Human Society International (HSI), an organization which works against illegal trade in wildlife, animals in research and testing, as well as animal farms, found out about 55 dogs held in a so-called meat farm in South Korea, they left no stone unturned to rescue them from their horrible conditions. The dogs were caged in near darkness, with nearly no human contact ever, waiting to get eaten. After the organization came to an agreement with the owner of the farm, they chartered a flight, to bring all of the dogs to the US.
TITLE: Several Dogs Rescued From A South Korean Meat Farm And Brought To The US

DESCRIPTION:
In order to overcome my world-weariness, I spend as much time as possible in nature.
It's better than any therapy or medicine!
While sitting next to a little river or hanging out in the deep forest I feel free, well-adjusted an my problems seem to be quite far away.
Maybe there are some people out there who feel just like me.
TITLE: I Captured The Beauty Of Nature To Fight My Depressions

DESCRIPTION:
I'm not different is a children's book that confronts the stigmas of a non traditional family set up. I feel it's important to address family life in a positive way, no matter the situation.
Originally I wrote it for my own children to understand alternative families and embracing their uniqueness!
It helps children to normalise their situation and know that they are no different to anyone else! Perfect for single parent families, same sex couples, adoption and more!
The book is available to buy on Amazon and is called I'm not different and is written and illustrated by UK author Melanie McCluskey.
TITLE: A Book For Children Growing Up In Unconventional Families

DESCRIPTION: With our phones being the predominant device for people to capture their memories with, I decided to shoot different places through the perspective of my iPhone.
TITLE: I Capture Places Through My Iphone

DESCRIPTION: I tried to get out of my comfort zone and try out Street photography. One morning I decided to go to the nearest green market. I met many different characters.
TITLE: I Capture Different Characters In My Photographs

DESCRIPTION: I started making polymer clay jewelry two years ago when my love affair with crystals began. I fell in love not only for their sparkling beauty, but also for their comforting and soothing energies. My biggest passion in life has always been art, since childhood, so when I became passionate about these amazing mother earth creations, it only made sense to mix the two into gorgeous, one of a kind, wearable art.
TITLE: Inspiring Natural And Bohemian Jewelry By Mystic Earth

DESCRIPTION: A commission I did a while ago for a friend.
TITLE: I Made This Mario-Themed Cabinet For My Friend

DESCRIPTION:
Flowers are chill, but food is life. Before photos of girls in flower crowns at music festivals flood your social media feeds, feast your eyes on these Flour Crowns.
I decided to take a pun way too far and start making these carby crowns from my favorite starchy snacks: bread, crackers, chips, cookies, pastries and more.
TITLE: Flour Crowns That I Make Are The New Flower Crowns

DESCRIPTION: I am a graphic artist living in Budapest with my family. Two years ago, when my son was 7, we started a series together under the the name Our Life Project. I did the line drawings and he colored them in, according to the unique perspective he had on account of his age.
TITLE: Lines By Mom, Colors By Son

DESCRIPTION: Spring is here, and it not only looks good but tastes amazing as well! To prove this, pastry chefs from all over the place have gone online to share their food art in the form of blooming flower buttercream cakes!
TITLE: 10+ Blooming Flower Cakes To Celebrate The Return Of Spring

DESCRIPTION: Internet trolls aren't exactly known for being bright, but this one made the dumbest move possible when he decided to mess with Arnold Schwarzenegger. After mocking the Special Olympics in response to a post by the famous actor, he was immediately selected for termination, and everyone who witnessed the event is singing Arnie's praise.
TITLE: Arnold Schwarzenegger Brutally Destroys Troll Who Mocked Special Olympics, Wins The Internet

DESCRIPTION: My first hand embroidery was in grade one, a mixture of lines and dots, under the supervision of my grandma! Gratefully, no major scratches and stabs took place, and that encouraged me to continue. I now make hand embroidered jewellery, using original drawings and design. Hope you enjoy and accept my invitation to visit my page!
TITLE: Back To Hand Embroidery, Back To Authentic Art

DESCRIPTION: I love maps so a while back, I started creating my owns. I hand draw the landmarks and then create the map digitally, by adding the drawings and the other details. This latest map is a walking tour map of Paris.
TITLE: I Created A Walking Tour Map Of Paris To Help You Discover All The Most Iconic Landmarks Of The City

DESCRIPTION:
I'm a mommy of six and an artist who creates precious look-a-like dolls to make people smile. Each doll is made from scratch by me, using beautiful yarns and fabrics and takes about 10-12 hours to complete.
Very often I get asked to make dolls for children with special needs, for someone who is going through tough times or someone who lost or is missing a loved one.
TITLE: I Make Precious Heirloom Dolls For A Good Cause

DESCRIPTION:
What is your style? People have asked me that for years. Steampunk? Gothic? Hippie? Biker? Heck, I don't even know. I'm a mixture of all styles!
In my travels, I have met many women and men who also have an eclectic sense of style and so I decided to make jewelry to fit everyone's unique style.
TITLE: I Make Jewelry For Ecclectic People

DESCRIPTION: Underlook project is getting bigger everyday. More and more people all around the world began supporting our projects. This is so interesting for us, that we even decided to go full time into it.
TITLE: Under-Cats: I Photograph Cats From Underneath (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: My name is Jeffrey Appiatu and I'm 21 years of age. I was born and raised in Ghana where I currently live. I am a pencil artist and I specialize in the genre of Hyper-realism.
TITLE: I Create Photo-Realistic Portraits Using Charcoal And Graphite

DESCRIPTION:
Following the last post I kept taking pictures of plums.
SAKURA are famous in Spring, but plum blossoms bloom beautifully before sakura. I was surprised to see this great view.
TITLE: I Captured Plum Trees Blooming In Japan (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION:
I made @stampoint on instagram to celebrate my obsession for travel and symmetry.
After quitting our jobs in London, @thekingalex89 and I went off to search for new exciting places, pinpointing each magical location with a symmetrical snap.
From the UK, to Kenya, India and Myanmar, Stampoint has become a visual diary for the stunning spots we have seen along the way.
TITLE: I Find The Symmetrical Centre Point Of Epic Places Around The World

DESCRIPTION: Lera Kiryakova is a Russian artist, who is known for cute celebrity portraits. She creates hand-drawn cartoons in a kind of puppet style, which not only affects the similarity but also adds adorableness. Look - you might like it!
TITLE: Russian Artist Turns Celebrities Into Adorable Cartoon Characters

DESCRIPTION:
Today is the birthday of my dear dear friend - my Babool(grandma in sort of Russian) and I really want to share with the world how incredibly lovely and cool she is :)
My Babool has got a big great heart and a beautiful soul. Despite her life hasn't been easy, she has lived it with much integrity and kept her good heart. She is an incredibly cute little mushroom and I miss her very very much.
TITLE: I Drew Illustrations To Explain Why My Grandma Rocks

DESCRIPTION: The eye is considered to be the second most complex organ of the human body, but artist Leon Keer has found a way to fool it. Leon uses a lot of techniques and materials (including acrylic paint, solvents, tar, and other) to create his 3D street art that bends reality through optical illusions.
TITLE: Mind-Bending 3D Illusions

DESCRIPTION:
We are Melvon and Reine from Russia.We create fantasy creatures inspired by real animals and Characters of films and books
This doll is handcrafted and inspired by Phoenix from the universe of books about Harry Potter.
TITLE: We Have Created My Own Version Of Phoenix

DESCRIPTION: I'm a British street artist and I go by my initials JPS, I grew up in the seaside town of Weston super mare and have a lot of works there and also in Norway, this is a selection of my word play works, hope you like
TITLE: Street Art Is More Fun, If You Add A Pun

DESCRIPTION: This video of a thirsty doggie running around Lima, capital of Peru, begging for some water with a bucket in his mouth has gone viral, stirring emotions all around the world. The unnamed canine, who was filmed in the district of Chorrillos, is one of the victims affected by Lima's latest water shortage, which has already left 75 people dead and led to more than 1 million Peruvians being forced to abandon their homes.
TITLE: Thirsty Dog Is Carrying A Bucket And Begging For Water After Drought Hit Peru

DESCRIPTION:
NATURE 55 is the last creation of Alexandre CHAPELIN creator of the concept TABLE. LA TABLE, a concept born in 2015, after more than two years of rigorous research.
We select natural stones that offers a graphic and architectural visuals.
TITLE: Aquatic Coffee Tables Made By Me By Merging Natural Stone And Resin

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Flavio Salsano, I'm an Amsterdam-based illustrator who tries not to use so many details in his works.
I really love using shadows of various objects for drawing. You can see what I've done so far below, enjoy!
TITLE: I Use Shadows Of Everyday Objects To Create Cute Doodles

DESCRIPTION: Scientists from the Worcester Polytechnic Institute have turned a spinach leaf into working human heart tissue, and this could revolutionize the treatment of damaged organs.
TITLE: Scientists Transform Spinach Leaves Into Working Human Heart Tissue

DESCRIPTION:
It's very likely that you've already witnessed a few dad jokes in your life. Dads love to torment their children with such jokes and they are so embarrassingly bad that they end up being funny.
Bored Panda collected some of the best dad jokes captured on camera, proving that while the jokes themselves may be cringe-worthy, they're also quite hilarious to look at. A big shout out to all of the awesome dads who come up with so many ways to annoy their kids in most ridiculous ways!
TITLE: 10+ Times Dads Took Their Jokes To Another Level

DESCRIPTION: Aurora Observatory in Senja Island, Norway has released a breathtaking video which shows what a magical experience the Northern Lights can be. The former term was coined by Galileo all the way back in 1619 and the natural light display occurs when the magnetosphere is sufficiently disturbed by the solar wind.
TITLE: Spectacular Aurora Borealis In Norway

DESCRIPTION: One of the highlights of spring in The Netherlands is when tulips blossom all over the country. Those colourful tulip fields are worth a bike ride!
TITLE: I Photographed The Endless Dutch Tulip Fields

DESCRIPTION: Taiwan designer Kevin Lin is obsessed with the rubin vase illusion and spent tons of hours hoping to create something practical and aesthetic at the same time. Rubin Vase 3D sticky notes is definitely good for display and useful to be your office stationery. The marble texture of note paper make it even better.
TITLE: Face Or Vase? Rubin Vase Sticky Notes Show You The Figure-Ground Illusion With Human Evolution History

DESCRIPTION: Artist Brenna Baker manipulates glass like it was clay. This black and white 12-inch Angel Reef Racer is one of her signature pieces, and it perfectly showcases incredible Brenna's skill. She began her career as a glass artist in Corning, NY at the age of 14 and hasn't looked back ever since.
TITLE: Sculpting A Fish Out Of Glass

DESCRIPTION:
I am Cody Ellingham, a designer and art director based in Tokyo, Japan.
I first came to Tokyo in 2012. From the very beginning the city inspired me.
TITLE: Derive: Wandering Under The Neon Lights Of Tokyo

DESCRIPTION: Boyan Govedarski (Bulgarian Ironmonger and sculptor by chance) had fun doing unusual metal works - a VIOLIN 4/4 metal, metal shoe, yacht by stone and rusty black sheet, engagement rings like shackles with chain...
TITLE: Metal Violin By Bulgarian Sculptor

DESCRIPTION: It took about a month to finish this epic character in smoking pipe. Made from briar wood and ready for a great smoke.
TITLE: I Hand-Carved Gandalf The White Into A Smoking Pipe

DESCRIPTION:
I realized to truly attack this idiotic fear of fashion prints, one must create fashion prints. And boy, was it fun! If only all fears could be as enjoyable. :-)
Continuing on my journey of fashion print self-discovery, here are 10 more designs of prints I came up with! (No.
TITLE: I Create Mini Paintings Featuring Patterns And Prints To Curb My Fear Of Them (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: Reading poetry has always been fulfilling to me. This is a series of images I have created for the poem Desires by Greek poet Constantine P. Cavafy.
TITLE: I Create Images Through Interpreting Poetry

DESCRIPTION: Night Shots Using Iphone 6s
TITLE: Night Shots Using iPhone 6s

DESCRIPTION:
My fiance and I have been together for 10 years, crazy right? Well we get asked on a daily basis when we are going to have kids - we finally made everyone happy and got one, well a four legged furry baby who is a cute and she is naughty.
She has become our pride and joy and we take her any and everywhere possible. Here are a couple of pictures of the first 14 weeks of her life!
TITLE: My Name Is Gizmo. No, Not The Gremlin

DESCRIPTION: I am a fine art portrait photographer in central Vermont. I've been practicing the freelensing technique avidly for the last year. If you're not already familiar with it, freelensing is a method where you hold your lens unattached in front of your camera to take the photo.
TITLE: I Fell In Love With Freelensing

DESCRIPTION: I have never been that comfortable shooting outside so an abandoned place is where we decided this shoot should take place, we had no ideas in mind other than the fact that I enjoyed seeing Ballerinas dance, so I asked her to be herself, in a place where it was all sandy with rough floors, and she did.. and the outcome was quite beautiful.
TITLE: Dancing With Perspective

DESCRIPTION:
Watermelons are one of the best fruits to carve. It is my favorite!!
I have fun to carve the red of it leaving the shade of the flowers with the white part of it.
Have a quick look at some of my watermelon artworks.
TITLE: I Turn Watermelons Into Intricate Sculptures

DESCRIPTION:
With new government of Kaunas (Lithuania) policy and art programme Kaunas Highlights an old graffiti piece Star Seeder finally was restored.
Primary version of this piece was made by lithuanian artist Morfai in 2008. Then at night without any permission simple stencil was sprayed on the wall in one of the main place of the city called Vytautas the Great War Museum.
TITLE: After 8 Years Epic Street Artwork In Kaunas Was Restored

DESCRIPTION: Last Friday Rhonda Miller was driving to work on a Canadian highway when she spotted someone walking alongside the road -at first she thought it was a man. I thought that was strange because you don't normally see people walking on the road that far out, Miller said. I slowed down a bit and I got closer. I thought it was a bear, and I thought, it can't be a bear because it was the wrong time of year. Then, another moving figure appeared. Upon closer inspection, Miller saw the unexpected... and realized these were two giant black wolves.
TITLE: Woman Films Two Massive Wolves Running Next To Her Car At 30 Miles/Hour On Her Way To Work

DESCRIPTION: Most of us think of LEGO as toys, but there are actually a lot of practical ways you can use these plastic bricks in your everyday life.
TITLE: 10+ Genius Ways To Use LEGO You Probably Never Thought About

DESCRIPTION: People don't often look back on the early 1900's for advice, but what if we could actually learn something from the Lost Generation? The New York Public Library has digitized 100 how to do it cards found in cigarette boxes over 100 years ago, and the tips they give are so practical that millennials reading this might want to take notes.
TITLE: 100-Year-Old Life Hacks That Are Surprisingly Useful Today

DESCRIPTION: According to the World Health Organisation, 372,000 people drown each year. Kingii wristband claims to be the world's smallest inflatable and its mission is to reduce that number.
TITLE: This Inflating Bracelet Could Save Your Life

DESCRIPTION: Fascinated by the beauty of hummingbirds, photographer Sean Graesser decided to share it with his followers. One of the things that really resonated with the public were the gorgeous colors of these little birds' feathers.
TITLE: Magical Colors Of Hummingbirds

DESCRIPTION:
Spring has sprung, which means that pretty much everyone is ready for a fresh new look - including your dog. Our best friends gain some extra fluff during the winter months, and rather than just letting it shed off in clumps, giving your pup a proper trim can help them strut into the season with style.
We want to see how your dog looked before their cut, and how they look now, because pups need pampering too!
TITLE: 10+ Dogs Before And After Their Haircuts (Add Yours)

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Marija Smanja and I'm a photographer from Bosnia and Herzegovina.
When I started with photography, I used to shoot what I see in front of me, but after gaining some experience in portraiture, documentary, and some other fields in photography, I realized that I want to capture something that's not just aesthetically appealing but engage the viewers more and evokes their personal emotional response.
Now, I don't shoot what I see, I shoot what I feel and I try to create photographs with more stories than I alone can give them.
TITLE: I Capture Emotional Stories In My Photographs

DESCRIPTION: What scared you the most the last time you watched a horror movie? We'd bet money on the menacing demeanor of famous villains like Freddy Kreuger, Jason Vorhees, and Michael Myers. It may surprise you to see, however, that the faces behind these ghastly ghouls are just ordinary people that bear little or no resemblance to the sheer terror their characters embody.
TITLE: What Horror Movie Stars Look Like In Real Life

DESCRIPTION: I'm Patty Variboa, the artist behind ChasingAMoment, where I began my journey of nature-inspired, inked illustrations on Instagram at the end of 2015 to inspire others who love nature just as much as I do. My illustrations are intuitive, minimal, and expresses my thoughts and feelings onto paper. I'm constantly in awe and inspired by the beautiful landscapes especially the Pacific Northwest.
TITLE: I Create Illustrations Inspired By Coffee And Nature

DESCRIPTION:
HAMILTON 23 is the last creation of Alexandre CHAPELIN creator of the concept TABLE.
LA TABLE, a concept born in 2015, after more than two years of rigorous research.
We select natural stones that offers a graphic and architectural visuals.
TITLE: Aquatic Coffee Tables That I Make By Merging Natural Stone And Resin

DESCRIPTION: I tried to impress my daughter with this whimsical fairy terrarium I made. She showed it to her dinosaurs and never gave it a second look. But I'm sure some of you would like to make one for your babies so here is a video and some pictures from the process.
TITLE: Made This In Four Hours While My Daughter Was Sleeping

DESCRIPTION: Today is an International Puppy day...
TITLE: Puppies Decided To Sleep And Have Fun In My Camera Bag

DESCRIPTION: I started this project two years ago, inspired by eyebombing.com. I created similar Bulgarian website to support the development of this street art in Bulgaria.
TITLE: I Bring Bulgarian Streets To Life By Putting Googly Eyes On Random Objects

DESCRIPTION: I started painting myself around two years ago. I wanted to train in FX makeup after years of trying to figure out what I really wanted to do for a living. Even though I'm borderline movie and TV obsessed, I had never thought to look into it as a profession.
TITLE: I Spend 10-20 Hours At A Time Turning Myself Into Different Characters

DESCRIPTION:
The Book of Revelations, created by Julia O'sullivan. It stands 2 meters high and when fully open it is over 3 meters wide.
I do love setting myself a task to try and create the best representation of each subject I undertake.
TITLE: It Took Me 18 Months To Create This Impressive 2×3 Meter Sculpture Of The Book Of Revelations

DESCRIPTION: Meet Moonpie, the miniature rescue cow who lives with 12 dogs and thinks she's one of them. She was spotted at a livestock auction house by a friend of Janice Wolf, the founder of the Rocky Ridge Refuge Sanctuary. From there, she was taken to a rescue, where, as the weather was really bad and she was too small to be outside with the other cows, Moonpie stayed in Janice's bedroom and eventually befriended her canine companions.
TITLE: This Mini Cow Saved From Auction House Now Lives With 12 Dogs, Thinks She Is One Of Them

DESCRIPTION: Cracker Barel, the restaurant chain with a Southern country theme, has been getting a lot of attention on social media lately, but not for a good reason...
TITLE: Husband Asks Why His Wife Was Fired From A Company She Worked For 11 Years, And Things Escalated Hilariously

DESCRIPTION: Cats only worship one thing: themselves. That, at least, is what we've always believed, but then we discovered these pictures. Because as you can see from this terrifying list compiled by Bored Panda, cats also worship something else...THE DEVIL!
TITLE: 10+ Pics Proving That Cats Are Actually Demons

DESCRIPTION: Do you get excited when you realize that a professional athlete is older than you? Does your back go out more than you do? Then we hate to say it but, well, you're getting old.
TITLE: 10+ Hilariously Honest Tweets About Getting Old That Will Make You Laugh, Then Cry

DESCRIPTION: A Japanese photographer named Nyam Kichi dedicates a good chunk of his time out and about on the streets, capturing the beauty of stray cats - and there's one particular spot with drain pipe holes that he loves to go.
TITLE: Stray Cats Find Drain Pipe Holes And Now They Are Having The Time Of Their Life

DESCRIPTION: Our best friend, the dog, has been around for years now, making our lives a whole lot better. In fact, it has been proven scientifically that dogs make us happier and healthier. So they most definitely deserve a day dedicated to them, don't you think? Turns out, not only is there a day dedicated to dogs but there's one dedicated to puppies too, and that day is today!
TITLE: 10+ Puppies That Are Too Adorable To Be Real

DESCRIPTION:
I am commercial still life photographer but i love creative or conceptual photoshoots.
So I had an idea to create my own location in my studio for the beautiful beast.
I did not use anything expensive, some polystyrene sheets for castle, homemade foliage, baking powder for snow and some paints.
TITLE: I Created This Awesome Location In My Studio

DESCRIPTION:
I'm Amanda Jones. I have been photographing dogs for over twenty years and have published six books of dog photographs.
You may have seen my previous book, Dog Years, here on Bored Panda.
TITLE: Dogs Romping And Enjoying Spring!

DESCRIPTION: This series was carried out in September 2016 in the following states; California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Wyoming, Colorado.
TITLE: I Documented The Beauty Of West American Landscapes

DESCRIPTION: Meet Steven Donovan, an ordinary pizza delivery guy with an extraordinary heart of gold, who risked his job by delaying a delivery - all so that he could stop and help this lost pooch.
TITLE: Pizza Guy Stops To Rescue Lost Dog Because Its Life Is More Important To Him Than The Risk Of Losing His Job

DESCRIPTION: I combined polymer clay and embroidery a while ago and still can't believe how many possibilities it gives for creative projects! Every hoop I make is unusual, one of a kind, suprising and fresh! Color combination are endless, forms and shapes of clay are countless. Number of ways of stitching baked clay makes my brain dizzy! And I'm in ave and in love with making these 3D hand embroidered polymer clay hoops! I have lovely collorful Instagram feed and etsy shop called Nibyniebo.
TITLE: I Create Unpredictable Art With My Experimental Embroidery

DESCRIPTION: I create Steampunk Artwork, clothing, gadgets and props for photoshoots and filming. It's my hobby and I do it in my spare-time. There is no commercial purpose behind, I do it because it's my passion.
TITLE: I Create Retrofuturistic Artworks

DESCRIPTION: Originally I am pencil and watercolor artist, who discovered the silk painting technique some years ago...
TITLE: I Paint On Silk To Create Wearable Piece Of Art

DESCRIPTION:
Travis has just gone through a bad break up with his ex partner. They both had a cat each but his evil ex took it upon herself to steal both cats as a result of their breakup.
Now all Travis can think about is how heavenly his cat 'Eden' is, and how demonic his ex girlfriend is but he is too scare to take back the cat because he doesn't want Eden to be lonely without her kitty pal.
TITLE: Man Gets Cat Tattoo After Bad Break Up

DESCRIPTION: Epi2mik also known as Thierry Olivier is a French artist who paints on any kind of surface with a distinctive theme...
TITLE: Intricate Drawings That I Create On Any Kind Of Surface

DESCRIPTION: As part of the Imagine Incredible team, I have the opportunity to work with excellent comic book artists. Our latest project is Lightstep Chronicles, a retro futuristic sci-fi space opera with heavy Art Deco undertones. You can see how it looks on our Kickstarter page.
TITLE: 10 Stunning Examples Of Art Deco In Pop Culture

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Kyleigh Parker and I'm a product/figure photographer. I work mainly with video game and Nintendo characters from Good Smile Company and currently work with Nintendo as a Brand Ambassador.
Video games have always grasped my imagination.
TITLE: Bringing The Geek And Gaming World To Life

DESCRIPTION: I think being a woman sometimes is almost an impossible task. If you try to look good, to keep doing your job, taking care of the kids, not forgetting why are you doing it all..
TITLE: Being A Woman Is An Impossible Task That I Portray In My Illustrations

DESCRIPTION:
Russian artist Marina Malinovaya perfectly depicts what an exciting experience a cup of tasty tea can be.
Malinovaya creates her poetic _Floral Tea Story_ photography series using only plants, a tea set, and a tabletop. She cleverly arranges everything to form swirling formations, making colorful floral bunches look like either rising steam or tongue-tickling savory liquid.
TITLE: Poetic Scenes Of Teacups, Overflowing With Beautiful Flowers By A Russian Artist

DESCRIPTION: Winter in Scandinavia lasts for almost six months. So I got bored and restless and decided to glue googly eyes to everything all over my monochrome hometown. I think it's called eyebombing.
TITLE: Some Hero Is Putting Googly Eyes On Miserable Objects, And His Photos Are Going Viral

DESCRIPTION:
Ever wanted to make mythical creature cry? Because nothing is more beautiful than a unicorn crying colourful tears - and this is perfect piece of unusual home décor for fans of mythical steeds.
This weeping candle will add some magical, if slightly creepy, mood lighting to any room in your home. Just light the tip of its magically spiralled horn and this majestic beast bursts into tears, weeping a waxy rainbow from its two hollow eyes, leaving a trail of vivid colours that will drip down its body.
TITLE: This Unicorn Candle Cries Waxy, Colourful Tears When You Light It

DESCRIPTION: Science tells us that women live longer than men for a whole host of reasons, but the most important one is that women don't even do half of the ridiculously dumb things that men do. Seriously, what were you guys thinking?
TITLE: Why Women Live Longer Than Men In 10+ Pics

DESCRIPTION:
I'm a stay at home mom to a 5 year old and 2 year old twins. Life is what all parents will say, hectic. 
These pictures sum up parenting without really needing a title.
TITLE: People Ask Me How It Is To Have 3 Little Kids. My Pictures Sum It Up Pretty Well

DESCRIPTION: Do you list your address as IKEA on official documents? Does your diet consist mostly of Swedish meatballs and lingonberry sauce? Do you literally bless yourself before entering those holy blue and yellow gates?
TITLE: 10+ Jokes You Will Understand Only If You Live In IKEA

DESCRIPTION:
Apologies in advance, this is my first post here and I'm a wee bit nervous
This big creepy cutie (Approx 12) was a giant leap out of my comfort zone, I forced myself to try a whole bunch of new techniques, skills and materials that I had shied away from in the past.
I stopped counting the hours that went into this guy after 20 - A majority of that time was spent re-sculpting the first of many faces, learning how to make a weighted armature and waiting for paint to dry.
It totally didn't take me 10 hours in to figure out I could use my heat-gun or hairdryer to speed up the painting process.
TITLE: I Created A Chester The Cheshire Cat Art Doll

DESCRIPTION:
Work produced by Plume Art Collective which consists of Andy Pilsbury (photographer) & Ernest Otoo (art director).
Our work is essentially a voyeuristic look at the hypnotic behaviour of different coloured paints in water. We want our work to serve as a means of reaching a contemplative state, without having any profound concept thrust upon the viewer.
TITLE: A Look At The Hypnotic Behaviour Of Different Coloured Paints In Water

DESCRIPTION: I have been sculpting for over eight years. Every one of my pieces is hand sculpted, hand glazed with tiny brushes and kiln fired twice. My goal is not to create replicas.
TITLE: I Sculpt Tiny Minimalist Animals With A Touch Of Whimsy

DESCRIPTION:
My name is James Meaney, and I am one of many 9-5 workers living in Glasgow.
I have always had a keen interest in photography, but this interest has grown substantially over the last couple of years.
Approximately two years ago I had health concerns that I was struggling to deal with, and this lead to me making the jump from casual shooter on my iPhone to purchasing my first DSLR.
TITLE: I Was Wandering Around The City Of Glasgow

DESCRIPTION: Anyone who works in retail and customer service knows that rude people are pretty much a daily occurrence, but this Starbucks barista had an experience with an angry woman in drive-thru that most of us would never even imagine.
TITLE: Rude Customer Irritates Drive-Thru Employee, Next Day Surprises Everyone With This Note

DESCRIPTION:
Photographer Rob MacInnis gathers barnyard animals that we selected for consumption and production, and turns them into majestic portrait subjects.
Everything started when Rob came back from a long journey through South America. Taking photos in places that suffered from extreme poverty made him rethink photography's role in his life and society: I had a tough time dealing with my relationship to photography after this trip, Rob told Bored Panda. I felt it irresponsible to ignore the exploitative aspects of photography, especially when making artwork in such a privileged position. I found that photographing animals enabled me to critique both myself and the photographic field.
TITLE: This Photographer Photographs Farm Animal Like No One Else

DESCRIPTION: Drawing portraits already takes an incredible amount of patience and skill, but Nigerian artist Arinze Stanley has decided to make his task even tougher and stick only to simple monochrome pencils.
TITLE: Unbelievably Realistic Pencil Drawings By This Nigerian Artist Look More Real Than Photos Themselves

DESCRIPTION: Meet Scruffles, the fat cat who has more admirers than you - and we're not talking about the impressive number of his 42k Instagram followers, but about the chickens who line up to watch him pose. Yup, other than lying around doing nothing all day, this particular fatty likes to strike a pose or two for the audience of chickens who see him through a glass door and marvel at the spectacle. He doesn't understand why they're so obsessed with him, but they are.
TITLE: This Cat Has No Idea Why Chicks Are Going Crazy Over Him

DESCRIPTION: There's lazy and there's next level lazy that's actually genius. But as this video shows, laziness isn't something exclusive to humans - chunky twin Himalayan cats Bonnie and Clyde sometimes even need a tow to get around the house.
TITLE: When Your Lazy Cat Needs A Tow

DESCRIPTION: These dogs were abandon June 30th, 2015. Since then they have learned to love and trust and now have amazing lives!
TITLE: Rejected Dogs Now Have The Best Lives Ever!

DESCRIPTION:
A few months back we launched a fine art emoji project: emoji versions of famous artists and their work. It got a lot of attention online.
But what meant the most to us was how the art history community embraced the project.
TITLE: I Turned My Emoji Keyboard Into A Frida Kahlo Art Gallery

DESCRIPTION: The cities are growing pretty fast and with that we have less and less green areas to enjoy. To create awareness about this issue rises Plants of Posters. A non-profit street art project that turns street posters into plant-pots with plants and flowers.
TITLE: Now We Can Plant Flowers On The Street Posters

DESCRIPTION: Hello ...
TITLE: I Spent My Days To Create These Simple Drawings

DESCRIPTION:
I began creating comics on Instagram as a way to share my new life experiences with my friends and family back in Malaysia when I made the move to San Francisco back in 2011. It all started as an illustrative journal.
My comics are best recognized for my grumpy and brutally honest redheaded character, who is an avatar of myself.
TITLE: Hilariously Relatable Comics About A Malaysian Redhead (Who Is Actually Me)

DESCRIPTION: Few of us will ever have the chance to visit outer space, but that doesn't mean we can't bring space to us! And what better way to do that than with these beautiful moon and planet lamps by Pulsar Moonlight, available to purchase on Etsy.
TITLE: These Moon And Planet Lamps Will Make Your Room Look Out Of This World

DESCRIPTION:
I completed this photo series on a recent trip to New York City.
The photos were taken on a DSLR that I had converted to take infrared photos and were completed over a 10-day period.
TITLE: I Captured How New York Would Look Like If You Saw It In Infrared

DESCRIPTION: Dads and technology don't always go well together. The same goes for dads and humor. But as you can see from these hilarious texts, sometimes the stars align to create a perfect combination of all three.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Funniest Texts From Dads Ever

DESCRIPTION: I think that Leo would agree that bears are no joke. These magnificent animals are strong, scary and dangerous. Unless they are plush bears.
TITLE: I Felt Bears That Carry Tiny Worlds On Their Shoulders

DESCRIPTION:
Disney Princesses are iconic characters. Everybody knows their names and stories and it is not surprising that these beautiful and strong ladies are an inspiration to many artists.
Bored Panda gathered comics about Disney Princesses from all over the web and invites you to take a look at cute, funny and sometimes a little twisted comics re-imagining the famous stories of Disney Princesses.
TITLE: 10+ Disney Comics That Will Ruin Your Childhood

DESCRIPTION: In 2012, I was a wreck. My life was falling apart and I was losing a really ugly battle with depression. I was desperate.
TITLE: I Paint People I See In Coffee Shops, On The Streets, And On Instagram And Then Give These Paintings Away

DESCRIPTION:
In 2007 I made my first stuffed animal, a red horse, out of red polyester craft felt from my own pattern. I have been making animals ever since, and I've created cats, dragons, rabbits, and seahorses as well.
Today, my animals are made from high-quality wool felt and embroidered with wool and cotton threads.
TITLE: I Am A Biologist By Day And A Felt Artist On My Free Time

DESCRIPTION: I've been doing digital art for about 2 years, using my Wacom Bamboo One tablet and some drawing softwares like Photoshop, Clip Studio Paint or Paint Tool Sai.
TITLE: I Draw Portraits Of Anime Girls

DESCRIPTION: Meet Phantom and Sarah, two pit bulls rescued from a shelter who just became K9 dogs. Knowing the bad reputation the breed has and the fact that pibbles are the #1 breed to be euthanized in the US, officers at North Carolina's Clay County Sheriff's Office took it upon themselves to change the situation. What will be the most shocking to some will not be that Clay County Sheriff's has the new K-9 Deputies, but rather their breed, the department wrote online, adding: even though pit bulls get a bad rap in the media, they aren't all bad dogs and can do great things for the communities they serve.
TITLE: Instead Of Spending $15-$20,000 For Purebred German Shepherds, These Cops Are Getting Rescue Pit Bulls

DESCRIPTION:
I grew up in the 80s, probably the glory days of arcade gaming, so I have always wished I had an arcade machine of my own with real arcade joystick and buttons.
Fairly recently, I built a 3D printer from kit, so I thought I should put it to good use and make myself a desktop arcade machine.
Over a few weeks, I ordered all the electronic parts I needed, like the controller, LCD display, Raspberry Pi 3, etc.
TITLE: I 3D Printed My Own Bartop Arcade Machine

DESCRIPTION: If you've already started planning for Halloween, these fireproof skulls are the new decorations of your dreams - or nightmares.
TITLE: Terrifying Fireproof Human Skull Logs For Your Next Family Camping Trip

DESCRIPTION: Remember the animals that look like celebrities? How about the little kid that looks exactly like Danny DeVito? Well, this time, we've got a list of babies that look like celebrities!
TITLE: This 2-Year-Old Girl Looks Exactly Like Ed Sheeran! See 10+ More Babies Who Look Like Celebrities

DESCRIPTION: Is it getting hot in here, or is it just these hot dudes with their adorable kittens?
TITLE: Hot Dudes With Kittens Is Still The Most Purrfect Instagram Account Ever (10+ New Pics)

DESCRIPTION: I am a 20-year-old student from Hong Kong. Motivated by a close friend to share my drawing online, I started to find inspiration from my experience dealing with emotions and stress issues while growing up. When I was struggling with stress and emotions, I was really confused and hopeless as if no one would ever understand.
TITLE: I Drew Cartoons Inspired By My Experience Dealing With Emotions And Stress Issues

DESCRIPTION: I have started working with clay 2 years ago, and have been experimenting with sculpting different objects and turning them into pins and earrings.
TITLE: Polymer Clay Pins And Earrings Made By Me

DESCRIPTION: Nowadays they are fast, quite safe, good looking, expensive, with cutting edge technology packed inside. Every boy is dreaming of buying his own four wheels. When we grow up, our first car is always a treasure for us.
TITLE: I Rescue Beautiful Old Cars From Being Forgotten Using Digital Art

DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate our favorite music from our favorite movies, I took the chance to make a series of digital collages featuring the album covers of some of the well-loved movie soundtracks.
I combined soundtrack album cover arts with classical paintings from the different art periods. It is my small way of giving homage to the art of music and filmmaking.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Kylo, the rescue doggie who just wants to snuggle and hug his human mom the moment the woman steps into their house. As soon as I sit down to take off my shoes he climbs into my lap to be held, Meghan Sweers, Kylo's new owner, told The Dodo. If I don't sit down for our cuddle time he follows me around with the saddest most pathetic look on his face until I give in and hold him.

DESCRIPTION: Reality has been a hard pill to swallow since the Election. Every day brings new surprises to the point where I can no longer differentiate up from down, fact from fiction, microwave from camera. I started drawing Trumpy Cat as a way to cope, and I hope it will help you as well.

DESCRIPTION: The Faces is personal project made with just pencil and copic markers. Getting the style right took many revisions for each drawing. They are a pure fushion of pencil and color markers Faces in order of appearence: Belle, Katy, Snow-white, Maleficent, Kate, Mary Poppins, Valerie, Alice, Diana, Princess Leia, Ariel, Self Portrait.

DESCRIPTION:

Since I was participating for the first time, coming up with concepts daily was a challenge. Studying animal forms and their characteristics played a major role in this series.

DESCRIPTION: I blend realistic portraits with backgrounds and animal companions to bring my favourite animated characters to life. Follow me on Instagram for frequent art progress and updates! https://www.instagram.

DESCRIPTION: Pictures of koalas drinking water have been released all over the Internet, and even though it looks cute, actually, it's a really bad sign. Koalas, one of the symbols of the Australian wildlife, normally get the hydration they need from the eucalyptus leaves they eat. However, due to draughts and wildfires caused by climate change, their food supplies dried out, which resulted in many koalas becoming thirsty and turning to water.
TITLE: Koalas Are Dying Of Thirst, So This Farmer Came Up With A Brilliant Solution To Help Them

DESCRIPTION: I live in arctic at Finland and we have very short summer and long winter so we don't have much sunlight for most of the year. In Lapland sun doesn't rise up the horizon for 2 months so we are left only with the darkness. I love to be in the darkness with my flashlight and adventuring to new places and waiting for the perfect moment for the magical and beautiful northern lights.
TITLE: I Spent 2 Years Alone In The Darkness And It Was Beautiful

DESCRIPTION:
#WeMetOnTheNet celebrates a concept of meeting online in a broad sense: from having a match on dating platform to approaching the people who have similar interests online.
There is a shared belief associated with meeting people online nowadays. You notice it every time you ask someone who met each other on a dating app.
TITLE: #WeMetOnTheNet Campaign Celebrates Friendship People Start Online (Add Yours)

DESCRIPTION: People often misuse words like depression and ADD. Sure you might be having a bad day, but are you really depressed? Likewise, you might sometimes struggle to concentrate, especially if you're doing something boring, but does that really mean you've got Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD)? We all have our little quirks and idiosyncrasies, but does that make us all Obsessive Compulsives?
TITLE: What You Say About Mental Illness Vs What You Actually Mean

I searched antique malls for the candelabrum, clock, and mirror.

One hundred years ago, in 1917, Russia was wracked by revolution, famine, foreign war, and domestic unrest. Indeed, the events that unfolded in Russia that year changed the course of twentieth-century history.

DESCRIPTION: In April 2015, Little Rock Illustrator Sally Nixon started a project called 365 in which she had to create one illustration per day for a whole year. As it was not that easy to think of new ideas so frequently, Sally started to search for inspiration in her own life and simple routine moments that she's going through. The artist wanted to show the natural side of women besides staged Instagram selfies, Snapchat filters, and all the other forms of social media that rule our world.

Hello! I have created a challenge for all the pandas out there to draw their pet!
You can draw pets you wish you had or even fantasy creatures. Draw in a variety of styles: realistic, comic, manga, and other styles you can think of! Be creative! One important thing to remember here though - please add a picture of your pet next to the drawing so we couldsee the difference!
Don't forget to vote for your favorites too, and have fun!

DESCRIPTION: Online shopping is sometimes a game of chance, and these poor people lost terribly.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Tek, the K9 officer who is one proud pooch after helping his partner rescue three abandoned puppies. Trooper Ennis and his dog Tek were in southwest Atlanta on Monday, driving in an abandoned subdivision in what is known as a stolen car dumping ground, when they saw something unexpected - three newborn pups left in the middle of nowhere. The Georgia Department of Public Safety (DPS) reports that they were dumped in a briar patch and left to die. But then the K9 doggie Tek stepped in and saved the day.
TITLE: K9 Rescues 3 Abandoned Puppies With His Partner

DESCRIPTION: Ash Soto was diagnosed with vitiligo when she was 12. As her vitiligo started spreading, she began to feel ashamed of her skin, especially after a little girl asked her if she had showered in bleach. Now the 21-year-old not only isn't ashamed, but she embraces her skin.
TITLE: After Being Bullied For Vitiligo All Her Life, This Girl Now Turns Her Body Into Amazing Art

DESCRIPTION: Jimmy Fallon's hashtag game is going strong, as always. The most recent hashtag? #MarchDadness.

DESCRIPTION: The bees have been in decline since the Second World War, so Cheerios decided to help them. Firstly, they removed Buzz the bee from many cereal boxes to spread the word, and now they're giving away 100 million wildflower seeds. This means that you can get a free pack to create a bee-friendly habitat in your own yard!
TITLE: Cheerios Will Send You 500 Wildflower Seeds For Free To Help Save The Bees

DESCRIPTION: Meet Oreo, the cat who somehow found her way into a nursing home - and decided to work there. She's like the family here. She helps the residents, she helps the employees, and we just love her, said Carmen Delgado, receptionist of St. Augustine Health Ministries in Cleveland, Ohio.

DESCRIPTION: Usually us humans are repelled by the insects that crawl around our homes and gardens uninvited. We cringe at flies buzzing over our heads, moths rampaging around lamps or maggots feeding on our food. But contemplate for a few moments the lives of these small creatures, as portrayed in the illustrations of Emilia Dziubak, and you might just change your mind about them.
TITLE: Insects Are Not What They Seem In Illustrations By Emilia Dziubak

Thanks for taking a look!

DESCRIPTION: Polimind is a creative design startup based in Lisbon, Portugal. Co-founders Dusan Cvetkovic and Andreia Cabanas, both architects, are the creative minds behind these papercraft models. As passionate architects with a shared love for conceptual art, 3D models, interior decoration and puzzles, they joined forces with a vision to transform homes all around the world with their DIY papercraft designs.
TITLE: These Papercraft Creations Will Change The Way People Decorate Homes

DESCRIPTION:
In Australia, our fire brigade and parks services burn sections of forest in order to help reduce the severity of bushfires (I know: setting a forest on fire to stop a forest catching fire makes sense). Just the other day they burned a section near where I live in the Dandenong Ranges and when they put signs up saying the burn was over, I decided to go and have a look.
The morning after the fires I got up before sunrise and made my way out into the forest.
TITLE: Hiking Through A Burnt Forest

DESCRIPTION: We have an organic farm in our yard. This monster edible puffball mushroom grew just outside the fence. A little egg batter, salt and pepper.
TITLE: Biggest Mushroom Ever That Grew On Our Organic Farm

DESCRIPTION: Every dream begins with a dreamer, this painting comes from my dream, it was peaceful dream, like meditation I felt like I'm part of universe, in this dream I was more awake than in are so called reality. Maybe are dreams are something much more, and just maybe there is another much bigger world to explore.
TITLE: New Work: Dream Voyage

DESCRIPTION:
We live in a global community. These days, borders get thinner, and as we travel more and more, our world gets smaller, and it's very hard to imagine that there are places still left hidden, and in plane site, non the less.
The Danube Delta is one of these places.
TITLE: The Undiscovered Beauty Of Romania Expressed In Ice Fishing Pictures

DESCRIPTION:
I work a lot with wood that I find lying around and in my aim to be able to use every part of a tree I came up with this product: magnetic stem vases!
These serve the dual purpose of (literally) livening up your fridge whilst displaying the beautiful growth rings of the wood. To accompany these I will be making little wood slice magnets.

DESCRIPTION: A woman was casually walking her dog in a remote area in England when they spotted an old suitcase left on some abandoned train tracks. To her surprise, the doggie rushed to the piece of luggage and started sniffing it as if to tell there was something inside. That's when the lady approached the suitcase and heard a faint cry of meows. She carefully unzipped it and saw a mother kitty with 8 baby cats left to die. They were emaciated and malnourished, and the mother feline looking particularly dehydrated.
TITLE: Woman Finds Old Suitcase On Train Tracks, Opens It And Discovers The Most Pawesome Thing Ever

DESCRIPTION: My art has always focused on the condition of our globe and the condition of man. I use photography and collage to create surreal images that are thematically focused on identity, dreams, new technologies, bio-science, the unconscious, morals, social situations, behaviours, habits, rituals, biological changes, depression in urban environments- which have significant impact on human life. To observe.
TITLE: I Use Photography And Collage To Create Surreal Images Of The 21st Century, Filled With Allusions, Metaphors And Allegories

DESCRIPTION: Everyone has a particular song that defines their relationship. The song he/she sent you when you first met, the song you both danced to for the first time, the song you listened to together when it rained, 'your song', the songs you listened to when your heart was broken and the song that reminds you of that so-and-so who got away. For this story, we interviewed various people in different stages of love and compiled a playlist of what it feels like, to fall in love, stay in love, fall out of love, remember love and be together forever
TITLE: 13 People Share The Feeling Of Being In Love Through Music
