DESCRIPTION:
Apparently the average British kitchen holds £267 of unused cooking gadgets, so it looks like Deliveroo has come up with a novel way to give these cooking implements a new lease of life, freeing up storage space at the same time. Turn them into a bicycle!
The bike is now part of the Deliveroo fleet and is now out delivering meals to hungry Londoners.

DESCRIPTION: I was born in 1987, in Budapest, Hungary. I started to deal with phtography in high school, when the first affordable digital cameras came out. At this time I have been acquainted with image editing softwares for years.

Paul I. Archer.

Hi :)
I work on a crazy pohotproject with my boyfriend and we need your help. Can we borrow your furniture for an hour? :D
I know it sounds a bit weird :D , but we are going to take pictures of rooms of our imaginary dream home in the most significant places in Europe. We started in Slovakia, Budapest-Hungary was the second one, then Ljubljana, Venice, Verona , Nice, Saint Tropez now we are in Marseille.

DESCRIPTION: You might not have heard of the quokka before, but there's a good chance you've seen pictures of them floating around the internet. They're distinctive because of their cheeky little grins, and it's no surprise that they're often referred to as the happiest animals in the world.

DESCRIPTION: No matter how many times you repeat an experience, there's simply nothing like doing it for the very first time. Whether it be the first time you see snow, the first time you set eyes on the ocean, the first time you ride a rollercoaster, or the first time you experience virtual reality, the magic (or the confusion. Or the sheer terror) of those moments will stay with you forever.
TITLE: 10+ Times People Did Things For The First Time, And Had The Best Reactions

DESCRIPTION: If you thought that Disney animations were purely fiction then think again, because as you can see from this list compiled by Bored Panda, the stars of some of our favorite films are actually real!

DESCRIPTION: Mexican designer Moisés Hernández has found a perfect balance between nature and machines. His new elegant series Immersed Birds is machine-milled but hand-painted and it looks absolutely marvelous.

DESCRIPTION:
Hello,
I'm a runner and illustrator based in Chicago. My name is Phil and I have a one-man illustration shop called Cape Horn Illustration. A few years back I decided to run the Chicago Marathon and, at the same time, commemorate the course with an illustrated map.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Tom, the emaciated pooch who spent the first four years of his life being chained to a tree, not getting enough food and water. His cruel Alabama-based owner didn't care about the dog's health issues, ranging from worms, to mange - or about the fact that the dog was seriously underweight, weighing less than 40 pounds at the time of his rescue.
TITLE: Dying Dog Chained For 4 Years Finds Forever Home, And This Is How Love Transformed Him

DESCRIPTION: I am a professional photographer. I'm also a mother of 2 amazing daughters which means when any of them is sick and does not go to a kindergarden I need to cancel a shoot and stay at home. So this time was exactely the same.

DESCRIPTION: Some husbands never really grow up. They might wear a suit to work every day, they might read the newspaper, and they might have seemingly adult conversations with other apparent grown-ups, but all they really want to do deep down is to break free from the shackles of conformity and simply become children again.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Hema the rescue pit bull who is obsessed with fostering kittens. All she wants to do is lick and snuffle them, dog's owner Marissa Clingen told The Dodo. Who would have thought a stray D.C. pit bull with scars on her face would be a good kitten mother?

DESCRIPTION:
I've got two super creative kids and when boredom strikes, we pick up a pencil, make a squiggle, and doodle the day away. It's a great way to kickstart some spontaneous creativity - and seeing how we all build upon the squiggles in our own unique way is fascinating.
So, knowing that there are a ton of creative Bored Pandas out there scratching around looking for something to do - we figured that we'd throw a random squiggle out onto the internet and invite you to add your own creative flare and imagination to it, and to share it with everyone to feedback upon.
TITLE: Challenge: Doodle Your Boredom Away By Finishing This Drawing

DESCRIPTION:
Hilarious encounter with a local? Misunderstanding that became the number one joke you always tell your friends? Public embarrassment caused by not knowing local customs?
If you love to travel, I'm sure you have some funny stories to tell. So go ahead and share the craziest ones with other pandas!

DESCRIPTION: Ever wanted to own a rabbit but don't have the time or space to look after one? Then why don't you grow one in a pot instead? Don't worry, we haven't gone crazy. We're referring to a species of succulent called Monilaria obconica that has a rather unique (not to mention incredibly cute) feature, namely the fact that it looks like it has little bunny rabbit ears!

DESCRIPTION: Elon Musk plants to get 1 million people to Mars, so we better start preparing for conditions in space. Luckily, astronauts like Chris Hadfield devote some of their space time to educate people about living in a zero G environment. In this video, Hadfield wrings a wet towel inside the International Space station and the water acts unlike we're used to it on Earth.

TITLE: Sleep Anywhere With Inflatable Hoodie

DESCRIPTION: Kenya-born and New Zealand-based artist Gordon Pembridge has developed a lifelong bond with nature. This connection with Mother Earth is often the main source of inspiration for his impressive wooden vessels that incorporate elements of natural history and portray colorful local wildlife.
TITLE: Kenya-Born Artist Hand-Carves Intricate Scenes Of Local Nature On Wood

DESCRIPTION: I love exploring and discovering myself in the beauty of a new place. Each and every destination is an unique opportunity to capture a moment, to frame the emotion, to keep the memory alive forever. This is my story told in frames, illustrating my existence along with all the happiness, joy, and color that surround me.
TITLE: Happy Feet : My Journey To Places

DESCRIPTION:
Since 2014 I am learning constantly new embroidery techniques, I am a self taught embroiderer with some inherited skills and big dreams.
After last year's Summer Collection I have created another series with insects for this year: Spring/Summer Collection of bohemian couture embroidery accessories. This year's fashion trend appears in my carefully detailed works: brooches, pendants, journals, and more.
TITLE: My Magic Wand Is A Pin With A Thread

DESCRIPTION:
This painting was created by Julia O'sullivan 4 years ago. It took me many months to research and design this piece and 5 months to actually paint it.
I had previously painted Lady Gaga and thought that she was such a colourful character that I wanted to paint someone more challenging so I chose David Bowie.
TITLE: I Took 8 Months To Research And Create This Epic Painting Of David Bowie

DESCRIPTION: Istanbul-based musician Sarper Duman found a way to connect with his cats through music. He composes melodies and performs them for his feline friends, who in return reward him with satisfying purrs and snuggles. It seems that Duman always hits the right notes, because the kitties look like they're in constant nirvana.
TITLE: Relationship Goals

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Riceball, I'm a 5 lb Chihuahua.
My human made me this room since 2 years ago, all the miniature furniture is either DIY by my human or collected from around this big big world.
TITLE: Little Chihuahua Riceball And His Miniature Room

DESCRIPTION:
This weekend I photographed senior dogs at the West Los Angeles Animal Shelter eating peanut butter. Senior animals often have a difficult time getting adopted and I wanted to show that older dogs are just as fun and silly as younger pups.
I typically photograph cats and I've found that when I take photos of cats with their tongues sticking out, people come into the shelter for those particular cats, so I knew I wanted to photograph dogs with their tongues out.
TITLE: I Photographed Senior Pups Eating Peanut Butter To Help Them Get Adopted

DESCRIPTION: On Thursday, a Twitter user named Emma shared a set of pictures of a cat with prosthetic human hands - and people immediately divided into two camps over whether the kitty is cute or creepy. The young woman says she found the images on Tumblr, but no one knows where they surfaced from or who exactly took those pictures. One thing is sure - no one is left indifferent after seeing this latest Internet cat sensation...
TITLE: This Cat With Prosthetic Human Hands Is Going Viral

DESCRIPTION:
Sometimes you create something so magical that you almost can't believe that you did it. My best friend and I have been cosplaying as a duo for about two years and with the upcoming release of the live action movie we decided to try our hand at Beauty and the Beast.
The result ended up being our favorite thing we've ever done.
TITLE: Beauty And The Beast Cosplay

DESCRIPTION: You are at home in your apartment, making tea and suddenly someone rings the doorbell. It's a complete stranger. He has a camera and is going to photograph you, naked.
TITLE: Strangers Came To These Berliners Houses To Photograph Them Naked And Here Are The Results (NSFW)

DESCRIPTION: I live in Poland (Rumia). I've been taking pictures for four years. I am an amateur.
TITLE: I Use Macro Lens To Capture Fragile Beauty Of Polish Nature

DESCRIPTION: Meet identical twins Cipriana Quann and TK Wonder - the girls that make heads turn when they walk the streets.
TITLE: These Twin Sisters Were Ashamed Of Their Incredible Hair, But Now They Became Famous For It

DESCRIPTION: Few animals have the power to make us smile quite like alpacas. There's just something about the South American camelids that's difficult not to like. Maybe it's because they're actually not so different from many human beings. They're slightly awkward, they're incapable of looking sophisticated in photographs, and some of them even like to go surfing.
TITLE: 10+ Alpacas That Will Make Your Day

DESCRIPTION: Anybody who's familiar with the comics of Sarah Andersen will know how perfectly they summarize the daily struggles of modern life, especially when it comes to the lives of introverts. Whether trying to be an adult, trying to fit in, trying to exit a bathroom gracefully, or simply trying to get out of bed in the morning, Sarah's Scribbles are as funny as they are relatable.
TITLE: 10+ Hilariously Honest Comics By Introvert Artist Sarah Scribbles

DESCRIPTION:
This series started by replacing Van Gogh's face with Clint Eastwood's.
I wasn't completely satisfied with the result, so I tried to work with masks and I realized that the stripes effect was super cool, as there was a perfect combination of pictured and painted image. Moreover, the new face I assembled was totally unique.
TITLE: I Create Striped Mashups Of Classic Hollywood Actors And Art Masterpieces

DESCRIPTION: The first time i saw the followmeto pictures in Murad Osmans instagram i became completely obsessed with it.I was very much inspired and dedicated to take pictures in such style to my trip to United States and Canada.With the help of my brother i was able to take some amazing shots.
TITLE: Inspired By Murad Osmans Follow-Me-To Trend I Decided To Take Pictures Accordingly

DESCRIPTION:
Walk through the 3D apartments of your favourite TV Show characters: Sheldon, Penny & Leonard.
Look at the colourful bedroom of Penny and at Sheldon's drawing boards. You may get inspired for your next redecoration or maybe your next invention.
TITLE: As Big Bang Theory Fans, We Created A 3d Model Of Sheldon, Penny & Leonard Apartments

DESCRIPTION: Last few months I spent among Kuki tribe in Manipur, a northeastern state of India and I had an opportunity to discover more about this still forgotten part of the World. Manipur is known as The Jewel of India and a Gateway to Southeast Asia. Honestly it is a very special place for me because my wife as well our daughter were born here.
TITLE: I Photograph Kids From Kuki Tribe In Northeast India

DESCRIPTION:
Hello, Ever since i started playing Hearthstone i just had to sculpt some of my favorite cards, so much cool designs and interesting characters. Blizzard again did a good job selecting artists and art work.
Sculpting relief sculpture is a bit different then sculpting full 3d, standing character.
TITLE: 17 Hearthstone Sculptures Turned In To Relief Sculptures

DESCRIPTION: An airplane landing at Budapest, Hungary. It took much trial and swearing to take this photo. No software manipulation.
TITLE: Oncoming Traffic

DESCRIPTION:
In the middle of 2014, I decided to move back Xiamen city from Beijing. There is sunshine, sea and blue sky in this southeast island city, except terrible haze.
I went to do the running or mountaineering exercise everyday.
TITLE: I See Many Funny Strangers On The Rock Everyday

DESCRIPTION:
I am an artist, painter and sculptor, and I like also to do creations with paper like pop-up and optical illusions.
It took 3 days to do this one Paper Dream.
TITLE: I Created A Pop-Up Paper Art Piece

DESCRIPTION:
When I go to the shops, I try to find the most desirable fruits and vegetables to carve up.
This time I found some beautiful green broccoli. They were like they were looking at me, shining & shimmering.
TITLE: Beautiful Broccoli Carvings By Daniele Barresi

DESCRIPTION: My name is Thea. I love creating an embroidery art with needle and silk threads. Most of the works I create by my imagination.
TITLE: I Create Embroidery Art With Needle And Silk Threads

DESCRIPTION: Last year I had an opportunity to go in Africa than voluntary for three weeks. There I decided, that under my volunteership I prepare a photo series about the local Luó tribe daily problems, their mentality, thei habits to present how wonderfull they are. I get acquainted with a culture in which the endless rotation of problems has thaught them to live for the present and believe in the god who's name is hope.
TITLE: Matumaini: The Daily Lives Of African Luó Tribe

DESCRIPTION: As much I love fashion, I'm a total wimp when it comes to prints and patterns. So to curb this dumb fear, I spent some free time creating little mini paintings that feature prints. I made up each print myself, (still not sure how that happened, but glad it did!).
TITLE: I Create Mini Paintings Featuring Patterns And Prints To Curb My Fear Of Them (Part 1)

DESCRIPTION: I was attending Boston University at the time, and something just didn't feel right. I was in their arts program but I didn't feel like I fit in. That's when I decided take a shot at earning a spot in The Cooper Union! This school also offers half-tuition to all students, so it was basically my only shot at attending an art school that wouldn't devour my bank accounts.
TITLE: I Spent 3 Months Filling An Entire Sketchbook For A College Application!

DESCRIPTION: A picture I did about a month ago.
TITLE: My Tribute To Carrie Fisher And Debbie Reynolds

DESCRIPTION: I paint, draw, and take photos to support my 16 year old and raise awareness for pediatric Complex Regional Pain Syndrome and Fibromyalgia. I have been a solo parent for many years, but last year things became even more challenging. My daughter, Pam, was diagnosed with CRPS and Fibromyalgia in March 2016.
TITLE: I Create Art To Support Pain Management For My Child With Fibromyalgia And Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

DESCRIPTION:
The moment I saw pictures of the Deadvlei featured in National Geographic I knew I just had to go there. So my girlfriend and me bought our tickets to Namibia to drive our way through the desert to this valley in Sossusvlei National Park in the Namib Desert.
Featured in The Cell with Jeniffer Lopez for its dreamy landscape, Deadvlei is well-known for unique color palet.
TITLE: My Pictures From The Namib Desert Look Like They Were Taken On Another Planet!

DESCRIPTION: Do you pray that nobody picks up the phone whenever you have to call somebody? Do you feel like partying when somebody decides to cancel a party? Do you fear living with somebody more than you fear the prospect of dying alone? Then this funny list of introvert tweets is especially for you.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Introvert Tweets That Are Worth Cancelling Your Plans For

DESCRIPTION: I found web comics pretty interesting and funny and I always wanted to make my own someday. So one day I just started and from that day until today inspiration is never ending. I think this is a fun and creative coping mechanism with everyday struggles that many people can relate to.
TITLE: I Cope With My Everyday Problems By Drawing Comics (10+ Pics)

DESCRIPTION: It was just another ordinary day for cameraman Garth De Bruno Austin, who was shooting a conservation film about rhino poaching in South Africa, when he was suddenly approached by a rhino asking for a belly rub. All of this was captured in a 15-second video that proves even rhinos need some TLC every now and then.
TITLE: This Wild Rhino Walked Up To A Cameraman, And Demanded A Belly Rub

DESCRIPTION:
Some may say that sexism at work doesn't exist or it's exaggerated, but this man just experienced what it's like to walk in a woman's shoes.
Martin R. Schneider, a writer and editor at Front Row Central, accidentally sent emails to a client under his female co-worker's name, and was completely surprised by the results.
TITLE: This Man Did A Sexism Experiment With A Female Co-Worker, And Was Completely Surprised By The Results

DESCRIPTION:
March 12th marks the day to remember one of the greatest film makers that have walked this Earth, Alfred Hitchcock. It's one of those times when people all around the world wish to pay a tribute in the best way they can.
Romanian Art Director and Graphic Designer Eduard Cirstea, known for this negative space work, created three movie posters of some of the most iconic films brought to life by Hitchcock.
TITLE: Negative Space Artist Back With Alfred Hitchcock Tribute

DESCRIPTION:
I created this whole setup in 3 days for the miniature conceptual photoshoot.
I used very basic supplies so that if someone wants to try they can. I used photoshop too to bring out the beauty.
TITLE: I Made My Own Outdoor Destination For Awesome Photoshoot

DESCRIPTION: War never changes
TITLE: War Never Changes

DESCRIPTION: Experimenting with the material I've created shapes and textures adapting to all sorts of needs including fashion.
TITLE: I Create 3D Magnolia Flowers On Walls Using Industrial Silicone

DESCRIPTION:
While my twins are running around making a mess or interrupting me every 2 seconds, my pre-schooler goes through Pinterest and pics out a hairstyle. 
Sometimes, I get creative all my own. It amazes me that she sits still long enough for me to finish.
TITLE: I Give My Daughter Pinterest Hairstyles Every Morning Before School

DESCRIPTION: Sir Patrick Stewart, a British actor best known for his roles in Star Trek and X-Men, just shared a video of him meeting his new foster pup Ginger - and it's just pure emotion. The new pup is a pit bull, and it's the first dog of this particular breed for Stewart and his partner. Celebrities adopting pit bulls are a powerful force against the prevailing prejudice associated with these dogs, as they are often mistakenly considered overly aggressive and not worthy of love.
TITLE: Patrick Stewart Meets His New Foster Pit Bull, Falls In Love Immediately

DESCRIPTION: Meet Poppy, a young doggie who got her spine crushed as a puppy and became paralyzed in her back legs. No one knows how this happened, but for the next weeks, or even months, she dealt with this on her own before dragging herself for miles to find someone to help her...
TITLE: This Paralyzed Dog Dragged Her Legs For Miles Hoping Someone Would Help Her

DESCRIPTION:
A while ago we established that cats are in fact liquids. But did you know that other animals can obtain a liquid form as well?
Bored Panda collected a list of melting animals, proving that different species just have different melting points. Some animals melt to disguise themselves, others melt involuntarily while sleeping and hamsters melt because you pet them.
TITLE: 10+ Animals That Just Melted (Our Hearts)

DESCRIPTION: When on live TV, you can never go back and fix a scene that went wrong... And neither could BBC correspondent Robert E Kelly.
TITLE: Man Tries To Give Serious BBC Interview, Forgets He Has Children

DESCRIPTION: No matter how cute the puppies in these pictures are, don't get fooled - these dogs are on a serious mission.
TITLE: 10+ Puppies On Their First Days Of Work That Will Make Your Day

DESCRIPTION: As a kid of the 80's, dragons have always inspired me. Whether it was through movies, video games or dungeons, and dragons, these mythical beasts had an influence on my imagination. With this series of drawings, I wanted to show a different side of the animal.
TITLE: I Draw Dragons To Destroy The Stereotypes About Them

DESCRIPTION: I photographed Japanese spring scenery. It is a season of plum blossoming. Cherry blossoms are famous in Spring, but plum blossoms bloom beautifully before cherries. I was surprised to see this great view. These pictures are all plum blossoms.
TITLE: I Captured Plum Trees Blooming In Japan

DESCRIPTION: My latest watercolor series captures the vibrant colors of various tropical and domestic birds. The three roosters were painted to celebrate the 2017 Chinese Year of the Rooster. Each represents one of the key elements of the Chinese Zodiac: Red (Fire Rooster), Blue (Water Rooster) and Green (Wood Rooster).
TITLE: My Watercolor Birds Capture The Vibrant Spirit Of Nature

DESCRIPTION:
Hi there! I'm Catherine Holmes. I'm a British photographer based in New Zealand and for the last few years, I've been creating wild and unique/crazy images of animals, with a particular focus on cats.
Why cats, you ask? I did this because I thrive on the look of abject disappointment and disgust from my subjects.
TITLE: I Made A Career Out Of Annoying Cats

DESCRIPTION: My name is Monika, I am 24 years old hitchhiker from Poland. Since one year I am travelling across Africa by hitchhike. I started my journey in march from Sharm el Sheikh in Egypt.
TITLE: One Year Ago I Started Hitchhiking Alone Through Africa

DESCRIPTION: I've seen plenty of iconic origin stories in comics and movies. And I've assembled my share of IKEA furniture items. Those little cartoon people in the instructions are so distinctive that it sparked an idea.
TITLE: I Mashed Up Three Classic Superhero Origin Stories With Ikea Instruction Manuals

DESCRIPTION: Sometimes it's really hard to understand and experience art, so one creative duo decided to make fun out of it. Artist Hank Schmidt in der Beek and photographer Fabian Schubert have been working on a project, called Und im Sommer tu ich malen (which translates And in the Summer I do paint) which combines photography and painting, and is not only well executed but hilarious as well.
TITLE: Artist Travels To Stunning Locations Only To Paint The Pattern Of His Shirt

DESCRIPTION: The Great Welsh Dragon is one woman's mission to try and encompass the whole history and culture of the Welsh people into one sculpture. It stands 2.8 metres high and has 29 oils paintings attached to it.
TITLE: It Took Me 22 Months To Make A Stunning 2.8 Metre High Monument

DESCRIPTION: The fashion industry is meant for designers to let their imagination go free, and that's exactly what Christopher Kane did...
TITLE: Furry Crocs Are A Thing Now, And The World Is Definitely Coming To An End

DESCRIPTION: We are a family of four and we create Friendly Toys: dad Donatas carries out all the woodworking, mom Sigita decorates the toys, and daughters Saule and Goda are the most important critics and the inspiration behind the toys. Before our first daughter was born we decided to leave the busy city life of Vilnius and moved to the place where trees touch the sky. Inspired by watching our daughter grow we began creating wooden toys for her and all the children in the world.
TITLE: Before The Birth Of Our First Daughter, We Moved To The Countryside To Make Wooden Toys

DESCRIPTION: Engraving makes a regular item personal and one of a kind. California-based artist Mike Ward specializes in a specific type of engraving that looks satisfying not only when finished, but whilst it's being burned onto the leather as well.
TITLE: Satisfying Leather Engraving

DESCRIPTION: Anyone who knows me knows I have this weird obsession with fog. I'm drawn to its ethereal dream-like quality. Here is a selection of fog photos from some of my recent location photo shoots in and around Southern California (minus the human component).
TITLE: I Drive Around To Find And Photograph Dreamy Foggy Scenes

DESCRIPTION:
My Brancusi Visions gather a series of photographic works made in a special technique - lightpainting.
Lightpainting, is a photographic technique in which exposures are made by moving a hand-held light source while taking a long exposure photograph.
Images are executed in a single shot , they are not digital compositions made in Photoshop.
TITLE: I Painted With Light Brancusi Sculptures

DESCRIPTION: LYFE is like a hoverboard, but for plants. This 'zero-gravity' pot was created by a Swedish company Flyte, and it hovers over an oak base using magnetic levitation. They designed it to rotate during suspension, so LYFE provides sunlight to all 360 degrees of the plant, 365 days a year.
TITLE: Levitating Flower Pot

DESCRIPTION:
As a miniature conceptual photographer, I did lots of projects. I did series on miniature cars, jets, helicopters and landscape.
But this is my personally favourite because I loved working on this project.
TITLE: I Went To Space From My Studio

DESCRIPTION: I always loved working with wood, but I was always bored with the simple project, I was keen to find out something unique...
TITLE: I Keep Finding Nice Pieces Of Wood In The Park, So I Decided To Recycle Them For Something Magical

DESCRIPTION: Street artist David Zinn's chalk creatures have been inhabiting Ann Arbor, Michigan since 2008. David calls himself an inveterate doodler and a shameless word nerd and uses art as a problem-solving tool. What are the problems he solves? Sad-looking street cracks, unappreciated blooming flowers, boring sidewalks, and other urban features that could use an additional sprinkle of happiness. David's light-hearted creatures are small-scale but high-charm, and have earned him 180,000 followers on Instagram.
TITLE: Chalk-Drawn Adventures By David Zinn

DESCRIPTION:
I am a self-taught sculptor from the finger lakes region of New York State making botanical art from porcelain and clay.
As a child, I made my toys from modeling clay from as early as 4 years old. I created everything from animals, airplanes, soldiers, sports figures.
TITLE: I Grow Succulents From Clay And Porcelain

DESCRIPTION: I am Paul Eis, a 19 years old architecture student. In the summer of 2015, I was walking through the streets of Berlin looking for some nice architecture to photograph. But I had to realize how monotonous the cityscape of my hometown is in the most places.
TITLE: I Got Bored By The Gray Cityscape Of Berlin, So I Started To Colorize Buildings With Photoshop

DESCRIPTION: Once I had a crazy idea to take a photo of a horse from underneath, today I have results from my most difficult photoshoot I have ever had. It all started with a project Under-Cats. After it reached a high interest I decided to make a far bigger project.
TITLE: Under-Horse: I Photograph Horses From Underneath

DESCRIPTION: The Veterans Community Project in Kansas City is taking serious steps to improve the lives of America's war heroes. Thanks to generous donations from community members, they've built the Veterans Village, a collection of small houses that homeless veterans can live in for free.
TITLE: City Builds Tiny Village For Homeless Veterans With 50 Tiny Houses So They Could Live There For Free

DESCRIPTION: This UK-based couple was heartbroken when their pet Bear the cat suddenly passed away. Little did they know, however, that soon they would get a note from a stranger that would reveal something surprising about their beloved kitty.
TITLE: After Losing A Cat, This Couple Found A Note From A Stranger Revealing How Their Kitty Changed Her Life

DESCRIPTION: Dale, 34, has been carrying the idea of proposing to Karlie, 29, under the Aurora Borealis for five years. I hadn't heard or seen anyone do it before, and I wanted to do something different from everybody else, he said. That place was also special for both of them because the couple visited it about 30 times. We both love chasing the Northern Lights and photographing them together, so it seemed pretty fitting.
TITLE: Photographer Proposed To His Girlfriend Under The Northern Lights And The Photos Are Breathtaking

DESCRIPTION: Do you feel like throwing a party every time your kid finally goes to sleep at night? Do you dread the thought of having to move your child's carseat into another car? Is dealing with your children akin to dealing with a pack of velociraptors? If you find yourself nodding wildly to any or all of the above, then this list of hilarious parenting memes compiled by Bored Panda is especially for you.
TITLE: 10+ Parenting Memes That Will Make You Laugh So Hard It Will Wake Up Your Kids

DESCRIPTION: While most 5-year-old children are in school or outside playing, little Anna Wang from Southwest China is taking care of her grandmother and great-grandmother. In fact, she is the sole caregiver for both elderly women, a role thrust upon her by circumstances no child should have to endure.
TITLE: 5-Year-Old Girl Becomes The Sole Carer Of Her Grandmas, After Her Mother Abandons Her

DESCRIPTION: Some of the most memorable moments of our lives come from the first time we did something, whether it be our first day at school, our first trip to the dentist, or the first time we rode a bike without falling off. But as you can see from this funny list compiled by Bored Panda, firsts are important to animals too!
TITLE: 10+ Times Animals Did Things For The First Time, And Had The Funniest Reactions

DESCRIPTION: Meet Sage, an elderly blind Labrador who lost her eyesight due to glaucoma. Last month, the visually impaired pooch went missing for a whole week. The doggie's owner, Beth Cole from Boulder Creek, California, said her family had gone to bed on February 24 when the 12-year-old canine disappeared. However, the doggie managed to return home - all thanks to this kind off-duty firefighter.
TITLE: Blind Dog Is Found In The Mountains 8 Days After She Disappeared

DESCRIPTION:
Saw this guy on Bored Panda a while ago doing something similar and I was inspired.
I gave it a try and this is what I've created using sticky notes!
TITLE: I Reimagined My Colleagues With New Famous Faces Using Sticky Notes

DESCRIPTION: Animals inspire some of the most beautiful tattoos, but this one even interacts with the body it covers. Inked by an Austrian artist Andre Zechmann, it features a colorful phoenix, and the shoulder movement makes it look like the creature is flying.
TITLE: Incredible Flying Phoenix Tattoo

DESCRIPTION: It is no secret that men and women don't see eye to eye on certain things. I bet most of us have witnessed or even been in one of those situations where a guy thinks he's complimenting a woman and she takes the compliment for insult...
TITLE: How Differently Men And Women See The World

DESCRIPTION: Hugh Jackman, AKA Wolverine, is currently on the circuit promoting his new movie, Logan. But when he tweeted a picture of himself with fans in Beijing recently, he probably wasn't expecting to be trolled by another popular member of the Marvel ensemble.
TITLE: Ryan Reynolds And Hugh Jackman Trolling Each Other Is The Funniest Celeb Feud Ever

DESCRIPTION:
Yesterday was International Women's Day. In celebration of everything awesome that women have achieved over the years we decided to illustrate 10 of the most iconic ladies of all time from around the globe.
From the lady who won UK women the right to vote back in the 1920s to the teenager campaigning for girls' right to education in Pakistan, we think these 10 females from around the world have kicked ass throughout history to the present day.
TITLE: We Sketched 10 Of The Most Inspirational Women From Around The World

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Rocío and my great passion is creating beautiful butter cookies decorated with royal icing, food coloring and, in some occasions, isomalt.
I have been drawing since I was a child and over the years I have used many tools: pencils, brushes, graphic tablets..
TITLE: I Enjoy Creating Art In Butter Cookies

DESCRIPTION:
Spanish street artist Pejac has recently came up with a clever idea to bring the outdoors indoor while also staying true to his advocacy to generate environmental awareness through art.
The Redemption series make use of standard pressed wood panels as canvases. Using only pencil and ink, he managed to hide some of the existing elements as well as elevate others, creating an effective illusion of perspective within which he placed unexpected imagery.
TITLE: Spanish Artist Pejac Transforms Pressed Wood Into Optical Illusion Artworks

DESCRIPTION: My left hand was missing when I was born. So growing up I had to deal with being different. And I never once saw someone like me! Not on the streets, not on tv, not in my books, not anywhere.
TITLE: I Love Modeling With My Disability

DESCRIPTION:
In the summer of 2016, I traveled to Finland to achieve a dream of mine: seeing and photographing the incredible brown bears that stalk through the ancient Taiga forests.
They move silently, foraging for fruits and berries amongst the marshes. One bear, in particular, stood out.
TITLE: I Waited 15 Hours A Day To Find The Biggest Bear In Finland

DESCRIPTION: Italian is one of the most charming and romantic languages on Earth, but it's common knowledge that real Italians talk more with their hands than their words. It's a trait often thought to reflect the passionate ways of the world's southern cultures. Here's a quick lesson that will carry you through Rome, Venice, and beyond.
TITLE: How To Speak Fluent Italian

DESCRIPTION:
It started as a 365 days watercolor challenge after a long break. I continued until over 200 days and stopped feeling it's just too much drawing for me.
But the good thing I've got from that time was the idea of making funny, silly, cute real cats portraits!
TITLE: I Make Funny Cat Portraits

DESCRIPTION: I started making these illustrations in 2014 after setting myself a goal to draw everyday, since drawing brings me great joy. I was teaching elementary school at the time and there used to be a lot of markers lying around in my office which I started playing around with. I'm especially fond of nature and I've always been a fan of drawing trees and floral patterns and as my sketches developed I started focusing more on the detail surrounding us everyday.
TITLE: I Use Permanent Markers To Draw Detailed, Night-Time Forest Scenes With Animals

DESCRIPTION: Your lovely pet on your skin with a different look
TITLE: Animals Resting On Bodies By Makinucci

DESCRIPTION: I brought this beautiful cat from my summer holiday in Greece, exactly he found me in the beach and from the very beginning I loved him so much and I decided to adopt him and to give him a loving home for ever. Now he is one and half year old and from tinny sick small kitten became an amazing domesticated lion with 7 kilograms weight. I will never stop loving him, my sweet friend from beautiful greek island
TITLE: My Amazing Ginger Cat Bastiaan From Greek Beach

DESCRIPTION:
On a day to day basis, I meet and interact with a lot of different animals. This is my dream.
Insects, mammals, birds.
TITLE: I Like To Take Photos Of Animals I Meet Using My iPhone

DESCRIPTION: It literally fell from the sky. The perfectly-made straw nest, no bigger than five inches in circumference, stood at our feet after we exited our car. Little did we know, it was the beginning of some interesting lessons for us for the next five days.
TITLE: We Learned Lessons Of A Lifetime In Five Days

DESCRIPTION:
Harry Potter (it's really a Harriet Potter as it's a gorgeous little girl), I'd had this idea for a while a fab lady in America makes me hats and props, this took 12 hours roughly (I don't normally edit to this extreme).
This is a combination of about 8 different elements, so many parents nowadays grew up with the wonder of Harry Potter and love this set up. I love that as these children grow and their sense of wonder and imagination grow.
TITLE: I Turn Babies And Children Into Fairy Tale Characters

DESCRIPTION: Since I was a little girl I`ve always loved colors. The more I have the better I feel. Using this Anime fashion style, gives me the option to show the world the beauty of many colors together.
TITLE: Its Doll Time

DESCRIPTION: March 8 is International Women's Day (US has its equivalent on the 26th of August) which celebrates the struggle for women's rights. Throughout history, many strong women had to rise against the odds and fight for their dreams and passions, equality and solidarity among men. Their bravery contributed to shaping today's world, and has to be remembered.
TITLE: 10+ Badass Women Who Changed The World We Live In Today

DESCRIPTION: For those of you who don't already know, today is International Women's Day, so we thought we'd honor the occasion by bringing you this hilarious list of tweets that many women are sure to relate to.
TITLE: 10+ Hilarious Picture Tweets That Every Woman Will Relate To

DESCRIPTION: Wall Street's famous Charging Bull statue now has company. State Street Global Advisors, the world's third-largest asset manager, has installed a bronze statue named The Fearless Girl directly across from the Bull, and she stands for more than just artistic value.
TITLE: $2.5 Trillion Asset Manager Puts Statue Of Fearless Girl In Front Of Wall Street Bull

DESCRIPTION: Back in 2014, photographer Lora Scantling captured three young girls fighting cancer. Now, 3 years later, the girls have reunited for a new photo, and they're stronger and healthier than ever!
TITLE: 3 Years Later, Cancer Survivors Recreate Their Viral Photo, And The Difference Is Striking

DESCRIPTION: Meet Mermaid Kelly, a Disney obsessed girl who always dreamt of becoming a Professional Mermaid. She has made her dream a reality and continues to inspire people around the world to never give up on their dreams.
TITLE: Disney Obsessed Girl Spent Over $3,000 Usd To Transform Herself Into The Little Mermaid

DESCRIPTION: My name is Julie and I am living my dream in South Africa. I live on a farm and care for all sorts of animals but I have one species in abundance. Chickens! When we moved here little over a year ago, there were around 30 Chickens living in our garden.
TITLE: I Rescue And Care For Chickens In Paradise

DESCRIPTION: A name tag is what introduces an employee to a customer, but sometimes they're so unfortunate that a good first impression is simply impossible. Just ask Ass. Manager Ashley or GIANT Johnson who gets pleasure from serving people. Bored Panda has collected some of the most unfortunate name tags, and they're so bad that they're hilarious.
TITLE: 10+ People With The Most Unfortunate Name Tags

DESCRIPTION: IKEA's furniture has a reputation for being stylish and practical, but also immensely difficult to assemble. After several years of brainstorming and creating, they may have finally solved the problem, and now they're introducing furniture that's stronger and simpler than ever before.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Friar Bigotón (Friar Moustache), the stray doggie who just became a member of a St Francis Monastery in Cochabamba, Bolivia. The saint after which the Franciscan order was established is known as the patron of animals, so it's only natural that the monks extended their helping hand to the pooch living on the streets. Now he is one happy doggie who gets to enjoy life to the fullest. His life is all about playing and running, fellow friar Jorge Fernandez told The Dodo. Here, all of the brothers love him very much. He is a creature of God.
TITLE: This Monastery Adopted A Stray Dog, Now He Enjoys His Life As A Monk

DESCRIPTION: Working student Zanda Indriksone started helping homeless and abandoned cats about two years ago. DESCRIPTION: Sharon Henry is a 40-year-old pastry chef, exploring the sweet side of Paris. She introduces outsiders with candy-making from the inside, and not only writes about them on her blog, but captures interesting visual material as well. Her Instagram video collection includes shots from Alain Ducasse's chocolate factory, chocolate laboratory of Patrick Roger, and other yummy places. Her work proves that UNESCO was right when it declared French cuisine 'world intangible heritage!'

DESCRIPTION: I'm an artist who ate Babybel cheese while watching TV, then mindlessly fiddled with the leftover wax. At some point, I looked down and thought, Huh, I made a tiny bird. This means I can make other stuff! So now I make other, better stuff out of cheese wax.

DESCRIPTION:
Ever since I was a child i have enjoyed drawing. I started when I was about 6 years old. Now at 21 I am doing art full time! If people tell me they will never be good at drawing 'because they don't have the latent' I tell them a very important thing I've learned over the years: Hard work, persistence and a looot of practice are way more important than having talent only!
This image shows the progress I have made in my work.

DESCRIPTION: The Ruffit is a backpack designed to strengthen the bond between a man and his best friend. It mimics a common dog sitting position on your back and allows your pet to join all of your adventures. The cushioned interior and side straps secure a comfortable ride, while the mesh side panels keep the dog nice and cool.

DESCRIPTION: Been painting a little over a year now and just trying to share my progress through videos and posts.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Pumpkin, a pregnant dog mamma who was rescued from a life on the streets - and recently needed to be saved again when she got stuck under a shed at the Hawkins County Humane Society. When the rescue's staff wasn't looking, the doggie with a baby bump managed to crawl under the narrow space beneath the storage house and got trapped in.
TITLE: Man Saves Dog From Being Trapped Under Shed, Realizes He Saved Something More

DESCRIPTION: I love yoga. It stays with me already for more than 5 years daily and I cannot imagine myself without it. It seems my pets have this secret addiction to it too - so every time I am trying to get busy - or I have an audience, or I am being helped with every single pose.

DESCRIPTION: I have made a new sculpture in my Heirlooms series titled Beginning at the End. This new piece features a child's cradle made of pine wood that I have knotted a 123ft of rope inside its interior space. At the center of the knotted mass is a photograph of me on the day I was born.
TITLE: I Create Fine Art Sculptures From Various Objects That Belonged To My Family

DESCRIPTION:
After living in Hawaii for the last 15 years, my husband and I have recently moved back to Sweden where I am now enjoying getting back in touch with my Scandinavian heritage.
This is my first painting since our return and I'd like to share with other Pandas what nearly four months of work looks like when compressed down to just over one minute.
TITLE: My First Painting Since Returning Home To Sweden

DESCRIPTION:
I'm a photographer from Lithuania, 19 years old. A few stray cats live near my house and about a year ago I tried to take some photos of them. 
Two months ago I looked at these photos and realized that stray cats look really interesting, not like regular, cute cats that we usually see.
TITLE: Intimate Portraits Of Stray Cats That I Took In My Hometown

DESCRIPTION: We have successfully settled the mic battle between a baby and a beatboxer, but now it's time to set the stage for a human drum competition. That's right, Matt Nickle has created a battle, entirely consisting of sounds, produced by slapping bodies.
TITLE: Incredible Belly-Slapping Music

DESCRIPTION:
The idea was inspired by the mountains that resemble a triangle, consisting of shipping containers, the hotel Quadrum is shaped like a pyramid.
The architect Sandro Ramishvili and Irakli Eristavi are the minds behind this extraordinary creation. Built in a minimalist style, the hotel seems to repeat the local terrain, cascading down the mountainside.
TITLE: Mountain-Inspired Hotel Built From Shipping Containers 2200 Meters Above Sea Level In Georgia

DESCRIPTION:
Four years ago I was diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder and to try and understand the diagnoses and what it means I used photography as art therapy to express emotions, fears and feelings during manic and depressive attacks. I guess a lack of vocabulary to explain these debilitating episodes made me turn to New Media Art to create this quirky self-portrait series to find a way to communicate something that felt overwhelming and unexplainable at the time.
Seasons of the Mind is a project about Mental Health.
TITLE: A Very Quirky Self-Portrait Series And Look At Mental Health

DESCRIPTION:
We made this beautiful sculpture for cats to enjoy.
There are 4 places to hang dangles, 4 platforms, the top two being connected by a rope bridge, and being basketed. At 6 feet, this massive playground boasts a luxurious tube bed, twin baskets and lots and lots of love.
TITLE: We Make Amazing Cat Trees Out Of Recycled Materials.

DESCRIPTION:
I made these one of a kind little magnets with polymer clay (and occasionally with a few other materials like stone and moss). My obsession with with sculpting tiny objects has mostly been focused on making jewelry pendants, but I recently decided to branch out a little and try magnets.
I love decorating my home with things I find in nature, so the idea of decorating a refrigerator with fantastical, earthy, organic shapes appealed to me!
TITLE: I Create These Earthy Refrigerator Magnets

DESCRIPTION:
UGEARS is 3D wooden mechanical puzzle which can be mechanically moved without using battery and glue does not required during the assembling process.
It will definitely inspire your logical thinking and creativity during the assembling process. It could be the best education toy to show you show the gears link to each other.
TITLE: This New Wooden Mechanical Puzzle Will Inspire Your Engineering Mind

DESCRIPTION:
Vintage books have been cut and transformed into book sculptures and posters.
The city guides function as representations of the cities and as symbolic tools to use when traveling. They have lost their value in the age of technology, but by transforming them, we have given them a new meaning and value.
TITLE: Deconstructed Book Series

DESCRIPTION:
These comics basically sum up my entire life, being an awkward twenty-something in a society filled with things I'll probably never understand.
I'm always happy to hear that I'm not the only awkward human being on this planet. Let's laugh at our daily struggles and be awkward together!
TITLE: I Illustrate My Daily Problems As A Woman In Funny And Relatable Comics

DESCRIPTION: Typically, building a house takes months. Yet a San Franciso-based company managed to build one in just 24 hours.
TITLE: This House Was 3D-Printed In Just 24 Hours For Less Than $11k

DESCRIPTION: The news media is there to provide the masses with factual information about what's happening in the world, but as you've no doubt realized, it doesn't always seem like that. Often it feels as if reporters deliberately spin a story a certain way in order to make it more sensational, regardless of whether there's actually any truth behind it or not, and this comic summarises that process perfectly.
TITLE: How Media Actually Works Summed Up In 6 Pics

DESCRIPTION: Meet Smokey the rescue dog who won't go anywhere without his elephant toy. His previous owners lost their home and couldn't look after the pooch anymore. The 5-year-old doggie was surrendered into a Franklin County Dog Shelter & Adoption Center on Valentine's Day, along with his favorite toy so that he can take comfort in it. Smokey loves his stuffed gray elephant with pink ears so much, there was a sign on his kennel saying that he and elephant must be adopted together.
TITLE: Sad Shelter Dog Whose Only Friend Was This Elephant Toy Learns That He And His Toy Are Getting New Home

DESCRIPTION:
Apparently, I'm becoming known for my ink sets so here's the next series. 
This time I drew the Zodiac Signs in my creepy style.
You can also check out my posts about Mental Illnesses And Disorders, and about 7 Deadly Sins.
TITLE: I Reimagined Zodiac Signs As Creepy Monsters

DESCRIPTION: My name is Yana Khachikyan, I create miniature oil paintings on stones. Most of my paintings involve animals, especially I love painting tiny birds which are all cute and colorful. Some of my birds are of a peas size, and this makes them even more attractive.
TITLE: I Create Miniature Worlds Of Tiny Creatures On Stones (Part 2)

DESCRIPTION: This is a story about stray dogs in Sochi. This happened in spring 2015, I was spending winter in that wonderful place. There were a lot of stray dogs in the streets of Sochi.

DESCRIPTION: In a recent ad, Zara tells women to love their curves. Hurray for that. Unfortunately, the retailer has put this remark next to a photo of two skinny models, who are very pretty and lovely, but not curvy.

DESCRIPTION: Graviky Labs has found a way to turn ugly and harmful pollution into beautiful art-producing ink. They have built a contraption that connects behind the exhaust of a tail pipe of a car, which captures soot and takes it through a purification process that converts it into ink.
TITLE: Air Pollution Turned Into Ink To Create Art

DESCRIPTION:
I Love to do miniature photography and what I love about my art is that I can create my fantasies into reality.
I am very much into my creative conceptual photography even if it's still life or Miniature photography.
I really want to tell everyone that being creative is not a gift it's all observation and honest work towards your art.
TITLE: It Took Me 50 Hours To Make My Own Island

DESCRIPTION: Some truck drivers were making their way through Botswana when a baby elephant suddenly appeared out of the bushes by the side of the road. The drivers from AfriAg transport company in Johannesburg, South Africa stopped due to a downed bridge in their path when the animal showed up. The men immediately realized that the elephant was terribly thirsty. They let the baby animal drink out of one of their own bottles, and started scanning the horizon for the elephant's mother and his herd. Unfortunately, he was all by himself...
TITLE: When A Thirsty Baby Elephant Appeared Out Of Nowhere, These Truck Drivers Stopped To Help Him

DESCRIPTION: Rosie the kitten and Lilo the Husky are different by chance, but best friends by choice. They met when Rosie was only 3 weeks old. She was a sick little rescue kitten, but when her new owners paired her with Lilo, the dog changed its life forever.
TITLE: Kitten Has A Husky Mama

DESCRIPTION: Hi I am an independent toy designer from Hong Kong. I have a soft spot for old Macintosh design. That is why i created the Macinbot Classic, a collectible figure inspired by Macintosh Classic.
TITLE: I Created A Designer Toy That Mac Fans Will Love. Introducing Macinbot Classic

DESCRIPTION: I am a self-taught artist. I like to draw, paint, and wood burn. I think anything with a surface can became a piece of art.
TITLE: I Mix Different Techniques And Mediums To Create These Artworks

DESCRIPTION:
Cristina Castro Moral is a graphic designer and illustrator from Spain. She is 27 years old and has been working as a freelacer since 2012.
She mostly works on logo and website design for small businesses and startups and illustration is her sort of guilty pleasure.
TITLE: These Illustrations Of Unconcerned-Looking Unicorns Will Brighten Up Your Day

DESCRIPTION: A smile or a tear, sadness or happiness... I feel my work is better when I want to express something with it because it has an additional value: it has meaning. Working with portraits means expressing personal feelings but to each person what an illustration tells is different so for me, the most important thing is not telling a particular message but being able to cause something in a viewer and the best way is showing emotions with m
TITLE: Painting Emotions With Coffee

DESCRIPTION: There's nothing funny about depression or anxiety, but some sufferers find humor to be a good way of dealing with the daily struggles of living with such mood disorders. British artist Gemma Correll is one of those people, and as you can see below, her illustrators are as funny as they are thought-provoking.
TITLE: Artist Suffering From Anxiety And Depression Illustrates Her Life In Hilarious Comics

DESCRIPTION:
I created this piece originally in college as part of my advanced drawing course. The assignment was to create a drawing made up of an object.
I chose chameleons as my subject to serve as a metaphor for the inner/outer self.
TITLE: I Made These Chameleons Out Of Thousands Of Glass Beads

DESCRIPTION: We often assume that works of creative art are based off events in the real world, but what if it's really the other way around? These examples could be the only proof we need.
TITLE: 10+ Times Life Imitated Art

DESCRIPTION: For those of you who don't know, vitiligo is a harmless long-term skin disorder characterized by white patches that appear on different parts of the body. This happens because the body's immune system attacks and destroys the skin cells that make color (called melanocytes).
TITLE: 10+ Unusual Looking Animals With Vitiligo Who Are Running Out Of Ink

DESCRIPTION: I started out this project soulfully because I have always wanted a collection since as long as I can remember. Of course, considering the price tags and exotic lands one must journey through just to capture the beauty of nature is something all us poor artists can't really afford. So I've decided to make my own collection.
TITLE: I Paint Insects On Cutting Boards

DESCRIPTION: I am Vivien Szaniszló. I like to paint since I was a child. My works always featured by vivid colours and expressivity.
TITLE: I Paint Human Emotions And Relations In An Unique Perspective

DESCRIPTION: Lana Del Rey painting. I made this photoshop.
TITLE: I Created Digital Painting Of Lana Del Rey

DESCRIPTION: This adorable polar bear cub might be only 14-weeks-old, but she already has plenty of charm. Pictures taken last Friday at the Hellabrunn Zoo in Munich show the little bear jumping on the rocks, playing hide-and seek, enjoying some pretzels and bravely exploring the surroundings without the slightest sign of timidness. Oh, and at some point, she even winks at the camera!
TITLE: This Polar Bear Cub Taking Her First Steps And Winking At The Camera Is The Cutest Thing Ever

DESCRIPTION: My photographs exist in that space between dreams and waking. At the age of 32, I am currently working on my art collector's book in occasion of 10 years anniversary of my career. My passion for nature brought me the idea to make a collection of conceptual photography with wild rescued animals.
TITLE: How I Turned Rescued Wild Animals Into Art

DESCRIPTION: Meet Picasso, the dog with a twisted jaw, who, together with his brother Pablo, were left at a shelter and slated to be euthanised. The siblings were born to a backyard breeder, who managed to sell all the puppies from the litter, except for Picasso who has a very noticeable facial abnormality. After being surrendered to a shelter, Picasso soon got reunited with Pablo, as the family who bought his brother changed their mind about having a pooch. The brothers didn't have much time left before being put to sleep...
TITLE: Meet Picasso, The Perfectly Imperfect Dog That No One Wanted

DESCRIPTION: Cerebral palsy remains an incurable disorder, and the symptoms range from mild spastic movements to severe seizures and the inability to control limbs. While there's no cure, scientists focus on treating the symptoms. Research on links of medical marijuana and cerebral palsy is still limited, but findings suggest that it offers a host of benefits (including pain control, reduction of spastic movements and seizures, and more).
TITLE: Parents Break The Law To Treat Kids With Cannabis

DESCRIPTION: A few weeks ago I started making character pictures using sugar sprinkles. I made them at night so my kids had a surprise to wake up to in the morning. Each design was done freehand and I used only my fingers, toothpicks, and different colored sugar sprinkles for tools.
TITLE: I Make Portraits Out Of Sugar Sprinkles To Surprise My Kids In The Morning

DESCRIPTION:
I am a graphic designer and illustrator who loves music so I decided to combine my passions into one project. Here is a look at 40 of the lyric illustrations from my collection (In total I have reached over 100 drawings now).
The goal of this project is to explore different hand lettering styles and illustration techniques.
TITLE: I Turn Music Into Visuals

DESCRIPTION:
The 70 finalists for the 14th Annual Smithsonian Photo Contest have just been announced, and as you can see from this stunning selection, the judges are going to have a seriously difficult time choosing a winner.
The competition received over 48,000 submissions from photographers across 146 countries and territories, and voting is now open for the Reader's Choice winner. Voting closes on March 27 and the winner will be announced alongside the Grand Prize and category winners the following day.
TITLE: Winners Of The 14th Smithsonian Photo Competition 2016 Announced

DESCRIPTION:
Little Planet Factory is a company created by George Ioannidis. One day this London-based artist searched for a Mars globe, and after failing to find one he liked, he decided to make his own.
George grew up watching Cosmos and reading Douglas Adams, and he also happened to be experienced in 3D printing so mashing space and 3D models was an idea close to his heart.
TITLE: 3D-Printed Solar Systems That Fit On Your Table

DESCRIPTION: This is the tale of Stephen, the only one of my monsters to ever give me nightmares. Once I had coaxed him out of the darkness and onto paper, it became clear that this one is special. He gets a real emotional response from people and I created a file for him showing people where he came from, through specially created artefacts.
TITLE: How I Got To Know My Monster

DESCRIPTION: Ever looked in the mirror and thought, Hey, I really want to cover my face with tattoo freckles? No? Well, me neither, but as you can see from the pictures below, a lot of other people clearly have.

DESCRIPTION: Cosplaying is easy, but cosplaying well? That's something else. Sure you can go online and buy yourself a costume (just no more Harley Quinn, please, we beg you), but the real show-stealers are the ones who make their own.

DESCRIPTION: Zupagrafika is an author and creative design studio founded by David Navarro and Martyna Sobecka. The studio has a special affinity with post-war modernist architecture. They are authors of award-winning publications, such as: Brutal London, Blokoshka or Paris Brut.

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Raluca, I am a self-taught photographer living in Belgium and I admit: I use photography for recreating reality.
I believe that when we photograph we project our whole inner world in order to understand what surrounds us. Unconsciously, we use the camera as a tool for exploring faces of our personality, our dreams and fears, our wishes.

If I think about something, or feel something, I already imagine it visually.

DESCRIPTION: Cute chihuahuas Mathilda, Augusto and Kenzo are riding a seld, barking and having fun playing in the snow. Many dog owners don't take their pups outside in the winter time. That's a shame because there are dog coats to keep them warm so they can run in the snow and enjoy the winter.

DESCRIPTION: In our last article, we told you about our photo projects documenting the secret lives of street cats in Riga. My grandmother, Tommy, was a first generation Japanese American living in the San Francisco Bay Area from 1916 - 2009. After she passed away, I found suitcases of photos and her diary detailing her life farming in Silicon Valley and taking road trips to landmarks across the Bay Area.
Once the U.

DESCRIPTION: Ever found yourself in IKEA without the slightest idea why you're there? That's the dark magic of IKEA. It subtly draws you in with its invisible Scandi-tentacles, and it doesn't let you go until you've bought at least one thing that you have absolutely no use for.

DESCRIPTION: You'll never find a box of Cap'n Crunch or a pack of Slim Jims in a hipster's house. Why? Well, aside from the fact that neither are organic, the colors of the packaging would simply clash too much with all of the other artfully designed products in their food cupboard.

DESCRIPTION:

The character in this series has no face and sometimes has missing limbs, firstly, so that anybody that either suffers from depression or has dealt with it in some way, can identify with her.

DESCRIPTION: When there's a will there's a way, and this is certainly true for Zuly Sanguino. Zuly was born with a rare genetic condition called Tetra-amelia syndrome (the absence of all four limbs), brutal bullies tormented her and she was later raped as a teenager. DESCRIPTION:
While observing that the souvenirs available in Lisbon shops were rather traditional and lacking in modernity, I decided to create my own vision on the subject, bringing colour and life to the usual Portuguese icons, through original paintings.
The patterns I use are inspired by the joy and nature from Brazil, the delicate flowers from Japan, bold colours from Africa, among other traditional art from around the world. In a way, bringing back to a famous Portuguese icon inspiration from countries that have played an important role in Portuguese history.

DESCRIPTION: Huayna Picchu mountain in Peru has arguably the best views of the famous Machu Picchu, but you must be brave to get there. DESCRIPTION: Recently, analog photography has been making a comeback, but whether you are a professional or an amateur, you had to be a nocturnal alchemist if you wanted to develop your own film. DESCRIPTION:
Slow lorises [Kera Duku in Malay] (genus Nycticebus) are primates that belong to the suborder Strepsirrhini. They are found throughout South and Southeast Asia and the surrounding islands, and live in the upper canopy of tropical rainforests.

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Milena and my passion is creating miniature food jewelry. Every charm, ring or earrings is a unique jewelry.
I just try to make everything that I crave to eat :) When I dream of an apple pie, instead I make a miniature pie charm with additional cutting board with dough and apples!
I am an artist and I started working with polymer clay by chance.

DESCRIPTION: Meet Darla, the therapy chicken in a tutu. She was rescued from an animal fair two years ago as one of the sickly chicks spotted by Erika Proctor and her son Finn. Proctor is the founder of a rescue group Green Dogs Unleashed based in Virginia that aims to help blind and deaf doggos. However, it was her son Finn who insisted they take the three ill chickens home with them. The boy's logic was that if they weren't going to survive, at least they'd have known love. While two of the birds didn't make it, Darla the chicken survived, and she is going stronger every day...
TITLE: This Chicken In A Tutu Dress Is The Most Adorable Therapy Pet Ever

DESCRIPTION: I have been drawing maps for many years, but decided I needed a more focused challenge. I decided to draw a map a day, but wanted an even more specific brief. I hit upon the idea of creating a typeface, with each letter being a unique map.

DESCRIPTION: An 8-year-old refugee from war-torn Syria named Hüseyin el-Hasan just got our faith in humanity restored after helping an injured stray dog. Hüseyin spotted a doggie hit by a car near his new home in Kilis, Turkey. The boy immediately rushed to help, and brought a blanket from his home - even when his own house was experiencing some heating problems. Hüseyin placed the blanket over the dog's trembling body, then alerted the adults to call for help. While waiting for the rescuers to arrive, Hüseyin lovingly stayed by the dog's side...
TITLE: Refugee Boy Refuses To Leave Injured Stray Dog Until Help Arrives

DESCRIPTION: While most artists have to spend money on their materials, Blake McFarland doesn't have this problem - he sculpts animals from recycled tires. Although I'm a german Photographer living in Germany, I'm luckily only living around 60km from the border to the Netherlands.

TinyRobots are one-of-a-kind creatures made completely out of recycled materials: discarded electronics, computer parts, monitors, MP3s, keyboards, mouses and many others.

DESCRIPTION: The 3-month-old girl puppy was dragging her little body on the streets of Eastern European country Romania in search of food and shelter. DESCRIPTION:
Hi! My name is Maria and I'm from Greece.
I have been involved in art my whole life, and finally on 2015,I managed to graduate from Fine Arts School, which was my biggest dream. Thanks to my university experience, I am in the pleasant position to illustrate children's books, occupy as a children's art tutor and last but not least, to do what I love most, in a daily basis: Draw.

DESCRIPTION:
Always inspired by this intricate classical painting The Swing, by Jean-Honore Fragonard - as a stylist and set designer- I only dreamed to recreate it one day. However, I thought that day would be so far in the future, because, as a freelance artist - I simply didn't have the capitol to produce such an extravagant shoot (as I had imagined it) and likely wouldn't in the near future.
After years of day dreaming- it dawned on me, in a beautiful epiphany moment, that I had stowed away some wallpaper I ripped off the wall from the first film set I designed (it was too beautiful to discard).
TITLE: I Recreated A Famous Classical Painting In A Photograph

DESCRIPTION: I have always loved this idea of taking something discarded and giving it a new life so it is no wonder that the majority of my art is created from things found in the trash or washed up on a beach. I am a mosaic artist who currently lives in Huntington Beach, CA. As an avid beach comber, I have found a lot of what I use washed up on shore at my local beach but I have also found many things in neighborhood trash bins or remodeling project dumpsters.

DESCRIPTION: I started knitting moths in 2014 when a friend suggested that I make a rosy maple moth. Before then I'd thought moths were all boring, brown tiny things that would eat my wool. When I saw this bright pink and yellow beauty I begun seeking out more and more fancy moths.

DESCRIPTION: Sadly, not all adopted dogs find a forever home. Last September, a family with four kids adopted a 3-year-old brindle boxer mix, called Rhino Lighting (Rhino for short).
