TITLE: Dog Learns Irish Dance

DESCRIPTION: Meet Patrick Kilonzo Mwalua, aka the water man, who delivers water to the wild animals in dry lands of Kenya's Tsavo West National Park. The kind fellow, who is a pea farmer in his local village, came up with the idea after seeing the dire effects that global warming is having on Kenya's land. We aren't really receiving rain the way we used to, he says. So I started giving animals water because I thought, 'If I don't do that, they will die.'
TITLE: Every Day This Man Drives Hours In Drought To Provide Water To Thirsty Wild Animals

DESCRIPTION: There are a lot of ways to save space in your home , but Milano Smart Living has a few more to offer. A sofa that turns into a bed, a bed that turns into a table and table that turns into a console: smart and functional furniture is definitely their strong side. All of their products are made in Italy, and the mechanisms are patented and built to last a lifetime.
TITLE: Space-Saving Furniture

DESCRIPTION: Starting a day with a cup of coffee is a ritual that inspires me to make even craziest ideas come true. A coffee stain on a napkin can lead to the curious thought of painting with coffee. So, I was excited with an offer to paint with coffee.
TITLE: I Used 2 Coffee Cups To Bring Audrey Hepburn To Life On Paper

DESCRIPTION: Fujifilm ambassador, X-Photographer Mindy Tan travels to Japan for the first time and spends 2-weeks slow-travelling in Kyoto, Japan. She captures the streets of Kyoto daily, showing the city's everyday life in street photography. Here is Kyoto like you have never seen before.
TITLE: Everyday Kyoto Captured In Street Photography By Mindy Tan

DESCRIPTION: A YouTube musician used a unicorn head to make a song. It sounds morbid, but it was actually genius. He drew a unicorn using MIDI notes, and the song it played was surprisingly pleasant.
TITLE: People Are Freaking Out Over This Song Made From A Unicorn Drawing, And You Will Too

DESCRIPTION:
My artwork almost always involves animals in some way shape or form. Inspiration comes from the animals themselves as well as cultural influences such as the case with my Celtic Animals series.
An idea does not always work in a linear fashion, sometimes the direction I intended to go doesn't work out, but an idea will occur along the way that takes me into a new direction, the way it was intended to go all along.
TITLE: I Draw North American Animals

DESCRIPTION:
Hello! I am Evisa Isabella Rose and here is a collection of my motivational comics.
Now if you're having a bad day, please raise your hands! Whoa! A lot of hands over there! The truth is that life is a delicate bouquet of moments: some of them are like beautiful, colorful roses, while some others are like grey, poisonous weed. Sometimes the bad weed steals so much of our attention and energy that we forget about the roses.
TITLE: 10+ Super Inspirational Comics To Brighten Up Your Bad Days

DESCRIPTION: Thanks to Amanda Joy Wells, anyone can have a sip of the universe. This Oklahoma-based artist has created a series of galaxy-inspired ceramics, and they look absolutely out of this world.
TITLE: Galaxy-Inspired Ceramics That Let You Drink From The Stars

DESCRIPTION: To me, stones are not simple materials or canvases for painting pictures on. Among all those numerous stones on a river bank, one stone, looking like an animal, catches my eye. When I find a stone, I feel that stone has found me too.
TITLE: I Want To Paint The Life, The Living Spirit Of The Being I Feel Inside The Stone

DESCRIPTION: It's hard to say how many animals are killed by vehicles around the world every year, but it's estimated that up to one million are killed every day on the roads of the US alone. As you can see from the list below however, some countries go to great lengths to ensure the safety of their wildlife.
TITLE: 10+ Amazing Animal Bridges And Crossings That Save 1000s Of Animals Every Year

DESCRIPTION: In honour of Black History Month, cosplayers across social media platforms are participating in #28DaysOfBlackCosplay, including Instagram star Kiera Please.
TITLE: This Black Cosplayer Is Breaking The Racial Boundaries Of Cosplay In Amazing Ways

DESCRIPTION: We have already written about perfect Star Wars gifts, but I would completely understand if you wanted this Death Star only for yourself. The replica is actually a speaker and even levitates as it delivers sound.
TITLE: This Levitating Death Star Speaker Will Make You Join The Dark Side

DESCRIPTION: A picture of a squirrel captured posing like some kind of superhero has started a hilarious Photoshop battle. While some portrayed the animal as a fighter or a character from X-Men, others photoshopped it to look like the squirrel is doing something casual such as cleaning a classroom or playing pool with its mates.
TITLE: This Squirrel Doing A Super Hero Pose Sparked A Hilarious Photoshop Battle (10+ Pics)

DESCRIPTION: Some say about North Korea that the only ones who smile are the Dear Leaders on the propaganda stuff. But after 6 trips in the most closed country, I can say that North Koreans are not the robots many depict..
TITLE: I Have Seen North Korean People Smiling!

DESCRIPTION: As you may know I am a nature person. I always recycle trash and try to save stuff from being thrown away. So I came up with this idea of refurbishing stuff which is on it's way to the landfill.
TITLE: I Saved These Old Radios By Refurbishing Them!

DESCRIPTION:
Last autumn we traveled through Italy and found this abandoned mansion. We were flabbergasted of the beauty!
When we also met Medusa it wasn't easy to leave the property without a last look over our shoulder..
TITLE: Exploration Of An Abandoned Italian Villa And Meet And Greet With Medusa!

DESCRIPTION: It is widely known that cats deeply love boxes. We noticed that our kitty Tika had a crazy obsession with the laundry basket, which is better than a cardboard box.
TITLE: Discover The Best Box For Cats. They Go Crazy With It!

DESCRIPTION:
We created this paper craft design set to celebrate the approaching arrival of spring.
Some of these images are also available for free in high resolution for those who want to add a touch of spring to your own projects.
TITLE: We Created Rose Paper Craft Designs To Celebrate Spring

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Daniele Barresi, I am 26 and I am from Bagnara Calabra (RC) Italy. I started carving at the age of 7 and I describe this period like the best in my life.
When I touch my knife, my mind gives up to the heart and it transmits directly, to the hands, giving different forms to the decorations.
TITLE: I Create Intricate Pieces Of Carved Art From Soap

DESCRIPTION: My name is Gelila I am self-taught artist and best known for my coffee and acrylic paintings. I use coffee to create diffrent portraits and figures.
TITLE: I Use Coffee Powder To Create My Drawings

DESCRIPTION: I started body painting to branch out of the cosmetology world. I wanted to expand my skills into a different art form because I was getting stuck in a rut from doing the same thing day to day. I thought to myself, there are so many talented body painters out in the world, how could I stand out from such an artist crowd? That's when I decided to do hand-incorporated body painting.
TITLE: I Am An Artist Who Cloaks My Hand Into The Majority Of My Art

DESCRIPTION: In case you thought that books are just for reading, artist Luciana Frigerio has got a surprise for you. She carefully folds pages of recycled books to create intricate three-dimensional designs. The Vermont-based artist usually does her work in Times New Roman or and Helvetica fonts because of their huge impact upon the literary world.
TITLE: Artist Folds Books Into Sculptures

DESCRIPTION: Some image that is associated with the gates of Mordor from the movie The Lord of the Rings. Nature this winter conjured amazing views Rudawka Rymanowska the Carpathian mountains.
TITLE: Land Of Ice In Poland

DESCRIPTION: When people asked me why I bike, I always said So I can eat more cake!. Often, when cycling, I think of how many calories I've just burnt and how much cake this equals too. With a crafty friend of mine we came up with a line of bicycle accessories that work as reminder and encouragement to those whose love for bakes is almost as big as my love for bikes.
TITLE: I Make Cupcake Themed Bicycle Accessories To Get More People Cycling

DESCRIPTION: Optical phenomeno in a very cold Morning, in the valley of Semmering , Austria due the Icy atmosphere and reflexions of the first sunny rays.
TITLE: Frozen Halo

DESCRIPTION:
Three pop icons are drawn with charcoal and graphite. Grace Kelly, Audrey Hepburn and Virna Lisi.
Measurements: 1 x 1 meter each.
TITLE: I Make Pencil Drawings Of Pop Icons

DESCRIPTION: We are marriage with a strong passion for photography. We started working together in 2016. There are two main areas of our interest: human existence and telling stories.
TITLE: My Heart Is An Animal: The Surreal Stories Through Photographs

DESCRIPTION: Fish can be terrifying and scary, but this cute couple of walking frogfish is a cute example of evolution. Frogfishes generally do not move very much, preferring to lie on the sea floor and wait for prey to approach. However, once the prey is spotted, they can approach slowly using their fins to walk along the floor!
TITLE: Walking Frog Fishes

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Monika Sutkute, originally Lithuanian, I am an illustrator based in London and graduate of Chelsea College of Art & Design, the University of the Arts where studied BA Spatial & Interior Design.
Drawing has always been my own method of meditation. Through drawing, I escape my thoughts, daily problems and fall into my own place of stillness freedom where time and all the outer issues disappear.
TITLE: I Create Pencil Drawings That Take A Lifetime To Draw

DESCRIPTION: I take commissions for creating artwork using metal cogs, beads, watch parts and charms. Some pieces can take up to 20 hours.
TITLE: It Takes Me Up To 20 Hours To Create A Piece Of Art Using Metal Cogs, Beads, Watch Parts And Charms

DESCRIPTION: My story of Seymour really began, with cactus wrens, and tub of worms my gecko would not eat. I tossed the worms out to my local cactus wrens that happened to be by my bird feeder. After a lot of worms and several more visits, the wrens adopted me as the worm lady and have become visiting wren friends for the last two years.
TITLE: Seymour The Roadrunner

DESCRIPTION: Three months after our first son was born, my husband bought me my first camera. It was confusing and cumbersome to learn - particularly when I had a newborn attached to me! Slowly I began understanding the different settings and enjoyed our little photo sessions with our newborn (which resemble every pinterest fail you've ever undoubtedly seen). Fast-forward through two more sons, a few hours of YouTube attempting to make sense of light and technique when I stumbled upon Lilia Alvarado's work.
TITLE: After Three Sons, I Was Determined To Uniquely Capture My Daughter Through My Photography

DESCRIPTION: I'm an amateur photographer from Poland. Every week I go to local shelter and photograph dogs on a walk. Most photos are portraits.
TITLE: I Photograph Dogs To Help Them Get Adopted

DESCRIPTION:
Whenever I need some relief in my daily life, I draw little 5 min. sketches to express my deep feelings.
It is not an easy task to represent the feelings on a blank sheet, so I use objects from the daily life and convert them into inexplicit feeling representatives.
TITLE: Series Of Offbeat Drawings That Interpret My Feelings

DESCRIPTION: When Alaina Brinton lost her senior dog, she decided to welcome a new pup into her home - but the woman didn't know she would end up adopting not one, but two inseparable dogs. Meet Lucy and Sully, two rescue canines who became BFF's the moment they set their eyes on each other. Little is known about their history. Lucy came to the shelter as a stray and Sully was returned to the rescue organization after being adopted. Sully was just a puppy back then, and Lucy, who is few years older, became like a mother to him.
TITLE: Woman Wanted To Adopt This Dog, But He Refused To Go Without His BFF

DESCRIPTION: If you had to imagine your mental illness or disorder as a house, what would it look like? Federico Babina has just released a new project called Archiatric, which depicts 16 different conditions as works of architecture in various states of repair.
TITLE: Using Architecture To Explain 16 Mental Illnesses And Disorders

DESCRIPTION: Japanese photographer Hot.kenobi plays with his action toys and uses photography to tell their entertaining stories. Osaka-based Hot.
TITLE: Action Figures Come To Life In Stunning Images By Japanese Photographer

DESCRIPTION: Gordon Ramsay is known for many things, but one thing he isn't known for is being tactful. And so when amateur chefs started tweeting him pictures of their own culinary creations, nobody expected him to say anything particularly encouraging. And as you can see from his hilarious tweets, the celebrity chef certainly didn't disappoint.
TITLE: 10+ Times Amateur Chefs Showed Gordon Ramsay Their Food, And Instantly Regretted Their Decision

DESCRIPTION: My niece had her 6th birthday recently. Someone in the family took this beautiful photo and I would really like to turn it into something even more beautiful. I have zero photoshop skills, so maybe some of you could help me.
TITLE: Please Photoshop This Photo So It Looks More Magical

DESCRIPTION: My little work.
TITLE: I Create Altered Realities In Classical Paintings

DESCRIPTION:
If you ever accidentally decide to go out for a walk in the middle of a night in -20°C, in a small winter resort like Bakuriani, located in Georgia, cutting through the snow covering your knees and ice crystals falling straight into your eyes, make sure that you bring your camera with you, as you may become a witness of an extremely rare event called Light Pillars.
These colorful light beams don't represent any kind of spotlights pointed up in the sky. What's more, they don't really exist - they are just an optical illusion.
TITLE: I Shot Extremely Rare Atmospheric Phenomenon Called Light Pillars

DESCRIPTION: With all these nude and semi-nude selfies on social media featuring the perfect bikini bodies, artist Aleah Chapin thought she would show the world something different.
TITLE: Powerful NSFW Portraits Reveal What Real People Look Like Without Their Clothes On

DESCRIPTION:
Have you ever wondered what it's like to live on a farm in Iceland, surrounded by sheep and waterfalls?
Well, now you can find out!
TITLE: I Document My Everyday Life On An Icelandic Farm

DESCRIPTION: In this video I would love to show you the story of a very special portrait I've done. Portrait which was inspired by true love and friendship. Portrait of my love, who accepted me the way I am.
TITLE: Love Beyond Barriers: I Drew A Portrait Of My Love Who Accepted Me The Way I Am

DESCRIPTION: Bieszczady National Park in Poland. In the winter picturesque piece of Polish.
TITLE: I Photographed Bieszczady National Park In Poland

DESCRIPTION: To celebrate National Drink Wine Day falling on Saturday 18th February this year, artist Richard Marsh has painted 5 landscapes with a twist...
TITLE: Artist Turns Wine Into Amazing Travel Paintings

DESCRIPTION: In our modern age levitation still looks like magic, so I guess you could call Flyte a team of wizards. Earlier they have produced a levitating light bulb and now they're back with a hovering clock. It's called STORY and its main feature is a magnetically levitating sphere.
TITLE: The Levitating Clock

DESCRIPTION: This could possibly be the most amazing indoor gardening structure we've ever seen, and people all over the world are being encouraged to build one.
TITLE: IKEA Just Released Free Instructions For A Spectacular Sustainable Garden

DESCRIPTION: Little Matthew Swetnam was born with congenital cytomegalovirus (CMV) and has started life with a lot of problems. Not only does he suffer from hepatitis and brain cysts, he is also deaf. On the 4th of August 2016, however, the University of Colorado Hospital gave Matthew an incredible gift when they fitted him with hearing aids at 4 months old.
TITLE: Baby Hears Mom For The First Time After Receiving Hearing Aids, And His Reaction Will Melt Your Heart

DESCRIPTION: Mental illness is a taboo. Often, we fail to understand it. Why is this? Is it because we cannot see the problem? There is little harder than trying to explain the impact of depressive disorders.
TITLE: I Paint Myself As Mental Illnesses To Raise Awareness

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Iwona and I come from Poland.
I love rock and metal music so I create pictures inspired by this kind of music.
I often draw different versions of skull which is associated with rock and metal.
TITLE: I Draw Pictures Inspired By Rock And Metal Music

DESCRIPTION: My friend Kelly found Tiger in an abandoned box and nursed the 1 month old back to health. Here she is six months later and still the cutest office employee.
TITLE: Remember Tiger? Here She Is All Grown Up

DESCRIPTION: Shadows can be sources of creativity, and even great playmates. This kitty looks like he met his for the first time. Be careful with showing him a mirror!
TITLE: Kitten Meets His Shadow

DESCRIPTION:
I'm a papercutting artist who uses an x-acto knife to carefully cut my creations out of paper.
I've created incredibly detailed artistic re-imaginings of several human organs. To create each piece, I draw the outline of the organ, and begin cutting the inside free-hand with different patterns.
TITLE: I Hand-Cut Anatomical Organs Out Of Paper

DESCRIPTION: Every year, 2.7 million cats go unadopted. To help out my local adoption center in Los Angeles, I stealthily placed these cat biography cards on their front window.
TITLE: I Gave These Cats Bizarre Likes And Dislikes To Help Get Them Adopted

DESCRIPTION:
There's a new subreddit page called Tiny Trumps and we have a feeling that the President is not going to like it.
The rules are simple: [it's] a subreddit for photos of the 45th President, where Trump is roughly 2 feet tall. What not to post: Photos of a normal sized trump.
TITLE: People Are Making Tiny Trump Photos, And It Will Annoy The President Bigly

DESCRIPTION: When 2 moms brought home their second set of twin babies, they thought it was a fitting occasion for a photoshoot. Thanks to kids being kids, however, their original concept didn't go as well as planned, but what happened instead was the epitome of adorable.
TITLE: Mom Shares Photos Of Her Two Sets Of Twins And It Will Melt Your Heart

DESCRIPTION: I was born in Hungary, in a town called Szekesfehervar. I spent the last 10 years living abroad, but I visit my hometown as often as I can. I always enjoy spending time there.
TITLE: I Photographed My Hungarian Hometown At Night

DESCRIPTION:
The fast pace of modern life, coupled with our increasing anxiety surrounding notions such as FOMO, makes it almost impossible to acknowledge the mesmerizing moments of nature. With my collection, I invite viewers to imagine, and enjoy a snippet of life as we know it, frozen in time.
Splashes of liquid stopped in their tracks, contrasting with the usage of subtle gold, highlights and celebrates how fragile and rigid the piece is.
TITLE: We Create Porcelain Bowls That Look Fluid

DESCRIPTION: James Fridman shot to fame by editing people's photos to express a satirical view of narcissistic behavior. And now he's back with more hilarious images!
TITLE: Photoshop Troll Who Takes Photo Requests Too Literally Strikes Again (10+ New Pics)

DESCRIPTION: The UK and the USA were once referred to by George Bernard Shaw as two countries divided by a common language. To this day, Brits and Americans continue to misunderstand and confuse each other. Thankfully, Grammar Check has put together a handy infographic comparing 63 British words to their American counterparts, and it needs to go viral for the sake of communication.
TITLE: 63 Differences Between British And American English That Still Confuse Everyone

DESCRIPTION: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, it's a sugar glider gliding effortlessly through the air. Get ready for your daily dose of cuteness because we gathered a list of the most adorable pictures of sugar gliders.
TITLE: 10+ Sugar Gliders That Are Just Too Sweet

DESCRIPTION: You know those annoying little body problems that you usually can't do anything about? A tickle in your throat, trouble falling asleep, a brain freeze... Well, it's time to put a stop to them!
TITLE: 10+ Incredible Ways To Control Your Body As If You Were Pressing The Right Buttons

DESCRIPTION: My name is Martijn Versteeg, I like to put drawing to the next level. these drawings measure 120 x 152 cm (47.24 x 59.
TITLE: It Takes Me 4 Months To Create A Photorealistic Drawing

DESCRIPTION:
I draw cartoon characters on the palm of my hand with body paints/make up. I've always loved to draw and am I big fan of Disney.
I found my love for body art when I did a make up course at college, I'm a fully qualified make up artist and would love to get a job working on a Broadway production or even working for Disney.
TITLE: I Draw Disney Characters On The Palm Of My Hand

DESCRIPTION: The UK and the USA were once referred to by George Bernard Shaw as two countries divided by a common language. To this day, Brits and Americans continue to misunderstand and confuse each other in subtle ways. Thankfully, Grammar Check has put together a handy infographic comparing 63 British words to their American counterparts, and it needs to go viral for the sake of communication.
TITLE: 63 Differences Between British And American English That Still Confuse Everyone

DESCRIPTION:
Pirouettes in a stadium, splits above Budapest - we see the traditional Hungarian ballerinas 'freed from their everyday environment' in a whole new light in Tünde Dóra's Ballerina Project.
The Ballerina Project is more than just documentation: it's a nod of respect paid to the most effective essence of human motion, ballet. It is also an undistorted mirror of dancers' ambitions - it's been 14 years since Dane Shitagi has decided to immortalize the outstanding talent of oversea ballet dancers in an unconventional series of photographs to reveal the mysterious gracefulness in their movements for all to see.
TITLE: Ballerinas Around Budapest: We Brought The Passion Of Dance To The Streets

DESCRIPTION: I often get very normal Sculpture requests from customers, like wildlife, or fairies...
TITLE: I Made This 2m Tall Alien From His Tree Stump

DESCRIPTION: Doesn't matter if you are 80, if you do things like that, you're a millennial too.
TITLE: 12 Comics About Being A Millennial

DESCRIPTION:
This is the Horse tail waterfall in the Yosemite National Park. Every year for a few days in February, the sun sets at a certain angle and illuminates the waterfall in luminescent orange and red, making it look like a molten lava.
Here are some photographs from this phenomenon that I have been capturing for the past two years.
TITLE: I Photograped A Real Firefall

DESCRIPTION:
It was once said that bijouterie may look even more refined than a precious thing with diamonds. These words by Coco Chanel are being proved by Russian designer Katrina Mayzengelter who creates elegant jewellery of delicate antique lace, freshwater pearls and haute couture hand embroidery.
Her earrings, necklaces and brooches are enriched with rococo splendour, Victorian aesthetics and an air of Fin de siècle and Art Deco.
TITLE: Splendid Rococo Jewellery To Live Life To The Fullest By Katrina Mayzengelter

DESCRIPTION: For the last four years, Boston Police Department's SWAT team has had an unofficial mascot - a stray calico feline who came to their headquarters one day and never left. Naturally, they named the kitty SWAT cat.
TITLE: This Cat Kept Coming To A Police Department, So The Cops Built Their New Master A Cozy Condo

DESCRIPTION: Meet JellyBaby, a tiny guinea pig that likes to work out and have lunch at the same time. She is part of the crew over at Fuzzberta & Friends, an Instagram page of probably the most adorable guinea pig crew on the internet!
TITLE: Baby Guinea Pig On Her Mini Tricycle

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Dolores and I am a fantasy artist from Croatia. As many such tales begin, I too was drawn to fantasy and folklore from a very young age but being from a low middle-class family such activities and interests were actively pushed into a 'hobby' and 'daydreaming' section, tucked away safely somewhere in the drawers of my heart so that my mind could focus on doing 'real' things, whatever the definition of real was to the ones in my surroundings.
However, none of my professional and academic journies could come close to the burning passion I felt when sculpting creatures, painting magical scenes or writing stories.
TITLE: My Fantasy Handsculpted Jewelry Has Stepped Straight Out Of Fairytales And Enchanted Forests

DESCRIPTION: I'm Die Elster, a digital artist from Germany. My nickname is German for the magpie. I love all members of the corvid family so I've choosen this beautiful black and white fellow as my eponym.
TITLE: I Illustrated The Eternal Fight Of A Brave Young Woman Against Her Malignant Melanoma

DESCRIPTION: Spring has arrived early in the Eastern Japanese town of Kawazu. The small town, located just outside of Tokyo, is famous for their 8000 cherry blossom trees that bloom early every year. The lush landscapes that greet millions of visitors each February are supremely romantic.
TITLE: Cherry Blossoms Have Just Bloomed In This Japanese Town, And The Photos Are Magical

DESCRIPTION:
I have always been fascinated by word manipulation, so I started this project as a personal challenge.
I manipulate Arabic words and transform them into their meaning, and I made a total of 40 illustrated words.
TITLE: Arabic Words Illustrated Based On Their Literal Meaning

DESCRIPTION: Ask most 7-year-olds what they want to be when they grow up and you can guarantee that the responses will be typically fantastical, from spacemen and cowgirls to firefighters and rockstars. But all Chloe Bridgewater wants to do is work for Google (well ok, and also work in a chocolate factory and be an olympic swimmer). She even sent them a hand-written job application, which was the only letter she's even sent except for one to Santa. And guess what? Not only did she get a reponse; the response came courtesy of none other than the CEO of Google himself, Mr. Sundar Pichai.
TITLE: 7-Year-Old Girl Applies For A Job At Google, Gets A Priceless Response Letter

DESCRIPTION: Todd Krieg may not be able to walk, but he's clearly still capable of getting things done.
TITLE: Woman and Her Paraplegic Fiancé Announced Their Unexpected Pregnancy In A Hilarious Way

DESCRIPTION: Parenting is arguably the toughest job in the world, and we salute those of you undertaking it every day. Like any stressful occupation, though, sometimes you just have to step back and laugh at it to get through. If you've got kids, these comics will help you do just that.
TITLE: 10+ Brutally Honest Parenting Comics That Are Impossible Not To Laugh At

DESCRIPTION: My last post here on Bored Panda was about adding extra limbs to photo subjects. This time, it's all about adding cracks and textures. The humans were all photographed in studio or on-location.
TITLE: I Fracture People In Photoshop To Help Me Process My Own Medical Issues

DESCRIPTION: One morning, Ashly Deskins found two injured squirrels in her yard, who had most likely fallen from their nest. She and her husband rushed them to the vet's, but it was too late. They didn't make it, but the incident was enough to spark Ashly's interest in squirrels.
TITLE: This Woman Throws Miniature Parties For Squirrels Who Come To Visit Her

DESCRIPTION: I've never had been an art student. But I've always had a connection with it. When I was a kid, I used to make any kind of objects to play with.
TITLE: I Use Cofee To Paint My Vertigo And Delusions

DESCRIPTION:
B&W Child 2016 is 3rd Annual International Photo Competition devoted to the high quality, fine art child photography.
Through this unique and highly popular photography contest we gather the best photographers from all over the world and together we celebrate the art of b&w child photography.
We are happy to share with you 1st, 2nd and 3rd places from The Second Half of B&W CHILD 2016.
TITLE: The Best Photos From The B&W Child Photography Photo Contest Of 2016

DESCRIPTION: Did you forget about Valentine's Day? Is your partner a pothead? Then fear not, because we have the perfect solution for getting back into their good books. Well, we don't, but the Lowell Herb Company does, because they make bouquets that are not only beautiful to look at, they're also awesome to smoke!
TITLE: Marijuana Bouquet Delivery Service

DESCRIPTION: Glass artist Scott Pernicka has the ability to fit an entire galaxy into the palm of a hand. His handcrafted glass vortex spheres create optical illusions that make the viewers believe they're gazing into outer space.
TITLE: Endless Galaxies In Magical Balls

DESCRIPTION: Whenever this man casually crosses his legs, it seems that he evokes some strange dark forces within his cat. The pictures capture the mad stare his feline has when it looks at the crossed-legged human.
TITLE: A Monster Comes Out Whenever This Man Crosses His Legs

DESCRIPTION: Jimmy Fallon sparked a wildfire on Twitter again, and this hashtag is one of his funniest yet. After sharing an awkward moment with the hashtag #IGotCaught, the Twittersphere flooded with brutally honest confessions, because we've all been caught doing something a little embarrassing at some point.
TITLE: 10+ Of The Most Embarrassing Moments People Got Caught

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Simon O'Rourke, and I always aspire to take art created with the chainsaw to the next level.
I love that something so destructive can create beauty when used in the right way!
TITLE: I Create Detailed Wooden Sculptures Carving Them With A Chainsaw

DESCRIPTION: Cutting Edge Stencils is a collaboration that brightens up mundane interiors with a sprinkle of creativity. They produce awesome stencils that allow anybody to become a designer in a matter of seconds.
TITLE: Stencils Give Life To Boring Interiors
